review:
Analise:
- DIFICULDADE
( ) Fácil
( ) Normal
(X) Difícil
( ) Depende

- GRÁFICO
( ) Ruim
(X) Bom Pra época
( ) Lindo
( ) Pesado
( ) Não importa nesse jogo

- MÚSICA
( ) Ruim
(X) Da pra distrair
( ) Boa
( ) Ótima trilha sonora
( ) Nao precisa

- PREÇO
( ) De graça
(X) Aceitável
( ) Perfeito
( ) Da pra compra se espera um desconto

- DURAÇÃO
( ) Curto ate 4 horas
( ) Normal (entre 4~12h)
(X) Longo
( ) Sem fim

-DIVERSÃO
( ) Difícil de gostar
( ) Repetitivo
(X) Vai te entreter e irritar
( ) Voce vai amar

E um jogo bom mas e preciso ter paciencia pois exige muita estrategia, mas joga se tiver com tempo,

author: {'steamid': '76561198002019002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1708254167}
review:
You will end up bankrupt or with colliding trains.
From the second campaign page on you have literally no chance to win the game - or you are extremely lucky.
Trains start by themselves after a while and there is nothing you can do about it.
New train stations appear much too fast and the income is too low to build up a working rail system fast enough.
Nice little game with an absolute horrible gameplay mechanic.
Save your money - don't buy !

author: {'steamid': '76561198142889404', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1705738911}
review:
Train Valley нудная и очень простая игра. Прокладывание путей здесь продумано за игрока - просто протягивай в нужных местах, а если проложишь на отвали, то прям на путях может появиться станция и всё - играй заново. Есть несколько интересных уровней, где надо подумать, но этого мало
Остается только менять направление пути поезда. То есть, игра это кликер на внимательность. Одна ошибка означает чаще всего переигровку уровню. И всё, в игре больше ничего нет. Но, пару часов поиграть прикольно, тем более игра практически бесплатна на распродажах, а те, кто в 90-ые застал подобные поездо-паззловые игры - самое то

author: {'steamid': '76561198004009140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1704919971}
review: This game is really a lot of fun. I originally thought it was going to be like a train sim game but then discovered it was more like a puzzle/strategy game. Its all about time management, strategically laying rails, and planning out what trains can go when to avoid collisions. There's other things you have to manage as well such as not overbuilding and going bankrupt or making sure the switches on the tracks are switched to make sure the train goes to the correct station. Its one of those games that I start playing and next thing I know its like 2 hours later and I can't stop! There is a sandbox mode but I haven't tried that out as I'm still working my way through the levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966331203', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1703889432}
review:
Recommended.

10/10  for the genre.   Your engineering skills will be put to the test!

Loved the game.  Completed the entire game with 3 stars on every map.   Basically, you have to plan your railroad tracks so that you can get trains from point A to point B.   There will be up to 8 different stations per map, that you will need to send trains to.  You will manage the train schedules and it can get hectic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032535719', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1710804937}
review: Die Regeln des Spieles sind recht einfach, jedoch ist das Erreichen der Ziele auf manchen Karten recht kniffelig. Die Karten bestehen z.T. auch aus zufälligen Elementen, die durchaus Einfluß auf das Erreichen eines Zieles haben können. Wenn ein Zug unterwegs ist, kann man ihn in der Form beeinflussen, daß man die Weichen in seinem Weg stellt, den Zug anhält und wieder startet, und ihn auch umdrehen kann. Jeder Zug startet beim Spawnen mit einem Warenwert, der mit der Zeit stetig abnimmt, egal ob er gestartet ist, fährt, oder angehalten wurde. Das zu bewältigende Szenario eines Levels ist immer ähnlich: Züge müssen zu ihren jeweiligen Zielbahnhof kommen. Dazu muss man geeignet Schienen bauen, Weichen stellen, Kollisionen möglichst verhindern und möglichst wenig Zeit verlieren. Train Valley ist ein nettes Gelegenheitsspiel für zwischendurch. Durch die Aufgaben gewinnt das Spiel etwas an Abwechslung, aber es ist nach einer Zeit doch recht eintönig. Trotzdem ist es ein recht kniffliges und nettes Spiel, das Spaß macht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033008669', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1704128387}

author: {'steamid': '76561198132655796', 'num_games_owned': 1304, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1702689788}
review:
Un très bon jeu de gestion de trafic !
La difficulté croissante des niveaux permet d'apprendre de bonnes méthodes pour gérer la création de nouveaux rails en fonction des contraintes qui nous font face (décors, apparition de nouvelles gares, trains spéciaux, etc.)
De plus les succès sont vraiment sympa a faire et pour certains il faut même s'amuser a faire des erreurs qu'on ne ferait pas en temps normal (le succès "Chuck Norris" par exemple)

review:
25.6小时全成就

打折下来本体＋德国DLC10块钱左右，值得入手。游戏文件不大，随时拿出来消遣消遣杀时间也蛮好的。最开始第一章都卡关，熟练后还是比较容易的，锻炼手眼协调能力，关卡含有历史元素，也算是寓教于乐了，感觉带小朋友玩也不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067358822', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1699936935}
review:
Interesting game. I purchased it because I expected something "just" relaxing. However, I'm glad I get it because it is more challenging than I expected.

Similar to other games that are basic puzzles (like Angry Birds), this one has a similar score system (imagine the stars score, depending on what you accomplish, you can get 1 to 3 stars).

The gameplay is relaxing, chill and interesting. However, the challenge regarding the levels themselves is entertaining and draws me to come back again and attempt again that level.

I'm not a completionist (I don't seek to get 100% of each game I own), but certainly this game, even pushes me to attempt "something a little bit better than last time".

Recommended for you if you like planning games, being relaxed, not stressed because of the action, but maybe  a little active trying to find a good set of options to choose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144398171', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 1958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1958, 'last_played': 1635947193}
review:
Train Valley é um jogo de quebra-cabeça desenvolvido pela Flazm e lançado em 2015. O jogo combina elementos de quebra-cabeça, estratégia e gerenciamento de recursos em um ambiente onde o jogador assume o papel de um controlador de tráfego ferroviário.

Train Valley possui uma mecânica de jogo simples, mas desafiadora. O objetivo é construir trilhos para guiar trens coloridos até seus destinos, evitando colisões. O jogo começa de maneira descomplicada, mas à medida que você progride, ele se torna consideravelmente mais complexo, exigindo planejamento e tomada de decisões rápidas. As fases apresentam diferentes desafios, como a necessidade de classificar os trens por cores, evitar colisões e alocar recursos limitados.

Essa curva de dificuldade é bem projetada. Inicialmente, os níveis são relativamente fáceis e servem como um tutorial gradual para ensinar as mecânicas básicas do jogo. Conforme você avança, os níveis se tornam mais desafiadores, com novos elementos introduzidos à medida que você adquire experiência.

Train Valley possui uma estética visual atraente com gráficos simplistas e coloridos. Os trens e trilhos são representados de forma clara e os ambientes são agradáveis. A simplicidade visual contribui para a acessibilidade do jogo, tornando-o adequado para uma ampla faixa etária. Não muito distante a trilha sonora do game é cativante e ajuda a criar uma atmosfera agradável e relaxante. Ela se adapta ao ritmo do jogo, aumentando a tensão nos momentos de desafio e fornecendo um pano de fundo agradável durante o jogo.

Train Valley oferece uma rejogabilidade parcial, os jogadores podem retornar as fases concluídas para tentar melhorar seus tempos e classificações em cada nível. Além disso, o jogo possui níveis de bônus desbloqueáveis, o que aumenta a longevidade do jogo.

Embora Train Valley seja principalmente um jogo de quebra-cabeça, ele também pode ter elementos educacionais. O jogo ensina sobre lógica, planejamento e resolução de problemas, o que pode ser benéfico para jogadores de todas as idades.

Train Valley é um jogo divertido e desafiador que combina habilidades de quebra-cabeça, estratégia e gerenciamento de recursos. Sua curva de dificuldade bem projetada, estética agradável e trilha sonora envolvente o tornam uma escolha sólida para fãs de quebra-cabeças e jogos casuais. Se você gosta de resolver quebra-cabeças e gerenciar recursos em um ambiente ferroviário, Train Valley é definitivamente um jogo que vale a pena experimentar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011534887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4754, 'last_played': 1698749709}
review:
Preso con i saldi e senza grandi aspettative, è invece un bel puzzle game
Inizia con livelli semplici a "tutorial" per poi crescere in difficoltà. I comandi a disposizione sono: crea binario, elimina binario e treno aggiuntivo. In più cliccando su uno scambio si cambia la direzione di percorrenza, cliccando su un treno gli si fanno azionare i freni.

Ovviamente nei primi schemi è banale, diventando via via complesso incastrare tutti i treni. Soprattutto se vi "obbligate" a fare tutti i 3 gli obbiettivi di livello, nella stessa run.

Mi ha talmente convinto che ho preso pure il DLC
Consigliato!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982250063', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1697987185}
review:
An sich ein netter kleines Zugstrecken Aufbau Spiel.
Das ganze findet auf einer durch Quadrate aufgeteilten Karte statt und ihr müsst euer Geld und die Züge auf der Map managen.
Grafisch ist das ganze etwas trist gehalten und die Bedienung ist hinter Shortcuts anstatt einem nutzerfreundlichen UI versteckt.
Mich persönlich hat es aber in kürzester Zeit gelangweilt.
Zug Fans und Kids werden hier aber Freude haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198969328631', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2405, 'last_played': 1696049481}
review:
実績35/39まで解除…「DLC購入しないと実績の全解除不能」のようです。

　ゲームとしては、良くも悪くもない…微妙というよくあるプレイ後感でした。

　慣れないうちは、無計画な「レール敷設」や「増便」によって破産することが多いです。このため計画的に…ということになりますが、そもそも「初見ではどこに駅が出現するか不明」ですので…パズルというより「後出しじゃんけん」を強いられます。

　意地悪なタイプの「はーい残念でしたぁ！はい破産！破産！」なんていう幻聴が聞こえそうになるぐらい後出しっぷりです。「全体停止( 空白キー )」の機能が強力で、さらに「電車緊急停止( 電車アイコンをクリック )」からの「電車メニュー」で「再移動、方向転換」を「縛りプレイ」すると難易度が大人向けになります。とはいえ一旦、駅の場所を覚えた後になります…これが「レールのラインが１マスずれた」だけで、天地の差が出る時があり「シビア」になることが多く、間違えたレール敷設を破壊して作り直すと「破産に近づく」なんてことも多いです。

　誤認からミスを誘発するデザインセンスであるという根本的な問題を抱えていますが、インディーズだしセール購入したし「許容範囲」かなぁ…という感じです。4章までとボリュームも少ないので、そこらを踏まえると「買わなくても買っても、ご自由に…」という感想しかありません。

　実績解除のしやすいという点でおすすめですが…ゲームとしての点数は「 60～65 / 100点」あたりかな？と。

Não Gostei:

review: Started this game with mixed expectations, but it is actually a pretty neat puzzle game. Had a lot of fun playing through it. review:
[b]My review to Train Valley[/b]

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]
+ Very difficult
+ 39 Steam-achievements (You need the Germany DLC)
+ Steam trading cards
+ Time management
+ Different types of trains
+ Very challenging game
+ Logical puzzle

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]
- No controller support
- The track switch is a little bit complicate
- The music gets a bit annoying in the long run

[h1]I do not recommend this game![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198138350339', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1693132459}
review:
Train Valley is a cozy puzzle game about trains. It features a simple yet variable mechanic of laying complex rail systems and managing trains by mostly switching the rail... switches in real time with pause.
You need to manage space between the station, your funds, and the demand, making sure that trains get to their respective stations as fast as possible. 
You would be surprised at how stressful the simple process of juggling several locomotives on a mess of a road system can be. Train Valley is really good at giving the player new challenges every few moments. It masters the experience of slowly ramping up difficulty on each level to almost impossible heights, just to slowly bring it down in the end.
It's like a train in that. A slow start, a gradual stop, and insane intensity in the middle.
One thing that could've used a bit of revision is the tutorial. It's enough, but it feels like it could be a bit more gradual. I somehow missed the message that you could pause the game, and it added a good deal of extra challenge to the early levels until I figured it out.
The game has a solid 10 hours of gameplay, not counting the DLC, the sandbox mode, and hunting for every single challenge. 
To be honest, I was a bit tired of the game towards the end, with its rollercoaster of railroading stress, but on the other hand, I found myself wanting to replay the levels just one more time to try and be a bit more efficient.
So, in the end, I would gladly recommend this game to everyone who likes a simple but challenging puzzle. I know that for someone, this game might become one of their favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054719100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1690444606}
review:
Не совсем новая игра как по дате выхода, так и по графике и функционалу. Неплохой вариант, чтобы залипнуть на пару часов, но не более. Играл когда-то в полный аналог на iOS под названием Rails, которая и вышла раньше и по графике и по наполнению значительно выигрывает у этой.
Здесь же поезда практически все одинаковые и отличаются только по цветам. Управление строительством достаточно топорное. Графика сильно устаревшая. Внутриигровые задачи копируются в разных комбинациях из локации в локацию, но в единственное DLC даёт небольшой глоток воздуха.
Из плюсов стоит отметить изменяющийся мир по мере доставки поездов, забавные стереотипные локации, где подобрана музыка и элементы каждой из эпох в конкретной стране: русские танки, балалайка, немецкая берлинская стена и пр. Несложные адекватные достижения.
Оценка положительная, потому что мой организм не стал отторгать эту игру, и в целом она понравилась, так как доставила удовольствие теми немногочисленными отличиями, да и жанр такой нравится, но проходить снова её вряд ли буду.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296087794', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1690634422}
review:
The game is very nice.

I'd say its a very easy game HOWEVER if you make a slight misjudgement or tiny mistake it can cause a chain reaction of negative events... Everything is going smoothly then one train goes in the wrong direction and suddenly you lose track of everything else (no pun intended)

There is a couple issues I have with the game, the biggest of which is a known bug where a train will randomly explode. I think it happens to me mostly when i try to reverse them. Luckily it doesn't happen all that often but the game would be better without it. I got the achievement for my train crashing into itself because of this strange bug.

I also think it would be nice if you weren't bankrupt the instant you hit $0. The amount of times I go bankrupt WHILE A TRAIN IS ENTERING A STATION is crazy. You can stop me from buying track at $0 but bankrupt me at like -$2500 or -$5000 please. or maybe even add a timer after hitting $0 and if you don't go above $0 before it ends THEN bankrupt me.

This game is about $2 on sale and well worth the price imo even with the exploding bug.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245123216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1704754990}
review:
Windows XP時代のゲームですがWindows11でも動きました（今どきのオンボードGPUなら問題なし）
[h1]「行っとけダイヤ」シミュ―レーター[/h1]
トラブル時の運転再開が早いことに定評がある関東の某私鉄ではダイヤが乱れたとき「とりあえず〇〇駅まで進んで」という無線指示が乗務員に入るとか・・・
狭いマップ内に駅がランダムに出現し、目的地を有する列車が待機（しかも一定時間すぎると強制発車）
なので迅速な線路建設と発車指示が求められます。
マップが狭く、カーブや分岐の取り回しに制約が有るので、各駅を対角線で結ぶような管理が楽な線路は敷けず、
見切り発車を頻繁に行い衝突をギリギリで回避するようなスリリングなゲーム展開になります。
例えば以下のような駅の配置で
　A　　　B
　C　　　D
列車の出現順で考えればAーB、BーAの順で発車させようと思った時に、
CーBの列車が現れたので、同じ方向の列車を続行させた方が効率が良いので
発車順をAーB、CーB、BーAに入れ替えるといった楽しみ方ができます。

後半の難関ステージが、世界的に見ても異様な過密ダイヤで電車を走らせてる日本が舞台になっているのも納得です。
難点は、各駅が持つ色（赤の駅、青の駅、緑の駅・・・）と、列車に表示される目的地を示す色が混同して見づらく、発車ボタンの当たり判定がビミョーで慣れるまで少しストレスです。
ただし続編の「２」よりも早く結果が出るのでサクッと遊べます（ステージクリア後に無限に続行プレーする事も可）。

author: {'steamid': '76561197978111218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1689809737}
review: I really like the concept (though it push the integrated GPU a bit too much, it could be done with less 3d effects). In short it is a puzzle where one has to manage trains going to various locations sharing few tracks. For those that like puzzles and trains it is pretty nice. The twist is that it also becomes hectic if one wants to play without pauses, one has to be quick in making decisions. Pretty neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561199025393301', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1689732777}
review:
[h1]想作上帝吗，这次是铺设轨道，管理火车 [/h1]
一款不错的休闲游戏，精美且治愈的画风，令人放松的音乐，都能带给你不错的体验，很适合玩完大作后的休息时间，看着火车在自己铺设的轨道上行驶，并且到达目的地，可以让你获得极大的成就感。
 [h1]这是一款特别容易上手的游戏[/h1]
玩法很简单，你只需要做的就是铺设轨道，任意的铺设轨道，笔直的弯曲的都可以，然后就是调遣火车，但如果你以为他只是一个简单的铺轨道，开火车的意志小游戏，那么你就大错特错了，游戏并不是你想象的那样简单，还是会有一定的挑战性，很考验你的逻辑思维能力，如果不经过思考胡乱铺设轨道，那么你有极大的可能会车毁路亡，与此同时你也需要有极大的耐心，如果你没有足够的耐心面对一次次的车毁路亡这样的常态，其折磨程度不亚于在魂系游戏里受苦，不摆烂，重拾信心。所以想让火车快速安全的到达指定车站，也是要花一番心思的，挣取修路基金，推倒树木，摧毁房屋，一切都要为铺设轨道开路。也让我们更加理解了早期铁路调度员以及铺设铁路工人的不易。
 [h1]精美治愈的卡通画风[/h1]
会把你狠狠地拉回童年，你可以在森林，在海边，在码头甚至是城堡前，铺设轨道调遣火车。想象一下站在上帝视角，观察着你的列车帝国，你的列车经由你铺设的轨道，穿过森林，湖泊以及各种美景，这是一件多么美妙且治愈的事情。
 [h1]轻松欢快的音乐也是这款游戏的一大亮点[/h1]
我很喜欢在开车的时候听歌，在游戏里也不例外，在明快轻松的背景音乐中，完成自己的火车事业通过一道道关卡，也是一件美妙的事情。[h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198309734859', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1689608442}
review:
[h1]游戏内容[/h1]
火车谷是一款建设、管理和运营铁路火车来进行盈利的模拟经营建设游戏。玩家修建铁路以连接城市、隧道和桥梁，不同颜色的火车代表了它们的目的地站点，去到正确的站点才有资金入账，否则就是这趟火车的一起投资都血本无归。玩家在建设铁路时会发现在平原田野上铺设铁路很花费最少，但在拆除森林、村庄和其他现有建筑时费用依次升高，用现实的眼光来看确实是很符合现实的一款模拟游戏（拆迁？）。
[h1]铁路大亨的发家史[/h1]
通过规划建设铁路线，来达成最短最快的路线，道闸、侧线和支线的规划决定了交通流量的上限，支线连接到别的线路时会自动出现道闸。而道闸是管控火车流量增加的最有效的手段，毕竟不可能每个站点都有专门的线路去别的站点，那样只会造成线路臃肿时间浪费。在支线侧线规划建设合理，道闸手动操作得当的情况下，最终就会可以多列火车可以同时运行而不会延误。道闸的存在可以有效避免火车相撞导致事故发生，当你手忙脚乱时不妨可以试试暂停，你可以在暂停的时候建造铁路和安排火车（花费金钱提前发车、通过道闸转移行驶的铁路线等等）。
[h1]游戏的剧情和背景[/h1]
游戏经历四个赛季:欧洲(1830-1980)，美国(1840-1960)，苏联(1880-1980)和日本(1900-2020)。有完善的故事模式，包括1849年的淘金热、佛罗里达海外铁路的建设、第二次世界大战、冷战、第一次载人航天飞行东方1号的发射等现实事件。有一个完善的背景故事和现实为依据的剧情对游戏体验有很大提升，毕竟啥都靠脑补那也太累了，哪怕是P社游戏也不能这么玩。
游戏内有15种火车，从早期的蒸汽机车到现代的高速列车，驾驶18种汽车——从老式的乘用车到弹跳车和蓄水池，再到军用坦克和火炮平台。蒸汽火车迷？现代高铁迷？这款游戏你都可以找到自己喜欢的部分。
[h1]游戏机制[/h1]
游戏有两种游玩方式：经典（故事模式）和沙盒模式，沙盒模式它允许玩家在没有时间和金钱限制的情况下进行游戏，可以极大满足想慢慢合理规划建设出一个铁路帝国的玩家。
[h1]总结[/h1]
《Train Valley》是一款想简单放松游玩的玩家或者是规划建设骨灰级玩家大师亦或者是平平淡淡的中庸玩家都可以游玩上手找到适合自己的部分。

author: {'steamid': '76561198414766381', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1689584528}
review:
[h1]游戏介绍[/h1]
《Train Valley》是一款由Flazm开发的策略模拟游戏，于2015年发布。在游戏中，玩家扮演铁路公司的老板，需要建设和管理一条高效的铁路网络，运送货物和乘客，同时处理各种挑战和障碍。下面简单聊一下我的游玩感想。
[h1]游玩感想 [/h1]
1、游戏操作简单容易上手。该作游戏机制非常直观，玩家只需用鼠标点击和拖动来建设铁路轨道，设置信号灯和车站等。游戏提供了一个简单易懂的教程，引导玩家逐步学习游戏的基本操作和策略。此外，游戏还提供了不同的游戏模式，包括故事模式、谜题模式和无尽模式，以满足不同玩家的需求。这种简单易懂的操作和学习曲线使得游戏适合各种年龄和游戏经验的玩家。
2、游戏具有策略性和挑战性。尽管游戏的操作简单，但游戏的策略深度却非常丰富。玩家需要考虑如何最大化利用有限的资源，优化铁路网络的布局，以确保货物和乘客能够高效地运输。此外，游戏中还会出现各种挑战和障碍，如山脉、河流和其他交通工具等，玩家需要灵活应对，并找到解决方案。这种策略深度和挑战性使得本作不仅仅是一个简单的模拟游戏，更是一个需要思考和决策的策略游戏。
3、游戏的可重复游玩性。游戏提供了多个不同的关卡和谜题，每个关卡都有不同的目标和难度。玩家可以通过完成关卡来解锁新的地图和列车，进一步挑战自己。此外，游戏还提供了一个编辑器，玩家可以自己设计和创建关卡，与其他玩家分享。这种可玩性和回放价值使得本作具有无限的游戏时间，玩家可以一直探索和挑战新的关卡和谜题。
4、游戏的音效和音乐非常出色，能够为玩家营造出逼真的铁路环境。图形风格简洁明了，同时又保持了一定的可爱和卡通感，给人一种轻松愉快的感觉。此外，游戏还提供了对社区模组的支持，玩家可以下载和安装其他玩家创建的关卡和内容，进一步增加了游戏的可玩性。
[h1]总结[/h1]
综上，《Train Valley》是一款简单易懂、策略深度和挑战性的模拟游戏。它的操作简单易懂，学习曲线平缓，适合各种玩家。游戏的策略深度和挑战性使得玩家需要思考和决策，增加了游戏的乐趣和挑战。同时，游戏还具有很高的可玩性和回放价值，玩家可以一直探索和挑战新的关卡和谜题。游戏评分8 / 10，值得入手！

author: {'steamid': '76561198094305960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6480, 'last_played': 1689096547}
review:
Ein sehr schönes Koordinations- und Geschicklichkeitsspiel. Nur die Musik wird relativ schnell nervig. Es ist schon ordentliche Herausforderung alle Errungenschaften zu bekommen. Bei mir wurden es über 100 Stunden. Wahrscheinlich ginge es mit ca. 60h. Da ich halt 2 bis 3 Jahre Unterbrechung dazwischen hatte, hatte den Spielstand gelöscht, um wieder erneut zu üben und alle möglichen Heimtücken zu erfassen.

Die Leveln ansich hatte ich in 30 bis 40 Stunden alle durch. Somit habe ich zweimal komplett durchgespielt. Es waren wirklich halt die Errungenschaften wo ich halt viel geübt habe. Diese erfordern auch eine gute Portion Konzentration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341742588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2630, 'last_played': 1688397888}
review:
A puzzle strategy game with trains!

You must complete varying tasks on each level to earn money and stamps. Your ability to perfect higher levels will depend on being able to manage multiple trains (and tasks) at once and sometimes even think outside of the box - such as sending trains to the wrong station in order to avoid collisions. While some tasks may seem impossible to achieve, it can be done by using simple tricks (such as sending extra trains out early in a level as much as possible, instead of later).

The game offers just the right bit of fun and challenge without ever becoming too frustrating (though it does become very hectic at times). There is also a sandbox mode for each map so you can built to your heart's content. Highly recommended!

review: A friend got me this game and I thoroughly enjoyed playing through each and every level. Whilst you might think that it would get repetitive you would be wrong, each new area adds a little something, be it different behaviours to the trains or unique map encounters. My only complaint is that they have achievements attached to the DLC, still though I would recommend getting and playing through the DLC.

review:
Very challenging game which is enjoyable to play.
I have to admit that some levels are much easier than others, certainly if you want to get the 'three' stamps but that's what makes it nice to play.
I would recommend everybody to play this game if you want to play solo, challenge your brain but in a way it's light and hardy.

review:
(game not complete at .7 hours) 
Not for me but I can see the appeal, more of a puzzle game than a casual train game.  I wouldn't say this is relaxing the constant demand to maintain time schedules and the unknown placement of future stations makes this game more nerve wracking than relaxing.  Not a bad game just not for me. $10 price point is fair for this game in my opinion.

review:
Jeu de gestion d'un réseau ferroviaire simple mais efficace avec de vrais défis.
L'objectif est de construire un réseau pour amener un train d'une gare à une autre. Au cours de la partie de nouvelle gare apparaissent et doivent être prise en compte dans l'évolution de votre réseau.
Le DLC amène une nouvelle région pour prolonger l'expérience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198853423788', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1680944241}
review:
여러 대의 기차를 서로 충돌하지 않고 각자의 목적지로 보내도록 철도를 놓는, 퍼즐 겸 피지컬 게임.
단순하고 직관적인 게임성인데도 다양한 미션들이 난이도가 낮은 편이 아니라 몰입해서 즐길 수 있다.

실제 나라들을 배경으로 한 맵들로 구성이 되어있는데, 맵 별 트레이드마크를 구경하는 것도 꽤 쏠쏠한 편.

DLC까지 포함해도 생각보다 맵 갯수가 적은 편이라 씹고 뜯고 즐길만한 거리가 많지는 않다.
후속작의 게임성이 많이 다른 편이라 이 게임성 유지해서 맵이나 더 나왔으면 좋겠음.

review:
[h1] Deltius Reviews Train Valley [/h1]

[b] Summary [/b]
[list]
	[*]Immersion: N/A
	[*]Graphics: 5/10
	[*]Audio: 5/10
	[*]Story: N/A
	[*]Bugs: Clear of Bugs
[/list]
	
[b] Details [/b]

[i] Immersion: [/i] N/A
[i] Graphics: [/i] Cute and suitible for the game but not that impressive either
[i] Audio: [/i] Sounds are nice if you like trains like I do.
[i] Story: [/i] N/A
[i] Bugs: [/i] Non-exsistant

[b] Recommendation [/b]

Train Valley is an enjoyable game that focuses on getting each train to it's matching station (colour coded) and is a relatively fun and deceptively challenging game. However, I would recommend you check out Train Valley 2 which is a marked improvement and still hits that puzzle solving train themed fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112797338', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1677541660}
review:
Za dzieciaka miałem wiele ciekawych zabawek, ale nic nie sprawiało mi tyle frajdy, jak elektryczna kolejka. I hej! Nie mówię o tych, które dzisiaj możecie zakupić, opisywane jako „bezpieczne dla dzieci”. Kiedyś mniej się zwracało na to uwagę, więc nikt nie patrzył krzywo, że dziecko bawi się prądem. Dosłownie tak, bo tak ta kolejka działała właśnie dzięki manipulacji natężeniem prądem — aby jechała szybciej, potrzebne było większe natężenie, aby wolniej rzecz jasna mniejsze. Metalowe tory, kilka rodzajów lokomotyw i wagonów — w pokoju czuć było tę elektryczność. Zabawa jednak tkwiła w umiejętnym manipulowaniu natężeniem prądu, aby pociąg zwolnił w określonym miejscu, co wcale takie proste nie było z natury działania siły pędu. Po tych kilkunastu latach o całej frajdzie bycia maszynistą przypomniała mi urocza i niepozorna gierka, [b]Train Valley[/b].

[h1] FABUŁA [/h1]
[i]Śpijcie spokojnie, zestawienie bez większych spoilerów![/i]
[b]Train Valley[/b] operuje w pewnych okresach historycznych, ale nie sili się na budowanie żadnego wątku fabularnego. Jasne, można sobie dopisać pewne kwestie, jak chociażby bycie świadkiem zimnej wojny, wystrzelenia pierwszej załogowej rakiety i podobnych rzeczy, ale tutaj chodzi głównie o rozgrywkę i tyle.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2940086205
[h1] MECHANIKA/ROZGRYWKA [/h1]
Produkcja oddaje graczowi do dyspozycji cztery rozdziały: Europę w latach 1830-1980, Amerykę w latach 1840-1960, Związek Radziecki w latach 1880-1980 oraz Japonię w latach 1900-2020. Każdy z nich zawiera pięć map umieszczonych w odpowiednich okresach czasowych i jedną mapę specjalną, do czego wrócimy później. Cała zabawa koncentruje się na stworzeniu sprawnie funkcjonującej sieci połączeń za pomocą — rzecz jasna — torów. I może się to wydawać proste, ale tak nie jest, wszak jednym z elementów mechaniki jest wyraźnie upływający czas, który skutkuje rozrostem cywilizacji, budowaniem nowych miast, do których trzeba całą sieć podłączyć. A jakby tego było mało, odgrywamy również rolę maszynisty, sterując w pewnym zakresie pociągami — to my decydujemy, kiedy opuszczą one stację, a także obsługujemy zwrotnice (elementy odpowiedzialne za to, którym torem pojedzie pociąg). Zadania wydają się nawet proste, lecz zyskują na ekonomicznej głębi, kiedy stajemy w obliczu konieczności ścinania lasów, burzenia zabudowań czy usuwaniu innych przeszkód w miejscach, w których chcemy postawić tory. Zarabiamy wysyłając pociągi — im szybciej te dojadą, tym nasz budżet zasili więcej pieniążków. I oczywiście nie obyło się bez podatków, które są automatycznie odciągane z naszego konta co rok.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2940085792
Zabawa w maszynistę, czyli samo sterowanie pociągami, jest o wiele trudniejsze, aniżeli mogłoby się zdawać. Zmuszeni jesteśmy do bacznej obserwacji wszystkiego, co się dzieje, odpowiedniego reagowania na wzmożony ruch, aktywacje zwrotnic — czyli wszystko tak, aby pociąg bezpiecznie dojechał do celu, wszak wypadek do kosztowna sprawa, na którą nie zawsze możemy sobie pozwolić. Dopiero pod koniec swojej przygody z [b]Train Valley[/b] odkryłem, że mamy możliwość zawracania i zatrzymywania pędzących do celu pociągów, co jest delikatnym ułatwieniem, ale nie zawsze korzystnym. W trybie kariery bowiem w każdym rozdziale na pięciu mapach mamy do wykonania trzy zadania — opcjonalne, nagradzane soczystymi pieczątkami i oczywiście osiągnięciami. Niektóre zadania po prostu zabrania zatrzymywania pociągów i jeśli chcemy przejść odpowiednio dobrze poziom, powinniśmy się tego zakazu trzymać. Ostatni poziom każdego rozdziału nie posiada zadań opcjonalnych do wykonania, a jedynym celem jest tam… przetrwać. Przetrwać do określonego roku, co nie będzie — który raz to już mówię — takie proste.

Oprócz soczyście dopracowanego trybu kariery, twórcy przygotowali jeszcze tryb piaskownicy, który pozwala na swobodną rozgrywkę bez ograniczeń czasowych i finansowych. Idealny dla masochistów szukających wrażeń.

[h1] OPRAWA GRAFICZNA [/h1]
Oprawa [b]Train Valley[/b] nie jest za ładna i nie mówię tutaj o samych modelach wykonanych w naprawdę przyjemnym, uproszczonym stylu. Mówię o niejakich teksturach o małej rozdzielczości i w dodatku z jakimiś bezpłciowymi kolorami. Nad lokomotywami natomiast ktoś naprawdę się postarał — niby jest tylko piętnaście modeli, ale szczegółowo oddano ich charakterek. Podobnie z wagonami, których modeli jest osiemnaście — od klasycznych przedziałów osobowych, poprzez cysterny i przyczepy z węglem.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2940086338
[h1] UDŹWIĘKOWIENIE/MUZYKA [/h1]
Muzyka jest irytująca. Na każdym poziomie jest zapętlona i zmienia się wraz ze zresetowaniem poziomu, lecz zamiast umilić rozgrywkę, bardzo męczy. Ostatecznie skończyło się na tym, że wyłączyłem muzykę z gry i puściłem własną playlistę, przy czym zachowałem efekty dźwiękowe będące dość nieprawdopodobnym ułatwieniem w rozgrywce. Kiedy na stacji pojawi się pociąg, sygnalizują nam to dzwonki, co naprawdę się przydaje na trudniejszych lokalizacjach, gdzie ciężko wszystko ogarnąć wzrokiem.

[h1] PODSUMOWANIE [/h1]
Niemniej jednak mimo kilku wad, [b]Train Valley[/b] to cholernie przyjemny, prosty i zaskakujący tytuł na kilkanaście dobrych godzin. Zarwałem przez niego kilka nocek, czego nigdy bym się nie spodziewał po takiej produkcji. Twórcy wyskoczyli na rynek z bardzo dobrym pomysłem, a jedynym zastrzeżeniem jest samo wykonanie, które mogłoby być lepsze. Oczywiście nie ma tutaj klapy i tytuł jest jak warty polecenia, ale niektórym oczy mogą zaboleć przez brzydko kontrastujące tekstury otoczenia z teksturami modeli.

[quote=Szynka013]Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny, jeśli zaobserwujesz moją [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33046115-Fridge-Friends/]stronę kuratora Steam[/url], co na pewno zmotywuje mnie do dalszej pracy.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561199012705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1669478676}
review:
príjemná a pekná hra zo sveta vláčikov

teraz je len na vás, čo od hry s vláčikmi očakávate

toto je pomerne zaujímavá a v prvom rade minimalistická hra - nie tak ako dvojka, ale aj tuto je to pomerne minimalistické

na hre je zaujímavých hneď niekoľko vecí, ktoré vás môžu zaujať a to je pomerne pekné prevedenie prostredia, alebo vláčiky v minimalistickom podaní

páči sa mi aj SANDBOX MODE, ktorý sa sem pekne hodí a môžete si vyskúšať prácu s vláčikmi s neobmedzenými prostriedkami

hra samozrejme nie je strašne komplexná ako RAILWAY EMPIRE, ktorú by som odporúčil v prípade, že by ste hľadali niečo fakt komplexné a niečo realistické

toto pre zmenu odporúčam pre svoju minimalistickosť, hra vás vôbec nezdrží pri tvorbe komplexných staníc a vymýšľaní komplexného železničného systému

levely vás príjemne osviežia a prinútia pouvažovať nad čo najefektívnejším využitím zdrojov a vlakov tak, aby ste z toho mali na konci dňa čo najväčší zisk

odporúčam

author: {'steamid': '76561198027129521', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1675896046}
review:
Tohle je věc, která by neměla nikoho minout. Logicko/strategická rychlovka. Stavíte koleje a pomocí výhybek se snažíte dopravit správné vláčky do správného depa (podle barviček). Jednoduchej nápad, skvělý provedení. Návykové jak blázen.

Tady mě dokonce baví i honba za achievementy (nevím, jestli dám perfect, ale zatím to nevzdávám). Ve skoro každém kole jsou i vedlejší úkoly na splnění. Ty dají místy zabrat. Někdy nedáte všechny najednou, naštěstí to není potřeba. Jednou stačí jeden, při druhé hře druhý, atd... Někdy se musíte dané kolo prostě "naučit". Kde se co objeví, jak stavět koleje co nejoptimálněji, atd...

+ Mašinky
+ Roztomilá grafika
+ Hudba naprosto perfektní pro tento typ hry
+ Návykové

- Mrzí mě dokupované DLC, proč? Jedna z pěti kapitol.
- 100 % achievementů je podmíněno právě nákupem DLC, tento princip subjektivně nesnáším.

Hra má i pokračování, ale musím říct, že jednička se mi líbí daleko víc.

Edit: dal jsem perfekt. Super, zábava až do konce. Až je mi líto, že už není čeho dosáhnout.

author: {'steamid': '76561199096237817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1672169085}
review: It is easy to understand how to start not too complex, it is a management train game. The time passing and quotas to finish the levels are arbitrary to me and I am left just building my railroad till it just stops sending trains and ends. I like the simple puzzles to solve with a little penalty and the little explosions are fun. things I would add are a clear time or quota on the start achievements screen before the level, and the ability to change the rail clipping sensitivity this is a personal issue. Warning before the end of the level to know when the last train can be sent. but it's a fun game and good visuals and diverse levels and puzzles I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155709139', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1669668949}
review:
Train Valley is a great stoppable real-time train puzzle game, so why am I not recommending it?

Because it is so buggy that the current "very positive" verdict of the Steam crowd is a bit too good, and because there is an excellent, mostly bug-free alternative with better presentation, more varied game mechanics, and far more content: Train Valley 2.

[h1]The game[/h1]

Each level takes place on a mostly fixed map that fits on the screen, with only some minor obstacles randomized. In the beginning there are only a few railway stations which you must connect; then more and more pop up. At certain times a train appears in one of the stations, in the color of another station -- indicating where it wants to go. Building tracks, destroying obstacles and hurrying trains cost money, and there is also an annual tax. The only source of income is delivering trains to their destinations.

The game is over when you are bankrupt. You win if you reach the end date.

The game consists of 4 stages (pages in a book) consisting of 6 levels each, for a total of 24 levels. The stages take place in Europe, the United States, the Soviet Union, and Japan. There is also a DLC available which adds a fifth stage of 6 levels taking place in Germany. Sometimes history is made while you are playing a level, having some effect on the game.

Every level is represented by a postage stamp. The first 5 levels of each stage are regular levels, in which you try to get the postage stamp stamped three times by satisfying three constraints such as not crashing any train or not sending any train to a station other than its destination. Technically you can get these separately on three different runs, although if you want a challenge you will insist on doing them all at once. The final level of each stage is mostly unrestricted free play, where you try to maximize your score.

With my experience from playing the sequel, I finished the entire game in under 30 hours. After that I was looking forward to the sandbox levels, but these turned out to be the regular levels in what feels to me a completely pointless and uninteresting mode.

[h1]Comparison to Train Valley 2[/h1]

The sequel has far more content already in the base game. The basic mechanics are more complicated because you are dealing with supply chains: transporting goods that are required for building other goods. Nevertheless, Train Valley 2 manages to start with a reasonably moderate difficulty that draws you in before it progresses to almost insane levels, always taking you with it. The original Train Valley mechanics is also implemented in Train Valley 2. It appears in some DLC levels and in some user-contributed levels.

Unlike the present game, Train Valley 2 is very polished and professional-looking and mostly bug-free. I haven't finished Train Valley 2 yet, but I love it so much that it was obvious that I had to play the present game as well. It was a nice experience, on balance, despite the annoyances. Whereas I can recommend Train Valley 2 without any reservations.

[h1]Annoyances[/h1]

There is a major bug that causes trains to crash for no valid reason. Possibly a family of such bugs. Some maps seem to be affected more than others. It is unclear whether restarting the level, or the game, typically makes a difference or not. It's a bit too rare and unpredictable to fully analyse, but far too frequent to ignore. Sometimes I restarted a level several times in a row because each time my first or second train left the station, it crashed immediately on a perfectly fine piece of track.

There is also a number of more minor annoyances that were mostly fixed in Train Valley 2. Both games don't always register button clicks. What makes this worse in the present game compared to its sequel is that the immediate feedback for stopping a train is a bit too subtle, so you can easily miss when a train doesn't react to your emergency braking. Usually not as dramatic in effect but far more concerning is the fact that very occasionally I got the confirmation sound after clicking the button to start a train in a station, and then it turned out that this was ignored anyway!

In both games, when a train rolls over a switch, it turns red and you can't change its position. In this game, this also happens to nearby unrelated switches, sometimes preventing you from setting them to prevent a disaster. This is one of the occasions where one would want braking to work reliably.

Compared to its sequel, it is incredibly frustrating how long it takes for trains to leave the station. This really messes with the tight scheduling that I got used to with Train Valley 2. Also, in this game if you stop a train you can't start it before it has come to a complete standstill. Since both stopping and starting take a lot of time, it is very hard to do minor adjustments. In Train Valley 2, you can interrupt the stopping process and restart the train, so the train
just slows down for a while. Once you are used to this, you really don't want to miss it.

Given the train crash bug and the user interface problems I just described, it was a really bad idea to make  'do not stop any trains' a relatively common requested achievement, in addition to 'no train crashes'. It is a testament to the quality of the underlying game idea that this game became so popular despite this blunder. Train Valley 2 has an option to always start the game paused; that would have been welcome here as well.

Unlike its sequel, this game sometimes does a poor job of communicating. When does a level terminate normally? Is it a specific date? A certain number of trains? What's the deal with the extra trains? Why are they sometimes not available yet, and why can they become depleted before the quota of extra trains has been met? Clearly there are simple underlying rules, but they are not transparent. When you have to do, or not do, 10 things, say, it is sometimes not clear what 4/10 is supposed to mean. If you concentrate on the game, not the notifier, it's not clear enough whether it counts upwards or downwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993899544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1670064781}
review:
This game reminded me of my father all alone in his special room for hours surrounded and entirely filled by his model train set.

I would peek in sometimes to watch him through the crack in the door, occasionally sneak in to look closer at this fascinating little world it was worth the punishments.

After my mother threatened to leave him he begrudgingly dismantled it and hid it all in the loft away from me, so I finally had a bedroom of my own but I think he always resented me for this.

After the divorce he had it all put in storage for years until a break in meant it was all stolen, God knows how much money all those little trains and carriages pristine still in their box's were worth.

When I was a child did he ever wonder if I might also love trains or feel the urge to share this passion with me, no he did not.

At least he could have passed it down to me, so I could have shared it with my children, but no he only hoarded and locked it away until it was ultimately all lost forever.

Now I sit all alone a sad 40+ year old man playing with my very own little digital trains with no one to share them with, Thank you for everything you taught me Dad now I have become you I hope you are proud.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312941751', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1667631994}
review: Verilen görevler ve süreler çok anlamsız. Belirli miktar da para kazan diyor ek sefer yapman gerekiyor o seferi yaptığın taktirde ortalık o kadar çok karışıyor ki bir şeylerin karışmamasının mümkünatı yok ek sefer yapmadan kazan dediği parayı kazanmanın da imkanı yok. Benim gibi 3 yıldız takıntısı olanlar için sinir bozucu bir şey. Böyle saçma bir şeyi yapmalarına gerek yoktu. Benim bildiğim bir oyunda görevleri yaparsan o bölüm biter ama bu oyunda görevleri yapmadan belirli tren sayısına ulaşınca ki bu sayıyı sen göremiyorsun otomatik bölümü bitiriyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978186095', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1666562132}
review:
Muy buen juego de lógica en el que tendrás que ir construyendo vías y haciendo que los trenes lleguen a sus destinos cumpliendo hasta tres objetivos por nivel. Hay cuatro localizaciones con 5 + 1 niveles cada uno, en total 24 pantallas, el DLC aumenta en otros 6.

Parece un juego de chill inicialmente pero poco a poco va subiendo la dificultad y tienes que estar atento continuamente para dirigir bien los trenes, intentar que no haya accidentes, etc porque a veces son objetivos indispensables. Además cada localización tiene sus diferentes tipos de trenes y orografía.

En definitiva, un juego que le puedes echar unas cuantas horas a gustito.

review:
Train valley is a fun, small scale puzzle game. 

You get to route little trains around a valley, matching them to their destination without hitting the others. There's some time pressure, but variable speeds allows you to mostly set your level of pressure. 

Great for people who like guiding shapes into their proper boxes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001656330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1664950381}
review:
This game is alright for an hour or two. That's a bit much for $10. For $3 to $5 this is a good for a couple of hours if you are bored one night. Overall it's kinda fun but it has 0 depth.

The first level is basically everything you will need to discover. Stations pop you release trains, trains arrive at destination you win/lose. That's it. No tech tree no progress no choice beyond the timing of your clicks just 20-ish repetitive levels with increasing complexity. This is very similar to "brain games" that you can find on phones it's all about timing an multitasking. Quickly you will find yourself pausing the game so that you can keep track of the 6 trains you have on the map. So yeah there is very little interest IMO. 

It's important to note that you can pause and turn around the trains by clicking on them. I didn't realize this at first and I was going mad after 30 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202554733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 7164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6405, 'last_played': 1689877179}

author: {'steamid': '76561199230769083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1700240494}
review:
Игра изначально не понравилась. Очень напомнила Mini Metro, только в неудачной версии с одним сплошным микро-менеджментом. Но всё же после пары часов игры на максимальные бонусы я начал получать удовольствие от увеличивающейся сложности и появившейся многозадачности. Так что игре большой плюсик: она подходит и детям, и взрослым, так как предлагает на выбор весьма широкий диапазон сложности. 
Также, игру не могу назвать головоломкой в привычном смысле - процесс больше строится на внимательности, чем на сообразительности. Хотя, по правде говоря, подумать иногда всё же приходится))
8/10 за неизбитый жанр и приятное времяпровождение.

review:
Beautifully crafted and extremely fascinating game. This will get more difficult and intriguing as you go along.
To the game's developers: I think it would be a great addition if the player could create any kind of rail tracks and any number of stations in the game, similar to the free roaming mode found in NFS. Therefore, on that canvas, we are not limited to just accomplishing problems.

But overall, I really enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025100013', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1662480619}
review:
Auch wenn mir das Spiel gestellt wurde, hier meine ganz ehrliche und eigene Meinung. Anfänglich wirkt Train Valley gemütlich und wuselig, die Herausforderung lässt aber nicht lange auf sich warten. Zwischen den Weichen und Windungen der Strecken kann es schon einmal eng werden. Das ergibt eine wundervolle Mischung aus Spielspaß, Nervenkitzel und dem Willen es noch besser zu schaffen. Jedes Level kann mit optionalen Zielen abgeschlossen werden, um eine bessere Bewertung zu erreichen. Damit halten schwierige Level auch nicht im Fortschritt auf. Das nächste Erfolgserlebnis ist nie weit und mit mehr Erfahrung kann man alte Level noch einmal besser bestreiten.
Die Grafik ist angesichts der nun sieben Jahre Alter hübsch anzusehen und absolut stimmig. Aus heutiger Sicht würde man sich ein paar mehr Lichteffekte wünschen und ein wenig mehr abgerundete Objekte. Das ist aber etwas für die Nachfolger. Hier ist grafisch alles in bester Ordnung. Auch der Ton und Musik ist abwechslungsreich und nie störend. Hat man einmal die Signaltöne verinnerlicht, helfen diese gut dabei einen Überblick zu behalten.
Ein paar Punkte lassen sich noch bemängeln. So ist das Wirtschaftssystem sehr gering und bietet kaum Informationen über die Einnahmen und voraussichtlichen Ausgaben. Lediglich ein einziger Kontostand wird angezeigt und so bin ich das ein oder andere Mal durch irgendwelche Kosten in den Bankrott gestolpert. Hier würde ein wenig mehr Übersicht zu Steuern weiteren Kosten helfen. 
Grundsätzlich lassen sich die Schienen gut verlegen und die Steuerung ist recht intuitiv. Manchmal kommt es aber vor, dass sich an Engpässen zwei Enden einfach nicht verbinden lassen, was zu mehr Umbaumaßnahmen führt. Wenn beim Bauen hier die Karte deutlicher erlaubte oder zu steile Winkel anzeigen würde, wäre das nachvollziehbarer. Auch lassen sich Kreuzungen nur in Gänze Abbauen, sodass man die verbliebene Strecke wieder neu bauen muss. Das ist nicht sonderlich schlimm, könnte aber einfacher sein.
Abschließend kann ich das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der kleine Knobelspiele mit einer gewissen Prise von Nervenkitzel mag. Mich hat es sehr unterhalten und noch bin ich nicht am Ende angekommen. Viel Spaß euch allen mit dem Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204467091', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1615540845}

review:
[h3] Good strategic puzzle game. [/h3]

Some levels can be rather challenging and require a lot of concentration.
Each level can be retried as many times as needed to gain the 3 goals without being reset each time.
Using [Pause] is very useful for planning and laying/removing tracks.
The order of events on each retry is random which adds to the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425585627', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1658900064}
review:
一辆失控的列车在铁轨上行驶。在列车正行进的轨道上，有另一辆列车相向行驶，疾驰而来。列车将要发生碰撞。你站在改变列车轨道的操纵杆旁。如果拉动此杆，则列车将切换到另一条轨道上。而另一条轨道上什么都没有。你有两种选择：

1.什么也不做，让列车撞车并发生超级大爆炸，这将带来一定的损失，但是非常coooooooool！

2.拉下操纵杆，改变为另一条轨道。但列车依然会在转向的途中发生碰撞，没办法，铁路是如此的短，而它又是如此的loooooooong！

3.[spoiler]拉下操纵杆，并停下远处的列车。貌似是安全了，但后面窜出来的列车马上又会导致一场追尾。 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025471558', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1658879066}
review: It's not too bad of a game. If you're looking for a building sim, this might be it. Problem is that the speed of what happens on most levels is too fast. 1x speed feels like 4x speed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842647056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1666182989}
review:
Great little game.
Build a simple rail network to get trains to the correct station.
Easy, once you start, but soon gets tougher, much tougher.
More stations, more points to switch, more and faster trains.
Not long before there are trains crashing all over the place.
Simple cartoon graphics, keep it frustratingly fun and addictive. (Just one more go)
Audio is excellent, clean simple so you can hear when trains are waiting.
4 levels (Base game), Germany dlc adds 1 more level. Which isn't playable until the
base game is completed. I purchased as a bundle.
6 Scenes to each level I can see this staying on my pc for some time.
Lots of replay value
20hrs to play all scenes, inc DLC, got around 50% achievments
I will still play to get 100% achievments

author: {'steamid': '76561198991541704', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1663916975}
review:
замечательная игра.
мозг работает на полную, чувства кипят, каждый свисток паровоза, тепловоза, экспресса - лижет нервы, хочется запрудить поездами всю округу, каждый уровень - вызов тактическим способностям, музыка релаксирует, но это обманчиво - поезда в депо хотят наружу быстро и быстрее. надо выбить все ачивки, надо попробовать пройти всё в нон-стоп на третьей скорости, заграбастать побольше бабла, как выстроить линии дорог так, чтобы не щёлкать стрелками постоянно, как одновременно направить 10 поездов туда, куда им надо.
Не хватает уровней, делайте ещё уровней, намажьте побольше уровней, длс не длс, побоку. Не хватает песочницы с деньгами, бесконечный режим  - та песочница что есть - отстой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025518269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1657311617}
review:
I really want to like this game, but I ended up so frustrated I became bitter. It seemed like a charming chill game where you make a stylized diorama of trains, but I hate it.

Maybe I suck at the game, I don't know, but here's my beef with the game.

Too much randomness destroys any possibility for the player to make meaningful decisions. The terrain, stations, trains, train length, train speed, time they automatically depart, cargo value/destinations are completely random every single time. You enjoying and completing the level is almost entirely at the mercy of randomness. It is impossible to know what is going to happen which means everything is up in the air at all times. This isn't fun, quite stressful, and gives the player little agency in their strategy on top of juggling all this in real time. This overbearing amount of needless complexity kills the game dead in the water.

It is very unforgiving. Money is always very tight. You will go "Bankrupt" very easily. The game has maybe 20~25 levels, so it seems in order to prolong the experience, the difficult ramps up fast. I could not get passed the 6th level.

The tile based grid that the game is based on is large, which means that you will frequently bump into objects that cost money to demolish, non-movable objects cause the map to be very cramped, and the trains take up quite a bit of space on the rails. Judging a train's speed, ability to start and stop in very specific places on the limited track you can build with a tight budget, and micromanaging switches and trains is frustrating. You will need to create "Y" intersections quite a bit, which can run afoul quickly in tight areas.

Switches automatically move when a train goes over them. When there's dozens of switches and you seem positive you have a train on the right track and the game is playing 4-D chess with you, suddenly your train will be going the wrong way into the wrong station or another train.

The developer seems sincere, but the game has a lot of technical challenges they seem unable to fix. Trains explode for no reason sometimes. Their vision for the game probably isn't going to change and I don't think it's well designed. Maybe I'm missing something, but why is the default action always the "Switcher" tool and not the "Track" tool. The first thing you'd want to do is build track because there's no switches yet. I'm not even sure what the Switcher tool does. How can you possibly do anything other than click on a specific switcher which already is allowed while other tools are selected.

My solutions, to the best of my ability to imagine is the following:

Trains and stations need to be color coded. Currently there are icons over the train and station which is cluttered and confusing. Simply and intuitive it is not.

A train's path should be drawn over the tracks in a line its respective color so one can better visualize the route it will take as a toggle option.

Trains should not automatically pull out of a station. Challenges should revolve around the player making the choices of when trains leave the station and better optimizing their routes. This gives agency to the player and sets optional difficulty by how fast they want to tackle completing the level for time or money.

The levels should not be random with the ability to toggle it to random for optional challenges either before the level or unlocked after you complete the level.

AI for the trains to prevent imminent crashes or reroute. If you think that makes the game too easy, it's not when there's 6 trains on the tracks with complete random variables. There is too much micromanaging for my liking for the game to be enjoyable. Trains should also stop and start much quicker. Time is money in this game, and allowing trains to stop automatically or take an alternative path still penalizes you if you aren't paying attention. It would probably be a lot less frustrating then your trains exploding.

The challenges should be from the extra objectives. If the player can't beat the game casually, then it's probably too strict.

I do not recommend this game, and did not enjoy it. Even if you like trains, I wouldn't recommend it. As a management game, its real time nature is overwhelming. As a puzzle game, it does not contain puzzles, because puzzles let you know all the pieces before hand to allow you to figure out how to solve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063498280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1710656204}
review:
I am really enjoying time with this little train puzzle game so far. It seems like one of those games that can be enjoyed equally in both long hauls (pardon the pun) and short spurts as well. I really like the challenge level. This game can really push your brain and reflexes if you want to complete all of the stars (challenges) but it wisely allow progression with completing all of the individual challenges per each layout/mission, and that was really appreciated. It's challenging as all get up, in classic mode, but they included a fun sandbox mode to hone your skills, while scratching that creative itch. 

*DISCLOSURE: I bought this game during the Steam Summer Sale, but have a strong feeling having played it now, that I would recommend it a full price, and Train Valley 2 is now on my wish list as well.

CONCLUSION: I'll keep it simple. If you are a fan of trains, and enjoyed challenging puzzle games, this would be a STRONGLY RECOMMENDED BUY from me - with one caveat: If you are looking for a train-transportation-tycoon-style-sim, this game IS NOT that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982490998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 1653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1705437594}
review:
Vous en avez marre des grèves SNCF? 
Vous vous demandez pourquoi vos trains sont toujours en retard? 
Allez, prenons les commandes de Train Valley et faisons en sorte que le trafic ferroviaire soit fluide.

Train valley s'adresse à un certain public. Soit vous allez adorer, soit détester.
Le jeu à un concept simplissime: construire des rails afin de permettre aux trains d'arriver dans les bonnes gares! C'est un jeu qu'on pourrait retrouver sur tablette ou smartphone.
Moi, j'accroche et je vous le recommande en promo à tout petit prix.

author: {'steamid': '76561199111617691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1649628226}
review:
https://youtu.be/iGIbtOlJBKY

Train Valley is a simple train management game, where you go through history to complete missions and while on those missions you need to ensure that your trains don't crash, which is harder then it looks since you forgot to change a switch in the game and all of a sudden 2 trains are running into each other. Overall the game is really easy to pick up, and if you are good at concentration this game is going to be really fun for you, in most cases I forgot I had changed something and trains ends up running into each other! Then I restart and try again.

I have attached some gameplay so you can see if this is a game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198872166164', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1684933994}
review:
Despite the genre listings of "simulation" and "strategy", this is really a puzzle game, not a builder or sim, so if you're looking for something like a Railroad Tycoon game, then you won't find it here.

The game as a Puzzle Game: Good idea, and it's fun when it works. But the game has a few major flaws that makes it incredibly frustrating. There is a timer that appears only when there are 5 seconds left before the next train. If you have anything in that range, there's very little you can do especially when the levels are complex.

I was enjoying the game for a while, but the train management is just far too frustrating for complex levels. I can't recommend the game until the developer fixes issues like this, and revamps some of the track management. 

The game itself looks decent, though buggy and frustrating with issues, it just isn't what it looks like it is on the store page.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048735141', 'num_games_owned': 2348, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1946, 'last_played': 1654524205}
review:
A great management game to chill out.
Train Valley has a nice toy graphics, a peaceful music and lots of trains.
You build rail routes, junctions and try your best to not cause a catastrophe.
The game itself is not super hard, but getting all stamps for all quets can be tricky.

Train Valley was super fun for me.
I highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968566119', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1653863191}
review:
Fun puzzle game, which increases in difficulty slightly then tremendously. Each map has 3 elements to win, which you only need 1 to pass on to the next stage. Some challenges are to: Never stop a train; Never let a train enter the wrong station; Never destroy a track; Spend enough; Don't spend too much; Do destroy objects worth enough $; Don't destroy objects worth so much $; etc.

I stopped after I couldn't complete one board which escalated the difficulty significantly which started with all railroads turned one direction, but the requirements were to connect them all in reverse. I tried to solve it for over an hour, but had to stop for the day. Every tiny mistake ended in failure. Even the randomness of the board's spawns could cause failure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128089685', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1653557854}
review:
[h1]Train Valley[/h1]
Veľmi jednoduchá a zábavná vláčiková hra, pri ktorej sa dá perfektne zrelaxovať. Princíp hry je jednoduchý. Postav si svoju koľaj a pošli vlak z miesta A do miesta B tak, aby si sa vyhol bankrotu a železničnému nešťastiu. V hre možno chýba oživenie tzv. horiacimi vlakmi, ale to by vývojári museli mať väčšie skúsenosti s cestovaním vlakom po Slovensku. Grafika, ovládateľnosť a optimalizácia nemá žiadnu väčšiu chybu a aj všetky bugy sa mi vyhli. V konečnom dôsledku ide o nadpriemernú hru nezávislého štúdia, ktorú všetkým fanúšikom vláčikov, môžem len a len odporúčať.

[b]Achievement hunteri:[/b] Všetky achievementy sa dajú pomerne ľahko získať. Potrebné i DLC.
[b]Pomer cena a zábava:[/b] Výrazné zľavy, v ktorých sa hra kúpiť jednoznačne oplatí.
[b]Celkový dojem z hry:[/b] ★★★★/5.

review: 我以为是策略类游戏，管理火车及调度的。实时上我感觉连益智游戏都算不上。实时上就是你在几个火车站之间运货，朝不同的火车站运货，你要手动切换不同的轨道，你没听错，是手动切换。你在游戏中唯一要做的就是铺轨道，切换轨道。仅此而已。。此游戏根本没有时间安排，火车调度一说，货物转联运等概念。实在想不通这个游戏那么多奖项是哪里来的。糟糕！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198409512948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2389, 'last_played': 1649342815}
review:
●给游戏两个标签：模拟经营、火车控
●游戏实属非常小众了，火车控的玩家会爱不释手，对火车不感冒的玩家，可能会想，这是啥？
●简单概括游戏玩法：通过花费资金修建铁路，让指定颜色的火车进入指定的车站，从而获得资金，来完成不同的关卡。
●你是什么玩家：
一般玩家：所有关卡打通；
高手玩家：在关卡打通基础上做到三星打通（每一星都是一个额外的任务，比如不能撞车等等）；
骨灰玩家：完成所有的成就。
●本人玩游戏的心路：
（1）刚刚进入游戏，天呐，这什么神仙游戏，满足了火车控、铁道控的我，做梦都在想怎样优化线路；
（2）10-20小时，有点点疲倦，尤其是完美主义，让我每关都想拿3星通关，结果卡在某一关卡；
（3）决定先通过，再重头刷三星；
（4）30小时左右，完成三星；
（5）现在40小时，成就已经刷完，以后应该不会再来玩了，有点点累。
●已经开始玩第二部，不知道为什么，游戏的吸引力没有最开始那么高了。

如果给游戏评分的话，10分我给8分，火车控、轨道控的朋友一定要玩，不会失望的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198258753615', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1674402075}
review:
Parafraseando a TotalBiscuit, Train Valley es un rompecabezas en tiempo real. Es divertido y frustrante al mismo tiempo. La complejidad del juego avanza a medida que vas armando las vias donde los trenes pasaran para ir dirigirse a sus estaciones correspondientes.

Los niveles se dividen por temporada, cada una de estas situadas en diferentes 5 diferentes paises, y uno de ellos viene en formato DLC, por lo cual si quieres completar el juego en su totalidad, debes desembolsar algo más de dinero.

La ambientación de los mapas son muy diversos, pero debido lo frenetico que llega a convertirse el juego, no da tiempo de si quiera detenerte disfrutar el paisaje o como se transporta los trenes de manera calmada, ya que todo se va acumulando, y si no liberas el trafico a tiempo, todo se termina convirtiendo en un caos. Esto es para mi uno de los puntos más negativos del juego.

Si buscas un juego para divertirte armando vias y ver a trenes ir desde el punto A al punto B sin querer frustrarte o desesperante en el proceso. Esto no es para ti.

Pero si quieres poner a prueba o ejercitar tu mente para buscar soluciones y completar retos, Train Valley te lo entregará sin ninguna duda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840392253', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1648463124}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981412938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1677955740}
review:
It's an action puzzle game about choo-choos and chuga-chugas in which you place tracks to avoid trains smashing into each other. Or do it on purpose to get the achievement.

Quite addictive. And nicely constructed rail system just makes you feel good.

It's very similiar to an old DOS game I loved as a schoolboy, not sure if it's from the same creators or not. But it's funny that there're at least three train puzzle games with the same gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 2028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1642723380}
review:
[code]Puedes ver más reseñas como esta en la mentoría [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Realmente divertido[/h1]

La premisa de Train Valley no podría ser más simple: llevar a los trenes a su estación. Esto, que es una simpleza, esconde una jugabilidad realmente entretenida y bastante retadora en muchos momentos.

A través de diferentes escenarios tendremos que ir construyendo las vías que unan las diferentes estaciones y hacer que los trenes lleguen a la estación adecuada. Sobre el papel suena bastante simple, pero luego la cosa se complica en la práctica.

La razón para esto es que las estaciones aparecerán a veces en lugares donde habrá que pensar muy bien en una estrategia a la hora de construir las vías, ya que nuestros recursos son limitados y vamos perdiendo dinero cada poco tiempo a modo de impuestos.

En poco tiempo tendremos una maraña de vías con varios desvíos unos encima de otros, todos ellos llevando de una estación a otra y donde tendremos que estar pulsándolos para variar el recorrido correctamente y que todo funcione como debería. En sí, sé que puede sonar un tanto simple, pero el resultado final es algo realmente divertido.

Durante el juego visitaremos 4 países diferentes con 6 escenarios por país a cada cual con mayor complejidad. En todos los países empezaremos a principios de siglo pasado, con esos trenes de vapor lentos, e iremos avanzando año tras año hasta llegar al siglo XXI con los trenes de alta velocidad como protagonistas, mucho más veloces y por lo tanto mucho más complejo de manejar todo. Sin embargo, tendremos la opción de pausar la acción en todo momento para poder plantear la estrategia correctamente.

Además del juego base también existe un DLC que incluye seis misiones más ubicadas en Alemania, y te recomiendo que si te gusta el juego base te plantees hacerte con él también porque añade nuevos escenarios y retos a los ya existentes.

Cada escenario tendrá tres objetivos que cumplir a modo de extras y podrán ser muy variados. Algunos serán gastar X dinero como mínimo o como máximo, hacer salir a X trenes extra de las estaciones, no chocar ningún tren o evitar que un tren equivoque su estación, entre otros objetivos.

El juego como tal es un título sin pretensiones, que lo único que pretende es hacerte pasar un buen rato mientras diseñas vías ferroviarias y haces que todo funcione como debería. Y desde luego que lo consigue.

Su apartado gráfico es bonito y aunque no destaca especialmente en nada cumple perfectamente con su función. Exactamente lo mismo para el apartado sonoro, donde los temas musicales nos acompañarán en cada momento y serán un añadido que hará más entretenida la experiencia.

Así que ya sabes, si te gusta la estrategia y los retos y quieres pasar unas 15 horas montando vías y dirigiendo el tráfico ferroviario como si tuvieras una mesa a escala en tu casa, sin duda este juego colmará tus necesidades y hará que te diviertas bastante con su simpática propuesta. De hecho, puede llegar a ser bastante adictivo en determinados momentos.

author: {'steamid': '76561199003745111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1644328391}
review:
電車を運行するシミュレーションゲームっぽいガワで、資金が制限時間代わりのパズルゲーム。
ストレスを堪えながら何回も同じステージをやり直す根気があるならオススメ。

各ステージの初回プレイでは情報が足りてない。シミュレーションゲームでは普通かもしれないけどパズルゲームとしてはかなりダルい仕様で、ゲームオーバーになりながら線路を組む。
線路を組んでも、急に意味わからんところから意味分からん電車がでてきて事故を起こし、無事ゲームオーバーになる。
金銭的にかなりシビアなので追加の電車を走らせると、思ったより速い電車やら長い電車が出てきて事故を起こし、無事ゲームオーバーになる。

author: {'steamid': '76561198181148895', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1699030628}
review:
不知道为什么，最近特别喜欢玩这种“益智类”游戏。

我虽然不是核心玩家，但玩过的游戏种类很多很杂。最近突然发现，这种益智类的游戏真的很治愈。它没国产网游手游的里的尔虞我诈，互相攀比；没有格斗游戏、FPS游戏那么高的门槛和技术要求；玩它也不需要像玩类魂游戏那样有着十足的耐心和毅力。

虽然它可能带给不了我像黑魂那种通关之后的巨大成就感，但在凉爽的下午，一边吃着零食，喝着可乐，聊着微信，一玩就是几个小时过去了。

这种悠闲惬意，是我除了玩老任的一些游戏以外，玩别的类型的游戏体会不到的。

以前游戏只是打发无聊时间的休闲手段，后来游戏变得越来越硬核，越来越有竞技性。需要投入大量的精力，时间去琢磨，研究。而这款游戏，真的让我找回了一丝童年玩游戏的初衷。

author: {'steamid': '76561198101352204', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1644983100}
review:
上手简单，精通困难；
看似休闲，三星硬核；
一局天亮，时间杀手；
反复折磨，考验耐心！

过年为了参加黑盒活动买的这游戏，才4块钱，约等于白给，游戏画面、音乐都一般话，但是这个游戏性只能说太上头了，两天玩了20小时，根本停不下来呀！一口气全三星通关了，发现还有个德国DLC没买，但是打折已经过了，啊啊啊！后面再说吧。这游戏太适合我了，刚好还有点余额，于是果断直接买了2代，画面更加精美，强烈推荐！

通关小tips：铺铁轨摸索一段时间就能发现几个基本技巧了（貌似跟拓补结构有点关系），简单来说就是多造圈，让车在圈上转起来就好办了，增加冗余轨道，最好是对向两个站同时出车都能走一条单独轨道，铁轨铺得越规整越有利于调度，前期随便铺也行，但是日本东京每一块地都贵的离谱，车还特别长，慎重布局。

author: {'steamid': '76561198176112202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1643473026}
review:
このゲームの難しさはその煩雑さにある。
同時に走る列車と線路を管理して行き先に届ける。出発管理、路線建設の管理やポイントの切替をしつつ、しばらくすると勝手に出発してしまうのでそこも見ておかないといけない(しかも出発直前にならないとわからない、ステージが進むと勝手発車までの時間も早まる)。
それを何本も同時にみなければいけない。それだけでなく予算も見ないといつの間にか破産している。
同時に見ることが多すぎすべてが勝手に進行するので忙殺され疲れる。最初の方はいいけど後半ちょっとしたミスですぐに詰んでしまう。
計画立てる難しさはほとんどなく要点以外はいきあたりばったり。むしろのんびり列車を眺めてられるくらいがいいよなあ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198859599796', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1708949210}
review:
Train Valley as a simulation of a toy train set, pitched in a puzzle environment with rules, challenges and restrictions.

I have never been interested in trains or toy trains owning a toy train set.  I am now 41 years old and I am enjoying this game so much that I wonder if this is my midlife crisis.  Maybe I will now buy a train set.

I am playing through the campaign mode - about halfway through so far.  Each level consists of a map with various obstacles and terrain and two or three train stations.  As time passes, trains appear in each station with a destination marked on them and every now and again additional stations appear too.  Your job is to build the tracks and to control the switches that guide the trains to their destination.  When a train reaches its destination you receive income.  The quicker the journey, the more you will earn.

Switches are automatically added where tracks connect.  You may lay track that crosses over other track, destroy previously laid tracks and destroy obstacles, such as trees or buildings.  Building tracks and destroying obstacles costs money and as time passes your money decreases under the guise of annual taxes.  When trains crash they blow up and damage everything around them.  It's quite fun :)

You successfully complete a level if you reach the end of the time allowed without going bankrupt - exploding trains are fine, but don't run out of money!  There are other challenges for bonus points, such as earning a certain amount in a given level or avoiding trains crashing, things like that.

Is it fun?

Yes.  Not bad.  I got this on discount for less than $1 and it's really good value for money.

I really feel like I am building a toy train set and guiding trains around.  It can be very satisfying optimising routes around the map and watching your toy trains pass within tiny spaces of each other, but not colliding.  It has a good feeling about it when you do something clever, probably once or twice per level.

This is NOT a transport simulator, it is not an intense puzzle game and it's not a management sim.

This IS a fairly simple puzzle game, building tracks and guiding toy trains to their destination.  It is not particularly challenging, but not totally casual either.  You will have to concentrate and plan and have the restrictions of budget holding you back a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041524040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1656262446}
review:
A fun game. The graphics obviously aren't overwhelming, but they are more then good enough for what this game is trying to be.

The distinction between worlds and the gradual learning curve make this a good game to pick up quickly, but you still notice a significant improvement on your skills in the late game compared to early game. The challenges make you think on your feet and add a nice, optional extra layer of difficulty on top. I've finished the base game in about 15 hours (after which i'm now writing this review), but that's a good amount of time for a good game. If you don't care about the optional challenges, you're probably done in less time, but who plays a game like this if they don't want to see how good they can get?

The DLC seems to be priced fairly for the amount of content it provides from what I can tell, so if you see me having played more since this review, you know I got myself the DLC to dabble a little more in some train valley action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052707118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3152, 'last_played': 1659907673}
review:
A great game, somewhat reminiscent of 'Locomotion', an ages old game where you had to direct trains to the corresponding station. However in 'Train Valley' you don't only direct the trains but you have to build the very tracks aswell. This alone does add up to the fun immensely. Also you could put more trains on the tracks as you see fit. Of course this will not only increase the amount of money you can earn, but it will most definitely rampi up the difficulty to sometimes insane heights.

Graphics, sounds and music are perfectly fine for a game of this kind and the developers did put quite a lot of details in the game as well. For example you will start out with slow and old trains that are reasonable short and easy to navigate around the tracks. But that's only the beginning: Later on during the levels the trains will get more modern, faster and longer.

Still that's not all. There are hidden gimmicks in the levels that will appeal to yourself during gameplay and keep everything fresh and fun. Of course I won't mention them for the sake of letting you find out for yourself. You most likely will, because this is a classy game you should definitely add to you library. And while you're at it, please do beg the devs to release more levels in the form of DLC in the future. Thanks in advance. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047883602', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1642304592}
review:
一先ず日本ステージのラスト以外、攻略しました。

MAP上の駅と駅を線路で接続し列車を走らせて収益を得て、新たな線路を引いていく。
線路を引くことMAP上の障害物を除去するのにお金を消費し、一定時間(ゲーム内の年数)経つ毎発生する税収でも手持ちのお金が減っていく。

謎の中毒性があるのは確かでステージを失敗しても、もう一回と続けてしまう。失敗を積み重ねた末のクリアの達成感で楽しめているが、ただ失敗した時のストレス、ステージごとの追加課題を上手くクリアできない時のストレスなど、結構しんどいので素直におススメは出来ない。
駅から出る列車の種類(全長やスピード、駅まで届けた際の金額)のランダム性に悩ませられる。前半ステージは線路を引くのに多少の自由度が有り楽しいが、後半の日本ステージは狭いMAPで如何に効率よく線路を引くかが求められる。

author: {'steamid': '76561199099159316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1641771532}
review:
Don't let this game fool you; Despite the cute looks and the nice colors, I've found gameplay to be difficult, even on the easy maps & gamemodes. This game is good in overall simplexity of where to send trains to and how to do it. It seems simple at first, but just wait till you click on the infinite symbol available at the end of every level.

For me, it seemed so simple and complicated so easily. I sometimes built tracks right as the trains were rolling through em. Other times, I knew exactly what to do and became focused.

I would recommend this game, but only for people who would be a lot better at it than me.

review:
A lot of potential, but ultimately the game is more infuriating than it is a satisfying puzzle game. Too much randomness and babysitting signals (sometimes at low speed to ensure you don't miss any since a single mistake can ruin your level, so you need to be risk averse) for it to make a good puzzle game. 

I gave it a few tries since it does have a bit of a nice addictive feel to it, but each time after 15-40 minutes it makes me so annoyed I just turn it off.
