author: {'steamid': '76561198378894513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1659850233}
review:
I've never considered a career in the railways other than the occasional, childish dreams of cruising along the rails in an engine cutting through the country from one town to another. So when I saw the warm, colorful title in my recommended I was intrigued and soon found myself eager to appease my sense of adventure, entreating those child like fantasies to the opportunity that laid before me. At first I found the game to be rather fulfilling, crafting literal bridges between communities by building an effective locomotive network and watching the trains gracefully push towards their destinations.
Then, things started to get a little different. The number of depots just kept growing as did the number of trains needing to traverse the railways. I felt the pressure but I was buckling down and making it work. Sure a few departures were delayed, and the rail networks I've crafted weren't always perfect and needed some revisions but it continued to function just well enough.
 But the demand and growth just kept rising and rising and rising. I began to feel overwhelmed. I scrambled to direct each engine to their appropriate destinations with careful planning and navigation. Trains were left sitting in depots for what felt an eternity and after leaving often needed to stall to allow passage of another locomotive on the same circuit. The intensity of it all became too much and I found myself unable to cope with the pressure and turned to the bottle. At first it was just to take the edge off, but it wasn't long before I was sneaking whiskey on the job. 
Then one day... the unthinkable happened.  I sent two on their way but I wasn't careful enough. The damn booze, I got sloppy and I didn't notice I sent them right at each other. By the time I realized it, it was too late. Those poor bastards slammed right into each other and both trains were completely destroyed. They died, and it was entirely my fault. An investigation took place and as soon as they smelled the vapors on my breath it was the end for me. Then it got real ugly. Before I was just tipping the bottle but now, I was swimming in it. I lost my house, wife, kids and everything with any value to me. 
Things were bleak, and i did some things to get by that I wasn't too proud of but nothing compared to the shame I felt from the men who died because of my ineptitude. One day, after wondering around for years, I sat next to some tracks and watched a train pass by. I was immediately reminded of those fond dreams living a peaceful life on the rails. It was just the inspiration I needed to finally climb out of that bottle. I decided that I would carry on that dream and that I would carry on the memory of  those who died as a stern reminder to never bury my responsibilities again. I have a long road ahead of me and have a lot to prove before I'm ready to take the reigns again, but if I steel my resolve and stay true to the course I'll find my way back on top in Train Valley.
So yeah I'd say it's a pretty fun game. A bit challenging at times and can be a little trial and error but you learn what works and what doesn't and apply what you learn moving forward. Would recommend to anyone  10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169103954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1640534927}
review:
８割引で購入したけど‥‥うーん、これは私には厳しい‥‥

ゲーム内容としてはストラテジーやシミュレーションというよりパズル。駅のポイントを切り替えて列車を駅に運ぶパズルに、レールを敷くことで前提の盤面を変えておけるストラテジー要素が付いた感じ。時間が経つごとに駅や列車が追加されてより煩雑になる。

それ自体は良いのですけど

ポイントがいつの間にか切り替わっていて列車が想定外の方向に進んだリ、列車は時間経過で勝手に出発するため入ろうとした駅からクロスカウンターを喰らって爆発したり、列車の長さがランダムで駅から出てくるまで分からず、すれ違いが出来ずに爆発したり、追加の駅が既存のレールを分断して作成されてて、列車がそこに突っ込んで爆発‥‥
理不尽と感じる「事故」がとにかく多くて「あーなんでだ！？」叫ぶことしきりで。

レールが引けると言っても(初期の)マップは狭いし、予算も少ないので結局、路線図的には毎回似たような形になるものちょっと残念。
あと、何もない時の列車の動き（特に出発時の加速）がトロくて気になるが、時間を加速すると、上記理不尽な事故が唐突に起きてレベル失敗になってしまうという。

総じてやりにくいと感じたゲーム。私が下手なだけだと言われると、そうかもしれませんけれど。
見た目はかわいいと思うけれど、見ている暇もないし‥‥。

author: {'steamid': '76561199122160757', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1643470428}
review:
非常不错的作品，非常考验脑力和反应力，规划轨道时的技巧性也很强，不同的规划会带来不同的玩法
你可以选择双向也可以选择单轨——一切取决与你可支配的金钱和地形
你可以用轨道建立起一个个岔道，支持几列列车的同时行驶——当然，你要避免它们相撞
同时，游戏中的3个任务也使其令人一遍遍经营，集邮时一次次小失误总会让你有些不甘心，想一遍遍地完美通关
画风略老，但放到今天仍是一部不错的佳作

author: {'steamid': '76561199156895515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1705333939}
review:
Apenas lo instalo y ya me clave 4.6 horas, una locura este juego de trenes. Si no lo conoces que es lo mas seguro, es un juego donde debemos construir vias y conectar las estaciones para que los trenes circulen entre ellas.
Si a primera vista parece una cagada pero es bastante dificil y tiene bocha de pantallas que nos ponen a prueba para no chucar los trenes y con el dinero que nos dan hacer todo esto sin quedar en banca rota.

Los [b] MODOS DE JUEGO [/b] son dos: 
Clasico: basicamente es pasar los niveles con una que otra mision.
Sandbox: donde haremos lo que queremos sin limite de dinero y solo por diversion de ver los trenes pasar o chocarse entre si.

Realmente denle una oportunidad si les caben estos juegos xq este es muy bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028903083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1662864316}
review:
Train Valley 2 just went on sale, and that reminded me that I had this earlier Train Valley.  It has languished, almost unplayed, on my drive for quite awhile.   Out of curiosity -- almost not remembering it -- I fired it up this evening.   Now I can't figure out why I didn't play it much.  It's actually an interesting little game, with charming graphics.  And it runs perfectly on my rig.  

Indeed, now I've decided to buy Train Valley 2 and its DLC while it's on sale, too.   That's a pretty earnest endorsement of the original.  I haven't seen it get quite difficult yet -- although I expect that to be coming, given comments in some other reviews.  But I must say -- the user interface seems pretty well designed, so if it gets very difficult it also seems that  I'll have only myself to blame if I can't solve whatever challenge it throws at me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089531410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1682539299}
review:
OK, das hat anfangs noch sehr viel Spaß gemacht, aber leider hält sich der nicht ewig! Woran liegt das? Nun, zuallererst mal daran, dass nicht wirklich viel Abwechslung geboten wird. Viel schlimmer ist aber die Spielmechanik.

Eigentlich könnte das ganze ein nettes Gelegenheitsspiel sein, dessen Level man immer und immer wieder spielt und versucht die Konstriktion zu verfeinern. Gerade auch weil das Spiel mit wenigen Bedienelementen daherkommt macht es zunächst ja auch vieles richtig, der Teufel steckt aber im Detail, und damit kommt auch der Frust: 

Wieso kann ich nicht abspeichern? Gerade bei den schwereren Level nervt es, immer wieder von vorn beginnt zu müssen, wenn man eigentlich mal eine solide Grundlage gebaut hat. 
Wieso gibt es keinen Timer, der mir anzeigt, welcher Zug wann losfährt und wie viel Zeit noch bleibt - ich mag das nicht manuell wo aufschreiben, und spätestens, wenn sich 8 Züge gleichzeitig neu ankündigen, dann schreibt man entweder mit, oder kriegt zwangsläufig einen Crash. 

Leider weiß das Spiel die Komplexität auch nur damit zu steigern, indem es möglichst viele Züge gleichzeitig reinwirft - das ginge besser, z. B. mit größeren oder komplexeren Landschaften. Auch die dauerhafte Budgetknappheit, das mangels Geld kaum formbare Terrain, die superlangsamen Züge (die Zeit beschleunigen gibt es zwar, aber das führt auch schneller zu neuen Zügen, bringt also nix), die fehlende Möglichkeit nur einzelne Züge zu beschleunigen, die ewiggleichen und auch blödsinnigen Aufgaben, etc. lassen leider eher Frust aufkommen und zeugen davon, dass das Spiel in diesem Teil noch nicht ausgereift ist. 

Ich bin also abschließend etwas hin- und hergerissen. Denn das Spiel an sich hat soo viel Potential! Auch weiß ich, dass es einen zweiten Teil gibt, aber im Moment schreckt mich der erste Teil eher vom Kauf des zweiten ab und drum kann ich den Teil auch nicht guten Gewissens weiterempfehlen :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198111787165', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1636254004}
review:
Stress, Aniexty, Fun & Pain...

These are all the things you will feel as you race to not only construct, but also conduct the trains on your line to safely get them to their correct coloured home. When you first jump in, you'd be forgiven for thinking this is a game for kids, but boy o boy does this game ramp up. Very quickly you'll have lines running everywhere, and trains coming at you from every angle.

Sit down, grab your choice of caffeinated drink, and watch the hours fly by, as you try and get your trains home safely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179284646', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1679682278}
review:
I bought this game the same way as I imagine a lot of us here did, as a part of the elegant engineering bundle.
I thought the price of the bundle was fine for Poly Bridge, Turmoil and Minimetro and just tossed this game aside. 
Years later I thought I might just try it for a few minutes and damn me; this game is actually pretty cool!
I really enjoyed the difficulty curve and I loved the moment when my head clicked with the game and I finally managed to multitask multiple trains at the same time.
The music is fine, the visuals do their job and I have barely encountered any glitches.
All in all this is a throughout 'fine' game, if not very ambitious. 
Just keep in mind its a puzzle game not a city builder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135223', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1634407920}
review:
Train Valley est un jeu de gestion, ou nous devons créer des chemins de fer pour ensuite aiguiller des trains jusqu'a destination!
Le principe est simple, la réalisation est bonne, l'amusement est bien là!
La difficulté est progressive et les derniers niveaux sont un réel défis!

Je recommande ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198943019223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1696498830}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048814614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1634945649}
review:
A simple little train management game where you have to figure out how to get all the trains safely to their stations.
It looks very simple, and frankly old-fashioned, but it is highly addictive.
The learning curve is not very steep, but it does get harder as you progress, with some of the later levels needing you to keep cool and stay focused as more and more trains are waiting to go out it can get a bit stressful.
You can do a half an hour game session, but it is easy to spend hours just figuring out where exactly you went wrong in your last try in the later stages.
Replay value is good if you want to finish all the levels with the full set of extra objectives.
I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002831274', 'num_games_owned': 1574, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1632815782}
review:
J'ai découvert Train Valley en jouant à Train Valley 2 bien avant. L'ayant adoré, je me lance désormais dans le premier.

Un gameplay plus simpliste et bien moins contraignant. Presque trop simple à mon gout, surtout quand on a terminé tous les niveaux du second avec toutes les distinctions ! Ici on se contentera d'apporter des trains vers une autre gare. Pas de système de "craft" avec un acheminement de ressources diverses comme le second mais ça reste plutôt sympa.

Les niveaux sont jolis avec une 3D simple mais réussie.

( Je ne peux pas noter la bande son vu que j'exploite le jeu dans un environnement où je ne peux pas faire de bruit [strike] bébé dort et doit resté endormi [/strike] )

Un peu court comparé au second opus et sa ribambelle de niveaux tous plus différents les uns que les autres. Comptez ici 4 chapitre dans l'édition de base avec 5 niveaux chacun.

A prendre à tout petit prix puis lancez vous dans TRAIN VALLEY 2 qui est vraiment une réussite !

author: {'steamid': '76561198922419143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 2183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1632488790}
review:
[h1]Что это за игра?[/h1]
Детская мечта

[h1]Плюсы игры?[/h1]
1. Простая, но относительно нормальная графика.
2. Механика геймплея простая и понятная.
3. Благодаря разнообразию уровней и заданий игра не наскучивает со временем.
4. За режим песочницы отдельный плюс.

[h1]Минусы?[/h1]
1. Есть возможность приближения и отдаления камеры на карте, но нет (или не нашел) возможность её повернуть.
2. В режим песочницы было бы неплохо добавить автоматизацию в плане отправки поезда из точки А в В и избегания ими самими столкновений. А так же не хватает возможности выбирать самому станцию отправки и прибытия.

[h1]Итог?[/h1]
Игра прикольная. Минусов, как таких, нет. Только личные пожелания. 5 составов из 5-ти.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018016339', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1628324461}
review:
열차들이 각각의 목적지에 도달할 수 있도록 레일을 깔아주는 일종의 퍼즐게임입니다. 열차마다 색깔이 존재하며 같은 색깔을 가지고 있는 목적지에 보내주는 것이 목표입니다.

레일을 까는 데 있어서 고려해야 할 요소는 돈, 지형 그리고 구조물들입니다. 이 게임은 일종의 장애요소로 구조물들위에 레일을 짓기 위해서 일정금액을 지불해야 하게끔 만들었는데, 그 금액이 천차만별이라 어쩔 수 없이 주위를 둘러가야 할 때가 많습니다.

레일이 겹쳐지는 구간에서는 방향을 바꿀 수 있는데 이 부분을 수동으로 조작해줘야 합니다. 나중에는 8개의 열차역이 생기는데 이때쯤 되면 레일을 수동으로 조작해야되는 구간도 많아져 굉장히 정신없습니다. 그래서 필연적으로 열차가 다른 목적지에 도달해서 다시 되돌리는 상황도 자주 발생하고 열차끼리 부딪혀 막심한 손해를 얻을 때도 많습니다.

아주 천천히 그리고 신중하게 해야하는 게임입니다.

7/10 : 나쁘지는 않지만 잘 다듬어지지는 않은 게임.

review: Всю игру от вас лишь требуется проводить рельсы и переключать стрелочный перевод для последующего движения поезда в тот или иной путь. Но есть условия для открытия новых эпох - не ставить паузу, пройти без аварий и так далее. Каждое условие накопительное и труда не составит переиграть уровень заново для открытия новой эпохи - которых несколько и в них открываются новые поезда. По части это игра головоломка без особой сложности.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107401538', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1607629694}
review:
Si au debut le joue est plaisant, trouver la meilleure trajectoire pour placer les rails  fin de destination efficace des trains, sans trop "se melanger les pinceaux", on arrive vite a un niveau ou clairement on se pose la question suivante, si le jeu n'est pas fait pour echouer, ni plus ni moins. Et, on en arrive a de la frustration, sentiment tres negatif. A moins que le but reel soit simplement de faire echouer le joueur ?! 

Bref : passe ton rail, non pardon, ton chemin, ainsi tu ne risques pas d'arriver sur une voie de garage inutile et instatisfaisante. ;-) 

:-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198023776638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1624792386}
review:
It took a little bit of getting used to. You have to build the tracks and set the switches manually, and it gets frantic when there are multiple trains all swanning about. As far as I can tell you can't stop trains either, they just go off until they reach their destination... or crash. And blow up all the tracks around them.

So I was screaming in chaos initially because from level 2 onwards, 1x speed really is necessary, the pause helps a lot, and the sandbox mode is very useful for planning! But the game doesn't really tell you about any of those things. But it is such a beautiful well made game that I did not have it in my heart to refund it. I don't know when I will pick it up next but I am sure I will at least have fun looking at the game even if I am not making much progress with the campaign.

Fun with my son and a different kind of fun on my own.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971188245', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1622902514}
review:
Whether you succeed at level has more to do if things randomly spawn in an order that allows you to win rather than skill or planning. An example:
 - build tracks, put train on track to destination.
 - town spawns in middle of track, destroys train and rail line.
 - not enough money to build new lines, get charged tax, lose game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131926054', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1547660467}
review:
Recensione completa: [url]https://www.tanadelcobra.com/train-valley/[/url]

Train Valley e’ molto appagante. La sua grafica cartoonesca dai colori caldi e’ molto rilassante, e nonostante serva parecchia concentrazione per portare il livello fino al termine, la difficolta’ non e’ mai eccessiva e con una buona pianificazione, ed a volte un paio di tentativi, la pagnotta si porta sempre a casa.
Ecco, forse il limite di Train Valley e’ qui: ci sono solo 20 livelli, e non sono troppo impegnativi. Ci sono tre obiettivi da raggiungere in ogni scenario, che puo’ essere completato anche ottenendone uno solo; davvero troppo semplice. Per allungare la longevita’ personalmente non ritengo un livello concluso fino ad aver raggiunto tutti e tre gli obiettivi, ma certo e’ un palliativo. Non c’e’ un level editor e il sandbox mode non e’ altro che la rivisitazione degli stessi livelli finiti in precedenza. Un DLC aggiunge 6 nuovi livelli, ma il prezzo di 2.5 Euro e’ secondo me eccessivo.

Voto: 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198008749599', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1619467432}
review:
This is exactly what I wanted from a train management game. The gameplay is more arcadey and action oriented. No complicated mechanics, just a simple, straight forward, get the right train to the right station type deal. 

There are 5 stages with 6 levels each. The last level in each stage is focused on high score but the rest give you 3 objectives to complete as an added challenge or for the completion achievement. Last stage is unfortunately a paid DLC but it is only a few bucks. So you build your tracks and as new stations pop up, you expand or adjust those tracks. The rest of the gameplay is just managing trains – who goes first and who goes after. The trains are constantly popping up and it can get really hectic, especially at some of the later levels. The pause button is your best friend, as you will be pausing after pretty much every train to make sure its route is clear. This whole process was very engaging to me. I had to really think about the correct order of operations and when everything went smooth, it felt satisfying.

It would have been nice to have some additional features or building options (I do think some of these are available in the sequel), but it was not necessary. Sometimes the simple way is the better way. If you are looking for a train management game that is more fast paced and action oriented, this would be the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198823065180', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1619641551}
review: played TV2 happily, and based on some reviews, TV1 supposed to be even better. Can't agree, this building process is way more flat, just stations, trains are too slow, budget is the biggest issue, and is less challenging despite constant mission restarts after EOY bankrupcy (very expensive railroads + train moves so slowly it takes literally one year from A to B! that's NOT what i'd like to watch). Building of railtracks is also so slow I often don't realize that a dispatched train might crash. It's still great tho. But it's just 20+5 missions vs 30+20 missions, way lasy gametime! I like TV2 direction and hope to see TV3 soon. With some twist, like buses or people visible on the streets, or households, or bigger maps, or more weather. I don't get why a nice night atmosphere in some missions in TV didn't appear in TV2. The series easily beat all train games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198848776404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1642150277}
review:
本游戏包含：建造铁路，管理交通，火车错站，铁路爆炸，扳道岔模拟器，我咋又破产了，能过关就算成功，以及可以使你内心平静的优秀音乐等众多要素。
游戏难易度：比较简单
游戏玩法：1.建造铁轨 2.发车 3.火车到站收钱（自动完成）4.继续建造铁轨 5.避免破产 完成以上几步就可以过关了，看是不是很简单呢。

玩转 1830 到 2020 年的欧洲、美国、日本和苏联，本体共有四大章节外加一个德国DLC，每大章内又有6小关，每关发车时间都是随机的，可重复游玩性极高，每一大章都有各自的主题，配合着每个国家不同的风土人情而分别制作的地图和BGM令人耳目一新，从 1849 年淘金热到第一次载人航天的飞行，从游戏初期烧煤的小火车到后期的高铁，历史的发展多么令人震撼，游戏的细节真是做到了极致
奇奇怪怪的成就也极大丰富了游戏的可玩性，虽然我不是成就党，但看到这些成就还是想去尝试下[spoiler]就快完成100次爆炸了（笑[/spoiler]
总之是一款极其优秀的小游戏，买了别吃灰，玩了绝不亏

author: {'steamid': '76561198896288874', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1697367781}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992487271', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1618785814}
review:
TLDR; This is an amazing gem on Steam and worth every penny at full price.

I play shooters aka COD etc., I play games like GTA Online, Red Dead Online, Destiny: Big AAA games.... I even dabble in roguelite games ala Hades and Dead Cells. But I'm not saying I'm a robot trained to play only big money games or super popular games. Just like everyone else I find small gems every once in a while. This is definitely one of those gems. It does feel like a mobile game, but I literally just looked it up on my android and it didn't find it lol. I'm glad steam can claim this as an amazing PC exclusive, at least as far as I can tell. This is an amazing rendition of the popular Air Traffic Control games from mobile phones but with trains via laying train tracks instead of drawing paths for vehicles, so if you loved those you'll love this. Just get it. Even at full price.

review:
[b] Simetri takıntınız varsa A L M A Y I N ! [/b]

Oyunda nihai amacımız istasyonlar arası raylar döşeyerek ulaşımı sağlamak ve trenleri gitmeleri gereken istasyonlara sağ salim ulaştırmak. Ama simetrik döşeme gibi bir hevese kapılırsanız genelde parasızlık ve hüsran ile karşı karşıya kalıyorsunuz. Kendinizi zorlamak, zaman zaman çileden çıkmak istiyorsanız on numara oyun.

Fiyat konusuna gelirsek indirimde almıştım, memnunum. Ancak tam fiyat üzerinden satın alır mıydım? Sanmıyorum. İndirim beklemenizi tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964166458', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1616137510}

author: {'steamid': '76561198147807823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1665538769}
review:
I wish I could do a 'neutral' review.  [edit- I changed to an up-thumbs because i think the game executes as planned...and so why should it get a negative because i was hoping for something else?]

This game is exactly what I worried it was from the video - a switch-management game. So, if you are into the micro-management of trains, and view track placement as a puzzle, this is a great game for you. 

I you want a strategic game to employ trains to build a transportation network, this is not the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262737856', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1451391591}
review:
Отличная расслабляющая игра про строительство железных дорог, как в 90х.
Игровой процесс прост и понятен - на карте появляются города, в городах появляются поезда, поезда показывают в какой город им надо, ну а мы строим дорогу и всячески помогаем им туда добраться строя железную дорогу и переключая стрелки на путях.
Объекты на карте появляются в случайном порядке, что добавляет реиграбельности.
Сейчас в игре 18 уровней из 24 доступных в финальной версии, игра стабильная, качество беты вполне достойно иных релизов.
Часов на 5-6 кампании хватит, а дальше можно развлекаться в песочнице.
В общем, всячески рекомендую любителям паровозов!

review: Sıkılmadan oynayabileceğiniz bu küçük yapım parasını hak eden oyunlardan biri. Fakat oyun zorlaştıkça koordinasyon bazen çığırından çıkabiliyor. Bölümleri öncelikle verilen görevleri tamamlama yönünde ilerlediğinizde daha verimli oluyor. Ana hikaye modu haricinde oyun içinde bir çok mod ve araç mevcut. İyi oyunlar.

review: Esse jogo pode parecer tranquilo, para passar o tempo e se divertir. Mas a verdade é que as vezes ele pode ser pior que o Dark Souls hahaha. Brincadeiras a parte, é um jogo que vale cada centavo. Train Valley é um jogo que você se diverte, trabalha sua mente, e te distrai. Você alcança as primeiras 10h de gameplay brincando, se nem ver. Se você gosta de jogos indie, e com uma boa jogatina, compre sem medo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373924597', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1612411491}
review:
Terrible little game!

If the devs didn't even care making maybe at least a 5 min tutorial...Why did they even bother making a game then?!

And EVEN if I had been smart enough to figure-out how to build proper junctions to avoid those stupid trains to constantly crash into one-another: From the videos I have seen and the absurd tracks design you have to come-up with to have a chance it all works out, the game remains unbelievably boring as there is way to much hands-on work, and very little fun to have here.

At least do NOT expect a little management / train tycoon or railways simulator here. All this 'game' is, is a poorly made and boring puzzle game!

review:
35个小时达成了全部成就✔

author: {'steamid': '76561198054005124', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1645766301}
review:
Giving this another shot, and I still find some of the facets frustrating to manage.
I still stand by most of what I previously said in older reviews and posts.
This is a micro-manage-y logic puzzle themed with trains, and having flawless timing when departing trains is how you win.

My major issues:
- One-off mistakes are unforgiving and many situations can only be fixed by restarting (if you're going for objectives).
- Income is inconsistent given the random nature of which kind of train spawns and what it's payoff is.
- Tax system is super inconsistent and the rate varies widely depending on the level. Tax rate depends on the speed at which the months fly-by and how much is paid. Some levels increase tax cost gradually over time.
- Tax system encourages minimal spending in effort to stay away from bankruptcy and as such slows down the pacing.
- The cost to remove necessary obstacles can be far too high.
- Game has too much RNG on how obstacles are placed and what kind, order in which stations spawn, what type of train spawns, and how much the train is worth.
- Sending additional trains is sometimes a gamble when the train's delivery is worth less than what was paid to summon it. e.g. Paid $2,250 for an additional train for it to only pay $1,700 when it arrived at a station.
- I still argue for an undo button because misclicks happens, but this being a logic puzzle game, the devs have their reason against it.

I have to say I definitely don't recommend this game because of the above mentioned, and because Train Valley 2 by the same dev corrects most of these issues. TV2 Passenger DLC brings back the same gameplay here but with a better rail-editing system and currency system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814839292', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1630122084}
review:
扳道工模拟器（后期满屏的岔道属实锻炼眼力和手速
按照国家和历史发展的顺序设计的流程很棒，每个国家的风土人情和地标建筑都被浓缩在地图里，个人最喜欢早期的日本地图，樱花鸟居很养眼。二代画风更加卡通和养眼但是相比一代少了很对细节有点可惜

author: {'steamid': '76561198029903975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 10307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1636323332}
review: Its a nice looking game at a very reasonable price that hits the spot. Text, which can be important to your goals is often too small. I didn't see a way to make the text larger or bolder. Sometimes you want to click on a switch and you end up clicking on the stop the train button because that button is pretty big. Things are a little cramped but I'm going through it now on my second time and its more fun and playing better too. You can reset your progress with the click of a button in settings. That's a nice feature that is missing in a lot of games. Definitely buy it and buy a copy for a friend if its on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199094551096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1611437985}
review: This game is deceptively cute. I got it because I like trains, but it gets pretty hard pretty fast. It pays to practice levels in sandbox mode beforehand to test the optimal track layout. The trains move agonizingly slowly, but one wrong turn and the terror of an air traffic controller on 9/11 sets in. It is not a relaxing game, but I thoroughly enjoy it nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446205077', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1585735987}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066783339', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1610075230}
review:
What a nice surprise!

I like to bounce between genres and this game looked like a nice light sim to unwind and relax.

And I have a thing for trains. Don't judge me...

Although the game has basic only two mechanics, it uses them in great depth. In a scenario you'll lay track and manage your trains. You can also control the speed the time goes by and request additional trains to show up. Them trains will apear and need to go to different towns. Your job is to connect the towns laying track and manage when the trains depart and control their routes, simple. 

Each level has 3 bonus objectives, and going for them (specially all 3 in one go) can be a nice challenge. This combined with the speed toggle, makes for some nice scenarios. Playing at 1x speed with several trains at once and micromanaging everything feels very different from playing at 4x speed and just trying to get everything routed and going smoothly. 

All in all the game surpassed my expectations and I look forward to play the sequel.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198202529859', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 2354, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1609528659}
review:
ACHIEVEMENTS:
39 Achievements ranging from easy to moderate in difficulty.

TRADING CARDS:
12 Trading cards

PROS:
-Addicting
-Fun and entertaining
-Chuck Norris achievement
-Gameplay

CONS:
-None as of yet

GAMEPLAY:
Great gameplay. If you ever owned a train track set then you will appreciate how these tracks fit together.

VISUAL EFFECTS:
Top-down view with pretty decent graphics. Everything is clear and distinguishable.

AUDIO:
Music has a good tone to it. Maybe for some the music might get annoying after a while, but I enjoyed it.

STORYLINE:
There is no real storyline in this game, but it works great without one.

REPLAY VALUE:
Very high replay value

PROBLEMS/ISSUES:
None - No problems installing game. No issues during start up. No game freezes, or unexpected quitting.

review: Esse jogo é fenomenal e sinceramente não sei porque não escrevi review também dele. O segundo também é, porém o primeiro parece que marca pelo seu diferencial, desafio para evitar acidentes e assim vai. Eu gostaria de ver os desenvolvedores criarem um 3 mais amplo, rebuscado, alguns pontos do 2 e com os toques do 1 principalmente. É uma gameplay que diverte e adoraria ver mais desses jogos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060528934', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1608603174}
review:
I’ve picked up this game on a rim a while ago as I wanted to play a puzzle game. Turns out this was more of a real time micromanagement game and I loved it. The graphics are good, the music fits and I just love listening to the sounds of the trains. When playing it, you don’t have to complete all the challenges on your first run, but if you can get all three at once, it feels so good. Not to mention going for the achievements can be a challenge but it's doable.

Also the DLC is nice as it’s an entire level added in with unique features in each level. I would recommend playing the game first before buying the DLC in case you don’t end up enjoying it but if you are a fan of micro management

review:
Relaxing building of train tracks. Ok if you want to be 100% successfull it is not so relaxing. But game gives you fun.
Kids love it - but when they play in way to direct you which train you should sent where and where to build trains etc it gets heptic.

So if you like puzzles (you need to plan where to put rails...), trains it is definitely for you. If you have kids then it is must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016747572', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1606926187}
review:
同時進行が好きな人向け

・線路を引いて列車を発進させて、ぶつからないようにすばやく短距離で目的の駅に到着させる
・最初は２～３駅だけだが、どんどんと駅が増えて同時に発進する電車も増える
・予算があり、線路を引いたり邪魔なオブジェクトどかすと予算がかかる
・税金があり、一定期間で税金分ひかれていく
・電車はすばやくつくと予算増加額が増える。しかし、あせって衝突事故起こすと予算がかかるので
　電車自体を触ってぶつからないように停止させたり後退させたりできる

・序盤は簡単目だが、どんどんと増える目的地と次々と発着待ちになる電車でパニックになる感じ
・数が増えてくると残り稼働時間＝もらえる予算が少ない電車を優先したが
　ぱっと見数字が見づらい

プァー　プァーという汽笛の音にせかされながらダイヤグラム組む感じで楽苦しい

author: {'steamid': '76561198018060191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1606764560}
review: This game needs switches!!!!! The only build tool you have is tracks, and switches are made by the direction you pull or push your mouse in. It seems damn impossible to make anything more than a 2 rail switch, can't for the life of me get 3, don't expect there will ever be bridges or turn tables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198405836527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1618646367}
review: Addicting! Give it a chance and keep playing. It's challenging but once you figure it out, it's basically like an RTS. The game makes you think in different ways and I appreciate that! Once you figure out the basic strategies, you feel confident and can easily handle early game. Mid to late game is harder, one slip up can cost you one of the three challenges every level has. You don't have to do all the challenges in one go but it's more fun to be an overachiever! I have lost track (pun intended!) of time while playing it, and I have a big smile on my face when I get the timing perfect and get trains to just barely miss each other. I've already gotten more than I expected out of it and would highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055966907', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1606671588}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043572089', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1622995969}
review:
A fun puzzle game where you lay out railway tracks and juggle dispatching trains to their destination stations (avoiding crashes and incorrect arrivals) all whilst you are gradually sapped of money. Run out of money and you lose the game!

Pleasant enough graphics and with a fair amount of levels to play in. Definitely worth it if you like simple train management games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035399845', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1606600590}
review:
Bardzo przyjemna gra w budowanie torów aby połączyć stacje wyzwanie to ogarniecie stosunkowo małych map, czasu a także pilnowanie budżetu. Jeśli odniesiemy porażkę, ogrywając ten sam poziom możemy zobaczyć iż elementy na nim dodawane są w innej kolejności co powoduje ze drugie podejście nie musi być łatwiejsze.  
Jako gra logiczna spisuje się dobrze i jest po prostu przyjemna.

review: Tout consiste dans le timing et faire rouler plusieurs trains en même temps sans qu'ils se rencontrent ni les envoyer dans la mauvaise gare, avec un tas de contrainte sur le budget, l'espace, le placement des rails, le temps. Passé un certain moment ce n'est pas amusant du tout. Je n'aime pas faire 36 choses à la fois et encore moins avec la montre. J'attendais autre chose. Donc je donne un non car je ne peux pas mettre un entre-deux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269565442', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1605275066}
review:
这个游戏还可以，玩起来有点上头。
不推荐的原因：
地图太小，日本关车的长度能占线路的1/3甚至一半，这么小想调度车辆很难，卡两三个基本车就必撞了。
轨道最多只有两个岔口。想搞十字就不能搞并线，想并线就没十字，还是日本关地图那么小车那么长，岔口还少很难玩。
地图的随机路障对有的成就非常不友好，刷十几把开局才能出能做成就的局，还有的开局障碍碰到车贼便宜直接破产就很神奇。

author: {'steamid': '76561198167630101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1605038804}
review:
Very stressful game. I was hoping for a relaxing experience: no. I gave up after 79 minutes and countless train crashes.
I reached level 5, tried a few times and could not succeed. I did not like the game mechanics: build tracks, decide when to make trains leave and keep clicking on arrows to try to avoid crashes. This is NOT a sim game, more like an arcade game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052989462', 'num_games_owned': 4711, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1605022607}
review:
A fun and surprisingly enjoyable strategy based puzzle game that is easy to jump into.  Train Valley has a nice aesthetic and the soundtrack is non-intrusive to your experience.  
You can challenge yourself if you are trying to get all three stamps or have a more casual experience if you are just trying to get through the level without going bankrupt (ends the round).  
Overall a nice experience 7/10

review: 我以为是策略类游戏，管理火车及调度的。实时上我感觉连益智游戏都算不上。实时上就是你在几个火车站之间运货，朝不同的火车站运货，你要手动切换不同的轨道，你没听错，是手动切换。你在游戏中唯一要做的就是铺轨道，切换轨道。仅此而已。。此游戏根本没有时间安排，火车调度一说，货物转联运等概念。实在想不通这个游戏那么多奖项是哪里来的。糟糕！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198105785707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1602897344}
review:
This puzzle game is way too difficult, but it's not the good kind of difficult.

As you keep playing you realize it has a conception problem. The maps are way too tight and cramped and don't give you enough room to maneuver.
The game starts handing your ass to you as early as the third level and it only gets worse from there. Not funny.
Even if you git gud at the game, the endgame isn't even that interesting. You just spend your time micro-managing trains on the track, stopping and moving them until the end of the level.

The main problem is that the game doesn't know if it wants to be a simple twitch puzzle game or a complex train simulation game and it sorts of sits halfway through, too fast to enjoy the world building and too complex and clunky to play fast.
In most maps you get repeatedly interrupted because of bankruptcy. Why does the game want me to manage money like that when it's not even realistic in the first place? (The trains take several month for each travel but you get to pay taxes at the end of each year)
A lot of annoyances like that can force you to restart the level for a very little mistake, losing half an hour of progress in the blink of an eye.

The User interface is also very bad and annoying and cause for many mistakes.

[h1](follow my curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33882793/]GenXPlayers[/url] for more retro and indie reviews)[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198381375930', 'num_games_owned': 2077, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1600775874}
review:
游戏时间是挂卡来的，实际目前只玩了5个小时
火车山谷2进包了，才想起来自己库里还有个1代，于是都下载来玩

本体包含四大关，德国DLC包含一大关，即共有五大关
每大关包含5小关+1特殊关，每一小关都有不同的三个任务，来满足玩家的收集需要
从我目前玩完的内容（全收集通过了9小关）来看，不追求全收集的话通关难度应该不大，追求全收集就得多动动脑子，有时候还看运气

优点
没啥突出优点，画风、玩法都正常，BGM还行
个人感觉比迷你地铁好玩

缺点（或者说是建议）
建议加入提示关卡结束的车次计数器，很多要求额外运送的任务到后面才发现时间来不及，额外运送的按钮不让按了

好评，推荐游玩
通关之后再看心情补充，目测除非有额外的吐槽点否则没啥好补充的

author: {'steamid': '76561197981604953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1921, 'last_played': 1597822142}
review:
One of the most fun puzzle games out there. The core concept is smart and it can be as relaxing or as difficult as you want (with pauses and speed controls.) You'll find yourself working on train timings and loop design. There are about 25 levels in all which are all pretty good. At the end of it you may find yourself wanting a tougher challenge and the DLC is there for that. 

The only con is there is some RNG in that the next station to open up (or bridge, tunnel, etc.) is not clear. While it adds level variety which is very nice, this isn't a game that you'll be replaying 20 times, but maybe twice. What made it frustrating was that the variation and unpredictability made some challenges very hard to solve because your super smart solution that you figured out after the last try no longer works. Is it a deal breaker? No not at all. Is it frustrating to not have to do more than 10k damage and the trees this time around spawned so you can't build your loop without losing the challenge? Yes. But we are talking about 2 levels of the 25 where this was an issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988307204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1598135318}
review:
Ich Spiele Train Valley seit kurzem so zwischendurch und muss sagen ansich gefällt mir das Spiel gut.
Von "Schwer" oder "zu schwer" kann hier nicht die Rede sein. Wenn man etwas über den Bau seiner Schienen nachdenkt, kann man viele kleine Hindernisse von vorn herein vermeiden. Ich baue mir wenn möglich einen Verteiler in den ich die Züge Leite und von da aus in die Bahnhöfe sende (vor allem die von selbst startenden, welche z.B. starten sobald man einen zusätzlichen Zug für Geld oben links kauft). Train Valley für zwischendurch macht wirklich Spaß, hatte es im Sale gekauft und auch zu dem Preis für mich ganz klar Daumen hoch.
Das einzige was mich etwas stört, ist der "sinnfreie" Zeitablauf. Ich hab Züge die brauchen dann quasi 2 Jahre um von A nach B zu kommen, selbst "die Bahn" wäre ja dann schon wieder überpünktlich =P
Bei der Geschwindigkeit der Züge, müsste der Zeitablauf etwas "realistischer" sein, aber sonst finde ich ist alles soweit ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209088231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1676397605}

author: {'steamid': '76561198154190604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1597677684}
review:
I fully completed this plus its Germany DLC within 17 hours so it's not a game you'll get tens of hours out of, however it is a fun puzzle game that justifies its price tag.

Pros: Very nice difficulty curve, first level is very easy and the last level is pretty tricky, and the game layers in mechanics very well to increase this curve. Game is aesthetically pleasing (menu not so much) and the soundtrack fits well.

Cons: Some mechanics aren't so "difficult", but just cheese. In the DLC levels, a plane can just come out at any moment, bomb the exact square of track right in front of your train, or even worst, bomb your actual train, and that's it: you lose because of something out of your control. Other difficulty mechanics work much better. Also, the game is genuinely a "click here to load this level up" type game, no back story or other gameplay. It's a pure puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036651810', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1833, 'last_played': 1711175850}
review:
Всем привет, машинисты и кочегары! 

Игра очень нестандартная. Чем-то напоминает телефонную игру, в которую удобно играть в очередях или в общественном транспорте для ожидания. С другой стороны, уже на сезоне США начинают трещать по швам нервы. А я ещё прохожу на все печати. (Да-да, я - конченный) 

Должен сказать, удивлён, что эта игра заставляет возвращаться и возвращаться к ней спустя год. Наверное, после того, как я пройду компанию будет немного скучно. Правда, Трайн Валлей 2 уже вышла. Надо будет её купить. 

Игра про то, как строишь железные дороги, отправляешь поезда и так по кругу. Веселят всякие отсылки. Начиная, от Гагарина и ГУЛАГа, заканчивая Фудзиямой и линкор Ямато. 

Я покупал эту игру за рублей 200 или даже меньше. Эти деньги она окупила с лихвой. Мало игры в Стиме, которые меня вообще заставляют заново их устанавливать. Это одна из них. 

Хорошая игра, чтобы убить время и размять мозги.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121112670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1596843376}
review:
Train Valley is a pretty straight-forward train game.  Beat it in 10 or so hours using a mouse.  Difficulty is easy-moderate.  Good game for kids.  

There are really only three things you do in this game: 
1. Lay/remove tracks
2. Tell trains to move, stop, or turn around
3. Determine which tracks the trains go on by clicking on the rail switch

There are also three speeds you can go if you find the trains too slow.  And there's a nice pause button in case everything is too crazy.  You can lay or remove tracks while the game is paused.


The music is charming, the game play and 'stamps' you can earn keep you on your toes, and I had no issues playing.  Did find it funny that Detroit was in a desert, so locations aren't exact or anything.  But for what it's worth, Train Valley is fun and will happily eat your time away.

The only real downside I can come up with is that the last level, Germany, is Dlc for about 2.50.  Lame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396077693', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3171, 'last_played': 1594959085}
review:
会接触到这个游戏，是因为...夏促[spoiler]【没错就是夏促】[/spoiler]三块钱白嫖的前四章，然后十几块钱买了个原价的德国章节DLC。
至于为什么会掏钱买DLC，可以从侧面证明这是一款不错的游戏[spoiler]【当然也是为了全成就】[/spoiler]，出的比较早，但放在2020/07/10依旧十分给力。接下来我就要论述这个游戏给我留下的心动之处。
我本人是一名快节奏游戏爱好者，讲道理这款游戏本是不会对我胃口的[spoiler]【然而夏促白嫖真香...】[/spoiler]，但是我偶然间点入并尝试了这款游戏的第一关后，我...沦陷了...精美的音乐，稍稍复古的画面，蒸汽火车质感的操作界面，每一种不同的火车头建模还原性都很高[spoiler]【在右上角有年份和月份的时间，蒸汽火车头属于19世纪！随着关卡的不同时间到了现代甚至还有日本的新干线，子弹头以及各种动车组】[/spoiler]，每一辆不同的车型甚至采集了该种车型出站时以及运行时的真实声音并运用到游戏中[spoiler]【这也太酷了！！！在这里吹爆日本关的新干线！！！那种鸣笛时现代感以及运行时和轨道丝滑的摩擦声真的是太赞了！！！】[/spoiler]，每个章节对应一个不同的国家并让我们见证火车在这个国家的发展历史同时还能欣赏这个国家秀美的风景[spoiler]【而且每个国家都有独具风格的BGM！！！】[/spoiler]，这款游戏也太超模了！！！[spoiler]【可能还是因为基础款夏促三块钱OvO，但认真来讲原价也不算贵的啦】[/spoiler]
但是吧....全成就好难...我肝了52小时才全成就...[spoiler]【或许是因为我太菜了吧...】[/spoiler]最后剩下的两个成就：同时运行10辆车车和一局建造300块铁轨，因为达成了还得完成那关游戏不能破产...在我破产了无数次之后，我终于[spoiler]借助修改器的力量[/spoiler]过了！！！OHHHHHHHH！！！那么，需要[spoiler]修改器[/spoiler]帮助的小伙伴可以联系我[spoiler]【企鹅号是501920415啦，也可以一起探讨其他好玩的游戏哦】[/spoiler]哦OvO
最后再强调一次！！！Train Valley它太超模了！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198172016819', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1684689852}

author: {'steamid': '76561198893329311', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1492, 'last_played': 1681075343}
review:
AT A GLANCE:
     5/5 Stars - Buy it, buy it, buy it! Such an amazing game! Very well done! Fun, and entertaining for the whole family.

GAME GENRE:
     Single Player, Casual, Puzzle, Strategy, Simulation, Building, Family Friendly, Top-down

GAME DESCRIPTION:
     Release Date: Sept. 2015 - Build railroads connecting cities, and keep the trains on schedule. Set in different historical periods in countries such as Europe, America, USSR, and Japan (The DLC is set in Germany). Each level, within these countries, has its own criteria that has to be met.

KID FRIENDLY:
     (First know that I am very strict on kid approved material. A game with a standard rating of "PG" I might rate "PG-13". These are my ratings and have nothing to do with standard ratings)

     I rate this "G". Absolutely set your kids in front of the TV with this game they will be there for hours. Love this title for its family friendliness!

ACHIEVEMENTS:
     39 Achievements ranging from easy to moderate in difficulty.

TRADING CARDS:
     12 Trading cards

PROS:
     -Addicting
     -Fun and entertaining
     -Chuck Norris achievement
     -Gameplay

CONS:
     -None as of yet

GAMEPLAY:
     Great gameplay. If you ever owned a train track set then you will appreciate how these tracks fit together.

VISUAL EFFECTS:
     Top-down view with pretty decent graphics. Everything is clear and distinguishable.

AUDIO:
     Music has a good tone to it. Maybe for some the music might get annoying after a while, but I enjoyed it.

STORYLINE:
     There is no real storyline in this game, but it works great without one.

REPLAY VALUE:
     Very high replay value

PROBLEMS/ISSUES:
     None - No problems installing game. No issues during start up. No game freezes, or unexpected quitting.

WORDS FOR DEVELOPERS:
     What an amazing game, thank you! Can't wait to try the next one! Keep them coming!

CURATOR:
     If you like my reviews please follow my Curator page. Thank you! :)
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37878480/

author: {'steamid': '76561198097736606', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1334, 'last_played': 1593846187}
review:
Gameplay Fr :
www.youtube.com/watch?v=C5YREHFbZag

Petite perle à récupérer lors d'une promo à 1,50€ qui vous retiendra de nombreuses heures. Ne vous y trompez pas, nous ne sommes pas face à un jeu de gestion/simulation mais bien un puzzle-game original avec des trains qui feront cogiter vos méninges.

Relativement relaxant, on se surprend à passer de niveau en niveau pour un total de 24, au travers diverses époques de 1800 à 2030 et différents pays (Europe, USA, Russie, Japon). La concentration sera de rigueur, une erreur d'inattention se paye souvent chers. Si vous aimez les défis, vous aurez l'occasion de remplir 3 objectifs bonus pour corser chacun des niveaux et vous apporter une plus grande satisfaction.

Le jeu tourne autour de 2 axes principaux :
- il vous sera nécessaire d'étudier le terrain et l'expérimenter à plusieurs reprises pour découvrir le tracé idéal à réaliser avec les voix ferrées
- gérer la circulation ferroviaire pour éviter les collisions et amener au plus vite vos trains à destination, pour obtenir un maximum d'argent, ce qui vous permettra de construire votre réseau

Curieusement, le jeu n'est pas réellement répétitif grâce à ses niveaux variés. Cependant, il n'y a aucune rejouabilité une fois les niveaux réalisés à 100%.

Les chasseurs de succès seront probablement déçu, car ces derniers sont peu intéressants. Ils se débloqueront soit automatiquement au cours de votre périple, soit en répétant en boucle une action longue et ennuyante sans le moindre intérêt. Heureusement, quelques uns bien que trop rare vont sortir du lot, en apportant un défis supplémentaire à relever.

Train Valley se révèle être une excellente surprise. Néanmoins, je ne saurai que trop recommander de se tourner vers son successeur, Train Valley 2, qui améliore sur tous les points son aîné, en rajoutant une infinité de niveau grâce à la communauté.

Pour vous en faire une meilleure idée, n'hésitez pas à consulter mes VOD sur Train Valley avec la vidéo en introduction, ou de me rejoindre sur ma chaîne Twitch pour en parler et découvrir d'autres perles sur Steam.

www.twitch.tv/JolanLive

Merci de m'avoir lu et amusez-vous bien. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040735667', 'num_games_owned': 1074, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1615499160}
review:
I may be mentally impaired, I don't know why railway systems and train tracks fascinate me this much, but Train Valley captivates me. A connect-the-dots game where your lines have a chance of crashing and burning without constant oversight. It really is as simple as getting trains to their stations either before they crash into each other, or before the value of their cargos depreciate to nothing, and I enjoy watching each one chug along on their journey.

I put this game off for a long time assuming that it was a train sandbox simulator, but I discovered there was a campaign, for which every map had secondary objectives beyond "avoid bankruptcy". It was dismaying to discover that stamps didn't unlock after completing a level (if you hadn't already met their criteria before the level's deadline) and opting to continue it, such as stamps for scheduling additional trains (i.e. spawning extra trains to increase profit) couldn't be completed because the game stopped allowing me to use the additional train scheduling function in continuation of the finished level. I can't say for sure, but it seems like you have to earn all 3 stamps for a level at the same time lest you need to replay it and see that the stamps don't stay unlocked permanently - that was my experience, at least.

I would recommend a train management game like this if the sound of a game like this doesn't instantly bore you, what you see (on the store page, or perhaps in gameplay videos) is what you get.

Good Puzzle game. I found it rewarding whenever I completed a mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1591402463}
review:
Thoroughly enjoyable puzzle type game.

Pros:
- Enjoyable background music and sound effects
- A variety of trains with different speeds, lengths, and styles
- Cute, colourful graphics
- Levels start relatively easy and get progressively more difficult at a good rate, but don't get too difficult
- You can pause time in the game, which makes later more hectic levels much more manageable. Similarly, you can speed up time when things are too slow

Cons:
- The main menu doesn't show you what the goals for each level are, it just gives you a stamp for each one completed. If you want to see what goal you haven't done you need to start the level.
- What's the point of the annual tax? It seems to exist solely to make bankruptcy possible.
- The bankruptcy mechanic is infuriating. If you spend most of your money you should be able to wait for the next train to give you more, but if it's too slow then annual tax will mean you go bankrupt and have to restart the level. 
- Rogue trains. These trains appear and and promptly leave stations with no warning instead of queueing up and waiting for you to start them. It's accompanied with a special jingle. This can easily mess up an entire level forcing you to start again to achieve the goals. Thankfully they seem to be very rare.

Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198821436532', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1592905530}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000138298', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1300, 'last_played': 1591981947}
review:
Quite the simple, relaxing and fun little game.
Got it to play with my little kid and found myself wanting to complete all levels myself.

This is simple to learn but provides quite the challenge after you learn it.
It's a puzzle game, as you need to find better and better ways to build your tracks and has a management aspect, as you need control the train trafic properly and efficiently. 
I appreciate this as I found it a good tool for kids to learn planning and priority concepts.

author: {'steamid': '76561199033142395', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1644325965}
review: 很有意思的休闲游戏，强迫症为了收集满3个邮戳真是耗尽了所有力气

author: {'steamid': '76561199015145988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1590127213}
review: steam上第一个玩通关的游戏，全邮票集齐。原本以为是个铁道大亨，其实只是个扳道岔的。站点越来越多，铁路越来越复杂，眼睛稍微没跟上就over了，容易上头。总体还是非常好玩的，推荐！

review:
Although Train Valley 2 is out, and is undoubtedly an improvement on this first game, there is still plenty to enjoy here. Indeed, there might even be room for more creativity in this first title with regard to track placement.

Fun puzzles, fairly relaxing, good for short sessions.

Recommended on discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045586153', 'num_games_owned': 5546, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1704274451}
review: Train Valley çok harika bir puzzle diye biliriz. İşin içinde para kazanmak vs. olsada amaç bize verilen hedefe ulaşmak için İstasyonlar arasında tren yolları kurarak bize verilen görevleri yerine getirmek fakat bunu oldukca zevkli bir hale getirmişler. Başlarda ısınma görevler diyebileceğimiz görevlerde bana ne var ki, bunda çok kolay diye düşünürken birde istasyon sayısı vs tren trafiği artınca işler karışıyor ve ister istemez tren kazalarına sebep olabiliyoruz. Oyunu tavsiye ederim, Fiyat olarak oldukca uygun fiyatlı güzel bir oyun yapmışlar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143556138', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1595521732}
review: Hra s velmi jednoduchými pravidly, ale umí pěkně potrápit. Hlavním cílem je posílat vlaky do správných stanic, za použití vlastní kolejové infrastruktury a přepínáním výhybek. Čím rychleji je vlak do cíle přepraven -> tím je z něj větší zisk. Pokud ale vlak čeká moc dlouho, rozjede se sám bez ohledu na to, jak moc bude překážet. Při hraní hraje příjemný sountrack a jednotlivé úrovně mají vždy 3 dodatečné úkoly, za jejichž splnění hráč obdrží známky. Stanice se objevují postupně při hraní úrovně na stejných, ale předem neoznačených místech. To někdy znesnadní správně rozvrhnout trať bez přibližného zapamatování si těchto pozic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112990801', 'num_games_owned': 1644, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1589721067}
review:
기차가 원하는 역으로 갈 수 있도록 해주는 퍼즐 게임입니다.

정답이 1개 뿐인 퍼즐게임은 아니고 mini metro처럼 길을 이어주는 게임입니다.

스테이지도 지루하지 않을만큼 준비되어있고 난이도도 높은게 아니여서 어렵지 않게 전부 클리어 가능합니다.

스탬프를 다 찍으면서 클리어하려면 어렵지만 파산만 조심하시면 쉽게 클리어 할 수 있습니다.

큰 기대안하고 플레이했는데 dlc까지 사서 할정도로 재미있었습니다.

한글화는 아니지만 언어가 크게 필요없는 게임으로 부담없이 즐길 수 있습니다.

주관적인 평점 : 8 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086252721', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2571, 'last_played': 1589593502}
review:
《Train Valley》殺時間的小遊戲，偷閒的時光在辦公司玩，隨時想暫停都可以，不得不說真的是偷玩的好選擇。不得不說後面關卡挺有趣的，有些不能暫停、有些急駛煞不住的火車、有些空投炸藥包，雖說玩法很單純(A->B)，但配上突如其他的狀況還真令人措手不及。
對於玩大作的人而言這款遊戲不推薦(玩法單純、無特效等)，但如果是隨時會被GK的朋友，還真的不錯咧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198804352528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1579897649}
review: Great game for those who are able to manage several things at once. The goal is to get trains to their stations, but you have to switch the tracks, build the tracks, and make sure there are no collisions. There are also different goals for each level that include not stopping any trains, only spending so much money, and more. I eventually got to the point where it is too hard for me, but I'm sure I will eventually pass the level. Amazing and challenging game. Definitely would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198887182944', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1587293776}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014629088', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1629391780}
review:
Que es Train Valley? a simple vista es algun juego casual de puzzles, pero no , va mas allà, es el videojuego que todo niño deseò en su infancia, es aunque no lo parezca un reto a la mente, pero de cierta manera y no logro entender el porque despierta algo de infancia, me transporta a los 90s, no entiendo porque este juego lo logra pero realmente es una pieza muy bien ella, minimalista pero puntual, exacta y plena. 
Sii te gustan los puzzles, quieres pasar un rato entrenido y relajarte de la puta vida, es train valley tu juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849222888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1643508441}
review: Love this game. Relaxing soundtrack, almost-retro graphics, nice UI, great replay value (at least if you're a freak like me who needs to have every stamp). What I really love about this game is that your successes, failures, and everything in between are a natural consequence of what you do with an incredibly simple tool set (i.e. build track, delete track, switch junctions). It's not a game that plays tricks on you. Its cards are on the table, except when a STATION opens up on TOP of your track, interrupting it and causing crashes. This is my one complaint, and once you know where every station goes, it is easy to avoid. All of my other failures have been my fault alone.

review:
游戏分为经典模式和沙盒模式。
经典共有五个章节，每章四个三星关卡附加一个（无尽模式？？），本体四个关卡，第五章需要购买德国dlc。
游戏容错率不是很高，初期建设需要一定的预判，你干的最多的事情不是建设而是做扳道工，游戏性不如mini metro。

author: {'steamid': '76561198389120039', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1535, 'last_played': 1587637813}

author: {'steamid': '76561198400196702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1932, 'last_played': 1588231813}
review:
列车增加提醒在右下角，有一个指针表。
点击列车头可以暂停前进，暂停时可以调头。

容错率非常低，需要足够的耐心和集中力。前期尤其不能撞车，会缺钱，后期尤其不能进错站台，注意养成良好习惯，不要为了几秒的快进反复暂停甚至重玩。
后期关卡会存在不同列车，速度不同，运行特别忙的时候注意空出间隔。

本质上关卡游戏，玩家修铁路、发车赚钱修更多铁路。每一关都有独特的城市特色，也因此有独特的核心难点。有几关真的惊艳到我，就不剧透了。
商店界面说的驾驶汽车，应该是翻译错误，汽车只是地图上的障碍物。
随机性对难度影响不大。
音乐超赞。
沙盒模式无限金钱，无定时增加列车，所以实际上是用来练习的。
一分钟上手，十分钟掌握诀窍，部分成就较难，但都具备可行性，多试几次都能做到。不用急，后期在合适的地图慢慢刷。

DLC基本是要买的，增加了德国五个关卡，影响全成就。（拆坦克的时候心情迷之爽。）（盟军过来炸铁路的时候，心情很微妙。）

author: {'steamid': '76561197972979016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1588116415}
review:
Je recommande le jeu, mais avec des réserves !! (que je détaille ci-dessous)

GAMEPLAY : amusant, mais vite répétitif (voir plus bas). Un peu addictif quand même, car on a envie de réussir les objectifs.
GRAPHISMES : suffisants pour ce que c'est. C'est un petit jeu de gestion qui tourne sur n'importe quel PC : il ne faut pas trop en demander aux graphismes.
DURÉE DE VIE : ~20h (hors DLC Allemagne)
SCÉNARIO : quasi-inexistant. Une très légère mise en contexte historique (aspect des trains et des villes), mais c'est tout.

Le principe est simple : construire des voies de chemin de fer et aiguiller les trains pour qu'ils arrivent dans la bonne ville. Il faut donc gérer au mieux l'itinéraire des voies, puis l'orchestration des trains, pour que tout le monde arrive à bon port, le plus rapidement possible et sans accident. Tout ça en gérant votre budget : construire des voies, ce n'est pas gratuit !

Côté gestion, on ne gère finalement pas grand chose. Les villes apparaissent toutes seules et vous n'aurez aucun contrôle sur leur croissance. Vous ne choisirez pas la gare de destination des trains, ni la gare d'arrivée. Vous pourrez simplement contrôler, dans une certaine mesure, le moment de leur départ. Vous n'aurez pas non plus la possibilité de construire des ponts ou des tunnels : ceux-ci apparaissent tous seuls, dans les scénarios qui le nécessitent. Il n'y a aucune automatisation possible (ma plus grosse déception), tous les changements d'aiguillage sont réalisés manuellement. Et ce sera même une part importante de vos actions dans le jeu.

Votre objectif principal sera toujours d'éviter la banqueroute (le découvert sur votre compte en banque), ce qui mettrait fin à la partie. Dans 5 scénarios sur 6, vous aurez également des objectifs secondaires à remplir : éviter les accidents, ne pas faire d'erreur de gare, gagner une certaine somme d'argent, etc.

Après quelques parties, on se rend vite compte que, dans 90% des scénarios, la voie en forme d'anneau avec des entrée/sortie pour chaque gare est ce qu'il y a de plus efficace. À partir de ce moment-là, le jeu consiste à se demander "comment vais-je pouvoir construire un anneau dans cet environnement ?". Une fois que c'est fait, un peu de concentration suffit pour terminer les objectifs. Quelques petites nouveautés/difficultés apparaissent en fin des saisons 3 et 4, mais rien de bouleversant pour le gameplay.

Vu le prix, ça reste un petit jeu très intéressant !! Il m'a fallu 18h pour terminer les 4 premières saisons de la campagne, avec l'ensemble des tampons (donc, pour ainsi dire, finir le jeu) : ça occupe quelques soirées !
Je suis pourtant loin d'avoir réussi tous les succès Steam, donc je pourrais y passer quelques heures du plus si je voulais peaufiner un peu. Par contre, point que je trouve très limite : un grand nombre de succès n'est réalisable qu'avec un DLC (la saison 5 : Allemagne).

Le descriptif du jeu dans le magasin mentionne un mode "Aléatoire", que je n'ai pas trouvé. C'est un peu abusé !
Je soupçonne que ce mode ne soit disponible qu'après avec fini la saison 5, pour laquelle il faut acheter le DLC. C'est sur ce point que porte ma plus grosse réserve ! Certes, le DLC ne coûte pas cher, pas ça reste frustrant de découvrir qu'il faut une rallonge pour débloquer certaines fonctionnalités du jeu...

Le mode "Bac à sable" présente très peu d'intérêt. Il permet de rejouer un scénario de la campagne sans contrainte de temps ou d'argent. On peut s'en servir occasionnellement pour tester une circuit de voies, sur un scénario un peu difficile. Perso, je ne m'en suis servi qu'une fois. Et ça ne m'a pas franchement aidé.

En résumé, un petit jeu sympathique, mais avec pas mal de déceptions en cours de route. Il ne tient pas toutes ses promesses. Mais j'ai quand même pris plaisir à y jouer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1587978607}
review:
Train Valley is a cartoony puzzle game where you create railway lines by dragging the mouse pointer between various points of interest on premade maps.   Work out the optimal routes and then run trains to make money and achieve the objectives for each level. 

This really looks and feels like a mobile game.  While the developers put a lot of effort in here, they seem to have completely missed the target audience by releasing the game on PC (although mobile app stores have heaps of these kinds of games, they still might have made some money).   The gameplay is really too simple on PC considering it's up against heavyweight transit simulators like Cities in Motion.   It might be good for kids to play, but I can't see myself recommending this one to other gamers, although I will give some kudos to the developers for building a well polished game that does meet the minimum requirements for any PC game.   Another game where it would be nice if Valve gave us a "maybe" option.

Edit: Actually, no maybe option here.  The developers, in the true spirit of mobile devs, stamped out an identical sequel, except with the #2 next to it, yet they still left this old deprecated version on Steam to try scam people out of money for a product they superseded.   That's just pure greed.  Thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 4712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4712, 'last_played': 1587931651}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Тайм менеджемент от отечественного разработчика. Нашей задачей будет направлять поезда на разные станции, путем строительства рельсов и перевода стрелок на них. Четыре страны представлены в самые разные временные моменты и это выглядит по настоящему круто... 2 мировая война, запуск первого космонавта к космос, олимпийские игры, это все не просто фон, каждый уровень именно пронизан историей и сделан с душой, но это никак не меняет игрового процесса. На каждом уровне мы будем делать одно и тоже - строить пути для поездов и дергать стрелки. На каждом уровне выдаются 3 дополнительных задания, за выполнения которых вместо звезд мы будем получать печати (они нужны только для ачивок), но смысла в них особого нет да и ачивки все получить будет крайне сложно, а также придется дополнительно портатиться купив довольно не дешевое длс с одной лишь страной, которую как буд-то вырезали из оригинальной игры. Впечатления получились двоякие, это одновременно восторг от оформления уровней, но и унылость самого геймплея, который приедается и к концу игры, от которого начинает тошнить... Плохой игру не назовешь, но и до шедевра не дотягивает... Вышла уже вторая часть и в нее бы интересно было поиграть, а в эту... Ну строго на любителя, я думаю не каждому она понравится. Рекомендую.

[h1]Оценка: 6/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967717377', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2225, 'last_played': 1587598101}
review:
[h1]Próxima estación... ¡DESESPERACIÓN![/h1]

Fantástico juego rompecabezas en el que deberás encarrilar cada una de las locomotoras hasta su destino. ¡Y sin liarla parda!

El botón de espacio (pausa) será tu gran aliado y calcular al milímetro cada movimiento será el camino del éxito. Pero sosiega, amigo. Yerra por un instante y todo saltará por los aires.

Mi consejo es que lo juegues tratando de cumplir con los objetivos de cada mapa como si de condición "sine qua non" se tratara. La satisfacción al lograrlo es magnífica y además se me han pasado las horas volando. Literalmente. 37 horas para completarlo al 100% (DLC incluido).

Segundo consejo (hoy me siento agradablemente generoso) y hablando del DLC, es que no lo compres de primeras. Juega la base y si ves que te gusta entonces te lanzas como perra en celo.
Para mí el reto ha sido grato, pero puede que tú lo que sientas es que te están metiendo un pepino, áspero y sucio por todo el ano. Avisado quedas.

do_Ob!

review:
Jednoduché a chytlavé. 
Za pár Euro ideální zábava na pár večerů, pokud vám nevadí, že v každé úrovni děláte pořád to samé. Ale třeba šachy jsou taky pořád stejné, a přesto pokaždé jinačí. Hra má jednoduchá pravidla, vystačí si se 3 tlačítky - za mě velké plus. Oceňuji také malou velikost 450MB, HW nenáročnost.
A "sandboxový" mod je ide0ální pro děti.
Hra zabavila, možná se k ní někdy vrátím, ale kupovat pokračování zatím nehodlám - bojím se nastavované kaše a "vylepšení" = zesložitění mechanik.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170191703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1582, 'last_played': 1587936906}
review: Train Valley is a highly addictive, engrossing and rewarding puzzle-solving train game (with very light elements of train simulation). The campaign is a good length (26 hours including all achievements) and the difficulty and game progression clips along nicely. Trying to complete all of the challenges to collect all of the stamps on all of the levels was a personal highlight from my time playing. On the most challenging of levels these had me shouting out in equal parts exasperation and mirth as one train inevitably clips the back of the train in front whilst trying to squeeze the most out of the narrowest of margins. Very fun, highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561199032345241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1869, 'last_played': 1587140946}
review:
Ok, I won’t be able to tell you about that if I wouldn’t give it a try, and it is surely worth a couple of euros on sale, but the truth is that if you’re not under movement restriction due to COVID 19  or similar reasons you should not play that game.
Beyond its slick graphic and logic addictive railroad project management task there are a lot of hidden works.
First of all, drawing the track is not easy. Playing grid is inaccurate and if by chance you’re crossing the railroad not yet built it fail to keep on and you have to start from scratch.
The game, against what seems before buying it, is much more on switching the railway exchange rather than projecting the track. 
On top of that, bankruptcy is more than an option especially in the very first games – sometime timing estimation about money seems harder than the getting trains safely to the right place, they also did an award for that.
Finally, it overheats the hardware and it really seems strange since far more complicated and graphics sophisticated games didn’t – at least not that much.

review:
So at first, I though this was some kind of boring childish train game, but then I tried to play a few levels and I was surprised. 
I started on high speed and it was pretty difficult. My trains always crashed and I couldn't look after all of them at once. My rails were a mess and I couldn't keep up with all of it.
It was really fun learning how to handle all the situations at once and build good rails.
I got it on sale and it was really worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198375136685', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1587036075}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Train Valley è un puzzle gestionale in cui il giocatore dovrà soddisfare le richieste degli innumerevoli livelli: pianificando con cura la costruzione di binari e ferriovie, rimuovendo ostacoli e cercando di evitare scontri fra locomotive, che nello sfortunato caso andranno a distruggersi, danneggiando il tracciato. Comprando i treni e potenziandoli sarà possibile trasportare il carico verso le giuste destinazioni, che potranno a loro volta restituirci dei prodotti lavorati da consegnare altrove.

[h1]Comparto Tecnico[/h1]
Il gioco è sviluppato su Unity in 3D, la grafica è sufficiente ma un po' grezza. Le impostazioni grafiche permettono solo di ridimensionare l'interfaccia.
L'audio è semplice e la colonna sonora un po' ripetitiva.

review:
Good game, not revolutionary or anything like that, but you will get good value for your money.

+interesting puzzle game
+each level feels somewhat fresh, even if it plays mostly like previous levels
+it's fast (I've been playing basicly entire game on max speed with active pause), so if you mess up and want to start over, it won't put you too far back timewise
+it's cheap

-feels like some features are not clearly communicated, I found out that you can stop a train halfway through last season of the base game
-sometimes obstacles obscure your rails, it is not common, but possible that the arrow to select direction will be beind a building so it's hard to say where it is pointing towards

review: Quaint little puzzle game, but I keep getting fucked over in the early game of maps because trains keep launching randomly before I've even set up a second track. Considering the whole gimmick of the game is to be essentially the traffic controller, it's a little difficult to actually stop trains from colliding when they won't even wait until you can lay down a second track before setting off on the one rail that's actually laid down directly into a head-on collision with another train.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142509162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1710453615}
review:
Train Valley nous propose de plonger dans la gestion de lignes ferroviaires simplifiée au possible - et le challenge sera au rendez-vous. Il vous faudra optimiser vos lignes malgré les obstacles, gérer votre portefeuille entre revenus, dépenses, et taxes, et faire partir vos trains le plus tôt possible sous peine de se retrouver dans une impasse. La moindre erreur d'aiguillage peut ruiner votre progression dans le niveau.
Sous ses airs de maquette et de jeu pour enfant, le titre se révèle prenant.
