author: {'steamid': '76561197982771744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1584241091}
review:
A fun game, but not very big (you can easily play through every level in 1-2 hours) and doesn't keep me coming back like Train Valley 2, which is a great game. I still recommend TV1 for an hour or two of entertainment, but I recommend TV2 more enthusiastically, and would say TV2 is worth a much higher price. TV2 also has a DLC that adds 20 levels with the 'people movement' objectives of TV1. I would also recommend the TV2 'people movement' DLC over TV1.

In TV1 and TV2, the gameplay is the same: lay track, dispatch trains according to demand, make money for successful arrivals. In TV1, you basically just build your track and wait for notifications to pop up showing you where trains need to go. In TV2, you move more freight than people, which ends up making for more complex objectives and more thoughtful planning of train schedules because you can better identify future route demand rather than it being random.

Why do I recommend Train Valley 2 so much more? Laying track in Train Valley 2 feels more polished, there are a lot more levels, there is much more complexity/variation in later levels and it feels more satisfying to replay a level just to get the 5-star score in TV2. This amounts to a game that has much more playtime in it: you could keep coming back and probably play 30-40 hours of TV1 before getting bored of it as opposed to 1-2 hours for TV1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014941814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2399, 'last_played': 1706455827}
review:
I've bought this game for my kids, and ended up finishing it myself, chasing for most of the achievements. It's fun little puzzler that requires a lot of concentration and multitasking on the last levels, particularly if you want to get all the bonus goals. The graphics are nice and do the job, the soundtrack can get a bit annoying though. 

It is also one of those games that you can just boot up for a short 15 to 20 minutes game, as it doesn't require any warming up.

review:
Fun puzzle train game. Nice graphics, intuitive gameplay, challenging train routing puzzles. If you love trains, building tracks and solving complex train routing puzzles this is a great game to try.

The developers are still around and even this late after release just implemented interface fixes for 4k screens so you can properly see and use the scaled interface. Really well done.

review: Simple, easy to grasp rules and concepts that lend themselves to a pretty robust overall game. It's just a mixture of money management, track position, track directions, and train timing, but it all comes together to be a very enjoyable mixture of time management and strategy. Excellent to play just a couple of games, or to gorge all at once while you try to get all 3 achievements for each stage.

review: its fun. puzzle difficulty range from fun to annoying (i kept failing making a good layout for a couple levels and looked up solutions on the internet). the difficulty ramp up is nice, as well as having sandbox mode as an option for every level. most of the levels are short which is a plus if you don't want to have to put a big chunk of time aside. but it can get addicting to try and finish a level with a perfect score, or attack the harder achievements. visual theme is neat, music is good and after 12 hours i still enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375958630', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1583246375}
review:
Hello~
去年6月10日全三星通关了这款游戏的本体+DLC，很是满足，以至于之后的一段时间很空虚。
自发的购买了这款游戏，在去年的5、6月份陪我度过了开心的20多个小时，每晚在宿舍都要扳一会儿铁路。
去年夏促购买了本作的第二部，难度相比较一代作品上升不少，秉承着全五星的原则，至今仍卡在40关左右，主要是太伤神了！
推荐指数五颗星，很难找到这种悠闲轻松不硬核的火车游戏了，也许是因为去年那段悠长的时光已经不在了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003969497', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1582426153}
review:
-No se dejen engañar por su estética algo carismática e infantil, Train Valley es excelente y divertido gestor ferroviario. 
-Aunque sus modos de juegos son bastantes simples y no tiene gran profundidad,  llega a ser un buen reto cuando en los niveles más altos se deben gestionar hasta 5 trenes a la vez en espacios reducidos. 
-Destaca sobre todo los escenarios inspirados en distintas ubicaciones de mundo y culturas.  
-Muy recomendado para pasar el rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988534641', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1682107914}
review:
I honestly didn't think this game was going to be as challenging and entertaining as it really is.

What started as "Yeah... I'll give it a shot" ended in hours of frustrated but satisfying railway planning and conducting.  The challenges are hard but obtainable for each level and the game paces itself from sometimes being "Oh this is easy" and relaxing to ":LKJHA:OINJA:OUINJ:LDKNS:!@@@@@!!!!!!!!" and you finish by the skin of your teeth.

If you are a fan of puzzle games, it's a fun strategic one.  If you don't really like puzzle games... you might start to after this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798615816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6519, 'last_played': 1648575972}

author: {'steamid': '76561198423060628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1582043847}
review: 该游戏可玩性极高，在游戏中需要平衡花销于收入的关系，规划铁轨建设成本，还得时刻规划火车行进路线，谨防列车相撞产生损失和影响，可玩性相当高，到游戏后期多个车站同时发车，协调好每条路线的规划的前提下还得尽快使每辆列车今早到站，强烈推荐

author: {'steamid': '76561197976552921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1593306054}
review: Good casual game.  Some levels are super easy while others are crazy hard without much ramp up.  How on gets all the extra stamps on some levels is beyond me in how difficult that would be.  Great game though for relaxing and just messing around for small blocks of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013622319', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 6454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4363, 'last_played': 1659109021}
review: I'm not sure why this says I've only played 72 hours but I've played this way more than that.  Anyway, I love this game.  I got it as soon as it came out and I still play it.  I've reset my progress many times and played all the way through several times.  Then I got the second train valley and I love that one too , but there is something nostalgic for me playing this one.  I love it!!

review:
What looks like a fun managment game is actually an RNG nightmare.
you have little to no control over track placement because of the map layouts and trains tend to randomly just start going even if a another train is arriving at that station.

To many frustration moments beyond my control to recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034402756', 'num_games_owned': 3370, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 5406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5392, 'last_played': 1624015305}
review:
A fun management/puzzle train-themed game! Direct trains to their wished destinations, and lay the tracks! Choo choo! 

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
In Train Valley you must direct trains from one station to another. Typically the levels don't have any tracks built yet, so you have to construct them. Building costs money, and you don't start with enough to connect everything. Delivering trains earns money, but the reward is lowered with time. Delivering trains also develops the city connected to the station, which enables the station to produce faster trains. You have the ability to spawn extra trains, which you want to do generally nonstop to maximise income. But that can be tricky, and my big downfall of creating too many trains! If all stations are occupied with waiting trains, the trains depart on their own. 

[h2]My memories post Train Valley 2[/h2]
I have played TV1 quite a while ago, I just completed TV2 and thought my review needed an update. So it's mostly memories and not a fresh playing experience. And those memories are fun. The levels, the 'ding' sound of new train spawning, the juggling of trains, it's a very fun game! 

[h2]TV 1 or 2?[/h2]
They look similar on gameplay, their name suggest an evolution of some sort, but they play very differently. TV1 focuses on managing the trains, TV2 is a pure puzzle to create products via a construction train. TV2 has upgraded visuals, workshop support plus a big friendly community, while TV1 has a deeper discount. I recommend both games, however if you want to create maps or participate in friendly weekly competitions, I recommend TV2!

This one is a classic in my book! 

86/100

[i]My review of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TNTFTB/recommended/602320/]Train Valley 2[/url]! [/i]

review: It's been a while since a played a game in its entirety! Train Valley is definitely up there with my favorite management games. Not too complex, but not at all boring either. In Train Valley you build.. - you guessed it - rail networks. Each of the 24 levels has its own challenges. To enjoy this games, challenge yourself to go for a perfect result each time. Make sure you don't crash trains, go bankrupt or miss any other mission objectives. I can't wait to get Train Valley 2 and the Germany DLC!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087761146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1886, 'last_played': 1704845750}
review:
[u] Train Valley [/u]

Recomiendo jugarlo, pero adquirirlo cuando se encuentre en descuento.
Este juego se centra en guiar a los trenes de la estación A hasta la estación B a través de las vías que nosotros creamos, esto lo realizaremos en diferentes mapas que recorren el mundo y donde cada mapa tendrá sus  obstáculos y dificultades propias.
Bastante jugable para esperar a alguien o matar un poco el tiempo, el juego no esta completo, ya que “Alemania” siendo el quinto nivel viene en un DLC.

[b] 8/10 - Si buscas un buen juego de estrategia con rompecabezas. [/b]
[b] 6/10 - Si eres fanático de los trenes. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1700936628}
review:
[h1] Постой, паровоз, не стучите колёса... Ведь ты врежешься!!! Куда ж вы едете все??? [/h1]

И да, Unity-плашка перед стартом опять напрягает. Да, она здесь есть... Неужели в игру все эти настройки не вшить?

Поначалу вроде неплохая казуалка на тему прокладывания путей от вокзала к вокзалу с попутным молниеносным оформлением логистики. И в этой игре можно сполна прочувствовать выражение "Мыльная пятая точка". Носиться и суетиться придётся от души. Притом лучше полноценно изучить вводную часть. А то многие моменты будут не ясны и придётся туго.

А по сути в игре прокладываем и сносим в нужных местах пути железнодорожного сообщения для бесперебойной перевозки грузов от вокзала к вокзалу. Местность тут активная и вокзалы плодятся как кролики. Особенно если включить ускорение игрового процесса. В медленном режиме тут хоть на стенку лезь от скуки. Особо игровой процесс больше ничем не разбавлен, но и имеющегося вполне хватает. Поток поездов тут уже не убавить в отличие от похожей игры про аэропорт. Но там нужно было разруливать пути воздушных суден без прокладки трасс. Это всё там происходило само собой. И главное там можно было убавить поток транспорта для более спокойной игры.

Здесь же покой нам только снится. Но зато всё на русском и даже карточки с достижениями есть. Даже порт на линукс завезли. В целом выглядит неплохо, если иметь ввиду казуальную природу игры. Опять же тут всё космически далеко от реальности и конечно же поезда так не ездят, пути так не прокладываются и организация составов более дотошная. Да и по одному пути редко ездят в 2 направления... Это очень сложный организационный процесс, который требует серьёзных навыков во избежание аварии. 

А эту игру можно порекомендовать лишь любителям казуальных игр на транспортную тематику... Особенно ввиду выхода сиквела, реклама которого уже торчит вовсю в первой части.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056119988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1603385168}
review: nice game

author: {'steamid': '76561198019061502', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1796, 'last_played': 1577039304}
review:
Замечательная железнодорожная стратегия-головоломка с лаконичным и очень приятным визуальным оформлением. От игрока требуется прокладывать рельсы, переключать стрелки, направлять поезда в нужные стороны и не растратить все деньги. Это игра на внимательность, логику и умение прогнозировать, но великолепные дизайн уровней и отсылки к мировой истории позволяет ей не стать занудной.
Train Valley очень проста, но при этом достаточно глубока: некоторые нюансы я открыл для себя уже при попытках получить самое последнее "достижение". 
К слову, о "достижениях" - как о внутренних, так и о стимовских: это тот случай, когда прохождение на "100%" требует достаточно мало времени, но всё равно позволяет узнать игру полностью и испробовать множество интересных тактик. 

Рекомендую всем! Но именно Train Valley (и DLC к ней), а не Train Valley 2 - сиквел совсем другой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034546374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1576885691}
review:
Consiste en poner vias entre las estaciones, darle la salida a los trenes y jugar con los cambios de via para llevar a cada tren a su estación. ¿Facil, no? No exactamente... Tienes un presupuesto y las vías cuestan dinero, de modo que vas a querer optimizar cuanto dinero gastas compartiendo tramos de vía. Cuando tengas dos o tres estaciones y un tren o dos será fácil de controlar, cuando tengas seis o siete estaciones y cuatro trenes, la cosa cambia. Oh, ¿dije que dabas la salida a los trenes? Te vas a reír... los trenes tienen un horario. Si no les das la salida tu, saldrán cuando llegue su hora. Tanto si la vía esta libre, como si no.

Es un reto de coordinación a la altura de pocos. Un puzzle sencillo de aprender, pero realmente complicado de dominar. Me he sorprendido reiniciando un nivel para terminarlo sin perder ningún tren (aunque no fuese requisito para continuar). Va directo a favoritos.

review:
Блин, игра зачёт, ХОРОШАЯ. Стоит своих денег. 
Для тех у кого железные нервы и не пыхтит как паровоз...
Минусы у игры мало, да и вторая часть уже вышла, буду покупать.
1) Нету редактора, но во второй части есть.
2) Очень бесит, что поезда тратят прибыль (деньги) в некуда.
3) Очень мало приколов в окружении, надо покупать дополнение, но и там тоже мало.
4) Хотелось бы играть с другом, мол у него сваи станции а у тебя свои.
5) Нельзя покататься на поезде =)
8.7 балов из 10 по залепанию.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988846326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1574708408}
review:
To be able to gain 100% achievements, You need to buy Germany DLC. 

The game offers two game modes: classic and sandbox. [spoiler]I know the game description says there's 3rd one but I couldn't find it or they simply ment last level of each page. [/spoiler]

The game revolves around You, building train rails from one station [spoiler]location of stations is pre-determined and only appear in random order)[/spoiler] to another and if necessary, guiding those, as well as managing crossroads if any will be made. There is 5 pages (one is DLC) and each page contains 6 levels, where last level has random generated obstacles and the only goal is to succesfully complete the level. All other levels have 3 side-objectives, which can be done separately, making it a little more difficult. I've counted only 1 frustrating map, all others are pretty much cool.

Graphics and music is simplistic but it catches your ear.

I've encountered two bugs, which make your trains explode, one randomly just because and one where trying to reverse train, while it stands on too many crossroads, might cause a boom. It happened maybe like 6 times in total so not much when taking total time into consideration.

Sandbox mode is just removal off time limit, objective, cash and most of random events from any map, making player controlling everything as they please. Boring to me but I know people who enjoy this.

Amount of time You can spend on this is assuming You like to abuse pause and play only on x4 speed:
Beat the game: 10hours or less (if You do not care for achievements and stamps)
All stamps: ~12hours
All Achivements: ~15hours
If You do not like to speed up the game and rarely use pause, probably can be enough for even 30-40hours.


It's relaxing game and I totally recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047941314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1574196026}
review:
A Puzzle-Strategy Train Simulator that I found really entertaining.
Good graphics, good gameplay, good sound in overall.
There are 24 (30 if you buy the Germany DLC) easy/medium and chill levels.
Some levels have different strategies too which made the gameplay feel less "repetitive".

For the ones who aim for the Maniac Vandal and the Mega-Railroad achievements, I had an easy time in 2-6 (Chapter 2, Level 6).

Anyway, I definitely recommend the game. 
10€ (13.50€ if you want all the DLCs) are way enough for at least 7-10 hours of fun.
There is a demo version too if you just want to try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153689102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1620573198}
review:
Um dos jogos mais divertidos que joguei no Steam. Os gráficos são fofos, tem muitas fases, trens diferentes, modo livre pra você brincar como quiser sem perder. Não é um jogo tão fácil quanto parece, as vezes você tem que quebrar a cabeça pra resolver um caminho ou prestar muita atenção pra ninguém bater em ninguém ou entrar nas estações erradas, e isso é meio frustrante, mas não chega a ser um ponto negativo porque do contrário você chegaria no fim do jogo muito rápido e não teria graça nenhuma não é?

Vale muito apena se você gosta de trenzinhos, ou gerenciar o que está acontecendo etc

PS: Melhor que Mini Metro! :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198000963037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1573346287}
review:
Wasn't a huge fan. The sort of just-in-time micromanaging that this game requires equates to more stress and frustration than it does fun. If you like chaotic, on-the-seat-of-your-pants management, I'd say give it a go. If you're more of a TTD, set-it-and-forget-it style of transport fan, steer clear or at least wait for a sale.

Update: Instead, check out the sequel, Train Valley 2! It fixes this problem and has a beautiful graphics update.

review: Fun little puzzle/train game. You play through it rather quickly, but I do recommend you get it if you find it on sale. The only frustrating thing about the game for me was that trains depart from stations by themselves after a certain time, but I guess the game would be too easy otherwise. The game works flawlessly on my GNU/Linux Ubuntu 18.04 system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799441118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3047, 'last_played': 1709193624}
review: 指定された駅に向けて線路を敷き、走らせるだけ。というゲームですが各ステージにそれぞれ条件がありそれをクリアしながらやらなければなりません。駅の位置は変わらないので何度かやるうちに線路の敷き方も分かってきますがそれでもたくさんの列車が走り出すと制御困難に陥ることがありなかなか面白いです。予定通りに完璧に進むと非常に爽快感を感じる方には中毒性があると思います。コストパフォーマンスは最高に良いと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198018751855', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1628015904}
review: It's a simple enough puzzle game that has some fun aspects to it, and its generally a pretty relaxing time once you realize that it's almost required to pause the game using the space bar (I was getting some serious anxiety in the early stamps attempting to figure it out on the fly at 1x speed even). I look forward to purchasing and playing the next installment in this title!

review:
Very addictive puzzle-strategy game. Starts fairly easy, but gets quite complex, especially in the last of the four countries. Comes with a few challenges per level and lots of achievements. Graphics and sountrack feel a bit outdated but that does not affect the fun at all. Can fully recommend!

EDIT: Bought the Germany DLC, it's also very fun - not too hard - and introduces a few interesting twists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130932508', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1571634237}
review:
[h1]Поездное безумие[/h1]

Эта простецкая на первый взгляд игрушка уже давно мозолит мне глаза. Привлекательная своей простой идеей - перевезти поезд на станцию соответствующего цвета путем строительства железной дороги, и привлекательная простой картинкой, Train Valley когда-то да должна была оказаться в моей библиотеке. И это случилось.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
[list]
[*][u]Геймплей.[/u] Он вроде как и простой, как ничто, а вроде и суперсложный, поскольку, чтобы перевезти один поезд, много ума не надо. А попробуйте одновременно управляться с 8-ю поездами, чтобы они не сталкивались. Здесь это явление ну очень частое.
[*][u]Графика.[/u] Просто и со вкусом. Есть множество различных тем для заднего фона, тут и Аляска, и Дикий Запад, и еще куча других.
[*][u]Цена.[/u] Я взял ее за 30 рублей по скидке, за такую игру цена - огонь.
[/list]

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
[list]
[*][u]Однообразность.[/u] Как бы хороша не была игра, но часам к 5-6 вам скорее всего надоест строить железные дороги, ведь уровни отличаются друг от друга лишь задним планом, количеством станций/городов и разными возможностями проезда (мосты, тоннели, etc.). 
[/list]

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Трэйн Вэллей зайдет любителям подумать. Думать тут придется много, как спланировать пути так, чтобы все ваши поезда не попересекались по пути. Как не обанкротиться. И следить, чтобы все поезда шли в соответствующие города. Рекомендую по скидке.

[i]Также подписывайтесь на:
[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC98kSF_PXGb8JMgpl7wT2Jg?view_as=subscriber]Youtube[/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/korukagames]Koruka - моя группа в Steam[/url]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33161518/]Куратор[/url]
[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983844168', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2518, 'last_played': 1572014814}
review:
Отличное казуальное развлечение, в котором, однако, можно не только расслабляться, без напряга наблюдая за игрушечными поездами и лениво переключая стрелки. Для достижения дополнительных целей нужно уже проявлять внимательность, реакцию, расторопность и навыки планирования. А при желании выбить ачивки, игра вообще превращается в настоящий хардкор.

79%

author: {'steamid': '76561198014518234', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1578966356}
review:
Way more frustrating than it needs to be.

The small maps and simplistic design elements are good and relaxing, but it's hampered by what seems to be an unfocused vision. What results is a game that is neither a challenging puzzle game, nor a relaxing chill-out game. The amount you can manipulate the game world is far short of a management sim -- you can only lay tracks and flip switches -- and yet the hostile bankruptcy mechanic is eager to cut short any relaxing experience you're trying to get out of the game.

There is no save/load functionality for individual puzzles, either, making the endless mode pointless really -- you can make a really nice train system, but for what? 

Furthermore, the devs either don't understand or are unreceptive to criticism -- see the steam discussion thread about the bankruptcy mechanic -- which means that Train Valley 1 feels like a shell of a game, and Train Valley 2 seems not to have learned any lessons from this.

It was fun, for awhile, and I really wish it would live up to that potential, but it doesn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393911865', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1571229314}
review:
14.4小时终于通关了哈哈哈哈但是基本没有三星的，每天都忍不住来上两局，非常容易沉迷，是没有朋友一起玩游戏时打发时间的利器，当然玩到后面也不是只是为了打发时间了。
那些说游戏太难什么考的不是智商是手速甚至打差评的，我想说，善用空格（暂停）键。
这游戏只用鼠标玩还是鼠键共用简直是两个世界。
玩这游戏玩到想砸鼠标很正常，但是玩游戏，不要这么暴躁嘛，毕竟是个休闲娱乐呀。

author: {'steamid': '76561198257104131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1611355559}
review: Jogo excepcional! Você lembra daquele joguinho de conduzir a água pelo encanamento? Eles fizeram algo muito melhor! Os trens aparecem aleatoriamente de cidade em cidade e as cidades vão mudando (aparecendo novas... crescendo...). Simplesmente apaixonante com gráficos interessantes. Dica: Os trens podem ser parados e revertidos (até para chegar ao destino). Cada fase é mais desafiadora que a anterior. Recomendo a compra! Um jogo de estratégia simples e fantástico!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025840813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5689, 'last_played': 1597884277}
review:
For the 2 or 3 dollars I paid for the game it's absolutely brilliant. I've been playing in bursts, rage-quitting when I oh so very nearly aced a level, having failed to juggle multiple trains on the crazy spaghetti railways I'd strewn across the landscape. Next day I'll have another crack at the level. A couple of them have been fairly challenging to complete the 3 objectives (Don't Crash Trains, Don't Stop Trains, Don't Bulldoze Too Many Things etc).

I've been playing at 60fps 4k monitor with a 6gb GTX 1060 and an i5-4570. The first time you start the game choose 1080p, set the interface scale slider to max, then restart in 2160p.

Oh... rather embarrassingly I didn't notice you can reverse a train's direction until yesterday...

author: {'steamid': '76561198042335794', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1571419369}
review:
I like trains and love little powered train models.
I can build tracks, send trains, manage them - a lot of fun.
Graphics and music is nice, has character. Levels are different enough, side quests sometimes really challenging and I can always just play level continuously after finishing it, or hunt high score.
Sometimes I play on favorite level on never ending mode for 15+ minutes on top speed - stressful and relaxing at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313176741', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1579793545}
review: 本以为是模拟经营方向的游戏，音乐画面都好评，唯独游戏难度让人火大，考验的并不是玩家的经营建造策略而是拼手速点道闸，难度过高无法通关就算了，好歹给个难度选项给休闲玩家吧，人生第一次玩一个游戏玩到冒火。

author: {'steamid': '76561198410169156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1554238912}
review: If you are expecting a model train simulator where you build tracks then sit back and delight at your new setup, you will be out of luck. This is more of a puzzle game where the levels get progressively harder requiring careful placement of track, switching of track points and above all ensuring that each train gets to its designated station without crashing into other trains. You will need to be quick thinking and plan ahead. This game does have the frustration factor so be prepared.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189899943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1570502699}
review:
Este es de esos juegos muy del estilo de Nintendo: Un concepto sencillo pero divertido con el que puedes pasar jugando durante horas y horas.
Es tan simple como ir del punto A al B y tienes que trazar la línea para que ambos puntos se conecten ¿en dónde radica la dificultad? que también aparece el punto C y D y aquí comienza la locura porque cada estación te pide un destino y tienes que ser rápido y organizado apenas teniendo un momento para organizar todo en tu mente antes de tomar la decisión de hacer partir los trenes, en un momento dado el punto C quiere ir al A, el A quiere ir al D, el B quiere ir al C y el D quiere ir al B, y si te demoras más de la cuenta los trenes parten solos, PERO además tienes la dificultad que tienes que cambiar los recorridos de las líneas que tu mismo trazaste para que los trenes lleguen al destino que te piden.
Un juego liviano que no pide recursos ni rams, solo trabajar el musculo de tu cerebro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063356085', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1570721817}

author: {'steamid': '76561198333441331', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1573098466}
review:
[b]Fazit nach 77 Minuten[/b]
Eigentlich wollte ich nur kurz reinschauen, bevor ich ins Bett gehe (es ist jetzt 06:40). Das Endergebnis lautet: Europa ist durch. Auf allen 5 Maps sind alle 3 Aufgaben gemeistert und die abschließende Mission wurde mit einem Kontostand von $106k beendet. Prima .. Zwei Bier sind auch weg. Aber ok. 

Ich habe bisher nichts zu meckern und muss sagen, dass es doch recht fesselnd ist. Die ersten Missionen waren alle mit dem ersten Versuch erledigt - nur bei der letzten habe ich mich 3 bis 5 Mal verzettelt und musste neustarten. Soweit ist der Schwierigkeitsgrad also auch für relativ Denkfaule wie mich noch gut zu schaffen. 
Die Grafik geht in Ordnung und hat ihren eigenen Charme. Das einzige Manko war bei mir die Größe des HUD bei FullHD-Auflösung .. es schrumpft doch schon recht deutlich. Vielleicht sollte man hier eine etwas niedrige Auflösung wählen. 
Der Sound ist zweckmäßig. Verschiedene Loks geben bei der Abfahrt verschiedene Töne von sich (ob sie sich noch in Geschwindigkeit o.Ä. unterscheiden, ist mir leider entgangen) und die Hintergrundmusik dudelt gemächlich vor sich her. Gestört hat soweit nichts.

Der erste Eindruck nach dieser doch recht kurzen Spielzeit ist durchweg positiv. Das Spielprinzip ist leicht zu verstehen .. ein bisschen Tutorial in den ersten Missionen hilft über niedrige Einstiegshürden hinweg. Die 1,49€ waren bisher top investiert und ich kann jedem nur empfehlen, dem Spiel im Sale eine Chance zu geben, wenn man derlei Knobelspielen nicht ganz abgeneigt ist. Ob es auch die knapp 10€ wert wäre, wird sich in den nächsten Runden zeigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991556719', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1570200768}
review:
This is a puzzle game which is train-themed. The only thing that comes remotely close to managing trains is flipping the switches on time. There are no resources, no passengers, no upgrades for trains and no way to build your own stations (you can only lay out track). On top of that, it is difficult to tell the flow of a track once there's a train on top of it. 

Was expecting more, got less. Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000896253', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1558456287}
review:
If you’re in the market for a puzzle game, check this one out, it’s regularly on sale for like £1. Train Valley is a puzzle game taking place on maps where coloured train stations are spawned and you have to lay the tracks down for the trains. You then have to get the coloured trains to the corresponding stations.

It sounds simple, but the maps are short and littered with obstacles. The faster you get a train to the station the more money you get, and you need that money for track-laying and demolition work. Also, there’s an annual tax for each level that whittles down your cash to keep you on your toes.

On the maps, as the years go by, you’ll see more modern trains. Each successful train arrival builds new additions to the map, expanding a city or factory or whatever. There are four ‘seasons’ taking place in various countries over the years. America, Europe, Russia and Japan. If you’re a history nut you might see some historical moment – Japan for example has the building of the Yamato Battleship and the Winter Olympics and Football World Cup. The first two scenarios are cakewalk, but Russia and Japan are quite difficult, particularly Russia’s WW2 scenario.

Anyway, simple, but tricky puzzle game, if that’s your thing, check this one out. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198353746924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1568526547}
review:
Great little Train Sim Game.
Fun for a few hours, more like a logic-fun-puzzle game than a train simulator.

I would like to see bigger maps, some signals and automatism.
Think it could evolve into a nice little train sim from its actual mini-game character.

What is not so fun, since the map is always just one screen and the trains get bigger/faster to the end, the game gets near to impossible in some endgame maps. But still okeyisch, and fun to start with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1564307280}
review:
[h1]Preamble[/h1]

A very good train simulator where you manage several trains and their tracks to different stations and try your best to avoid collisions.

Difficult to play, very hard to master and get perfect levels. It is very addicting and has several hours of gameplay for only 10$, [i]or your regional equivalent[/i].

The base game has 4 seasons with several levels/missions in each season and 1 DLC Season, Germany.

The latter levels are [b]very[/b] difficult to even complete, let alone getting 3 stars on them and you will definitely go through trial and error many times.

If you despise games where you need to attempt the same level several times to complete I'd just stop here and move on, because you will use a lot of time on re-doing levels due to your own failure.

I wouldn't say playing this game in hour-long sessions at a time is the best. I enjoyed it more by playing about an hour at a time.

[h1]The gameplay and mechanics[/h1]

The trailers of this game depict the gameplay perfectly.
You create tracks, preferably as efficient tracks as you can, and send trains from Point A to Point B. Early levels are quite easy, they are more of a tutorial to learn you the game, but once you advance just 1 season you will be forced to focus a lot more on efficiency of your tracks and keeping everything organized.

The game has 4 gameplay speeds that you can switch between, Normal speed, x2 times, x3 times and Pause. The pause button is extremely useful as sometimes you just have to pause for a second and get a real overview of the entire situation because it's so hectic.

Graphics are obviously one of the least important things in a game like this, but the graphic style is nice and pleasing as you can see in the trailers.

Later levels introduce new mechanics(off-screen trains, bombings and more complicated track management).

[h1]Things I'd like to see improved[/h1]

You build tracks, you build a lot of them.
The way the track-building system works does not reflect this. The way it is works makes it seem like you just build a few tracks so they just quickly threw the system together and didn't bother spending too much time on perfecting it.

What do I mean by this?

I mean that it just... doesn't work properly.

Several times you will find yourself having to destroy the last part of a track because it didn't go where you wanted it to go on the very last part. It is difficult to explain with words, I really don't know how, but it is very apparent that it could've been improved upon by a lot, especially considering that the track-building is a very big part of this game.

[h1]Ending words[/h1]

All-in-all I think this is a great train management game. It is very difficult to master, and once you do you will be very proud of yourself, and rightfully so!

It is not a giant, super-complex train sim. It is a bit more minimalistic in terms of the mechanics that are present, but in it's own right it is a great, difficult game.

I'd pick this up if it interests you, it is not a bad game at all, just keep in mind that it is a bit more on the minimalist side in the grand scheme of train sims.


[h1]Curator page[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or otherwise found it helpful in deciding whether or not to buy this game, feel free to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29162366/]my Curator page[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459119', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1564844092}
review:
Railroad simulators are nothing new. It's a well explored genre so any new comers need to be bringing something unique to the table. If anything, Train Valley takes away from other, better, railroad simulating game. 

The core problem with Train Valley is the gameplay. There is very little choice in Train Valley. The only thing you do is place track, switch tracks, tell trains to leave the station, or tell them to stop/turn around. That's it. There are no buildings, there is limited financial management, you don't have any say as to which trains will spawn in what station, & you will be doing this over and over again for some 30+ nearly identical levels. There is little distinguishing one level from another other than some static terrain challenges. Some areas are either impossible or more expensive to build track over but other than that level 5 plays like level 20. 
Each level has some challenges you can accomplish and while they can be tricky it doesn't give you a sense of satisfaction having completed them.

Graphically it's soothing. The music is repetitive but not obnoxious. It runs well and I suppose if you are into a relaxing experience this might work. But compare this to a game for iOS/Android called Trainyard, whose level of complexity is ten times more interesting and more fun. Train Valley feels like [i]it[/i] should be on mobile platforms, and even then it'd still be a bore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108270275', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1563088828}
review:
À tous les passagers, prière de monter à bord. Prochain arrêt: Train Valley!

Mélangeant à merveille jeu de micro-gestion et trains électriques, Train Valley nous amène dans le monde merveilleux de l'histoire des chemins de fer à travers le monde. Se déplaçant à travers différentes régions (Europe, Amérique, Russie, Japon + l'Allemagne en DLC) on retrace plusieurs périodes de l'histoire, des premières locomotives à vapeur, en passant par la ruée vers l'Or américaine,  la construction de la première fusée soviétique habitée, aux trains électriques modernes.

Dans ce jeu, on est autant derrière les commandes d'une locomotive que dans une tour de contrôle du trafic. À travers les différents niveaux, on devra gérer les aiguillages et le trafic ferroviaires avec que tous nos petits trains se rendant à la garde correspondante dans les temps impartis, tout en s'assurant que le moins d'accidents possibles n'ait lieu. Parce qu'un déraillement ou une rencontre inopinée entre deux trains et s'est l'explosion, et on devra vite reconstruire nos voies détruites. Mais trop d'accidents, trop de voies construites trop rapidement, et c'est vite la banqueroute de notre entreprise. Et il faudra toujours rester aux aguets. Les débuts sont assez lents, avec des locomotives à vapeur avançant pépère à pas de tortue, mais l'arrivée du fuel et de l'électricité, avec de trains beaucoup plus longs et rapides, et ça peut vite devenir la galère si on n'est pas à notre affaire.

Les niveaux sont diversifiés, présentant chacun une petite particularité, qu'il faudra parfois surmonter: chaîne de montagne limitant le nombre de voies entre deux secteurs, villes empêchant (ou limitant) la possibilité de construction de rails, nombreux lacs à contourner, (le mur de Berlin dans le DLC), etc. Chaque tableau va également s'accompagner de trois petits défis que l'on doit remplir (mais pas nécessairement tous à la fois) pour obtenir nos tampons de réussite). Ces défis vont varier globalement entre un nombre de trains supplémentaires à appeler, arrêter aucun train sur les voies, engranger un certain montant, détruire des structures pour un certain montant, etc.

Le jeu se prends facilement en main, avec un premier niveau tout simple comme tutoriel. Il faudra toutefois user parfois de logique dans certains tableaux pouvant parfois être légèrement plus complexes (surtout si l'on veut remporter tous les défis). La D.A. est très jolie avec des décors près de la maquette. On se croirait réellement être en train de s'amuser devant de petits trains électriques sous fond sonore de petites pièces musicales appropriées à chaque région ou période historique visitée. Le seul point négatif pourrait revenir toutefois au placement de certains courbes ou aiguillages qui peuvent parfois ne pas vouloir répondre à notre volonté (nécessitant parfois de les détruire pour les repositionner, ce qui pourra nous mener parfois à la banqueroute dans certains situations). Mais malgré tout, Train Valley est un jeu des plus divertissant où l'on passera plusieurs heures à jouer avec nos petites locomotives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836364206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1562862439}
review:
很有趣的益智遊戲，主要是蓋鐵路將A站物品利用火車運送到B站去，隨著站點越來越多就要去思考火車路線及先後出車的問題。
有倍速及暫停功能非常貼心，可以暫停慢慢思考路線再發車。
玩到後期覺得此遊戲最需要的是手速與耐心，即將3星通關卻因為自己急著發車造成撞車真的會很想砸電腦。
是很好打發時間的小遊戲，價格也不貴，值得入手!

author: {'steamid': '76561198135634516', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1590116692}
review:
I can't tell if Train Valley is one of the hardest puzzle games I've ever played or if I'm just really bad.

10/10 would recommend if you can handle the stress of things happening outside of your control.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044271358', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1562884937}
review: I'm not a huge puzzle game guy but this one was decent. It's very similar to PolyBridge in that you are given an amount of money and have to get vehicles (in this case trains) to their destinations. I like how you sort of end up making the puzzle for yourself to solve, as you create your rail network and have to figure out how to get all of your trains where they're going. I'm pretty bad at this game, but I stilled enjoyed my time with it. If you like trying to figure out how to get your traffic to work in games like Cities:Skylines, you'd probably like this game. It does, however involve A LOT of MICROMANAGEMENT. The later levels are definitely not chill. Would recommend for fans of puzzle and/or train games.

review: Do you like trains? Do you like puzzles? Do you like levels that start out easy and slowly build to a stressed-out zen state of flipping rail switches and juggling trains, only to be interrupted when you mess up and your trains crash? Do you enjoy telling yourself 'okay, this time I'll get it' over and over again? Then this game is for you. It's definitely for me, anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140146180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1562530654}
review:
A very entertaining, and occasionally even amusing, game.
Not much I can tell you about whether it is for you or not, that isn't already revealed by screenshots, trailer or zapping through a gameplay video. But I will point out some borderline points that may otherwise hold you back from making a purchase;
+ Notice that there is a demo available.
+ Gameplay is intuitive and smooth. I found no annoyances with interface or controls, and there are assignable keyboard shortcuts to build, erase, pause and speed.
+ Gameplay (puzzle) elements are introduced gradually and are paced perfectly.
+ You can make (some) changes while the game is paused, meaning that you are almost certainly able to complete all levels with not many restarts.
+ Great value in terms of playtime;
++ I'd say minimum gameplay time to completion is 6 hours or so, but it's an easy 10-12 hours total for completing all "advanced objectives", which are what I'd call "meaningful", and not just random difficult things.
++ There are three additional objectives for all levels, such as completing the level without pausing, not letting a train into the wrong station, not rebuilding any track, etc.
++ Add additional replay value if you have a bit of "Hey, I can improve on that solution, let's try again" in you.
++ The final level in each of the four worlds is kind of a free-for-all where a point score is given, which you can attempt to improve on.
++ Overall I got 30 enjoyable hours out of the game before I was "done" (base game, ~3 hours of additional content in the German DLC).

10/10, would crash nuclear train again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037138875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1561328326}
review:
A very enjoyable strategy/puzzle/management game. 

Simply put, you'll have to make way for trains aiming to go to different stations. 
Each train arriving at their destination will give you cash, which you can spend on new railways, maybe make a parallel line so you can have 2 trains going each way etc.. 
There's usually obstacles in the map that will block you way, some removable for (sometimes really high) cash, others unmovable, period (such as mountains).

It's simple enough to play, but can be really enjoyable to min-max your railways to make them efficient, and each stage having a set of 3 achievements definitely spices the challange, such as not being able to pause, or stop the trains. 

Definitely recommend it, specially at it's price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090084538', 'num_games_owned': 1320, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 1545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1562910159}
review:
A polished semi-simple train & track puzzle-type game which is relatively relaxing and I recommend on deep sale to fans of puzzle & strategy games.  Here is what you need to know:
+Decent simple music and graphics fit the look & relaxed vibe of the game.
?Its a micromanagement puzzle: You build tracks, control track switches, choose when a train leaves a station, and can stop or reverse a train.  The latter may be limited with certain train types or levels, but that was never explained in-game.
?There are no notable differences between trains of different eras, nor can you choose between train types to deploy. You can only choose whether a train deploys early, which costs money because the sooner a train reaches its destination the more money you get.  That means...
?The way you earn money incentivizes you to be careful by either playing slow at 1x speed or by pausing periodically when laying track or pulling switches to make a path for a train.  This can become tedious or an issue with...
-There is no way to save your progress on a map/level which takes much longer than the advertised 5-10 minutes (normal mode) if you feel the need to stop the game at all, even if you run the game at 2-4x speed when unpaused.
+The map/terrain often evolves over time - The more time passes, the more buildings or things get added to the map that you may want to destroy later. So building many tracks early may decrease bulldoze costs in the long term.
?Out of all the levels, there are only a few map/terrain specific events like the rocket launch in the Store page's trailer.  Those are caused by train(s) that enter from the outside of the map using pre-existing track, all of which is equally as rare as the events they trigger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146645159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1569881636}
review:
其是从2代来回首，第一作的3D美术还是有点粗糙的。核心玩法虽说简单，却也含有一点变化，只是万变不离其宗，达成游戏全部目标基本知识时间问题，只是部分成就需要专门花工夫完成。
说实话，这是一款并不算复杂的游戏，不过能玩25小时以上也够长了，几乎要赶上《Into the Breach》的一半了，其中有些关卡结合了时代背景还是挺有趣的（比如美国西部淘金，前苏联的太空建设），我确实多体验了几次，对我来说《火车山谷》的魅力还是不小的。

review: This game is a lot more complicated than it seems. At first it's just a couple of trains, then suddenly there are five of them and they are crashing in all directions. You really have to think about planning the routes and it twisted my brain in a knot trying to figure out how to not have them all die a fiery death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054589890', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1596179387}
review:
遊戲目的是用鐵軌串聯各個火車站，使火車能順利抵達目標車站。
遊戲看似簡單，但其實還挺有難度的，一不留神火車不是相撞就是開錯車站。
加上可愛的卡通風格及輕快的音樂，讓人想不沉迷也很困難。

review:
I quite enjoy this simple and relaxing puzzle game.
Not too mention trains are awesome!
It follows a fairly linear increase in difficulty through each level by adding new stations of various colours, but it creates a well balanced puzzle despite having such simple mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972900635', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1662747436}
review: I really enjoy this game. I won this in a contest and wasn't certain what to expect. Pleasantly surprised to find a simple puzzle game that is easy to hop into and fun to play.  For me, some of the stages have been fairly challenging, but their presented in way that I don't feel punished for not getting them right. Each stage is easy to start over if you noticed you made a mistake; and they aren't long so they feel annoying if you make a mistake later in the stage. I just found this game really relaxing to hop into an play during a work break to help reset my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977461855', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1562256564}
review: Gioco molto carino per passare una mezz'oretta di divertimento. Sedetevi comodi, installate il gioco e preparatevi ad imprecare contro dei treni che vogliono partire quasi sempre dalle stazioni sbagliate. Ma alla fine il bello è proprio questo: creare un percorso che permetta ai treni di partire e arrivare integri alla stazione di arrivo, evitando pericolose collisioni durante il tragitto. Un casual game molto carino adatto a chiunque, specialmente a chi ha sempre sognato di creare una piccola ferrovia. Da acquistare il prima possibile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064494426', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 682, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1577852389}
review:
easy enough to just get through, and the challenges are decent in difficulty. I find the icon at the station to dispatch a route to be small. played in a windowed screen really shows why the ui majority should be at the bottom, because in a panic you close the game than pause. A lot of time I am sure I launched a train from a station only for it not to register and mess with my timing. and I find as soon as one thing goes wrong those whole thing falls apart. It is fun and not forgiving. it can be as soothing as stressful.


also playing windowed if you drag the window to the top of desktop the game maximizes to fll screen, w10 os. with only a handful of achievements locked behind the dlc its not bad but a bummer for achievement hunters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991685583', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1561845442}
review:
This game sucks if you have any sort of lack of patience. The train speeds are juust a bit too random, change a little bit when they go between train types. For some reason tracks change direction when a train drives into a junction so the track is different for the next train so you can't keep structures. The train drawing track is a bit wacky, can go off screen for some reason. You don't get a timer for when the next train spawns, which makes buying another one early a bit odd. 

What this game did do was remind me of how much I love Mini Metro, which is easier to play and harder to master. Recommend that one a lot more.

review:

Siempre quieres lograr mas y al terminarlo te empeñas en los logros, que no son muchos pero son un reto (porque no necesitan ser muchos logros para ser un reto). El apartado visual no tiene gran impacto en la jugabilidad.

El DLC esta bien, capaz si uno lo consiguiera a menos precio o si eres muy fan, lo compras del tiro!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038880470', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1561812509}
review:
[h1][b]★★★★☆[/b][/h1]
As expected, it's a small-time game meant to be played in 30-minute sessions. It is slightly too repetitive to run this game from start to end within a view days, because ultimately it's just a plate-spinner; all you do is making sure the trains reach their destinations while avoiding accidents, hazards and bankruptcy (e.g. game over). Each level has three optional stipulations which only build up toward unlocking achievements. Later levels pose challenges in a variety of ways, like managing a incoming trains emerging from offscreen, planes bombing the traintracks or working with or around structures on the map like bridges and mountains.

If all the above sounds like a mobile game to you - with the generic and aged artstyle - than I totally agree. It is just another game that you can play while watching or listening to something else. It's nothing insulting. It's best to get this during a sale (obviously) as the discount tend to pretty big on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040657252', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1596135214}
review:
Train valley is a nice realxing puzzle game where you have to bring a train from the one to the other station. the stations are divides in colours. You need to build tracks to bring the train from the one station to the other, the danger is that the trains can collide, then you get no money form bringing it to the station and the railroad is damaged. the trains then dissapear. After a few hours i really like the game.

Good:
- High replayability
- many missions
- nice artstyle
- a game for the mister worldwides out there

Overlal a pretty nice fun game you should pick up for not too much money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132857682', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1562512845}
review:
Казуальна стратегія-головоломка.
Дуже приємна і достатньо цікава щоб затримати на всі 6 годин геймплею.
Реокмендую всім поціновучам потягів та простеньких ігор.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061924559', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1559265978}
review: ¡Muy bueno! Me pasé horas añadiendo vías para hacer el mejor sistema de logística. El juego es tenso por momentos cuando tenés que gestionar muchos trenes a la vez para que todos lleguen a su destino, también es relajante a veces cuando todo está saliendo bien, pero divertido todo el tiempo. Me hace acordar por momentos al Pipe Mania de DOS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139815184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1882, 'last_played': 1562251985}
review:
Excellent puzzle game, with a lot more content then I expected. 
Some of the levels are extremely challenging, especially in the later levels and the Germany DLC, and really make you think. It is both a nice way to unwind, and mindbogglingly frustrating all at once.

If you can pick this up on sale then I wouldnt hesitate, but even at full price it is completely worth the money.

review: A petit prix, un petit jeu agréable sans prise de tête, et qui permet de s'aérer l'esprit après une journée de boulot. Il s'agit simplement de relier différentes gares entre elles et s'assurer que les trains y arriveront sans catastrophe. Cela remplit son office, quand vous voulez jouer 15 min, sans avoir à vous concentrer sur un jeu dense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077170607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1604471524}
review:
This game is pure hell. You think it'll be easy and comfy and then that one station you weren't paying attention to releases it's train that crashes with the train that was about to arrive and it blows up your lines, causing a chain reaction with the third train that wasn't even going in and it explodes too. And then you start again, thinking this next time it'll be different and you got the perfect solution. 
Oh how wrong you were, you're bankrupt because you couldn't afford the maximum efficient road positions.
And then you start over, trying three strategies at once and have an absolute blast. Until the next mission.
I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1609712757}
review:
A nice tiny game.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1782723561
It is not a usual railroad game. It is more action puzzle game. Your main task is changing switches. Yeah, you have a lot of trains and some stations. You can start the train, stop it and reverse. It can't choose the track. You need to move switches to bring it right station. Seems easy, but it plays very nice.

I spend 2 hours and passed 15 missions. It is OK gameplay. I stopped playing, because new levels bring nothing new. Just more stations in more difficult layout.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1782723601
Pros
- Very simple rules
- Mechanics is engaging. Just one more train
- Chill gameplay

Cons
- New worlds don't give anything new except visuals
- Graphics is extremely outdated
- Random level (the last level in each world) could be insane
- Special tasks are getting repetitive very soon

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1782723523
[h1]Resume[/h1]
A nice game with interesting but simple mechanics. The game could be passed in 5-6 hours. It doesn't offer a lot of diverse content, so it think buying the game for a full price is a robbery. But if you see it with 70%+ discount - take it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189129115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1556368580}
review:
Kurz & Knapp: Gutes kleines Spiel für zwischen durch.
Kann man gut mal 5-15min einschieben und ein Level machen. (Oder auch viele Stunden am Stück spielen).

Es gibt auch verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade/Missionen für jedes Level.
Ebenso kann die Geschwindigkeit während dem Spielen angepasst werden & man kann auch Pausieren.

Errungenschaften sind auch sehr nett, und einige als zusätzliche Herausforderung ;)

Alles in einem: Gutes Spiel für jeden der Rätsel mit Zügen mag :)

PS: Man kann gut nach einigen Monaten einfach nochmal von Vorne alle Level Spielen - Spielspaß bleibt erhalten :)
btw. Kein Level ist auf normaler/langsamer Geschwindigkeit zu schwer zu meistern & es müssen auch nicht alle Missionen gleichzeitig gelöst werden um die Stempel zu erhalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000358211', 'num_games_owned': 1829, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1767, 'last_played': 1556007838}
review:
Fun and addictive. The gameplay is as minimalistic as it's art style, but that adds to the charm. The game is not about train management like OpenTTD, but more like a puzzle game where you have to build a good enough rail system on each level and then juggle trains from origin to destination carefully operating all the intersections along the way.

~30h to get all the achievements including the DLC ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054341119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1642913683}
review: I've just started playing this game, and am hooked. The concept is very simple, but the puzzles they keep throwing at you are complex and intricate. Trying to get all the "stamps" makes for replayability. I just wish the game would tell you which station was going to appear next, track laying can be a little frustrating, and I wish there was an undo button. However, all-in-all, I really like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131133374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2497, 'last_played': 1622737394}
review:
Really, Really, REALLY super fun game.
It is simple, quick to play, each level takes like 10/15 minutes to finish (even if you have to repeat it a few times to get all the stamps ;) ) and challenging enough.
Juggling all the possibilities and the moving parts.

DAMN the "a train can't enter the wrong station" is SOOOOOOOOO ENNOYING!!!!!
And the "you can't stop trains" is probably the most difficult to complete......

Graphics are good, pleasant and entertaining and they fit the game perfectly...

This is just a great game for someone that just wants to have a little fun for 10 ,20 or 40 minutes (or more :P )..... But it CAN be just 10 or 20.....

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198333996324', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1660927528}
review:
Отличная расслабляющая игра про строительство железных дорог, как в 90х.
Игровой процесс прост и понятен - на карте появляются города, в городах появляются поезда, поезда показывают в какой город им надо, ну а мы строим дорогу и всячески помогаем им туда добраться строя железную дорогу и переключая стрелки на путях.
Объекты на карте появляются в случайном порядке, что добавляет реиграбельности.
Часов на 5-6 кампании хватит, а дальше можно развлекаться в песочнице.
Рекомендую  любителям паровозов!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016377494', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1663619658}
review:
Микроменеджмент поездов в простой, понятной форме.
У вас есть бюджет, есть заказы по перевозу грузов/пассажиров с одной станции в другую. С течением времени станций и заказов становиться больше. Вам нужно не допускать столкновений поездов и при этом не стать банкротом.
Игроку нужно постоянно следить за вышедшими поездами, параллельно составляя список последующих «рейсов». Бороться с собственным чувством перфекционизма при построении и эксплуатации дорог. Переигрывая, карта строится по другому, запрещая строить одинаковые пути.
От режима «песочница» я ожидал случайно генерируемых карт или редактора. Но это неспешная тренировка построения идеальной дороги. UI хотелось бы крупнее и удобнее.
Главное - ты играешь отдыхая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313841137', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1575297407}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1559220519}
review:
Train Valley est un joyeux mélange de casse-tête, construction, synchronisation et gestion avec un habillage façon magnat des chemins de fer. N'en attendez pas la gestion pointue et l'optimisation de réseaux d'un tycoon de transport ferroviaire. Une partie ne dure que quelques minutes, des gares et trains apparaissent au petit bonheur la chance et il faut relier et amener à destination tout ce petit monde dans une débauche de clics pour poser la voie qui manque par ci, basculer l'aiguillage par là, arrêter d'urgence ce train qui n'a rien à faire à cette jonction et lui inventer une voie de contournement, redémarrer ce train qui doit franchir ce carrefour maintenant et plus vite que ça...
Ca peut se jouer pépère façon puzzle en abusant de la pause. Ou alors frénétiquement quand on se prend au jeu et qu'on décide que : "la pause c'est pas marrant".
Un jeu qui arrive à être divertissant en distillant juste ce qu'il faut de stress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113238791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1512741632}
review: Железная дорога строиться, паровозики  снуют туда-сюда, иногда из-за плохого расписания врезаются друг в друга, вообщем всё очень мило и интересно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052504066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3193, 'last_played': 1564248716}
review:
I certainly like this one! It's one of those "easy to learn, difficult to master" games. To get through a level is usually pretty easy, but getting all three goals in a given playthrough is another story entirely. Most levels take me probably close to 100 playthroughs, most of which are, "Ah, crap! Restart level... :P" Sometimes that's after 30 seconds, sometimes 20 minutes. It will definitely make you say some expletives, but it's never so frustrating that it's not fun. And when you finally achieve it, it's immensely satisfying.

If you like the train game in Lumosity, you'll definitely like at least part of this. It's very much about divided attention, though you can pause and look at everything (unlike Lumosity's train game).

For railroad junkies, I don't know that this will really scratch the itch. It's a little light on lore and fluff. It's cute (but not cartoonish), but not hyper-realistic. There's no factoids about trains/railroads, no realistic maps, etc. Each level is given a name related to the area it's supposed to be modeled after, and perhaps you could tell if you compared the level to the real thing, I don't know. But if you enjoy the logistics aspect of building a semi-complex rail system, then you'll get a lot out of this.

The groups of levels are called "seasons," and generally are countries. I think there are 5 seasons, and each season has quite a few levels. There's definitely a lot of playtime in this game, especially for perfectionists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050995659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1581185464}

author: {'steamid': '76561198265375537', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1590534780}
review:
Train Valley ist ein niedliches Gelegenheitsspiel, das mit Herausforderungen nicht lumpen lässt. Wenngleich die fast schon kindliche Grafik es zu einfach wirken lässt, sollte man es keineswegs für zu leicht halten. Der Grundkern der Aufgaben ist immer der gleiche, wechselt sich aber mit verschiedenen Aufgaben ab: Erreiche einen bestimmten Betrag, verbaue eine bestimmte anzahl an Schienenabschnitten, schicke eine bestimmte Anzahl an zusätzlichen Zügen los, vermeide Zugunglücke, erhalte die Umwelt mit einem bestimmten Betrag ect.
Im einzelnen sollten diese Aufgaben kein Problem sein, da es aber pro Runde 3 Aufgaben zeitgleich zu erfüllen gibt (zumindest wenn man alle 3 Stempel haben möchte!) kann es zuweilen wirklich knifflig werden. Ein schönes Spiel zum knobeln und immer wieder mit Überraschungen, denn der jeweilige Level wird immer anders aufgebaut sein -auch wenn man ihn 10 mal spielen muss wird es nie langweilig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198892659587', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1575735898}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075518178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1696429821}
review:
This game rears its ugly head pretty quickly. The simplistic gameplay design rapidly becomes inadequate to the point of frustration past the halfway mark, where the level design becomes worse and worse. Maps will attempt to force the player into ugly and inefficient designs, due to the large turns required by the tracks and the absence of being able to make three-way switches.

The maps themselves are short in supply, with about 6 maps each for the 4 worlds, and a fifth world locked behind some infuriating DLC. Each map comes with a quickly grating endlessly looping piece of music and three challenges, which start off simple like "Cause no train crashes" and "Assure no train goes to the wrong station" but soon they turn into ludicrous challenges such as "Stop no trains" and "Send off 12 additional trains"

The additional trains mechanic in of itself is laughable. To explain, at any point during a level, you can spend money to make a train appear at a station, the idea being you'll get more money once it arrives at it's respective station. The problem arises when stations are placed so far apart and trains travel so slowly that there is never a suitable break to add anothe train to the mess.

If you're looking for a puzzle game to sink your teeth into, buy this only if you have a large supply of painkillers

author: {'steamid': '76561198027008838', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1558269562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198433696176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1604042309}
review:
首先，这是一款休闲游戏，为什么会做出这样的强调，是因为其游戏特性如果玩家以一种不良好的游戏心态去接触他可能会带来并不友好的体验，但是如果以一种休闲放松的心态去玩他绝对不失是一部佳作，但事实上人们很多时候在玩游戏的时候并不能做到真正的放松。
作为一部休闲游戏，火车山谷绝对是合格的。游戏时长控制的很好，随时拿起来随时放得下，什么时候玩他都能给你带来相同的游戏体验，同时游戏本身所提供的小目标也会让玩家更好的投入到游戏当中，带来更好的游戏体验。同时不同关卡也会有一些小彩蛋，就不细说了。
游戏本身需要一定的专注力，也需要动一些小脑筋，并不适合完全的放松主义。游戏作为一款简单的道路规划问题，可能是开发商对于游戏难度的考虑，并没有引入高架桥等更为多样化的设定，是一大遗憾。
总体来说，火车山谷都是一部优秀的休闲模拟游戏，价格也很亲民，感兴趣的话不妨入手看看。

author: {'steamid': '76561198313887498', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1638572859}
review:
Well worth the money. Looks like some kind of simulator at first, but it isn't. It is a great puzzle game which can be pretty stressful at times. You can make it as hard as you want by dispatching more trains. But it was already challenging enough without doing that. Grahpics look alright and the soundtrack is great.

Is worth the purchase if you like "stressful" puzzle games.

review:
Inspired by another user I’m on a mission to play all my games at least one hour and review them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980147522', 'num_games_owned': 1183, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1704, 'last_played': 1704735337}
review:
Train Valley is one of those games, where a simple gameplay with strategic influence becomes a great game. It's so easy to use the controls , but with the wrong strategy you won't get far. I've played it through with all three stamps on each track in 28 hours. so it does give you some good value for your money. I didn't obtain the stamps on each map one by one, I actually played each level until I got all three stamps in one go. That was a little challenge I did for myself. I do recommend to play it that way for all. To get all three stamps in one go for each map is very challenging!
This game is for anyone who likes to move trains around and loves a puzzle challenge here and there.
Great game, will get Train Valley 2 as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198888699524', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1558781837}
review:
Первый тур покажется детским (на то он и обучающий), но дальше сложность нарастает и будет очень интересно. Отлично тренирует внимательность и концентрацию, т.к. нужно следить одновременно за несколькими поездами, за балансом и за временем до конца миссии.
Игра увлекательная, для любителей выполнять достижения отлично подходит. 
29 часов, 35 достижения (все достижения базовой игры), оставшееся чувство завершенности и полной победы над игрой бесценно )
После полного прохождения и выполнения всех достижений вряд ли захочется переигрывать, но своих денег игра стоит на 100%.

Некоторые туры могут вывести из себя, но тем приятнее их в итоге проходить, выполнив все задания.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039701457', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1991, 'last_played': 1557367903}
review:
Loved this game. Easy going game that you can pick up and play for 30 min or hours at a time. The game is easy enough that it won't frustrate you if you're just looking to relax and play, but there are some challenges in this game (3 per level) that will keep the OCD gamers busy for hours. If you feel overwhelmed in the game, the ability to pause the game and evaluate your routes helps a ton.

I see reviews saying this game is way too tough after the first couple maps. This game can get very hectic at times, but like I mentioned above, you can pause the game at anytime and it won't affect your challenges. You DO NOT have to complete all 3 challenges in order to advance. You can fail all the challenges as long as you don't go bankrupt. For my play-through, I completed all 3 challenges before moving on to the next level. You also don't need to complete them on the same attempt. If you have a knack for micro-managing & can multi-task fairly well, this game is worth every cent. 

After you complete all the challenges there is no real replay value. There is 1 DLC, which I'll be attempting before moving on to Train Valley 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028331780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2300, 'last_played': 1571288766}
review:
SALE GAME ONLY. Want polish? Simplicity? And an attractive environment you love spending time in? This game has it in spades. Want endless hours of gameplay frustration thanks to devs that were no doubt too frazzled by publishing day to play-test this with anyone above an IQ of 80? This is that game, too! This game is an absolute waste of time.  This is an ADDICTIVE puzzle game, but, don't let the super-cute interface fool you. Try to play your puzzles beyond solving them, and you might as well just crack your skull on the wall behind you. Don't waste your time. 

Buy this on sale. Play the puzzles. Although the game lets you "play" with your puzzles forever, if you want, there's no point. One mistake and your game is toast, and the trains just keep coming and coming and coming and coming. Who runs a railroad this way? And who enjoys playing with a game that continually has it out for you? Don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025778401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1557152011}
review: It's just awful. The first 2 or 3 maps are fine, but when the difficulty increases, the things you need to do to solve the game are impossible or you need to fiddle with the UI in great detail. At the same time trains will start moving randomly of their own accord. You have absolutely no feeling of control. The UI is buggy and slow, will randomly throw away your tracks, especially long ones, and the graphix are blocky and pulp. The sound is one midi file that will slowly kill your brain every boring repeat after another and the game has three sounds: a train horn, a train whistle, both sounds when trains start moving and a bell that is used for all the other sounds in the game, thus you have the feeling of impending doom, but you have absolutely no idea what the bell you just heard meant. I know it's cheap.But like the man said. If you pay peanuts, you get monkeys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882363533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1559991367}
review: 最后一关（不含德国）靠五车连撞解决了积压问题顺利通关。基本上倒数的关卡都是靠这个解决了。如果追求收集邮票就会反复重来好几次。一开始觉得难度很高什么智力测验啦，但是只要常看地图就能从中找到灵感，最后得到一个套图修铁路法，不过要搬得轨道实在太多。还不错挺值得玩
