author: {'steamid': '76561198272047978', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1591700429}
review:
Soft review: Train Valley excels in so many things. With cute, cartoony graphics and interesting gameplay it's a solid choice for the $10.00 it costs, but with a flat soundtrack the entire experience suffers.

The hard 2: Train valley is a wonderful experience. With limited world building tools and an even simpler premise the developers managed to create a wonderfully complex and rewarding game. The game supplies you with a grid, a goal, and $50,000 to set up your very own train line. You get to choose how complex, or how simple, your network is going to be, all while balancing building, conducting, and switching the lines in your network. 

Although the game gets very complex very fast I never felt like the disasters were the fault of the games design. No matter how slow things got, or how complex the lines became, I always felt like the crashes were a side effect of my design, track control, or over confidence in my abilities. This allowed me to play with intermittent disappointment, but never frustration.

The game also includes a system for experienced players to add risk and reward. A little button in the top left corner allows the user to spend a little bit of in-game money to spawn a new train. This train when successfully delivered to the proper station will reward the player with more money than the train cost. The inclusion of this button is a phenomenal little design piece, providing a bored player with options, and an experienced player with a challenge. 

On top of all of this the UI is brilliant. The train log menu design really drives home the railroad themed design. With stamps marking your success levels on each stage the theme is really capitalized on by the design team. Their stylistic choices create a wonderful atmosphere that fits the game perfectly. 

That atmosphere is then shredded and burned as you watch the game slowly melt in front of your eyes, and for what? Well I'll tell you what, but first, let me try and figure out where that [i]awful music is coming from.[/i] That's right ladies and gentleman, the game's soundtrack makes me want to find a place to vomit and then curl up under my desk to hide from the anti-composers. Long story short: This soundtrack is [i]garbage,[/i] and when I say garbage I don't mean grab your Glad brand garbage bags and dump it in the beautiful dark green bin where all the bad things go. No. This soundtrack is so trash that Mike Rowe is scared. I am having trouble keeping up the typically professional character that I put on for this. 

I can't place what makes the soundtrack so endlessly terrible. I can't decode if it's the awful mixing noises that jump from one ear to the next torturing what little sanity it lets you hold onto, or if it's the transitions that go from so staggeringly fast to  blisteringly slow within 2 bars. It feels like the composer was strapped to the back of a Ford F-150 and forced to jot down the notes on a piece of loose-leaf copy paper that's been bound to one of those opaque plastic clipboards who's sides always chipping off at sharp angles that would cut you if given the chance. The music is jarring, anxiety inducing, and gave me a wonderful opportunity to catch up on the Stardew Valley soundtrack. 

In the end though, all we really want is the numbers. Although the soundtrack was severely disappointing the problem is easily mitigated by muting their music and putting on your own, whereas had the problem been localized in any other area of game design I would've been forced to experience with it. Had that been the case I wouldn't be giving this game a recommendation. All things considered I can say that this game gets a 1/2. With wonderful game design and an easy access mute button I found myself coming back multiple times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021072540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1655554297}
review:
This game is great:
The further into the missions the more trains will be zig-zagging past each other. So it just gets harder and harder and yet the basics always stay the same. Get your red train to the red station, and avoid crashing into the other trains that you're also trying to get to their stations.
Keep a mind on your budget with laying tracks and dispatching extra trains and don't go bankrupt. Being a perfectionist I don't consider a level complete unless I've got all 3 challenges.

I love this game and I'd definately recommend it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993210277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1556389647}

There is a very nasty bug relating to Trains that spawn and then leave the station immediately. Even if you have a Train pulling into the station. I am stuck at level 3 and can't progress forward.

It's a fun puzzle game with terrible support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068654383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1694123811}
review: While I personally like this game because of its style, I can't recommend it to particular people.  It isn't for everyone.  If you get frustrated easily this game isn't going to be good for you past the 3rd or 4th level.  There are certain levels in this game that just make me ask "why?".  This is unfortunately the case for a lot of the later add-ons that pose a huge challenge.  There are certain levels I never got an achievement for because the layout was so complicated.  There will be a level that starts and you tell yourself there is no way you are going to win an achievement.  Certain levels are laid out to force you to demolish weeds, and they give you penalties.  Others have railroad stations so close together there is no way to have one go to another without forming a loop.  I was actually okay with this for awhile, until I started noticing that more railroads just give you the virtual finger and spawn right on your tracks interrupting everything you just planned.  I see where the developer went showing expansion throughout the timeline.  But, for me personally I thought it happened so much that it just wound up being completely annoying.  While I like a challenge, I can see how this would turn away some people.  My friend plays so many games, and I tried to get him into Train Valley.  It was only about five minutes on one of the first levels that he just gave up in frustration.  So, I recommend this game with a grain of salt.  I am very particular about my games, but I must say this game had me addicted, and I haven't been completely invested in a game for years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815369774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1561041187}
review:
EDIT: You know what? I changed my mind! I don't recommend this game to anyone who likes or wants to complete a game they purchased. Here's why:

SEASON 4: LEVEL - TOKYO: I have probably tried this level 20 times until now and frankly, I think it is impossible to complete for a human being. You need a robotic / computer-like approach to pass this level. The map is small and offers barely enough room to lay the tracks. AND GUESS WHAT!? 

You can ONLY HAVE A PERFECT TRACK LAYOUT! It gives you a false sense of security by giving you a lot of balance in the account to start with. But DON'T BE FOOLED BY IT! The money is barely enough. The level starts off slowly (in terms of the number of trains scheduled) but the catch is the number of stations the level starts with. The new stations spawn incredibly quick and before you know it, there would be 6-8 trains scheduled for departure! 

This is where the POOR UX of the game starts to show. The stations won't tell you the order in which the trains have been scheduled and neither would they tell you the type of train that is supposed to come out of them (the faster ones are very fast and their path needs to be defined before the departure because of the tight layout of the map).

Some might say that you can take a look at the amount of money that you could make on successful arrival of that train. Yes, that is one way of figuring out the order but then, the faster trains make you more money so it isn't an exact science. I found myself CONSTANTLY PAUSED trying to figure out what to do but it doesn't help either. The last station spawns pretty late into the level and mostly WILL SNEAK UP ON YOU! And suddenly, you have 8-10 trains scheduled for departure and one of the stations won't even be connected!

And then comes the RAGE PHASE! Suddenly 2-3 trains would depart because the timer runs out and I can ASSURE YOU THAT IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO NOT HAVE A CRASH OR HAVE ONE OR MULTIPLE TRAINS HEAD FOR THE WRONG STATION AT THAT TIME!

The game anyway gives you very less room for error and in this level, that becomes the reason for its unlikeliness of completion. I honestly don't think anyone would have managed to complete this level with all the 3 conditions. This level is as difficult, if not worse, as the Dark Souls games. I AM NOT EXAGGERATING!

FUCK THIS LEVEL AND FUCK THIS GAME! It is supposed to be a fun yet engaging puzzle-like gameplay experience but this level turned it into a MESS! Also, whoever designed this level is probably, if not definitely, a PSYCHOPATH! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

REVIEW BEFORE GETTING TO THE TOKYO LEVEL:


Although it lacks any complexity in its controls and gameplay, it manages to keep you invested in the game. It does suffer from inconsistent progression difficulty, but it does make each level feel interesting. It's a relatively short game but is definitely worth the cost and I am looking forward to playing the sequel.

Keep in mind that the UI is not the best as you can't really tell the order of trains that need to be sent out. There's no numbering, order or scheduling system for the departures which makes it impossible to keep track of the trains when there are 6+ stations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978631408', 'num_games_owned': 2672, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1558336688}
review:
[h1][i]Если Вы мечтали о свей собственной железной дороге, если Вы хотели управлять несколькими поездами на ней, если Вы в душе машинист или диспетчер, то Train Valley - прекрасная возможность реализовать свои потаенные желания![/i][/h1]

[h1][b]Основная задача:[/b][/h1]
На каждом отдельном уровне находятся вокзалы - они помечены разными цветами. В каждом вокзале появляется новый железнодорожный состав с цветом нужного вокзала, куда его (состав) и нужно доставить. Далее мы строим пути так, чтобы поезда доходили до нужных вокзалов и самое главное - не врезались в другие поезда.

[h1][b]В итоге мы имеем:[/b][/h1]
Замечательную головоломку, в которой нам прийдется поднапрячь извилины и пройти каждый уровень.

[h1][b]Плюсом:[/b][/h1]
Нам дают дополнительные задания на каждый уровень, которые нужно выполнить, чтобы доказать всем уровень вашей виртуозности владения регулировочного мастерства железнодорожного транспорта!

[h1][b]Та самая атмосфера…[/b][/h1]
Из детства… когда смотришь сверху вниз на все это железнодорожное безобразие и чешешь «репу»: а как бы мне соединить вот эти две, а то и три, железнодорожные ветки…

[h1][b]Картинка:[/b][/h1]
Игра имеет симпатичную, простятскую детскую стилистику, но не смотря на это разработчик так заморочился, что для каждого сезона (как-никак, каждый сезон - это отдельная страна со своими историческими событиями) создал не только атом мосферу каждой страны, но и продумал каждую модельку поездов. Таким образом, Вы с удовольствие узнаете те самые зеленые, родные тепловозики, которые безустанно гоняют вагоны по нашей необъятной стране!

[h1][b]Экономическая составляющая:[/b][/h1]
Как и в любой другой специфике, нам понадобятся денежные средства, для того, чтобы строить наши железнодорожные пути, которые будут вести нас из пункта «А» в пункт «Б» и даже «Ц», «Д» и т.д.

[h1][b]Что понравилось:[/b][/h1]
- Нетребовательные к железу системные требования. Игра работает с разрешением 1920x1080 на компьютере 2011 года.
- Приятная мультяшная 3D-графика с возможностью приближения.
- Наличие достижений.
- Присутствует возможность хранить ваше прохождение в облаке Steam.

[h1][b]Мультиплатформенность:[/b][/h1]
По уже сложившейся традиции, благодарю заботливого разработчика за поддержку таких платформ, как: Linux и macOS. Мы тоже - люди и чего таить греха - тоже любим гамануть, только тс-с-с-с, это между нами, мой дорогой и внимательный читатель!

[h1][b]НЕ понравилось:[/b][/h1]
- С периодичностью возникает глюк - не позволяющий пройти уровень: поезд, который должен появиться - виснет на вокзале и не выходит, а чтобы завершить этот уровень нужно, чтобы поезд добрался из пункта "А" в пункт "Б". Особенно это обидно, когда пытаешься получить специальные достижения игры.
- Разработчик поступил некрасиво заставив покупать последний сезон в отдельном DLC. Так еще и достижения завязаны именно на нем. То есть, те кто хотят пройти игру на 100% - не смогут это сделать, не покупая сезон «Германия». Подобную историю мы могли наблюдать в Mafia II.

[h1][b]Итог:[/b][/h1]
Train Valley - это занимательная и прекрасная головоломка, для тех, кто в детстве мечтал стать машинистом и отдушина для тех, кто мечтал о настоящей (игрушечной) железной дороге. Всех нас, неумолимых романтиков, это игра сможет затянуть на несколько деньков.

[h1][b]Рекомендую?[/b][/h1]
Если Вы «стрелочник» и Вам нравится «разводить» (юморю) - конечно рекомендую! Тем, кто не любит думать - не рекомендую, скорее всего Train Valley - не понравится!

[code]► [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34056851/]Куратор для пользователей macOS в Steam. А игры для macOS всегда работают в Windows! ;)[/url][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197976988431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1554328226}
review:
As a railroad inspector IRL, I'm annoyed that a switch costs the same amount of money as 1 panel of track. A switch is going to cost at least 4x as much money for the switch points, switch stand, frog and all of the material to go with it. If it's a samson switch point it's going to be even more money. Chances are with the current standards all of the plates are going to be MSR rather than hook plates and basic double shoulder plates.

They obviously didn't do any research. 

Other than that, it's an alright puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099951744', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1649237236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198948812790', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1575730323}
review: I don't know what to write here. It is a good game. 7/10. Wrapped the campaign in about 5 hours without achievement hunting. Some of the building scenarios are hard, and it gets hectic when you get into the later levels. If you like sim-type games, I would recommend this game. Its cheap, fun, and you can waste 10 hours from life by running a virtual railroad thing, while not having to interact with other responsibilities such as preparing for exams, and writing that 30 page thesis that's due in 3 days. I mean man, come on, why would you wanna pass a university course where your paying a thousand bucks just for the course when you could be playing Train Valley? Screw that GPA crap, orchestrate a giant monopoly on creating railroads, and running trains. Destroy the environment, and upset the townsfolk (in your mind) by running a giant railroad through a city with no consequences or backlash by the local residents.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980814599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 12270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1564620455}
review: Charming, challenging train-themed puzzle game. Not a full-blown train simulator, but will certainly help polish route planning and traffic management skills. A bargain at list price; even more on sale. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171099130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1569554263}
review:
El juego me resultó muy adictivo. No tiene nada que ver con la estrategia y la gestión, está lejos del "Transport Tycoon" (al que se le parece estéticamente) para acercarse más al estilo de juego frenético de los viejos "Dinner dash", donde la coordinación es lo más importante. Y si bien sirve un poco de planificación, tampoco tiene nada de constructor de ciudades.
Sí es un juego con un aspecto sencillo e infantil, pero desafiante a la hora de intentar obtener todos los premios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199159411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1554560281}
review: This game isn't inherently bad, just quite limited in it's approach, build tracks, route the trains while try and avoid their collisions all in increasing pace, very much like vintage video games in spirit of 'Snake', just with more sophisticated graphics. Visual appearance is the best part of this game along with the general feel. Fortunately read that Train Valley 2 is more on the management side for a game, so think I'm looking forward to get it at some point, perhaps. Bought this game from sale and it shall remain among those cheap and simple games of curiosity, that I may occasionally enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259447112', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1604151329}
review:
暂停下来慢慢思考是策略游戏的精髓！
大多数关卡都能暂停的，频繁暂停观察思考就够了。

合理规划路线才是这个游戏的重点，剩下的就是安排好火车的出发顺序。
在钱足够的情况下，尽量多拉铁轨保证能同时运行多列火车。

最后德国关那两张不让暂停的邮票真的很反人类，简直是不让人在一次性拿到三张邮票的设计。反正拿邮票没有要求一次性把三张邮票拿齐，我分两次拿就好了，我是放弃一次性拿三张邮票了。


这游戏还有2代，不过还在EA阶段。看了一下，2代的游戏类型好像变了，不是单纯的规划游戏，而是变成了一个具有经营内容的游戏。
等什么时候正式发布了我再试试看。

author: {'steamid': '76561198099535093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1600514644}
review: A fun, chill train game getting from point A to point B, can get chaotic and frustrating especially when collecting all 3 stamps for each level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047279716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1710633799}
review:
Train Valley. 
Es klingt so einfach und ist doch so knifflig...
Man verbindet die Bahnhöfe mit Schienen und koordiniert die Züge zu ihren Zielbahnhöfen, indem man die Weichen korrekt stellt. Die Züge müssen zu den richtigen Bahnhöfen gelotst werden und es darf natürlich nicht zu Kollisionen der Züge kommen. Das ist bei 3-4 Bahnhöfen und 2 Zügen gleichzeitig noch recht überschaubar. Aber es werden schnell mehr Bahnhöfe, ein komplexeres Schienennetz mit noch mehr Weichen, die man richtig stellen muss, und noch mehr Züge. 

Die Lernkurve bzw. die vom Spieler abverlangten Skills steigen in diesem Spiel angenehm. Man wird langsam reingeführt, aber nach ein paar Levels wird es dann doch schon knifflig und man braucht möglicherweise mehrere Anläufe, um alle Ziele des Levels zu erreichen. Es frustriert und motiviert zugleich, wenn man bereits 10 Züge erfolgreich an den Zielbahnhof geleitet hat, dann aber eine verdammte Weiche vergessen hat, umzustellen, daraufhin fährt ein Zug den falschen Bahnhof an, aufgrund dessen muss ein Zug angehalten werden und ein anderer umgedreht werden, weil es sonst irgendwo crashen würden und naja......

Ich habe es im Sale für 1,39€ gekauft und ich bereue nichts. Wer auf diese Art von Knobelspiel steht, kommt voll auf seine Kosten. 

Von mir gibt es auf jeden Fall eine Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042298885', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1555163853}
review: Joguinho simples, casual e MUITO desafiante. É fácil se viciar tentando colocar os trilhos certinhos e administrando a hora certa de enviar trens sem que um bata no outro. Adorei e já devo pegar o Train Valley 2 quando estiver em promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020563701', 'num_games_owned': 3475, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1560967452}
review:
On my ever failing quest at getting ahead of my backlog of games (every week, there is a bundle or sale that puts me ever deeper in a hole of unfinished games) I finally got around to playing Train Valley. It's a strategy-puzzle type of game, that requires planning ahead, changing plans on the fly and sadly, a LOT of luck. Yes, the ever dreaded random level layouts and such rear their ugly heads here, quite poorly.

The goal in Train Valley is to get various color-coded trains to the matching stations. You'll usually start with 2-3 stations, which you must run rails to, so you can send the trains about their way. Spend too much time and trains will auto-run (if another gets put in queue behind it at the same station). It's a quite easy game to learn, but a very hard one to master at harder levels thanks to some poor randomness to the levels. You'll occasionally have rock or hill formations you can't do anything but go around, and you'll also get buildings (which cost precious game $ to destroy) placed in inopportune locations.

Take away the randomness of the maps and the occasionally frustrating objectives and you're left with a fairly fun little game. There is something oddly exciting about having a screen full of crisscrossed rails filled with trains, narrowly missing one another as they roll into their destinations to complete the level.

Graphics are colorful, yet basic, but completely fine given the genre. The game shouldn't do much to tax any systems you'd game on. These type of games aren't remotely close to being about the graphics though. They're about taxing your brain (and reflexes at times) more than your graphics card.

Overall, it's a fun time diversion that offers up 24 levels (6 more if you opt for the overpriced DLC). Train Valley currently sales for $9.99 standard price, though I personally feel that it's a bit overpriced given the low amount of levels. At $5.00 it becomes a TRY, though in a bundle OR for 75% off, it's a must buy. But even with my personal belief it's a bit overpriced, it's still in the TRY category if you're a fan of these type of games. Just make sure you play it for a short bit and see if YOU like it so you can refund it within the 2 hour/2 week window if it's not your cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085463010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3516, 'last_played': 1650922589}
review:
I  thought this would just be geometric puzzles.. figure out how to lay the tracks. But the creators took this into account by throwing an array of constraints at you: 
A. Budget (both too much and too little) 
B. Physical Constraints.. both "immovable" and "purchasable" where you pay to use the area 
C. Scheduling Challenges.. not only the ones thrown by the game but a "must do" quantity of add-on trains you add at your choice of times in your game play.  
D. Time Constraints.. each "location" has limited time to accomplish your work  
E. Money is made more difficult by a "ramping" tax structure that penalizes you for being too slow or taking too long. Taxes increase with time and subtract from your earnings, though you still get "credit" for having earned the cash, even if you spend it on "property rights" or on construction or track re-works. 
The game requires you to address all these and balance the effects to achieve your results

It's interesting that you can meet the challenges one at a time and get your "stamp" of approval, thereby building up the achievements until you've done them all (Based on what I've played so far, it's always three per "location") But of course if you're one who likes to "be better" you're always going to try to do them in one time period. You can be as relaxed or as challenged as you like. I suppose this in a way makes up for the fact that, as far as I've seen, there is no "Difficulty Level" setting.

The game can be very frustrating as you swear its just targeting you.. but of course that kind of goes with puzzle games. As you learn and improve, you begin to see that you can have "moves" that help you overcome the obstacles and "rules". 

Some people say "the graphics suck".. sorry but that isn't what this kind of game is about.. if you want movies, go to the movies or tune in the binge-worthy web content. A game is about the Ai and workings of the game. It's not a better game just because it has spectacular graphics and frequently is a bar to players unless they want to waste big money on fancy graphics processors and high speed or overclocked CPU's or whatever gimmicks you want to throw at it. The graphics are quite reasonable.. Pretty much everything you'd need to know is clearly represented. I mean you can see  what you're getting right in the previews, demos, trailers, etc. I'd far rather have mediocre graphics with good AI or thoughtful game play.

Further the game is rather cleverly themed.. as appropriate to a TRAINS game.. a "Visa" or "Passport" book records your progress and shows you what's in store. The opening pages are well-done and I enjoy the "postage-stamp" theme of the travel folder.. it evokes both bygone days and the "travel experience" idea of the game. And the "cancellation" or "achievement stamp" lets you see your progress at a glance. And of course it evokes the passport stamps you get when traveling.

You can play any "location" in any order and as often as you like. Additionally there is a "sandbox" mode that removes the constraints of time and money so you can play around. I think this might let children too young perhaps for the game use it. It also lets you try track layout ideas for the areas to see what is better or worse in a relaxed setting. By the way, I expect quite young children (5-8 or so) can enjoy this game though "winning" it may prove difficult. Those 10 and up should have no problem and should enjoy the challenges. There is a fixed number of layouts and you can't do your own. As I understand it, if you purchase the "Trains 2" add-on you get an editor that lets you make your own, but not in this game.

I'd rank the game "very positive". I got the game on a cheap offer and it has more than repaid me with dozens if not hundreds of hours of play. I'd recommend it to anyone who shows interest based on my descriptions and/or the "game info" on the steam store.  I only have the "TRAIN VALLEY" and none of the expansions or added DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042424238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1554981291}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069639881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1693768365}
review:
I bought this game on special as a time waster. 
The time management and strategic track laying makes for an addictive game that you can relax into playing.

A few of the features that I like:
- Different map styles and layouts with different types of obstacles.
- Historic Eye Candy and the frustratingly funny WWII bombers (The bombers are on the Germany DLC).
- Visually soft and pleasing aesthetics.
- Train sounds. 

It was supposed to be a time waster, but I ended up enjoying it so much that I battled my way through all of the maps to complete all of them. This was well worth it, including the DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198398653251', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1604932196}
review:
パッと見の可愛さにひかれて購入しましたが、まぁ～おもしろいこと^^;

一言でいうならパズルゲーです。

UIが単純明快で開いた瞬間わかりやすいのも良いですね。

20～30分くらいあっという間に消し飛ぶので通勤中とかにスマホでやりたいくらい、アプリ出してくれないかな。

チュートリアルステージで「あ、これ楽しいわ」と私は感じたので、おもしろくなるまで時間のかかるゲームと違いすぐに向き不向きがわかります、だからとりあえず買ってみよ？

Q「マルチあるの？」
A「ないです」

Q「FPS好きなんだけど、楽しめるかな」
A「（多分楽しめ）ないです」

author: {'steamid': '76561198002252866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 526, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1554950428}
review:
[h1] リアルタイム鉄道運行パズル [/h1]

画面内に点在する駅の間に線路を引く。
↓
「青」駅から「赤」駅まで列車を運行しまーす、という通知が来るので、手動でポイントを切り替えながら列車を通してあげる。
↓
無事に目的地についたら、運行報酬ゲット。
↓
報酬で新しい線路を引く

というのが基本的な流れ。

面ごとに設定された「一定量のお金を稼ぐ」などの条件を満たし、破産せずにすべての列車を運行させれば面クリア。

ただし、時間と共に駅の数が増えていったり、問答無用で突っ込んでくる特別列車みたいな奴がいたりで、なかなかに難しい。
列車同士が接触すると、事故になり大きなペナルティを受けてしまう。
ある程度は待たせることもできるが、一定時間が経つと勝手に出発してしまうのが困ったところ。

環状線を組んだり複線化したり、とにかく資金と相談しながら上手い方法を考える必要がある。
非常に良くできたパズルだが、ひたすら線路を引くだけのサンドボックスモードがあるのもありがたい。


ちなみに、列車を運行させると周辺の土地が発展して、ビルが建ったりするのだが、建物がある場所に線路を通そうとすると、用地買収に余計なコストが･･･。
えー、土地開発はグループ企業じゃないのか。

review:
This was a fun arcade game that really held my interest to the end. It has a great aesthetic and a simple mechanic that is easy to learn, but can become challenging to manage.  The levels get progressively harder in a satisfying way.  The game is also really easy to pick up and put down.

I picked this up on sale and it was well worth it!

review: 資金に注意しながら駅と駅を繋ぐ線路を敷設し、列車同士がぶつからないよう分岐点変更や出発タイミングを変えながらクリアしていくパズルゲームです。出発から到着までの時間が短ければ短いほど列車ごとの運賃報酬は高くなりますが、列車本数をいたずらに増やせば衝突事故の可能性も高まり、かといってやたらめったら線路を引けば資金切れでクリア失敗となるなど、マネジメント面でも頭を使わされます。各フィールド後半のステージほどこの傾向が強いですが、気付けばいつもこのゲームを開いてしまう程度にはハマる要素があるかと。価格的にはライトなパズルゲームですが、一度やり出すと案外抜け出せません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102252391', 'num_games_owned': 884, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1657097212}
review: Train Valley, to świetna gra logiczno-ekonomiczna. W grze zarządzamy liniami kolejowymi, a my musimy na bieżąco przestawiać zwrotnicę na naszych torach dla naszych pociągów, aby dotarły do odpowiedniego punktu docelowego. Mapa jest strasznie mała, co czyni grę bardzo wymagająca, a więc często zdarzy się, że będziecie musieli wstrzymać grę, aby przemyśleć dokładnie to co dzieje się na mapie. Same stację pojawiają się w losowych miejscach i o losowych porach, gra nigdy nie będzie taka sama. Nie trudno tutaj o bankructwo. Miejsca strasznie mało, a sama gra również nie jest idealnie czytelna. Na szczęście to my decydujemy ( do pewnego czasu ), kiedy pociąg ma opuścić stację i ruszyć do celu. Train Valley oferuję bardzo przyjemną, cukierkową grafikę, oraz bardzo dobry schemat na grę. Dłuższe sesje mogą znudzić, dlatego gra dobra na jakieś krótsze granie, oderwanie od czegoś innego, bądź w trakcie oczekiwania na coś/kogoś. Za takie pieniądze, świetna gra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277519118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2704, 'last_played': 1554612167}
review:
Train Valley is a simple and efficient railroad scheduling simulation. You build tracks between up to 8 colored stations, a train schedule is given and the goal is to lead all trains to their associated station without going bankrupt or failing the level's special criterion. The game play can be fun and challenging in Train Valley, but some details always seem to irritate.

The core of the game relies on making money which is obtained through initial funding or leading a train to its destination. Different convoys have different worth which can be prioritized independently. The issue with this scheme is it's really difficult to see numbers add up on the screen and often you go bankrupt when not even aware of what is in your account. This caused way too many restarts or pauses. Another issue is the lack of camera controls and highlighting feedback. A junction group highlighting function would have been great. Laying tracks could also be better, I often messed up a level just because of the track not being built where I wanted.

After a week and having completed everything the game had to offer, I recommend this title. There's probably better in the railroad simulation category, but at regular price Train Valley has a place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079575243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2651, 'last_played': 1549555824}
review:
Lots of confusion about this game. It's a puzzle game, yo!

Connect stations and manage when trains leave those stations. Beautiful art. The devs really love trains and it shows.

Just too much bullshit and weird fail states make it hard to tolerate and enjoy. Once every 5 levels or so a train will just leave the station without prompting, because... 

I loved it then grew to hate it. Did not try the DLC as it just appears to be more bullshit.

review:
A pretty simple game with shallow gameplay.
Building is a very small part and looks very artificial. 99% of gameplay is switching tracks in a time attack like manner (cooking dash etc). Not a puzzle, not a simulation, not a city builder, marginally management.
Not what I expected, but still recommended to those, who like time attack games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971816346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1554512086}
review:
If I knew what I do know now I would not have bought the game. If I'm running a train company, shipping line etc, I make the schedules, trains should only run on my orders. I can't see how a station can fill up when no trains are being sent down the line. 

Yes I know now since I've tried it that they have made the game that way which annoys me tremendously.  Personally I need a much more advanced game to have fun, but if you're not a control freak and like being told what to do, you might enjoy this.
I however, do not.
Maybe the sandbox mode will be more to my liking. I really want to like this. I enjoy the graphic style but it's not for me. And I might be old fashioned, but a game without a manual always annoys me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961862023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1554508687}
review: Honestly a fun little game, there's just one real annoyance. The randomly appearing stations will sometimes appear right on top of your built tracks and destroy them and if a train is on those destroyed tracks, the train blows up immediately. A station spawning code needs to be adjusted honestly to make sure it doesn't spawn on already built tracks

author: {'steamid': '76561198842393036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1554661750}
review:
Um bom jogo, nunca foi muito do estilo indie mas decidi experimentar e gostei ,o jogo não é uma masterpiece mas em desconto vale a pena comprei-o apenas a 1 euro. O jogo é muito soft e bom para jogar com um familiar, exige muito foco, atençao racionio e melhora a nossa habilidade de multitasking. Este jogo é como uma febre adoramos durante 2 ou 3 dias e depois só voltamos a jogar de vez enquanto é um vicio mas algo curto no final. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198345227415', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1611642592}
review:
Купил не читая описания, очень понравилось, давно искал игры типо такой. Такое чувство что игру делали жадные евреи, потому что лично мне 50к не хватает чтоб построить нормальную железную дорогу, понравилось что что тебе долго думать не дадут и поезда в скором времени сами поедут. 
10 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037483753', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1675340287}
review: This is a neat strategy/puzzle game hybrid, kind of like a light RTS. If you're a train fanatic or even just slightly interested in them, this game is for you. The rules are fairly simple but the game can become chaotic quickly if you don't manage the board well. That being said, the game can be taken at your own pace with fast forward and pause functions, which making use of both features is essential. The game looks and sounds very nice, but one thing that caught my attention was the fact that the game takes place in notable time periods around the world, specifically around the late 1800s and 1900s. Its a little subtle, but seeing the slow changes over the time periods to the trains and scenery was a nice touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251353654', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1566773528}
review: 游戏内容就是造铁路一款   非常轻松的休闲益智游戏，只需要点点鼠标，就可以指点江山。游戏里面不需要过度追求全3星，能通关就可以了。。。。。有色盲的玩家请不要尝试这款游戏，因为你颜色无法分辨。。。没有色盲的玩家也请不要尝试这款游戏，它将让你无法分辨颜色。。。游戏中有暂停按钮，请千万不要按，它会严重打乱你的游戏节奏。。。总之一句话：道路千万条，撞车第一条，铁路不规范，亲人两行泪。

review:

总之很不错的一款规划游戏，而且是会上瘾的。玩到分不清颜色。【来自一天开了六小时火车的我...

author: {'steamid': '76561198058689400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1706299862}
review: How can a game be both relaxing, and incredibly tense?   This game will show you how.  There is an incredible amount of depth to the game for such a simple concept.  I am constantly amazed at how complex and enjoyable this game is.  It is NOT a new railroad tycoon game.  It's a puzzle game based on rail lines and timing.  So if you're looking for next Tycoon game, then this isn't it.  But if you're looking for a great casual puzzle game, I think you'll really enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025229428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1554491202}
review:
EHRMAGERD!
Such a fun little game. As I am Dutch, I'm glad it was on sale so I got for a real bargain. Definitely worth every penny/dime/cent.

Build tracks, command trains, make profit.
Let them crash into each other and laugh like you're Dastardly's trusted companion Muttley as you wreak havoc and cause mayhem and destruction (mind you, that's for sandbox mode).

Haven't played this one for that long so far, but I love it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406218438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1554704604}
review:
Gra warta poświęcenia uwagi. Jest to gra prosta w obsłudze, łatwa i wymagająca trochę myślenia, skupienia ponieważ wystarczy na chwile spuścić wzrok i pociąg albo nie dojedzie tam gdzie nie trzeba, lub wkolei się w inny pociąg Gra polega najbardziej nad budową, konstruowaniem torów w odpowiedni sposób tak aby każdy pociąg mógł dotrzeć do swojego celu nie rozbijając się o inny. W grze są 4 Chaptery po 6 lvl w każdy po dokupieniu dodatku "Germany" dostajemy dodatkowy Chapter. Możemy też znaleść 2 tryby Klasyczny i Piaskownica. "Klasyczny" tryb czyli inaczej Kampania, a tryb "Piaskownica" inaczej "SandBox" nie muszę chyba nikomu tłumaczyć na czym polega ten tryb. 
To teraz Plusy i minusy

Plusy:
- Jak na mało wymagającą grę niezła grafika
- Trzeba myśleć i się skupić
- Prosta w obsłudze i łatwa (dla niektórych) 
- Misje

Minusy:
- Mały błąd i wszystko leci w kosmos.
- Mało poziomów.
- Dla ludzi o słabych nerwach nie polecam.

Moja końcowa ocena dla tej gry jest: Pozytywna 7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198392798890', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1632158243}
review:
9 Mayıs 2020 ~ Train Valley incelemesi!

Oldukça basit bir mantığa dayalı fakat gittikçe dallanıp budaklanan ve sizi içine alan bir oyun. Kısa zaman boşluklarınızı güzel değerlendirebileceğiniz kendine has zorluğu var. İlk sezon son derece basit gelebilir fakat ilerleyen sezonlarda oyunun zorluğu sizi epeyi zorluyor.

Oyunumuzun mantığı sahip olduğumuz demiryolu şirketinin aktarmak istediği trenleri ilgili istasyonlardan alıp diğer istasyonlara gitmelerini sağlamak. Bunun içinde demir yolu hatları döşüyor ve aralardaki makasları kontrol ediyoruz. İlk başta dediğim gibi çok basit fakat ileride tren sayıları, durak sayıları, trenlerin uzunlukları, üst üste binen hat ve makas sayıları iyice arttığından artık kontrollere yetişmekte epeyi zorlanıyorsunuz. Hatlar yetersiz geliyor döşediğiniz rayları iki kere düşünmeniz gerekiyor. Birde işin içine düzensiz harcadığınız para bittiği anda iflas bayrağını çekmek girince işler hepten zorlaşıyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048710362', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1553842929}

author: {'steamid': '76561198262864341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1553314991}
review: Casual train routing simulator with a little bit puzzle to solve efficiently enough.  There are some pressures, trains have to get from certain stations to other stations and is worth less money the longer it takes.  There a tiny bit of time pressure because you need revenue to stay afloat vs taxes so you need to deliver trains fast enough while they are worth something.  But it isn't too challenging.  It adds challenges to make it more interesting that vary by level.  I really enjoyed this game. [4/5 stars]

author: {'steamid': '76561198053707107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1636524374}
review: overall the gameplay is simplistic but fun although it can get downright aggrivating at times . however there are a few minor issues I have with the game as a whole. First off on some of the levels the countdown timer for a new train waiting at a station goes too fast while on other levels it is a little slow. some of the stations are so close to others you have to build your tracks in ridiculous ways just to get a train to the proper station. some of the extra objectives are almost non-completable with how many stations you end up having, how many trains you can have going and/or waiting at any given time. also after a certain period of time if a train has been waiting too long at a station will just go on its own without the player authorizing the train to go and that can create havoc if you already have trains on the tracks especially if you have a train heading for the same station that the other train that the game decided to send without the players say so and you get boom. then you have to repair and replace all of the tracks that were destroyed in the explosion wasting money and time with both are at a premium in this game (not talking about MTX just using it as a figure of speech). there are also some objects which you cannot get rid of even if you have hundreds of thousands of dollars because the game simply won't let you and then you have to route your tracks around these objects. still its a fun little game despite these minor issues but could use just a little more polish (ei: the fixing of the above mentioned issues)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994222878', 'num_games_owned': 2475, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1477125677}
review: A really simple and fun puzzle train management simulator. This does play more like a puzzle/challenge game than an actual rail simulator, but I like that about it. Each level is interesting and more unique than the last, presenting new challenges to get the best score you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350232439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1620928362}
review:
Ce jeu pourrais être bien si les trains n'étaient pas aussi aléatoire dans leurs longueurs / valeurs / vitesse, et si la map n'était pas du genre "tu dois faire ça sinon tu perd tu n'as pas le choix car le level designer à décidé ça comme ça" .

C'est un jeu calme, presque agréable et presque bien. Mais on peux trouver beaucoup mieux au même prix voir pour encore moins.
developer_response: Hello! Thanks for the input! If you are not a big fan of randomness and tight pace you can try Train Valley 2. We have tried to solve these factors there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084689472', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1511597507}
review:
9/10

맵상에 이곳저곳 생겨나는 역을 선로로 연결하는 '퍼즐'게임
이겜은 선로에 복선이나 신호기, 통표따위 같은건 존재하지않는 철덕 언해피게임
따라서 방향을 수동으로 바꿔줘야하며, 충돌방지를 위해 머리를 잘 써야한다.
특히나 시간이 지나 물류량이 많아지면 엄청난 긴장감을 줌.
꿀잼.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014277284', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1550620152}
review: There's really not a lot too it, you can only build track there isn't any real depth, it boils down to just timing and micromangement of switches. I don't think it's worth $10 (I did get this for free.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048171007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 17944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12374, 'last_played': 1637567668}
review:
Of all the games I own, this is the only one I keep coming back to time and time again.  It is an absolute joy to play.
It is relaxing, stressful and sometimes infuriating (when rocks generate in the worst possible place) but that is what makes it the great game it is.  The premise is simple yet the complexity of the levels doesn't over tax your cerebral cortex.
There are a lot of train games on steam with a similar concept but none of them come close to Train Valley.
And the music is perfect.
Do yourself a favour and buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970146084', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1553291936}
review: It's like the kid dream of owning an infinite and endless train set and playing at engineer all day in your attic or basement or garage. Build tracks to connect stations, dispatch trains to their appropriate destinations, and operate switches to avoid collisions. This is a game that allows you to just relax and play; but it is challenging enough to be compelling and to keep you going. Collect stamps in a passport book as you complete tougher challenges and sit back and chill while you play trains!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094652712', 'num_games_owned': 874, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1652555593}

author: {'steamid': '76561198328467965', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1571017895}
review:
箱庭の様なディスプレイで、線路を敷いたり列車を走らせたりするゲーム。

プレイヤーが出来る事は、レールを敷く事と列車の発進停止転進。
ゲームの流れは、最初駅が2つ有り、左上のアイコンを建設モードにして
線路を敷き、駅に待機している列車マークをクリックして発進。
時間が進むと駅が増えて行くので、その駅とも線路を繋ぐ
だんだん待機列車が増えてくるので、順番にもしくは行ける物から
クリックし、発進させる。
建設費用の概念もありますが、面クリ形式なので資産の繰り越しは有りません。
序盤は片手間でも出来ますが、中盤以降はかなり忙しくなります。

こう言う系が好きな人は良いと思うけれど
グラフィックは綺麗ですが、見ている余裕はないですね（笑

review: I love this game.  I always liked playing with trains when I was little and this brings me back to that.  The levels are fun and a bit challenging at times which is very good.  It's really cool to manage trains on a large rail system.  The art is beautiful and the trains are cool.  I recommend this to anyone and any kid who loves trains.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198036451416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1493113488}
review: Если хотите игру про поезда, экономику, планирование маршрутов, поставки и прочие радости с этим связанные, приобретите лучше Mashinky или Transport Fever. Эта игра совсем в другом жанре, чего нельзя сказать бегло взглянув на скриншоты. Я купил ее, но после первых двух миссий вернул, ожидания были совсем другие нежели то, что предстало взгляду. Я рекомендую ее тем кто хочет логические задачки, но не тем кто хочет игру про поезда.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059883840', 'num_games_owned': 1914, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 583142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438098, 'last_played': 1555000670}

review: Cool little puzzle/cognitive game. Nice for in between things. Focuses on what made Transport Tycoon / Locomotion so nice (at least for me) but doesn't overstay its welcome. The difficulty is relative to the amount of stars you go for, which is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159725889', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1689153412}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026252424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1657185859}
review: Leichtgewichtiges Spiel, indem man seine logistischen Fähigkeiten unter Beweis stellen und die wirtschaftlichste Route zum Ziel finden muss. Durch die verschiedenen Level, dem im Verlauf leicht steigenden Schwierigkeitsgrad und den optionalen Zielen bekommt immer wieder aufs neue kurzweilige Knobelaufgaben. Hier bekommt man gute erste Erfahrungen mit Micro-Management. Absolut empfehlenswert - auch für "mal zwischendurch" spielen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017977574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1543168908}
review:
Non ci ho giocato molto, forse non è il mio genere.
Il tutto si risolve nel costruire binari e far partire i treni in modo tale che non si scontrino.
La difficoltà è via via crescente e solo per giocatori dotati di molta pazienza.
Nel mio caso, pur apprezzando l'idea, l'ho disinstallato poiché quando una partita non riusciva, mi provocava più frustrazione che soddisfazione ed un gioco deve essere piacevole non frustrante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058162847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1674, 'last_played': 1534579991}
review:
ストラテジーとあるがプレイヤーができることは、線路を引くことと分岐部のポイント変更、列車の発車と停車くらい。
目的の駅に列車を到着させる事で資金を得て新しい路線を増やしていく。
ただし、マップはある程度のランダム性があるが駅の出現ポイントやおおまかな地形は同じであるため、“詰み”や“理不尽”は無いものの効率重視の最適解ができてくるため単調になりがちである。
しかしながら、資金要素はランダム要素の影響により大きく変動するので単調になりがちなシステムに良いスパイスになっていてゲーム性に大きく貢献している。
多様なステージとちょっとしたギミックでボリュームもちょうど良い感じ。
BGMとトゥーン調のグラフィックで眺めているだけでも楽しめます。自分は3歳の娘と協力してプレイしていました。

定価ではちょっと高いかな？セールでの購入をお勧めします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198045380427', 'num_games_owned': 4982, 'num_reviews': 513, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1542573313}
review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are worth your time [/url][/code]

Info Game: 
This is a fun simulation game in which you build track and manage switched to make sure trains get to the right destination. It plays very smooth and looks amazing. It is very clear to see where a train want to go. This game starts very easy but becomes a lot more complicated very quickly. 

Info achievements:
For the achievement you mostly have to complete the different tasks in every level. The good news is that you don't have to complete all the tasks at once. You can complete first one and later another to get all the stamps which you get for completing the tasks. In order to progress you also have to play some free mode games in which you have to play for X minutes in that specific level to go to the next era. 

Pros & Cons:
+ Smooth gameplay
+ Fun challenges
- German DLC Needed for 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198052570888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1540378243}
review: "Train Valley" est un petit jeu indépendant à mi-chemin entre jeu de gestion et puzzle. Ici, vous devrez relier des gares entre elles et faire en sorte que tous les trains prévus arrivent à bon port avec des contraintes plus ou moins importantes selon les niveaux et leur place dans l'histoire du ferroviaire (les TGV japonais des années 2000 vont un poil plus vite que les locomotives à vapeur du Far West). Plutôt joli, avec un principe simple mais très efficace et une durée de vie plus que correcte pour son prix (20h environ pour le terminer à 100% pour moins de 10€), je recommande ce jeu à tout fan de trains/puzzles !

author: {'steamid': '76561198013841641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1539896721}
review: The game is pretty and quite hectic at times when you're trying to juggle several trains at once. The bankruptcy mechanic can be annoying when you suddenly run out of money. The levels can take a while and you don't have  a proper indicator on how much longer they're going to take. However, it's not too expensive and you get a nice, relaxing game with enough variety to keep it interesting. Train Valley 2 improves upon the concept and seems to fix the flaws I mentioned. Overall, I recommend trying both Train Valley and its sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254764088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1518476159}
review: Train Valley bietet Unterhaltung für Gelegenheitsspieler und auch Eisenbahnbegeisterte. Strecken müssen gebaut und Züge von verschiedenen Bahnhöfen in ihre Zielbahnhöfe durch entsprechendes Schalten der Weichen gesteuert werden. Das Spiel bietet Unterhaltung für viele Abende.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162955558', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1540153706}
review: 敲好玩！sheldon附体！

author: {'steamid': '76561197970903125', 'num_games_owned': 1490, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1541421481}
review:
Railroad Tycoon meets Pipemania (keeping it modern!) in this fantastic puzzler; thoroughly enjoyed this one.

Lay track between the different coloured stations, then guide each coloured train to it's correct destination, by manipulating the points on your rails. Watch your spending or you'll become bankrupt!

Simple, addictive and tricky in parts, Train Valley has a great look, good sound and is a bargain. I got this as part of a "mystery bundle" and am ashamed to say I would probably have never considered buying it, partly because I rarely look into indie games. That will all change after having played this gem; it even has a demo, so why not download and try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280750238', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1539519489}
review:
Je trouvais ce jeu cool sur les videos je l'ai donc echeté et je me suis rendu compte que les graphismes n'avainet rien a voir avec les images et le gameplay st insatisfaisant a mon gout j'ai pu me faire rembourser donc tout va bien.
Je ne deconseille pas vraiment ce jeu mais il ne m'a pas plus et certains en feronts leur jeu préféré c'est une question de point de vue seulement je vous invite donc regarder d'autres commentaires que le mien pour vous faire une idée plus globale et determiner votre choix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286238210', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1539517681}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354651705', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1539205029}
review:
Mad props to the railway operators of old. That job must have been *very* stressful, and I can imagine them hitting themselves over a misaligned junction or similar incident causing loss of life.

On the topic of junctions, I have found them a bit iffy to make in compact arrangements. Perhaps some tweaking is needed, or maybe I'm just being a noob with the track layer. I highly recommend this game to young and old alike who yearn to live their fantasy of conducting a railway (I see now why that term is used), even if it's only on the screen of a computer or television.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026575104', 'num_games_owned': 2072, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1538760322}

author: {'steamid': '76561198817269595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1601290562}
review:
一个让人第一眼以为是模拟经营游戏的益智策略游戏。玩法很简单不过挺好玩的，后期也挺有挑战性。目前玩了不到20小时，终于全三星get。
关卡内容挺丰富，除了地形和车站摆放的多样性，后期还有入境车、过境车、飞机轰炸等各种阻碍来增加游戏难度。因为车站是随机发车的，而且一段时间后会强制发车，时不时就会遇到前面的火车还没调度好后面就发车了这样的窘境；还有最后几关的地图，几乎只有唯一解，试很多次才能找到最好的铺轨道方案，各种火车炸裂心态炸裂反射弧炸裂。不过有挑战才能吸引玩家不断探索，这正是策略游戏的趣味，然而不能接受这一点的玩家还是要谨慎考虑。
要说缺点的话，故事模式全三星通关之后好像就没什么可玩的了，现在基本就压箱底；以及，没有看到游戏介绍里的 随机模式 在哪里，这点很谜，也有可能是我没找到或者玩过了但是没意识到。

review: I originally purchased this game as it was on offer and I wanted something easy going to occupy my mind. I honestly didn't expect anything amazing... But, 29hrs of game time later, I have finally completed 3 stamps on all the stages. This game is addictive, fun and easy to come back to for a quick challenge. A surprisingly addictive, great little game, with lots of playability definitely recommend it!... I might try Train Valley 2 now... ? :)

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198354044427', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1581067984}
review:
刚玩的时候心态爆炸，特别想给差评，就是那种搭建半天积木被人毁的感觉，毁的人还是卖积木的。现在冷静下来了，觉得游戏素质对得起这个价，只是自己实在玩不来，虽然我真的迫切想玩，可就是过不去，好在游戏给了个沙盒模式，平时逗逗小孩子玩还是可以的，这游戏当初就是因为想起小时候玩的火车玩具才买的。

至于游戏性，让人头疼的是游戏设定了在ABCD之间莫名其妙随机发车，还有时间限制，还只有一条轨道，我思来想后也想不出比这更好更有可玩性的办法，最开始不知道有暂停，玩的那叫一个憋屈，实际上点火车头就能暂停并且能掉头，即使这样，还是很另类的硬核，中国有句古话，船到桥头自然直，说的就是这游戏，玩家需要在火车行驶目的地途中快速规划路线，经典模式还有指定目标挑战，促使人重复游玩（三星强迫症）。千万不要抱着休闲心情去玩！反而会玩的想打人，因为到了后期，基本就属于走错一步，全盘GG的境界，然后十分钟就白玩了，虽然能设定游戏速度，不过发车速度还是固定的，如果能降低发车速度难度，也许我还能坚持下去，现在这样，我只会越玩越气，游戏有demo，建议试玩后再决定购买。

[spoiler]其实我是看到电车难题那张漂移gif突然想试下，结果发现这里的火车傻乎乎的只走一条轨道。
┐(￣ _ ￣)┌[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1535771832}
review: I. Cant. Even.  Three thumbs down.  Very simplistic.  You lay track between stations.  Switch track as needed to get each train to its destination.  That's it.  You have literally no other options.  Lay track.  Switch Track  Ok for kids maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118041806', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1670271559}
review: I got this game for my young son who loves trains. He enjoys watching me play it and I let him help. The bonding is an enjoyable experience, but I do not feel the game itself would warrant purchase if I were to get it for my own enjoyment. It works well enough and provides a decent challenge, but I am just not interested. Additionally, it has a sandbox mode that feels like a pointless, last minute addition. I was pleased with how much my son likes it and I would get it for him again, but I doubt I will ever find myself playing it on my own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337030930', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1587302676}
review:
Mašinkové údolí.

Tato hra je pro děti, dospělé, náctileté a možná i důchodce - nevyžaduje žádnou složitou mechaniku. Hra se skládá ze 4 kapitol a jedné bonusové - DLC Německo (DLC je prakticky stejné jako předešlé kapitoly, avšak tato přidává do hry bombardéry, které vám znemožňují průchod levelem. Pro kompletaci všech achievementů je DLC zásadní. Bez něj se neobejdete.)

Princip hry je propojit příslušné stanice na kolejovou síť, kterou si musíte sami navrhnout, a přehazovat výhybky. Trať je možno zničit a postavit znovu, avšak za zbouraní kolejí se vám vrátí jen polovina vkladu. Další stanice se objevují v průběhu úrovně a může vám to způsobit značné komplikace. Samozřejmě na to máte i omezené peněžní prostředky. Obnos peněz získáte za úspešné dopravení vlaku do příslušné stanice. Rychlost hraje roli, čím rychleji se vlak odbaví, tím víc peněz dostanete. Dávejte si pozor, pokud vlak bude čekat ve stanici příliš dlouho, hodí časovač a vypustí se sám.

Chcete-li předejít restartům úrovní a frustraci, používejte alfu-omegu celé hry - [b]PAUZU[/b]. Během pauzy můžete stavět, zastavovat vlaky. Jen bacha na omezený počet peněz. Každý rok platíte daně (pokaždé jiné hodnoty) a pokud nebude moci zaplatit, prohráváte. Bankrot. Restart. 

Pro soutěživost jsou v každém levelu tři dodatečné, dobrovolné úkoly, které nabízí další hodiny gameplaye. Některé vám zakazují vjet do špatné stanice, v jiných nesmíte vlaky zastavit. Pro splnění velké části úspěchů musíte vyslat nadstavbové vlaky, které se náhodně objeví v jedné ze stanic. 

Hra nenabízí žádný příběh, ale zato dávku frustrace. Ovládání je intuitivní, grafika příjemná. Pro milovníky vláčků je to hra, která ve vašem inventáři nesmí chybět. Vřele doporučuji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026920667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1534215162}
review:
I tried reallyyy hard to like this game, but frankly the 80's Railroad Tycoon game is LOADS better and it runs on D.O.S.  

A major problem i could not get over with this game was how the track switches work or rather don't. If a real life railroad system had to cope with switches that where like this, railroads never would have been used...   This game take micro-management to unholy levels of Distain and Disgust.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370297360', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1594221881}
review: 好久没有找到这样一款能够如此让我着迷的游戏了。当初是看打折而且是火车题材的就入了，我很喜欢火车题材的东西，放在库里很久，快放暑假了无聊就来玩玩。我没有想到这款两百M的小游戏能够让我如此神魂颠倒。各个关卡玩法大同小异，不过背景都是各不相同的，你在建设铁路的同时，还可以看到城市的不断发展。只是有时候新出来的站有时候莫名其妙把我的铁路顶掉很脑残这个设计。实在是太好玩了，于是我又入了德国的DLC。刚开始我还只会简单的三岔口铁轨铺设技术，但是后来随着越来越难的关卡和越来越拮据的预算，让我晚上躺在床上想到了四岔口铁轨铺设技术和双四岔口铺设，以及短直达等专线设计，为了一关的三星我居然可以打一下午，那真的是心力交瘁，必须时刻保持高度的注意力和敏捷的操作才能让一辆辆火车正常且高效的运营。我不是什么聪明人，就是喜欢玩这个游戏。断断续续通关了以后。我觉得让我卡关的是东京那关和德国的一关。东京太小了车又多建筑也多关键预算也不够，那是我花了很多时间去研究怎么样用最好的铁轨去铺设。后来还是过关了还是三星很舒服。德国我觉得难的地方好像是鲁尔区，忘了名字了。也是钱也不算多，必须灵活调度，同时德国背景是在二战后期，会有盟军的飞机来轰炸你的火车铁路，也会让人比较棘手。（珍惜和平啊）玩了一关又一关，特别好玩很适合打发时间。玩了第一部我就买了第二部，可惜第二部变了特色，我不太喜欢那种经营风格的。还是第一部我更喜欢。不过游戏都做得比较精致的。很喜欢，推荐

author: {'steamid': '76561198013462546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1534066946}
review:
NOT A TRAIN GAME ITS JUST AN ARCADE GAME AND A POORLY TIMED MISSION GAME AT THAT! 

I love trains but not this game it has cool build tool but all you do is this stupid quick drop and runs with limited build usage trying to get so many trains out without crashing!  
 I HATE TIMED GAMES BECAUSE MOST NEVER WORK WELL! 
I wish it was more like build a cool train station and cool city starting out in the first steam engines all the way unto today designs with survival through the ages and over time with a lot more but this is more like a basic quick play game not that fun!
I own trains two also and I would have not wasted the money, should of tested the first one but I will probably never play the second game for the first one s@cks.

  Sorry i don’t like the idea maybe others will but for me it gets big thumbs down!

(REVIEWED BY {S.S.G} STEPPING STONE GAMING SITE!)6/10/21

author: {'steamid': '76561198008109833', 'num_games_owned': 2947, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1716, 'last_played': 1533477014}
review: Genial juego en el que simplemente debes llevar trenes de una estación a otra construyendo las vías necesarias. No hay nada de gestión de recursos por lo que se convierte en un juego sencillo y muy adictivo. El reto es conseguir todos los logros aunque para eso hay que comprar el dlc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960865806', 'num_games_owned': 2072, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1564116069}
review:
Freakin' delightful.

I was on the hunt for games my nieces and nephews might enjoy, so I fired up Train Valley to take a look. I ended up playing for several hours that night. Hell with the kids, this is a damn good game regardless of age.

Gameplay starts out simple enough, but ramps up satisfyingly throughout the game. Eventually you'll find yourself juggling switches, struggling to time your departures, intersections, and arrivals, gasping at near misses and groaning when a collision blows up not only your trains but carefully-laid tracks. For an extra challenge, I don't let myself finish a level without scoring perfectly. Map variety keeps things interesting, as does the evolution of the trains as you progress though the years.

Enthusiastically recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091808820', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1565811004}
review:
there's no way to recommend this turd to anybody.

at first glance it looks all nice and cool and interesting.
but it's not.
it's not casual.
it's not relaxing.
it's not fun.

however it is tedious and infuriating. big time!

it's not about building your little train paradise. it's about cobbling together your cr#ppy little train network as you go and work around the stupid limitations this game has to offer.
after the second level i knew i was going to play this for 100% achievements only. i sure as hell don't play this turd for fun.

- most maps are randomly generated every time you start or restart a mission. not just the terrain but also when and where cities, bridges and tunnels pop up on the map over time. it's impossible to plan ANYTHING.
- one mistake usually means restarting the whole damn map because you just can't afford to lose income.
- switches tend to change direction on their own after a train passes over them. it just defies description. unbelievable.
- as soon as all stations on the map are filled with waiting trains some random train starts moving to make space for a new train. and you get a two second warning before they do and you can't do anything about it. it's not unusual to have a train start moving while another one is entering the station. instant explosion yeeaaah!
- talking about explosions, trains do randomly explode on their own for no reason at all. big fun!
- the idea of yearly taxes is probably the dumbest thing i've ever seen. countless times you will fail your mission because you just blew all your money on new tracks a second before tax collection.
- you have to set the UI to max size to make the text readable and the buttons useable. especially when you need to act fast.

it's just too poorly made to recommend to anybody.
i will try to get it to 100% and when i do i'll be a smoldering train wreck myself.

for casual gaming this game just isn't enjoyable at all.
for serious gaming there are like a gazillion way better games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1532931090}
review:
Un gran juego con mucho potencial, Muy corto y Bastante frustrante a la hora de conseguir logros, las mecanicas son muchisimo mas sencillas y el juego termino siendo muy diferente a como se veia, tiene un gran potencial, sobre todo si se hubieran agregado mas elemtnos que añadan complejidad y dinamismo, pero solo quedo en un simple juego de calculo matematico para hacer que no se choquen los trenes mientras pasan por los rieles.

La musica es muy aburrida y repetitiva, el tutorial te enseña lo basico, pero no hay mas para aprender.  
Un juego quedo a medias, no es recomendable su compra salvo que realmente le encante el genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239194758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1532865514}
review: 以這價格來講差不多, 看得出有用心製作.

review:
線路をひいてポイントを切り替え、
車庫から車庫へ電車を誘導するゲーム。

しばらく一時停止・Uターンができることを知らずにプレイしていたが
それでもすべてのスタンプを獲得できたので
難易度はそこまで高くない。

電車を整然と適切な車間距離で走らせるのが楽しく、
その手の几帳面さをもつ人には特におすすめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198352441338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9597, 'last_played': 1530713346}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986618829', 'num_games_owned': 2977, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 1665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1665, 'last_played': 1531444638}
review:
Juego muy sencillo en el que iremos conectando estaciones mediante vías de tren y luego controlando la dirección, sentido, y los tiempos de estos para que no colisionen entre ellos ni equivoquen sus destinos. Se hace realmente adictivo tratar de superar cada fase cumpliendo todos los objetivos mientras el juego va añadiendo dificultad progresivamente, todo ello acompañado de una música relajante y unos gráficos bonitos. También hay un modo "sandbox" que nos permite jugar a nuestro ritmo, sin límite de tiempo ni dinero.

El único punto negativo es que han despiezado el juego descaradamente para añadir un dlc que viene siendo el quinto episodio, si bien es cierto que los 4 primeros ya nos darán para bastantes horas (6 niveles en cada uno) si queremos completarlos al 100%.

Recomendado como juego de puzzle, entretenido y casual donde echar horas jugando solamente con el ratón y que pide muy pocos recursos del PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056466800', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1828, 'last_played': 1531159840}
review:
Простая, но затягивающая игра. Расслабляет на пару вечеров (я неделю играла по чуток). 
Уровни нарисованы хорошо, очень интересно разглядывать типичные для региона исторические и архитектурные элементы, с долей юмора. 
Дает возможность переставить управление на хот кеи мышки и вообще играть 1 рукой)) Можно гладить кота, кормить ребенка, или что вы там у компа делаете ;)
Все ачивки получить несложно. Моя первая идеальная игра по зарабатыванию ачивок)
Спасибо нашим ребятам за добротную игрушку :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198412210500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1618596616}
review:
I've bought this game really recently and couldn't stop playing it!
It's a puzzle game where you must direct each train to the right station. It begins really simple, but gets really challenging with time, building tracks and releasing multiples trains can get tricky!
The graphics are really cute, I could run it easily on Highest Definition. The gameplay is also on point, really easy to learn and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011965365', 'num_games_owned': 2442, 'num_reviews': 2080, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1530739923}
review: The game is more of a puzzle game. You do have money to manage but the game is focused on the trains getting to the right stations and switching the junctions. Your money will always go down, forcing you to send trains to train stations to get money.  For the story you will have a set number of trains you need to move but additional challenges will require you to spawn additional trains requiring careful management.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040710212', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1530734472}
review: I should have watched TotalBiscuit's "WTF Is" on this before buying because some of the reviews here gave me the complete wrong impression. I bought this assuming it'd be a spiritual successor to "Sid Meier's Railroads!", which is completely is not. There's zero automation in terms of train management, so I spent a frustrating amount of time on the first couple of levels watching trains crash into one another because trains don't stop once they start moving. I don't like that trains lose value over time, and that the levels are very small and generated for you. There's no station placing, no scheduling, no rail signals. The game instantly ends if you hit $0, which is really easy to do. You might think you're floating just above bankruptcy with 5 trains about to hit their destinations, ready to give you a huge cash boost, when in comes the yearly tax and you instantly lose. The lack of a grace period is incredibly frustrating. I like micromanagement, but this is just too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997036304', 'num_games_owned': 3192, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 1621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1530719196}
review:
A very fun little puzzle game that starts out quite simple, but gets far more complex as it goes on with buildings blocking paths, stations being placed in odd areas and the little challenges becoming far more difficult to obtain, especially the "do not stop trains" one as that would always give you lots of options to be able to run multiple trains without them smashing into eachother or making you bankrupt.

I highly recommend it to any puzzle enthusiast out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326251553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1588327139}
review:
在买mini metro的时候发现了这款游戏 
同样是规划线路，但这个游戏更加注重列车的发车和运行
这个游戏的tax挺坑的 好几次都是铁轨造太多没钱交税直接结束了
作为益智游戏还是非常推荐的


TIPS：
1.点击火车头上的图标可以让列车停车或者直接掉头
2.不要让火车在站点挺太久，如果这个站点要刷新火车出来而还有火车停着就会强制发车

author: {'steamid': '76561198318225440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1529681028}
review:
看介绍我以为是模拟经营类，结果是个拼手速的游戏...
我不知道是不是因为我没玩到最后的原因，铁路和车站设计及其不合理。
铁路只有单轨道我认了，车站居然只有一条轨道，进车的时候就不能出。
车站是自动出现的，你只能让列车贴钱出发，不能延后，不管你是否准备好了，
时间一到，列车必须出发，哪怕那个车站外面一节铁轨都没有，

唯二的优点，就是画面风格还算漂亮，BGM也还不错。
奉劝铁路爱好者经营爱好者购买前三思，这真不是个可以悠闲的一边吃下午茶一边玩耍的休闲游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198110110963', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1340, 'last_played': 1530732586}
review:
Лучшие 100 рублей (49 игра+51 длц германия). Пару лет назад попробовала пиратку, и дальше 3го уровня не осилила (не люблю я челлендж). Со второй попытки втянулась с головой. Так приятно предолевать уровни, выгадывать тайминг, перезапускать уровень миллион раз. Кому-то игра покажется легкой: последние уровни щелкаются как орехи, после 15 часов практики.
Спойлер!!: в паре уровнях с посторонними поездами  - они прибывают по расписанию каждые три года!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077599879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2999, 'last_played': 1548169356}
review:
Got pretty addicted to this game lol. Was personally looking for a casual simulation/management game and found this on sale. I had no idea I would get so OCD over perfecting each level. The stamps/tasks you are given are not too hard to begin with, but as you progress through the levels, you will encounter tonnes of train explosions, crashes and irreversible traffic jams ;) Nevertheless it can still be quite a relaxing game if you just want to manage trains to and from stations, build tracks in strategic ways and listen along to its soothing music. 

Similar to Mini Metro, so recommended to those who enjoyed that!
