author: {'steamid': '76561198113562470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1533067389}
review:
[b]Прикольная игрушка
Увидел, подумал что-то типа Train Fever. Но нет,это совсем другая игра.Аркада, а не стратегия.[/b]

1) Попотеть придется, некотоые уровни перепроходил раз 15.
2) Смысл: прокладывать жд пути от базы к базе, пускать поезда. и следить, чтобы каждый попал в указанную точку назначения, между делом переводя стрелки путей. Поезда могут столкнуться,или приехать не в тот город-тогда (в зависимости от условий уровня) перезапуск. Поезда можно останавливать и разворачивать. По мере развития уровня и течения времени поезда постепенно усовершенствуются: если вы начинали с паровозов, то закончите скороснтными электровозами.
3) 5 эпох (С длц Германия), в каждой по 6 уровней.Есть СССР))
4) Элементов стратегии нет, главное следиь за финансами и не стать банкротом.
5) Игра хорошая,и ачивки интересные) Правда.
6) Отличное музыкальное сопровождение для каждой эпохи.
7) Есть режим песочницы для всех уровней.

Минусов не нашёл. 

[h1]Финалочка[/h1]
Думаю, по скидке 80 проц купить с длц и поиграть будет не лишним.Довольно затягивает. Будем надеяться, что игра равзивает мозг)).

author: {'steamid': '76561198044491378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1512418374}
review:
В игре много хорошего, но один ЖИРНЫЙ минус испортил всё впечатление. 

Сначала о плюсах:
- приятная головоломка, позволяющая отдохнуть от других игр и отвлечься от забот;
- «игрушечная» графика полностью соответствует геймплею;
- несмотря на кажущуюся незамысловатость, игра не так проста. Если не пользоваться паузой и выполнять все дополнительные задания, играть становиться сложнее и от этого ещё интереснее;
- игра тренирует концентрацию внимания, учит быть бдительным и приучает допускать меньше мелких досадных ошибок. 

В целом, играть комфортно, обязательно куплю вторую часть.

А вот теперь вопль, крик, призыв к разработчикам:

Судя по фамилиям вы русские ребята, ну или хотя бы из бывшего СССР. Объясните мне, пожалуйста: ну зачем в игре столько «клюквы»??? Почему карты по нашей стране сделаны так, будто бы их рисовал недалёкий иностранец, который кроме фильма «Красная жара» больше никакой информации о России не имеет?

Почему Россия в вашем представлении - это сплошные исправительные колонии, заводы по производству танков, ядерные ракеты за каждой ёлкой и атомные подводные лодки в каждой луже? Это не смешно, это печально.

Считаю, что оскорблять Россию и её историю недопустимо даже в шутку. Надеюсь, в следующей части игры вы исправитесь и больше не допустите такого отношения к нашей стране.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029508562', 'num_games_owned': 2560, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1512018460}
review:
It is well presented and has a suitable soundtrack. Despite the lack of complexity, I was obsessed with getting all 3 stamps in all levels for quite a while. It is a game for detail-oriented people who at the same time aren't willing to commit too much time or effort to play a bigger more ambitious game, and that's alright - it's what I was looking for at the time.

You can pause the game while you decide how to spend your credits or how to best develop your tracks. That gives you a better sense of control over how the game plays out and allows you to adjust when something unexpected happens.

If you're looking for a deep game just avoid it, while just go for it if what I said resonates well with what you like in gaming. It is not for everyone, but it works well and shines within its niche.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277775057', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1662617364}
review: Train Valley is a great sandbox game where you control a train company and you have to delver trains to the correct stations. You have 3 goals per level and have a certain amount of money at the start of each level. But be careful, If you take too long, you will go bankrupt and will have to restart the level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067785611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2043, 'last_played': 1515288397}
review:
Jogo bacana de alta dificuldade me surpeendeu positivamente!

Trata-se de um jogo de controle de trafego, aonde tu monta os caminhos, e direciona cada carga (trem) ao seu destino. No começo parece simples, mas tem uma dificuldade exemplar!

Pontos positivos - Simples e Viciante
Pontos Negativos - Em alguns momentos a jogatina se torna repetitiva ou com objetivos complicados demais. DLC Germany não deveria existir. Ja deveria ser uma expansão inclusa, pois não apresenta nenhuma novidade é apenas um pedaço do game que foi retirado para lucrar posteriormente

author: {'steamid': '76561198169957637', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1640554584}
review:
This is a little fun game! There are plenty of [i]different[/i] levels that you can play.  You can buy an expansion to get a couple of extras. However it would be have been nice if the game included just a little more levels, because the ones that there is, is pretty quickly completed. However on the other side it doesn't matter to play the same levels again, espacially if you haven't got all the stamps(optained by completing small missions for each level) for it. But when you have completed the same level five to ten times, it starts to get a little boring.

So instead I would go for the version 2 of this game, which does exist now. It has more features, like being able to make your own levels. This extends the time you will be able to have fun in the game. And for the same price, it is just more valuable than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971571095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1671724913}
review: A really nice but somehow challenging game - at least if you want to score all the Achievements. I love those small mind-breakers from time to time and Train Valley really hits the brain sometimes. A really charming and great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059694229', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1558986473}
review:
Mein Gott macht das Spaß. 

Eher aus Langeweile, billig im Sale geholt hatte ich überhaupt keine Erwartungen an dieses Spiel. Es hat mich echt gefangengenommen und erst losgelassen als ich jede Errungenschaft erhalten hatte. 

Im Grunde ist es ein Puzzlespiel. Man legt Gleise um darauf markierte Züge in die richtigen Bahnhöfe fahren zu lassen. Geht dies schnell genug bekommt man viel Geld, geht es langsam wegen anderen Zügen oder fehlenden Gleisen / Weichen bekommt man weniger. Hört sich simpel an, ist es auch! Aber der Spaß packt einen unheimlich schnell und ermuntert einen zu: Nur noch ein Level... Auch kann es sehr wusselig werden wenn man zig Züge auf zig Gleisen in Auge behalten muss. Dabei ist Train Valley aber niemals unfair. Alle Anforderungen und Errungenschaften sind fair zu erspielen. 

Absolute Kaufempfehlung für ein Spiel für zwischendurch und für 10 – 20 Stunden Spielspaß!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003631784', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1700779803}
review:
Pour commencer je dirais, attention ce jeu n'est pas aussi simple qu'il n'y parait il y a rapidement une vraie difficulté qui s'installe. Ca ne l’empêche d’être sympathique et reposant ca en fait un petit jeu de gestion agréable.

Les plus :
+ L’ambiance donne un côté reposant du jeu
+ La D.A est mignonne c’est sympa
+ Le jeu a un vrai côté gestion
+ Des niveaux variés et plutôt nombreux
+ Un gameplay qui arrive a varié
+ Des succès steam qui en plus sont sympa a faire

Les neutres
/ Le prix 10€ c’est un poil trop je trouve mais il est souvent entre 3€ et 6€ et la c’est un bon coup.
/ La difficulté, au bout d’un moment elle supprime le coté reposant.
/ L’ost est sympa mais pas extraordinaire
/ Un éditeur de niveau aurait été très agréable

Les moins :
Aucun, bah oui c’est un petit jeu aux mécaniques très simples et bien dosé il n’y a pas de réel défaut du coup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204159008', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1510345997}
review:
A familiy friendly game to play occasionally with nice animations and even with the try of expansion, i.e. the Germany DLC. For sure it's within its limits. Long time ago, there was a game called "Locomotion". Train valley picks up the basic idea behind it, transfering trains from station A to station B avoiding collisions. It's, of course, level-up compared to Locomotion, the player can 
- Build track,
- Remove track,
- Start trains,
- Halt trains,
all the things he/she couldn`t do in Locomotion. And although there still seems to be the common factor that the player has to change switches in order to direct trains correctly, it's not really the case, because in Train Valley, switches can be set back automatically according to trains to possibly let them pass.
For more additional material, the player is invited to consult the DLC, Super Train will appear and bombs will fall and destroy parts of the track. The level of challenge can be adjusted by three time configurations (1x, 2x, 4x) as one might tend to like it. Future games can be build on this idea and the genre further improved, may be a reasonable conclusion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001204793', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11394, 'last_played': 1690033007}

Dennoch kann ich das Spiel uneingeschränkt empfehlen, vor allem wenn man Züge mag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205215707', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1544166333}
review:
Train valley certainly one of the best games I have ever played.

"Its just trains." Cry my friends when I rave about it, they are wrong. If you think along their lines, think again.

Firstly a warning, this is a puzzle game. If you love trains but despise puzzle games I would not recommend you to pick it up. However, to all of you still left, if you like puzzles or even have a passing intrest in them I would highly recommend this to you. You do not need to know the first thing about trains. All I know is what I learnt from a childhood addiction to Thomas the tank engine.

The gameplay for the whole time is exhilarating. You are tasked at directing the trains which pop up at various stations, building tracks to new stations and while doing all this trying to keep above that dreaded £0. This may not sound like much but it will keep you invested for many hours. This is beacuse this game is tuned to perfection. You start off with some money to build your initial track and you start to build up some income, however just as you start to feel comfortable the intensity is ramped up by the addition of another station. This ruins even the best layed plans and forces you to think on your feat. The intesity is layered up until you finally finish a level and can finally breath a sigh of releif after an exhilarating time.

Furthermore this game sets the difficulty just right. It never feels too easy or too hard. As I progressed through the game I found myself getting better and better, but the game was improving at the same pace. The game never felt as if it was throwing an impossible challenge at you, on the other hand it never felt it was just gifting you a free pass as I progressed throught the game. However, this style of design heavily impacted one important feature of any video game... Replayability. After I got through the game I replayed some of the earlier levels doing some achievement hunting, they were so easy. After you get all the stamps and the achievements you can't go back and retry the earlier levels as you will be able to play them at mostly 4X speed.

The DLC is also a very welcome addition, I bought the game without the DLC but when I finished the game I immediately bought it. It adds extra play time to the game, extra challenge and many new innovative features. Most importantly it doesn't feel like something the devs took out of the main game just to squeeze every last pound out of us, it adds many new innovative design features not present in the main game.

In conclusion this game is a M A S T A P E E C E and you should buy it. It is only £6.99 and while I got it on a deal I would happily buy it again at full price. I have had a great time with this game and I am looking forward to experiencing the joy of it all over again with train valley 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043904467', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1510984069}
review: There is something about this game that really can't be described. Your first 30 minutes are wondering how this is even a game...it seems so simple and almost boring. An hour in you're starting to get the hang of it, but your trains are still crashing and missing their targets...15 hours in and you're a masterful director of trains, having 4, 5, or 6 long trains all active at once going towards their destinations and furiously clicking the lane switchers to make sure you get everyone to their objective without a mistake. Absolutely and incredibly fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229410460', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1551715232}
review:
[h1] Je recommande [/h1]

Train Valley est un bon jeu qui saura plaire aux gens qui aime la réflexion et les "puzzles".

Avec un design minimalist et épuré, vous saurez apprecier la détente tout comme les petits moment de stress que ce jeux pourra vous procurrer.

[b][u] Les + [/u][/b]

[list]
[*] Le design, simple et efficace avec une 3d agréable à l'oeil.
[*] La bande-son, un poil répétitive mais qui reste sympa à écouter.
[*] Le gameplay qui est très bon.
[*] La config requise, qui est assez basse pour tourner sur un petit PC.
[/list]

[b][u] Le - [/u][/b]

[list]
[*] La durée de vie du jeu. Je l'ai terminé, succés entièrement dévérouillés en seulement 18 heures :O
[/list]


Pour conclure, j'ai passé de très bonnes heures sur ce jeu. J'attends avec impatience Train Valley 2 afin de voir ce que les devs peuvent apporter comme amélioration !

review: Despite running into a bug which deleted my saved games on Linux Mint, this game is SO FUN. I can highly recommend it. It's a simple game of managing that trains get to their designated stations. The graphics are fine, the music is cute and surprisingly good and the gameplay can be challenging, in terms of actually managing multiple trains at once. It's a fun little game I must say. author: {'steamid': '76561197960463278', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1510497953}
review:
Train Valley is a ton of fun until you realize how some of the mechanics can betray you.
Why does it cost money to bulldoze?
Why does spending money take effect during builder mode while paused, if I've erased or changed some of it?
Why do trains automatically launch themselves if you mistakenly send it to the wrong station, can you not put it in a priority queue maybe? That shit fucks up all my other running trains.
Why do trains seemingly launch themselves when not sent to the wrong station sometimes? I was never taught this.

In addition, the lack of polish when it comes to player feedback can really, REALLY make things more difficult. Being a Unity game, it should be possible to have the icon for launching a train somehow change when you have your mouse over it. It should also be possible to have your icon and/or the tile change when in building mode to show what you're mousing over, but only if it can be built on (green tiles.)

Finally, and this is on a personal level. Why is it that on the 5th level of the game, seemingly everything is going so well, but you're given the option of a second bridge? This seems a little early in the game to start having the entire level be focused around having multiple trains launching toward similar destinations. Due to the lack of space, player feedback and some bad mechanics, I've played this level maybe 8 times and have not been able to progress.

Don't confuse this review with a lack of caring. I cared enough to really study what I was doing, pause and take it slow to plan out my routes. However, seemingly, every time either I would make one slip up and it wold excessively build, or a train would launch itself. I feel like, after 8 times on this level, actually caring enough to really plan it through, and dealing with odd mechanics, that I should have progressed on the first chapter. Some developers or readers might think, "Well, you just suck. That's not our fault." Honestly thoguh, think if I might be the only one in the future?

If I can refund it, I will. If I can buy it again further down the road, when some changes are made, I will. If I can play this game with some slight flixes in the future, I would love to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019741084', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1489681803}
review:
This is a good game for killing time. It's not really like having a model train set and it's not at all like Railroad Tycoon, but it doesn't try to be those things. It's a puzzle action game and a pretty good one.

The game's major failing is that you can keep pausing it and deal with everything at your leisure. The game would be quite hectic if you weren't allowed to do anything while it's paused, and I think it would be better for it. Still, it kept me entertained until I reached the end of the campaign.

I didn't enjoy it quite enough to buy the DLC; the game is just too samey. I would consider buying the sequel, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061815441', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1510356440}
review:
Sat in my library for 2 years untouched. Regret it very much.
Train Valley is an indie puzzle game. Gameplay consists of creating tracks to multiple railway stations. And sending out trains to the stations. On paper it sounds like it's not for everyone. But I would disagree.

The nice cute look of the game will diminish quickly as you realize it's the devil in disguise! This game has you pulling your hair out at what looks to be simple. But in fact is a complete nightmare, but in a good way. Constantly changing train tracks and adding new tracks to different stations while trying to manage all the trains wanting to get going is brilliant chaotic fun.

And once you think you have everything down.........the game will throw up a new station somewhere every now and then to hit you in the gut. I highly recommend this little gem. Also comes with a sandbox mode with other challenges as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971325273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1591658120}

author: {'steamid': '76561198373188620', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1513910858}
review:
in Train Valley besteht die Aufgabe darin, in jeweils verschiedenen Szenarien dafür zu sorgen, das die Schienen der Züge möglichst auf dem kürzesten und billigsten Weg so verlegt werden, das alle Bahnhöfe, die zu dem jeweiligen Szenario gehören unfallfrei von den einzelnen Zügen erreicht werden können, wobei die Reihenfolge, in der die Züge fahren - durchaus auch mal 2 oder 3 auf einmal - vom Spiel vorgegeben wird.

Wurde ein Zug durch die richtige Weichenstellung in der sehr schönen Landschaft fehlerfrei zum Zielbahnhof dirigiert, gibt es eine  Erfolgsprämie, die Abhängig ist von der zurückgelegten Strecke (nehme ich zumindest an).

Die Loks und Wagons sehen prima aus und es macht Spaß, ihnen beim fahren zuzuschauen.

Sollte es doch einmal zu einem Zusammenstoß kommen, fliegen die Wagenteile prima animiert durch die Gegend und Schienenteile der betroffenen Teilstrecke gehen zu Bruch und müssen erneuert werden. Auch das man pleite geht und eine Aufgabe nicht direkt beim 1. Mal bewältigt wird ist gegeben. Bei der dann folgenden Aufgabe ist es aber so, das die Bahnhöfe an anderen Stellen  aufgebaut werden, so das ein hoher Wiederspielwert gegeben ist. Ständig ist man motiviert die nächste Aufgabe zu meistern, einfach klasse, zumal für den Preis!

author: {'steamid': '76561198231874740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1570392901}
review:
This game provides a neat simplistic simulation of a train network. There are some aspects I really like about this game, but sadly it is also plagued by several issues. Here's why this is only a [b]weak recommendation[/b]:

Don't be fooled by the "Puzzle" tag. Had I tried the demo, I'm not sure I would have bought this. The game has a small strategic component in track laying and decision-making and a rather large simulation/management/action aspect in switching the tracks. But this game does not challenge your brain in any substantial way and even within the same level there is a huge amount of randomness. The store page claims there are "story mode" and "random mode". As far as I can tell after beating the game, this is simply false advertising. All story mode levels are randomized (which stations open first, where trains appear, how long they are).
Since the stations have fixed locations, each level has an optimal track layout. This is obvious after playing the level, but since the locations are hidden at first and the stations appear one by one, you can get screwed over pretty badly (stations may even spawn on top of existing tracks). On your second play-through the strategic component is vastly diminished and the game is even more of a mindless clicker game.
Finally, all the hidden information makes it really hard to make informed decisions and plan ahead. Trains appear randomly at stations and before sending them out you only know their destination, not their length and speed. This forces you to react on the spot, which to me kills even the tiny semblance of a puzzle game this might otherwise have. You cannot optimize or plan ahead for those sweet moments of perfect timing.

There is also an eco-sim aspect where you have to make money to afford tracks and demolitions. While there are no running costs, for some crazy reason the developers decided to "tax" you regularly. This turns out to be horribly annoying as you might be 1 tile away from cashing in a train and still go bankrupt due to taxes, forcing you to limit building and keep a small stockpile of money. If you are caught up in building it's very easy to over-spend and lose the game which is incredibly frustrating. I don't see what purpose the tax serves, other than to annoy players.

Other criticisms include a lackluster tutorial and the game not auto-pausing upon entering a level. I still don't know where the active area of the button to send a train out of a station actually is or if there is a different reason why the game sometimes ignores my clicks. I've also had a few times where trains crashed randomly. Once reversing a train on a straight track even somehow made it crash into itself (which gave me an achivement). The level selection is styled as an album, but each time you enter the menu you have to sit through a short page-flipping animation, which gets old really fast. And some of the achievements are needlessly grindy.

And still I didn't hate the game. It wasn't the game I expected, but I simply had fun. Admittedly, mostly mindless fun, but still! The game looks and runs great, even on low-end systems. The technical aspects were solid (separate volume sliders, UI scaling, colour blind mode). You can tell the maps were created with a lot of love and attention for detail. They are filled with diverse custom objects and some really neat historical references that I enjoyed very much. There is some amount of replayability, but I liked figuring out a map for the first time best and there is no map generator. Each map giving you 3 extra tasks (like making X amount of money, never pausing, never crashing trains, etc.) gave an otherwise very easy and forgiving game a bit of a challenging edge, which I enjoyed greatly. Given my frustration with several aspects of the game I can't recommend spending full price on it, but picking it up on sale might be nice. If you still have doubts, maybe try the demo first?

author: {'steamid': '76561198325680034', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1634465129}
review:
[h1] Hello, guys! [/h1]
In below I'll try to describe how amazed I am from this game. In first 10 minutes of the game I was thinking it's just an easy game in which you just need to dispatch sloppy trains, but that was my biggest mistake! With every next mission it's becoming just more hard! You need to adapt fast, because even if you replay the mission, the things changes a lot!
Here are my opinions about the game:
[h1] Pros: [/h1]
-the game is changing with your decissions
-so many missions and different play modes
-the game is being updated very often
-many Steam Achievments for which you must play a lot
[h1] Cons: [/h1]
-for me it's not a big cons, but I must say that the graphics aren't the best for game at this level. I think the game is okay with this graphics, but I can say that they can be a little better. For these ones for which the graphics are big part from the game it can be a cons!

[b] For final - the game is pretty at almost every inch. Hardly recommend it for the train lovers or just for the guys who want to play something different [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041840597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1509575302}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002870904', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1509510281}
review:
Fun little game about managing some trains. It's not a traditional sim game focused on business and economics. Instead, the strategy in Train Valley is about how to lay down your tracks and how you manage your trains.

Laying down train tracks is pretty self-explanatory. You have a budget limiting how much track you can make. Going through obstacles costs additional money. There are many things to consider when designing your track. Distance between stations, how many trains your track can hold at one time, how often you have to switch junctions.

The player controls when trains depart and which way trains go at junctions. This is most of the "gameplay": making sure trains get to the right station as quickly as possible without accidents.

The game is pretty easy if you only send [i]mandatory[/i] trains. However, you have the option to effectively send as many trains as you want to earn more money (until you go bankrupt from all the collisions). The is where most of the challenge was for me: testing and pushing the limits of my track and my micro to send as many trains as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984816265', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1509286059}

author: {'steamid': '76561198174751210', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1525619482}
review:
Ein schönes Spiel für Zwischendurch...

Man verbindet Bahnhöfe mit Gleisen, lässt einen Zug starten (z.B. von Grün nach Blau) und muss dafür die richtigen Fahrstraßen mittels kleiner Weichen einstellen. Am richtigen Bahnhof angekommen, gibts Geld, was für weitere Strecken gebraucht werden kann.

Im Laufe des Levels erscheinen neue Bahnhöfe, die sinnvoll in das bestehende Schienennetz angebunden werden müssen. Manchmal fahren Züge auch nach einer bestimmten Zeit einfach Richtung Zielbahnhof los, dann gilt es, schnell zu handeln und ggf. Züge anhalten oder (sofern Nebenstrecken vorhanden sind) umleiten, damit es nicht zu Kollisionen kommt.

Sehr einfaches Gameplay, viel Spaß für Zwischendurch.
Machste bei dem Preis nix verkehrt...!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045177988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1509342934}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1509378937}
review:
線路を引いて列車を目的地に誘導するパズル。シンプルなルールに分かりやすいUI。
しかしマップごとの最高評価を目指していくと難易度はなかなかのもの。常に路線全体に目を配る必要があるので、一時停止があるにも関わらず些細なミスから失敗することも。トライ＆エラーが容易いのが嬉しいね。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995380276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1518127254}
review:
Not my kettle of fish this one. It has a very manual micro management approach to a train sim. It wasn't obvious on the game promotional videos that that was how it worked sadly else I would have skipped it. I had thought it was a bit similar to Sid Meier's style, or even the ancient A-Train or maybe like Open Train Tycoon with nice graphics but sadly not.

Probably nice for kids and family. I won't return, only played a few mins but got it for $2.49 so will hang onto it in case grandchildren visit and they find it fun.

Update post visit by grandchildren:

They asked me to load minecraft back up after 5 minutes when I tried to get them interested in the game. Fail :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198014985201', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1510262869}
review:
スマホゲーにありそうなお手軽なリアルタイム系パズルゲーム。

パッと触っただけだが、他の方のレビューにもあるとおり面ごとに一癖あって練られている印象を受けた。インターフェースも分かりやすく、操作系も単純で軽快。なかなかに小気味良い。

基本的には列車の線路を敷いて、分岐路をクリックすることで経路を上手く指示して目的地に列車を運ぶと言ったもの。1つの列車だけならば単純だが、複数の列車を同時に目的地に運ばなければならないため、並列処理を行って分岐路の操作が忙しい感じのゲームになっている。一時停止可能なので、あまりリアルタイム性は問われない感じ。

日本語に対応している。ただ、１つ分かりづらい部分があるので補足を。
日本語で"列車をX本以上送り出す"という目標は、デフォルトだと"R"キーを押すことで列車を強制催促できる。その催促して出した列車を目的地に到着させることで達成でき、それを行う回数を示している。英語設定にして、その文章をGoogle検索して目的の内容が判明した。

1ゲームも10分程度と短く、軽くプレイする分には良ゲー。上級目標をこなそうと思うと難易度は高い。

2017/11/17 追記
全てのキャンペーンで上級目標を達成しつつ攻略済み。歯ごたえがありながらも決してクリアーできない難易度ではない所がとても良くできている。かなりの良ゲーだと思えた。価格も安いので良心的なゲーム。続編にも期待。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025636372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1641, 'last_played': 1528935139}
review:
A really fun and challenging puzzle game that involves managing trains and building tracks to connect stations.  Took me about 15 hours to "complete" the game.  There are many more achievements but I don't see the point of a lot of them (why should going bankrupt ten times reward me with an achievement?).  I had a few issues with the mechanics of the game as I played but overall this is a great game for a few quid, and I will be purchasing the Germany DLC.

Pros: Great value, challenging, very fun, addictive.
Cons: Strange objective mechanics, i.e. you can complete 2/3 of the objectives on a level despite crashing many trains.  Also, why do I fail on the "destroy no tracks" objective because the game decided to build a new station over my existing tracks?  Seems a little unfair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024272611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1342, 'last_played': 1513555334}
review:
This is a great management/building/strategy game.  It's like a combination between Mini Metro, Subway Shuffle, and Cities in Motion.  

You start with a certain amount of cash that ticks down as time passes and you use that money to build train tracks to connect the train stations that will appear over time.  Once the stations are connected, you must dispatch trains from their starting station to the correct station without crashing them into other trains.  The trains also have an amount of money that will decrease as time passes so there is an incentive to get the train to the station asap.  Getting a train to a station successfully yields you whatever money is left over from its starting money pool.

The crux of the game is balancing your money (it's easy to go bankrupt on more challenging levels), building tracks that will allow trains to reach all stations (in both directions), managing the interchange directions which are constantly changing as trains pass over them, and avoiding train collisions. 

My only complaint is I want more content!

review:
This game is equal parts entertaining and frustrating (with a dash of addicting thrown in)
Its not a tycoon game and time management is quintessential to the gameplay.
My desk has taken a few poundings thanks to a few crashes, impatient trains or mismanagement of funds bankrupting me but I've still managed to complete it and each of the 3 tasks set out for each level.
I've also reset and replayed it so it certainly has replay value!

I'd most certainly recommend this game and can't wait for TV2 next year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003422578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1507855608}
review:
Train Valley is a great little game, its easy to learn and understand but tricky to get right later on as the game progresses. The core game itself is simple but the difficulty ramps up very quickly. You will struggle with some levels and replay difficult ones to get all the objectives. The game is balanced and the levels are all different fitting everything together rather well. It’s a fun puzzle game, each level averages around 15 minutes so if you want to quick game and not get sucked into a game for hours this will definitely work!
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003970062', 'num_games_owned': 2038, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1507435575}
review:
Train Valley is an extraordinarily simple and yet oddly satisfying game about connecting up rail stations. The game has extremely simple controls – you have the ability to build train tracks, to send a ready train out from a train station, to cause a train to get readied up ahead of schedule, to stop a train in its tracks, or to put a train into reverse.

At it’s heart, this is a puzzle game with very simple resource management. Every time a train reaches its destination, you are rewarded with money. If a train should crash into another train, or run out of track, it will blow up, denying you any money you might have earned from the train. The longer it takes for you to deliver a train to its destination, the less money you earn – and given that deploying a train early costs you money, if you aren’t fast enough on the deployment, you can lose net money in this fashion. Each train has a specific destination, randomly assigned at generation; sending a train to the wrong station will cause it to simply turn around and re-emerge, possibly wrecking havoc with the other trains you’ve got moving around the map.

Building train tracks costs money, and demolishing obstacles so you can build train tracks costs money.

Every “year” in game (and the years go by quite fast – the game proceeds very quickly through the years, though it can be paused) you must pay a tax, which depletes your money – run out of money, and it is game over.

That’s it. There’s really nothing else here. And yet, the game manages to get 24 levels of content out of it.

The trick to this game is the limitations on rail placement. The rail can go from straight in one tile, to 45 degrees in the next tile, to 90 degrees in the tile after that. Train tracks can cross at perpendicular angles – in which case, trains cannot switch tracks between the routes – or rails can merge together at 45 degree angles, allowing multiple tracks to merge together or to split traffic on the rails apart.

Thus, the game’s placement of the train stations – 3-8 per map – combined with the obstacles on the map (some can be demolished, albeit sometimes at great expense which makes it unwise to do so, but some – like mountains and rivers – cannot be) and narrow outlets for rail traffic (such as a single bridge or tunnel) make each level a different challenge.

Simply beating the game is pretty easy; the real challenge of the game is to complete the three optional challenges on each of the levels. These vary from challenges requiring perfect play – never allowing a train to go to the wrong station, never stopping a train, and never allowing a train to crash – to challenges which restrict you in other ways, like not allowing you to demolish more than a certain value of obstacles on the map (requiring you to thread your way between them) or requiring you to earn a certain amount of money (requiring you to deploy many trains early and deliver your trains quickly and consistently to their destination).

All in all, this game was simple but somehow quite satisfying. It isn’t anything overly complicated, or extraordinarily difficult, but it felt like just the right amount of challenge to be enjoyable without being brainless. Each level takes about 20 minutes to complete, which makes for a nice little bite-sized challenge, and 100%ing the game might take somewhere in the realm of 12 hours or so, as you replay some of the levels to try and complete the more difficult challenges.

If you enjoy puzzle games with some minor resource management, this might be up your alley. If you prefer more active games, though, this might feel a bit too passive; while you do have control over what is going on, and sometimes you need to switch things up fairly fast, this is more like a management sim than an action game. And if you’re looking for a story, look elsewhere; there is nothing here but simple train puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061657440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1507180031}
review:
En eğlenceli makinist :)

Oldukça basit bir mantığa dayalı fakat gittikçe dallanıp budaklanan ve sizi içine alan bir oyun. Kısa zaman boşluklarınızı güzel değerlendirebileceğiniz kendine has zorluğu var. İlk sezon son derece basit gelebilir fakat ilerleyen sezonlarda oyunun zorluğu sizi epeyi zorluyor.

Oyunumuzun mantığı sahip olduğumuz demiryolu şirketinin aktarmak istediği trenleri ilgili istasyonlardan alıp diğer istasyonlara gitmelerini sağlamak. Bunun içinde demir yolu hatları döşüyor ve aralardaki makasları kontrol ediyoruz. İlk başta dediğim gibi çok basit fakat ileride tren sayıları, durak sayıları, trenlerin uzunlukları, üst üste binen hat ve makas sayıları iyice arttığından artık kontrollere yetişmekte epeyi zorlanıyorsunuz. Hatlar yetersiz geliyor döşediğiniz rayları iki kere düşünmeniz gerekiyor. Birde işin içine düzensiz harcadığınız para bittiği anda iflas bayrağını çekmek girince işler hepten zorlaşıyor.

Atıştışrmalık güzel ve keyifli bir oyun. 10/6

author: {'steamid': '76561197991128699', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1594442886}
review:
I initially bought this for my son, but after I realized he was too young for it I started playing it myself, and I must say I have been enjoying it a lot. 
Fun and challenging strategy game: Build tracks, manage the switches on the tracks so the trains don't crash and get there as quickly as possible so as to maximize profits, all the while trying to achieve other miscellaneous objectives given at each level. Relaxing at times, challenging at times. All around good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037736673', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1514316842}
review: Un juego que llegas a odiar.  Niveles que aun siendo el modo fácil, tardas cientos de repeticiones en completarlos con los 3 objetivos cumplidos, lo cual llega a cansar y desanimar a seguir jugando.  Por no hablar del sistema de construcción de vias que llega a desesperar por sus pocas posibilidades y la nula logica de curvas y cruces.  La música repetitia y aburrida.  Si estás pensando en comprarlo, mi consejo: no lo hagas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037843747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1673796257}
review:
Malgré un gameplay addictif, Train Valley ne propose pas l'ergonomie et la réactivité de contrôle nécessaire pour en profiter. Alors que toute l'expérience repose sur la gestion rapide des flux, on butte en permanence sur des problèmes d'interface qui   ternissent l'expérience : la création de routes est approximative, la réactivité de l'interface est très aléatoire, la lisibilité n'est pas optimale, les options favorites de jeu se remettent à chaque partie à zéro, quant aux feedbacks sonores, ils sont trop répétitifs et violents pour être vraiment adaptée à ce type de jeu... comment as-t-on pu penser que répéter toute les 10 secondes un son de cloche puisse être respectueux du joueur.


La progressivité du level design doit être également repensée.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041457591', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1519464740}
review:
Unlike some reviewers, I knew in advance what train valley was and what it wasn't. It is NOT a tycoon game or a simulator of any kind. If you play this with a relaxed attitude and want to sit back and build a few tracks and ponder over choices, this game isn't what you're looking for. Train valley certainly has management decisions, but time and money are pressing issues; every second counts. You'll need to think quick, act fast and plan ahead if you want to keep bankruptcy and train crashes at bay. This may not be how this game looks or even plays in the first few minutes, but believe me: get another game if you want a slow paced game.

For me personally, this is exactly the sort of game I actually wanted to play when trying out openRRT: lay down tracks, navigate the routes and have a ballet of near-misses as you estimate which train is best to set first. Granted: the money aspect can feel a bit game'y: there's an annual upkeep cost, tracks cost money, train crashes cost money, building over landmarks cost money and the cargo loses value over time. You've got to accept this all "as is", but hey...that's how this game rolls.

Controls are intuitive and easy. Up to the point where I'd almost expect this game to be a mobile game, though the visuals are still a couple notches above mobile standards. Building rails is a matter clicking and dragging (which sounds obvious, but at the end of the level you probably have a complex web of relay junctions on the board) and everything else is as intuitive as can be.

The whole gist of this game is how things go from a steady, simple pace to keeping as much trains on the correct route as possible. It's not uncommon to guide train A to location B and train C to location D, only to discover that while you were busy elsewhere, you forgot to switch the junction so C would go to D instead of to B. The game is set up so near misses are common, and since train crashes are hard (if not impossible) to recover from, you can say that this game is hard and//or frustrating. But for some reason, I don't feel it either way. Yes, I seldomly do okay, but the fact that I'm totally in control of what I build or how many extra trains I dispatch reduces that. Most of the time, I think this game is just hilarious if things go wrong (yup...those train drivers do NOT stop on their own :P ).

All in all: do I advise it? Absolutely yes. Do I advise it for everyone? Absolutely not. Read the review, guys 'n girls. If you reduce this review to a simple thumbs up, I'm not one to come crying to when your calm little train simulator expects you to take risks to not go bankrupt. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561197972914544', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1687903327}
review:
A Strategic Puzzle game that will have you cursing because you forgot to turn one arrow and a train crashed or went somewhere it should not have gone. This is NOT a Train Simulator but it IS a rewarding Strategic Puzzle game

This game is a fun strategic puzzle game well worth a buy, whether you are looking to fill in 20 minutes or a couple of hours.

The core concept of the game is to lay tracks for trains to go from one station to another where tracks meet each other there are arrows which will force a train to go onto one or the other track becoming more complex as you try to ensure trains don't crash and arrive at the correct station by adding less direct routs but allowing more trains on screen at a time.

This game is an extremely well made game with a good number of interesting and challenging levels. As puzzle games go, this is one of my favourite, the challenges on each level very much stretches you and adds an optional layer of difficulty to a game that on the surface is quite simple. As a strategy game this is a simple and easy going game that will have you working and reworking the track positions to find the perfect layout (I personally use the sandbox mode to plan out my level without the limits of trains and money)

If you want an interesting challenge that also allows for a fairly laidback style of gameplay then you will struggle to find better experience. Considering the price this game is very much worth it even if its not on sale. Start to finish (including DLC) your looking at a about 10-15 hours if you purposely try to complete all the challenges but its very easy for the game to last you 20+ hours

Pros.
Each level has different challenges.
Can be played casually as well as intensely
Touch Screen Playable
Lovely Scenery(levels)

Cons.
Wish they had a mode that allowed for multiple levels with the same Terrain/map

author: {'steamid': '76561198292388267', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1506506428}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998886660', 'num_games_owned': 2532, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 4726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4726, 'last_played': 1505306900}
review:
What a fantastic little train puzzler.  reminded me of the pop cap lococommotion but in real time.  This is in no way a train simulation but rather a puzzle game that uses trains.
Game may or may not have been a mobile port but that does not distract from the puzzles as it is intuitive and responsive.
The object of the puzzle is to get the trains to the correct station, and the quicker the more coin is earned.  Sounds simple enough but there are multiple trains and becomes frantic quickly.
Purchased this on special for a couple of dollars and well worth the investment as it provided nearly 80 hours of enjoyment.  Finished the game in the 1st 30 hours with the remainder spent getting the achievments (yes some were difficult but they are all doable).
Would suggest purchasing when discounted as the cost per hour is a little high especially considering this is a casual game.  Train valley 2 is due out early next year so i would be expecting this will be available with good discount to get new players involved with the release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057562761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1505231995}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005155926', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1531990933}
review:
Train Valley wirkt auf den ersten Blick sehr simpel.

Von dem zweidimensionalen Blick auf eine Gegend,
die mehr nach Kinderspielbahn aussieht,
sollte man sich jedoch nicht täuschen lassen.

Train Valley holt aus seinen Mechaniken das Maximale heraus.
Vor allem spätere Level sind herausfordernd und wenn dann
noch die Sonderziele erfüllt werden sollen ist das Spiel in seinem Element.

Leider ist der Spaß recht schnell vorbei und der Wiederspielwert nicht
besonders hoch, dennoch kann ich Train Valley guten Gewissens weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049837486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1644761116}
review:
A good game and very nice to see how much TV2 has evolved. This game is ok in itself, but TV2 is definetly better. 
TV has a more realistic artstyle. Trains accelarate slower and are longer (more cars). There are no industries like in TV2, just stations.
The game can be beaten "relatively" easy (with some experience). The hardest levels are Japan night level where you need to juggle several stations and can not stop trains to get the highest rating and the German supertrains level - where again you are not allowed to stop trains.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069522800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1504811813}
review:
I've only begun to scratch the surface of this game, but so far I enjoy playing it.  Nice puzzle game that reminds me somewhat of the original Railroad Tycoon in that you can control track switches.  Having the trains depart on their own adds a bit of pressure to the game.

The only criticism I have of the game so far is that every time I've played it, it has forced my computer to a hard shut down.  Not sure if it's the game or my computer, but this is the only software I've run that causes my computer to react that way.

If you like train games and puzzles, you will probably like this.

EDIT: Just noticed the Store Page for the game warns of possible crashes in Windows 10.  That may explain my issues....  ;-)

review: 这个游戏最开始是个poly bridge捆绑买的  9块钱 但是发现这个好像更好玩一些（捂脸）   毕竟这个不是太费脑子  不过还是需要费一些脑子的，我个人的经验就是三岔道！三岔道！三岔道！ 比较崩溃的就是日本的轨道真的太蛋疼了，就小地方 站还傻多，目前还没玩到dlc德国篇  不过确实是个休闲游戏，就我个人来讲的话打折入的9rmb也是很超值了，而且各种成就，任务什么的也不会说一边通关就吃灰了，至少也得玩个两三遍吧，消磨时间利器。而且汉化也没问题，如果再打折还是挺推荐的

author: {'steamid': '76561198356777197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1554988623}
review:
●最初の感想
購入後3時間プレイしたあとのレビューです
自分は、鉄道に興味があり購入しました。ですが、どっちかというと、パズル好きの人のほうが楽しめる内容なのではないかと感じました。

●ゲームの内容について
このゲームは、次々に出てくる駅から出て来る列車をうまく正しい駅に運ぶというゲームになっています。
ゲームの内容はいたってシンプルでこれだけです。あとはあなたの腕次第で、うまく列車をさばいていきます。

このゲームではDLCなしでは4シーズン（１シーズンあたりに6ステージ）、DLCがあると、もう1シーズンついてきます。
様々なステージがあり、楽しめます。

（DLCは購入しましたが、まだプレイはしていないので）

●購入を検討している方に
パズル好きならすごい楽しめると思います。
割引しているのであれば買うべきだと思います。　自分はこのゲームにハマりました。
鉄道好き＆パズル好きなら絶対買ったほうがいいです。はい。

＊追記 10/25
このゲームやればやるほど面白くなってくる気がします

author: {'steamid': '76561198202975203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1566398160}
review:
考驗反應力的益智小遊戲，簡單易懂的遊戲模式
遊戲目標就是把對應顏色的火車送到同色的火車站，在關卡時間內盡可能賺錢，並且不要撞毀火車！
風格很可愛，收集印章的收集冊也做得很精緻

玩家除了建造鐵路之外，也要負責在叉路的節點轉換行進方向，鐵路蓋完後就不太會拆，之後主要的工作就是看準時機轉換叉路方向
越到後期，火車站的數量越多，鐵路網會變得相當複雜，因為不同目的而交錯路線的火車更多，也容易發生撞車事故

每一個關卡會根據國家設定而有不同的風景、列車種類
像是在美國西部的場景會出現開採礦石的列車，美國紐約的場景有許多高樓大廈，還有場景中有火山、有城堡、大湖等等，雖然對關卡內容沒有任何影響，但塑造了很棒的異國風情，玩起來很有氣氛

也有一些很細緻的設定，比如說火車站在經過長久經營（送出很多列車）後，會一直翻新擴展，從小車站變成大車站，還有每次在列車上按暫停時，總是會多跑一段才慢慢停下的感覺也很真實，停止後再起步的動作也很緩慢。

適合喜歡休閒小遊戲、喜歡火車的人

author: {'steamid': '76561197966043087', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1503333159}
review:
It's decent.  I enjoy puzzle games and simulations; this game tries to be both, but doesn't do a good job of it.  It's a mediocre puzzle game and a mediocre simulation game.  I think they just tried to do too much and should have just decided which genre they wanted the game to fit in.

Had they decided against full 3d, they could have done a lot more to make the puzzle more interesting and challenging.

Had they decided against the puzzle aspects, they could have built a better sim.

I played this game for an hour and it kept me entertained, but 2 days (or so) after buying it I have little-to-no desire to double click its icon... maybe ever again.

Is $10/hr value?  Nah, I don't think so... I'd recommend that you skip it unless you're really bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055171179', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1503421651}
review:
J'ai adoré ce jeux ! 
Le 1er niveaux vous explique comme il faut les commandes de bases, meme si elle sont simples et faciles a prendre en main rapidement. Les premiers niveaux sont faciles, peut de train, moins de gare ... A chaque niveau vous avez 3 tachez a effectuez pour obtenir des tampons. Pas de panique ! Si vous n'arrivez pas a obtenir les 3 dans la meme partie, vous pouvez vous concentrez sur un a la fois et recommencer le niveau pour la prochaine tache. 5 Pays composé de 6 niveaux chacuns, soit 30 niveaux. Avec un degrés de difficulté supplémentaires a chaque niveau. 

But de la partie : 
Vous demarrez la partie avec 2 gares, vous les reliez et échanger les premiers trains entre elles jusqu'a ce que une 3eme gare apparaisse que vous reliez aux 2 autres gares et ainsi de suite. Chaque gare est différiencé d'une couleur, ainsi que chaque train. Plus vite vous acheminerai vos trains vers les bonnes gare, plus d'argent vous gagnerai. Attention si vous etes trop long, les trains peuvent partir d'eux memes ce qui parfois complique la situation. 

Les graphismes sont vraiment agréables, un reel plaisir a joué.
Petit plus, a la fin de chaque niveau vous pouvez continuez a joué autant que vous le voulez.
Certains succes sont casse tetes mais c'est le but du jeux aprés tout ? 

A recommandé fortement

author: {'steamid': '76561198162634216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 4554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1925, 'last_played': 1686134707}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137722837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1501652506}
review:
这是一款养老的游戏，游戏的内容非常单调，就是规划你的路线，调度各个站点的火车，并不断地、让人精疲力竭地调整铁路岔道。游戏的节奏非常慢（雾），但是你却需要始终地盯着屏幕上的每一辆火车，以防止它们走错线路或者发生碰撞，也就仅此而已。

要说优点的话，精致的模型与带有相当本土风情的背景音乐，算是这个游戏的亮点了吧~

我并不推荐这款游戏，这款游戏需要异于常人的“耐心”，然而我并没有这种耐心。我想能够坚持下来的，除了前面所说的情况，也就只有那些为了集齐成就的强迫症患者了吧( ╯□╰ )

author: {'steamid': '76561198054485566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1935, 'last_played': 1574817271}
review:
It's important that you understand that this is a puzzle game, not a train simulator.   The game has 4 'levels' with 5 maps in each level (plus an extra level of 5 maps in the Germany DLC).  When you start a new map you see two train stations that are already constructed and it's your job to build track between the two stations.  Once track is laid you will start getting alerts from the individual stations that a train is ready to depart.  You are also shown where that train's destination is (marked by an easy to understand color system).

Sounds pretty easy, right?

It's not nearly as easy as it sounds.  After you get past how to lay the track (with limited funds that vary from map to map.  You also gain funds by getting trains safely to their destination in a timely fashion, or risk reduced income) you are also given parameters to meet in order to get a "perfect" score on each map.  There are always 3 parameters you will need to satisfy to get a perfect score (anything from "Don't allow any train to arrive at the wrong station" to "Do not destroy over $20,000 of assets, like trees or buildings or even track you've previously laid).  As the levels move up, so does the challenge.

To add one more little piece of difficulty; the trains will automatically depart if you do not manually send them to their destination within an allotted amount of time).  Not much of an issue on early maps but it certainly makes things difficult later in the game.

I love building games, puzzles and trains and this one checks all three of those boxes.  For the price, it's the best game I've purchased on Steam.  If you like puzzles, building games and trains, then what are you waiting for?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 1978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1948, 'last_played': 1502842937}
review:
鉄道運営パズルシム。
線路を引いて列車をコントロールして、できるだけ速く多くの列車を目的の駅まで運行させるパズルゲームだ。
線路のつなぎ方には規則性があり計画的に引いていかないと遠回りを余儀なくされることがある。列車の操作は発車と停車、逆走させることができるが、同時に複数の列車を走らせることが前提なので、衝突事故や間違った駅への到着などに気を付けなければならない。また、線路敷設や列車事故、列車追加、そして毎年1月に徴収される税金と何をするにも金がかかり、金が底をついた瞬間に破産によるゲームオーバーがあるので、資金についても気を使わなければならない。
こうした線路のつなぎ方と複数の列車の運行、利益回収という同時並行的なコントロールがゲームのメインとなっている。忙しいゲームだがゲーム速度は3段階切り替え可能でポーズもできるので、じっくり考えて楽しむことが可能だ。登場する舞台の国は5か国(DLC含)で1つの国には6ステージ用意されている。

マルチタクスな脳でないときついゲームだ。少なくとも適宜ポーズして各列車の運行を「確実に」チェックできるようでないとこのゲームのクリアは難しい。私はゲーム序盤から大苦戦したが、ゲームへの慣れと共に上手くなっていく感覚が感じられて非常に良かった。
基本的な部分やレベルデザインがしっかりと作られていることが感じられ、やることは最初から最後までほぼ同じだが飽きることなくプレイしていける。マップの形と駅の位置は固定だが、マップに配置されている一部のオブジェクトと駅が出現する順番はプレイごとに異なるので若干のリプレイ性もあるのも一因だと思う。
非常に丁寧で手堅いつくりの良いゲームだと思う。同時並行的なコントロールとチェックするようなゲームが好きならぜひプレイするべきゲームだ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198078933066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1561, 'last_played': 1502827265}
review:
Очень милый симулятор железной дороги для тех, кому в детстве так и не купили конструктор. Сильно затягивает, невозможно оторваться, пока не пройдёшь все уровни — но именно в режиме истории, где нужно укладываться в бюджет и сроки, выполняя определённые задачи. В режиме песочницы скучновато, т.к. нет мотивации, хотя, думаю, в определённом настроении медитативно прокладывать рельсы и гонять туда-сюда поезда без ограничений тоже может быть приятно. На каждый сезон свои пейзажи, архитектура и мелодии. С течением времени изменяется не только внешний вид, но и скорость движения поездов, причём с особенным коварством это происходит на одном из последних уровней в Японии, когда часть поездов ещё старая и ездит в привычном темпе, а часть — возникающие довольно непредсказуемо новенькие синкансэны, летающие со скоростью света и норовящие смести всё на своём пути, сорвав миссию "без аварий". Несмотря на кажущуюся простоту, на некоторых уровнях приходится изрядно поломать голову, чтобы выстроить систему путей оптимальным образом для решения всех задач, а в паре случаев я даже сдалась и прибегла к выложенным в сети руководствам. Вообще, в каком-то смысле игра сродни пасьянсам — только в пасьянсах от неудачных решений не взрываются с грохотом поезда х)
Дополнение про Германию тоже стоит купить, если в целом игра понравилась. Четырем стандартным сезонам оно ничуть не уступает, да ещё и разнообразит процесс внезапными авиабомбёжками (подрывающими и без того скромные финансовые ресурсы) на уровне про Первую мировую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189173169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1577992542}
review:
"The entire game is for babies."
Pros:
- Encourage thinking and planning
- Explains how train stations and train companies run
- Simple controls

Cons:
- Feels more like a phone game port
- Super duper hardcore puzzles sometimes
- Generally calls you to think of nothing but how to get the train safe 
- Stressful for trophy-rusher

Score: 4/10
Sidenotes: I don't really like this game. Bought this in summer sale in a package but feels like this game is a phone game port and it's like for babies when it's easy, but for actual entrepreneurs when hard. Well done, only in terms of "train"ing poeple to be railway entrepreneurs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125915390', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1516168481}
review:
Jogo muito fixe.
Mais uma vez os jogos indie a ganharem varios pontos pela originalidade e simplicidade, mas ao mesmo tempo viciante e com possibilidade de varias horas/dias sem nunca fartar.
Existe niveis com bastante dificuldade inserida, onde precisamos de estar atentos e ter uma estrategia definida.

A nivel gráfico simples, com cores pouco vibrantes apesar de tudo, mas apelativas.
Mas a melhor parte é mesmo a banda sonora original e perfeitamente adequada ao jogo em questão.

Jogabilidade: 8/10
Autonomia: 7/10
Visualização: 6/10
Sonolizaºão: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061200283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1499977496}
review:
A huge positive surprise!

Train Valley is a real-time puzzle game - you need to lay down tracks and manage your train departures while avoiding train crashes and going bankrupt. You can stop, start, and reverse trains and change which tracks they should take.

The gameplay is spectacular! It's generally fun and laid back - but sometimes also nervewrecking.
If you want to raise the dificulty level you can go for the additional challenges - or even some of the achievements.

The maps are cute and colourful and the music is very enjoyable.
I think this is the only game I've played where I just HAD to revisit nearly all the maps to get all the challenges and achievements. I'm looking VERY much forward to Train Valley 2 (reportedly coming first quarter of 2018)!

Train Valley gets a hearty recommendation from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996744560', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1570865300}
review:
A great little train-themed puzzle game with about 5 hours of classic play. 
I found the sandbox mode a bit boring but the classic mode is fun. 
It's definitely worth buying on sale if you like these kinds of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090566114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1467105013}
review:
不敢说是神作，但是非常合我的胃口，记得当初买来的时候一口气玩了两天玩通了。总的来说是非常有趣的游戏！

明年要出续作了，支持创意工坊，有兴趣的朋友可以去看看～

author: {'steamid': '76561198314196784', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 3567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1597194117}
review:
As other people have said, this is not a Sim or a Builder game, it's a puzzle game. You are given a limited playfield to work with and objectives to reach. I found the game very frustrating to start with, but also rewarding when I manage to progress. It's worth noting that you can pause the game and still lay track, order trains and set off trains, this gives you more time to think on the harder levels. The graphics are functional but pleasing to the eye.

Only issues I can think of is sometimes the objective text can be hard to see on white backgrounds and some of the measurements aren't super clear.

But overall I come back to this game more often than most it's a good way to kill half an hour at a time.

I only paid £1.74 for this so I do think it's worth waiting for a sale. But even at full price it's probably worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036945313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1503225270}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995946313', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1501451560}
review:
This [i]isn't[/i] a sim or a builder, there's not much economy here. it's a [b]logic puzzle[/b] game. Intensive and frustrating at times, but also fun.

The concept is interesting enough: lay down tracks and guide trains from A to B (and later on from C to F and from E to B and from F to B simultaneously) while balancing both budget and time. Don't go broke or trigger any fail-criteria (most often this entails crashing trains) until the time ends and you  pass the level, with extra stamps (the game's equivalent of stars) for its bonus criteria. All while on a [b]very[/b] space-constrained map, where terrain features will make some connections impossible, and others too expensive to build. What is there of the mentioned eras and locations is expressed purely through graphics and rolling stock, the gameplay doesn't change.

The initial levels are simple and fun, but later on it gets tough. Not for the easily frustrated, because you'll be replaying some levels over and over until you find a solution that works. The game makes that a bit harder though, because on every replay the level is slightly altered: stations activate in different order and of course the exact sequence of trains is never the same.

The frustration kicks in in the later (and longer) levels, when the trains start going off on their own because you kept them waiting too long.Then you're frantically trying to arrange the switches so that they don't get completely lost or crash, and with every next train on the tracks it gets more and more unworkable. And then you fail the level, restart and try again.

What you're actually managing here is what the "big" transport-builder games do for you automatically: start and stop trains, and toggle switches so that your trains reach the destination, leaving you to only plan and build. If you think it's fun - go for it. Otherwise stay with the transport builders you know and love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126081939', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1501089373}
review: This is really mixed experience 5/10. High base price tag seals it's fate. Like other people said this game is more targeted towards younger players, still older ones can have quite some fun too. The game is more about logic with some arcade then a serious strategy or management, still for most of the time the game is fun. The graphic is pretty basic, but sufficient, it's sad my intel integrated card cannot run this, still multi platform support is nice addition. Unfortunately sometimes game is frustrating. Forced departures are adding quite more spice to the game, but sometimes train is crashing to other train on same station, mostly when I rotate train at station, but also when computer releases faster train behind slower one. Other thing is the station spawn system, the computer has the habit to place stations on your rails and junctions, sometimes even crashing trains. On some levels one can guess where other stations will be spawned, but on some this is completely random. The sandbox mode is endless. Although it gives completely freedom at the end it's boring and pointless. The game could be longer (I've finished this in offline mode-you can check achievements), but it has some small replay value. I can recommend this game when you get it on sale, or if you have smaller child in home.

review:
Проблема с игрой как в linux Debian 9/10/11, так и в Windows 7/8.1.
Видеокарты nvidia 8600gt, 7600gt, 630gt. Драйвера установлены последние из поддерживаемых соответствующими картами и ОС.
Проблема заключается в том что поверх меню серый полупрозрачный прямоугольник почти на весь экран, а когда выбираешь "комнату" - получаю просто серый экран и ничего больше. 
Исправьте, а то купил ребёнку и облом. После устранения проблем отзыв поменяю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310053560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1499915546}
review: 全成就后，来评价一下。这是一款非常杀时间的休闲游戏，精力稍有不集中，就会撞车或错站，当然这也是游戏的一大乐趣，成就里就有一些与之相关。最难的成就应该就是清除300K建筑完成游戏/ 10辆车同时运行并完成游戏 /铺300轨道并完成游戏，要完成这三个成就，都需要刷张好图，尽可能保证主干道上无杂物。前期尽可能地增加班次，保证足够多的钱，尤其是清除300K建筑的成就，时间紧，钱确实有点不够用，这里建议用4-6关完成（这些在社区里的成就指南都有提到），铺300轨道我是用2-6关完成，尽可能把图铺满就没问题了。至于10辆车同时运行并完成游戏，我是参考@Uaral 的评测，用1-6关完成，前期攒钱，然后建临时轨道，把短节火车停在上面，最后同时让10辆车运行1-2秒即可。如果可以的话，尽可能别让火车全部撞毁（从5万亏至破产的教训= =），因此牺牲个别辆火车，再铺路把剩下火车运回比较现实。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029928404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4120, 'last_played': 1651327379}
review:
Great game! 5/5 Stars.
Train Valley is a puzzle/building sim game that tasks you with constructing a small-scale railroad connecting randomly-generated stations and successfully delivering trains to their required destinations. There is very little economy to worry about here; just don't go bankrupt and you're fine. This lets you perfect your railroading techniques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031158228', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1501092120}
review:
Nettes Spiel für Zwischendurch, aber durch total dumme Niederlage-Bedingungen muss ich negativ bewerten. Man verliert sofort wenn mit dem Finanzen ins Minus rutscht. Und zwar auf der Stelle. Es wäre ja toll gewesen, wenn die Entwickler zumindest eine Art "Timer" eingebaut hätten so dass man vielleicht 20-30 Sekunden Zeit hat. 

Ich empfehle das Spiel deshalb nicht, jeder der eine starke Frustrationsgrenze hat, darf es sich aber trotzdem antun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029930497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1535836784}
review: At first I enjoyed this game and found it quite addictive. Then I reached the final North American scenario and after my twentieth attempt to play it successfully I uninstalled this game having become completely frustrated with it. Everything is fun until trains in this scenario have a habit of setting off on their own accord causing collisions which wreck track and make the goals unachievable. Then as you attempt to rectify the damage caused ... same again! There just isn't the space or budget available to build enough track for trains to pass each other harmlessly on. Add to that the situation encountered further on in the Japan scenarios where trains regularly appear over which you have no control and one of the stations is located virtually on the edge of the screen / two of the others so close together one train will have no trouble stretching between them! My final verdict on this turkey is that it looks great on paper but the frustrations experienced whilst playing it killed the game completely for me ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1504009506}
review:

It is just fine, very indie and sober. Somehow cute, yet too casual to give it a 7. No bugs per say, but objects collisions are normal in it, and the visual style is a bit impersonal.
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]AUDIO[/b]

[i]music, sound effects, voice-over, audio balance, subtitles...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]4/10[/b]

I feel sorry for the composer but I could not help but be annoyed by the musics, because of their repetitiveness and their not-so-casual-wannabee melodies, especially the Japan level which was Chinese-sounding... Since you can spend an hour on the same level to get it 100% complete, a loop of these is a pain. I ended up cutting it and putting my own music.
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]PLAY[/b]

[i]controls, difficulty, level design, luck-strategy-skill balance...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b]

Probably the most exciting thing in the game: a very simple gameplay where you put railroads and adjust the splits. Too simple at first (my fan-attitude for openttd yelled for signs!) you quickly accept its simplicity and end up enjoying it. It turns out to be a bit like FTL where you pause-and-play every second!
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]CONTENT[/b]

[i]story, world, solo immersion, multiplayer depth, overall idea...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]6/10[/b]

Nothing interesting, very casual, it's just fine. A bit too cliche maybe!
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]OTHER[/b]

[i]length, replayability, price, community, economics, devs...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b]

Game is a bit short yet sufficiently long enough to provide you fun, the price is really reasonable, the devs are lovely people...
[/td]

        [td][/td]
        [td][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]TOTAL[/b]

[i]Average sum with a secret formula to adjust nuances...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]69% - very interesting![/b]

I know, it almsost reached the GOOD section of 70%, but so many little flaws/casual aspects make it stay in the "very interesting" section: I think it is a great start for this studio, and they are already working on the 2nd one and I am confident this second one will be ranked much higher! For now, if you have time to give it a try, it is a very interesting indie game, with good oldschool challenge, a very good surprise!

review: You know it may be that when I was a small child I remember going into the media stores with my parents and always seeing old train games on the shelves, I always wanted one but never got any. This game fills that spot from when I was a kid wanting those games but never had the ability to play them. If you like simulation and management games, I say give this one a go. There is something charming and fun about it that will keep you entertained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066311208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 10885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3861, 'last_played': 1566222707}
review:
Review in English:
My rating: 8/10

Like Mini Metro, but have higher pressure and more frustration in this game.

Good:
1. Trains run like models in displaying.
2. The towns growth after received train services.
3. Very really switch control.
4. Easy to start.
5. Fast pace without undo, save, load,
6. Make plans for campaign levels.
7. If you are new in transportation games, go practice in sandbox, don't try campaign deep.

Bad:
1. VERY easy to lose the game from BANKRUPT.
1A. No debt or bond avaliable, if your cash down to 0, you lost.(Try to have more than 5k cash at ANYTIME, it hard, I know.)
1B. Classic campaign levels starts with low cash and very easy run to 0.
2. Classic campaign is HARD. Not only for all objectives, but also for survival.
2A. The extra objectives are not easy, have to try many times.(with little luck)
2B. With low cash, only few tracks/lines avaliable, NEVER make mistakes; if you do something wrong, you lose.
2C. Crash means lose, you wouldn't have enough cash to repair or recovery from the crash losses.
2D. Sometimes, trains may crash from your reverse order.
3. Easy start game with unfriendly diffcult.
3A. No diffcult options avaliable.
3B. With only few helps, newbies may fall into confusion and frustration than abandon or boo this game.
4. Bridges and tunnels are fixed and we can't build new bridges or tunnels by our own.(but even I can build, no money to do such job)
5. If you want to be a game maker, try NOT make a HARD game with cult/lovely looks.
6. Game may crash when you starting.
7. Sometimes, trains explode ITSELF!!!!!


Review in Mandarin:
你如果喜歡迷你捷運, 這個遊戲可以玩玩, 但壓力更大, 因為容錯率不高.

優點:
1. 像是火車模型一樣的遊戲地圖
2. 列車服務的城鎮會成長擴大.
3. 真實轉轍器控制.
4. 上手容易.
5. 節奏明快, 因為沒有反悔,存檔和讀取功能.
6. 經典戰役要好好計劃怎麼玩.
7. 如果是交通遊戲的新手,請由沙箱模式開始玩,不要輕易嘗試經典戰役中期(俄羅斯)之後關卡.

缺點:
1. 非常容易因為破產而直接失敗.
1A. 沒有貸款或債券, 現金一掉到0, 你直接輸.(請隨時保持5000以上現金週轉,政府的稅很重,別玩財務槓桿.)
1B. 經典模式戰役給的錢相當少,一不小心就破產了.
2. 經典戰役模式相當困難, 不單是要完成所有目標, 而是連基本的存活都有問題.
2A. 額外目標有的相當困難, 必須要多次嘗試, 和一點好運氣.
2B, 由於錢很少,因此能運用的鐵路線也不多. 永遠不要犯錯,你只要犯錯,就是只能重玩.
2C. 車禍就是破產,你沒有錢從車禍的傷害中恢復過來,也無法彌補車禍的連帶損失.
2D. 如果你命令火車調頭,火車有可能自毀.
3. 容易上手的遊戲卻在"經典模式"之中有著極不友善的難度.
3A. 沒有難度選項可以調整.
3B. 新手很容易因為建議和求助功能的不足而陷入困惑或挫折感, 最後放棄這個遊戲.
4. 隧道或橋梁只會出現在固定地點. 玩家不能自己建造隧道橋梁來增加額外選項.(不過應該也沒那個閒錢可以蓋新的隧道和橋樑就是.)
5. 如果你想當製作人,這個遊戲就是難度失控的典範, 請引以為戒.
6. 遊戲啟動時不定時當機.
7. 火車自己爆炸這種事情, 現在我可是看多了.

德國人一定以為全世界都是愛因斯坦,所以把遊戲難度弄很高很
正常嗎?

author: {'steamid': '76561198016868247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1500798081}
review:
Incredibly simple to play and fiendishly difficult to master. Picked this up on the cheap during the Steam Summer Sale 2017 and instantly loved it. Great game, and an awesome way to wile away a few hours trying to get that perfect score and third level stamp.

Can't wait for Train Valley 2!
