author: {'steamid': '76561198072145638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5672, 'last_played': 1638592350}
review:
First, and most importantly-- This is a puzzle game revolving around managing increasingly complex train lines and switches. This is NOT a railroad tycoon game. Mini Metro would be a closer analogy, though the two games are quite different.

It starts off simply as you route slow moving trains between a small number of stations. The difficulty ramps up considerably with an increase in train speeds/types, station quanities, difficult terrain, and challenging secondary objectives. (IE, Don't allow trains to arrive at the wrong station, no pausing, Dispatch X additional trains, etc...) 

Highly recommended for train and/or puzzle fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286017559', 'num_games_owned': 2641, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1480617929}
review:
Looking at it, you may think it's just a casual sim made for kids, with it's innocent looking graphics and fun style of art. You're mistaken that's what, it's a gut wrenching game that's absolutely terrifying with how hard it is, no matter how long you'll manage to keep the train going, your brain is going to die and you'll ess everything up I promise.



But it's pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114602905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 3444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3370, 'last_played': 1473975615}
review:
Train Valley

Интересный аркадный симулятор стрелочника :-)
В начале уровня есть два города, между ними вы прокладываете Ж/Д пути. Делаете стрелки перекрестки и пускаете поезда между этими городами. Каждый поезд необходимо доставить в определенный город.  И поначалу вы неплохо справляетесь со всеми логистическими задачами, но горда прибавляются по ходу игры, поезда не дождавшись вашей реакции стартуют сами. Чем выше уровень тем сильнее закипает мозг, вы начинаете метаться по карте пытаясь проследить путь поезда и переключить все стрелки так, что бы он ни с кем не столкнулся и добрался до нужной точки. Но посередине пути стартует другой поезд и цепляет ваш. В попытках избежать столкновения вы направляете состав по кругу и локомотив догоняет свой последний вагон и взрывается столкнувшись со своим же составом. Что бы было не так обидно, за это дадут вам ачивку. Городов на карте становиться все больше, места для путей все меньше, спасает режим паузы, когда вы можете остановить время составы и попытаться разобраться со всем, что вы натворили. 
Каждый поезд выезжает из города с определенной суммой, которая уменьшается каждую секунду, как только поезд достигает конечной точки оставшаяся сумма идет вам на счет. Имея деньги на счету вы можете строить новые пути, сносить старые, сносить постройки и т. д. Каждый игровой год с вашего счета списывается налог. И вот тут очень большой косяк в игре, который проявляется особенно в начале уровня. Налог списывается в самый не подходящий момент, когда вы все деньги истратили на строительство путей, а вышедший поезд не успел добраться до города. Причем в некоторых ситуациях доходит до маразма поезд уже скрылся из виду в городе куда должен прибыть, но деньги вам насчет еще не пришли, а налог списался — все конец игры вы в минусе начинайте сначала. Конечно пока таможня проверит груз, пока логистики проверят пак листы, в общем если уж поезд добрался то можно подождать со списанием налогов, пока деньги не поступят. Второй момент время игре не пропорционально событиям. Поезд запросто может добираться пару лет до нужного города. 
DLC дает набор нескольких сюжетных карт в Германии. Стоит дороговато для своего содержания. Но для любителей повыбивать все ачивки - без него не получите нескольких. Лучше брать все вместе и по скидке.
Графика не блещет, не пиксели, но и не впечатляет, для такой игры пойдет. Музыка не напрягает, но и не откладывается.

Хотите побыть в роли стрелочника, разобраться со всеми путями и стрелками — заходите попробовать. Парой вечеров не обойдется, из-за проблем с поступлением средств на счет придется попотеть побольше. 
6 поездов не туда из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198080665452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1647054479}
review:
Bei "Train Valley" geht es darum, die eigenen Strecken und Wege zu optimieren, neue Ziele auf der Karte anzufahren und die Züge heil und sicher an den Endbahnhof zu bringen. Dabei nimmt die Kniffligkeit der einzelnen Level zu und auch die Herausforderungen werden schwieriger zu erfüllen.
Das Spiel ist für all die geeignet, die Puzzlespiele mögen. Das Streckenbauen in Knuffeloptik ist zwar im Eisenbahnsetting, aber die Mechanik ist ganz klar keine Fahrplansimulation. 

Die Umsetzung ist schön, die Bahnhöfe werden selbständig ausgebaut, manchmal tut sich auch anderes auf der Karte. Auch der Rest ist toll aufgemacht. In einem Briefmarkenalbum sammelt man Stempel (also Auszeichnungen), die Länder auf den Marken stehen für die Levels und passen definitiv zur Zielgruppe. Natürlich ist das keine High-End-Graphik, aber wer braucht das schon für so ein Spiel.

Wer gerne Strecken baut, das Zugsetting mag und grunsätzlich Puzzlespiele auch, der bekommt ein schönes familientaugliches Spiel mit steigendem Kniffelfaktor.

review:
Petit jeu sympathique pour qui aime les trains et les petits puzzles.
Les défis rajoutent le piquant qui aurait pu manquer car pouvoir stopper ses trains, continuer après un accident ou aller dans la mauvaise gare n'est pas si pénalisant à mon goût.
Se termine assez vite, mais obtenir tous les badges ne se fait pas du premier coup !

review: Este juego me pareció entretenido desde que ví a mi hermano jugarlo. Pero cuando inicié el primer nivel me consumió por completo jugandolo casi todo el día, trantando de completar los logros y aun intento completar algunos. Tiene una gran mecánica de juego, colores agradables a la vista y explotar trenes es de lo más placentero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119427353', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1640348226}
review: Hra zabaví, ale když ji dohrajete celou tak už je to nuda. (případ mě :-) ) Občas se hodně naštvete, když vám třeba exploduje pár vlaků za sebou, nebo když už po několikáté zapomenete přehodit výhybku. Když už si hru koupíte doporučil bych po dohrání dokoupit sadu pátou Německo, jinak by jste přišli o skvělí zážitek ze hry :-). author: {'steamid': '76561197972597927', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1476876954}
review:
La verdad es que no esperaba mucho de este juego ya que es un indie sobre el que no hay mucha información en español.Realmente lo compré porque me gustan mucho los trenes.

Pues bien,es un señor juegazo.Realmente el juego encaja muy bien con el famosa frase "fácil de jugar ,díficil de dominar" 

Por un lado tienes que construir las vías y los cambios de agujas de la manera más eficiente posible y por otro,debes estar muy atento para dar la orden de salida a los trenes en el momento adecuado para que no choquen.

No es un juego de gestión económica ya que solo debes tener cuidado de no arruinarte, es más bien un juego de planificación rápida y destreza mental.

Por cierto,los gráficos son muy vistosos y la música es muy pegadiza.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022462326', 'num_games_owned': 2123, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1480154746}
review:
殺時間的火車小遊戲 
遊戲中玩家最主要的兩個使命

1.蓋好鐵軌
路線玩家可以隨意規劃
但其實這大同小異因為金錢有限制 
你沒辦法蓋出太複雜/方便的鐵軌路線

2.注意好你的火車
遊戲有個很雞婆的設定 只是被火車壓過的入口的指標方向都會被改變
所以你每台火車要跑前都要注意一次路線是否正確
不然它進到錯誤的車站
就會被退回到軌道上 如果剛好又有其他班次再跑 就會撞再一起

基本上就是個調度員模擬器
要顧好每一台火車 別讓它出事
盡量讓火車早點出發 不然會被扣錢

遊戲機制真的超單純 就是要有耐性的注意火車路線正確 
但通常沒耐性如我 一直放班次出來就很容易撞車... 然後就悲劇了

* 覺得時間太多 或是需要分散心思 有折扣時可以考慮入手
* 風格與音樂都相當童話風 給小朋友玩也相當ok

review: This is a fun game with a simple concept. Make sure all the trains get to the station they need too, sounds easy enough. It starts off that way, but quickly becomes much more difficult and you can lose track of trains fairly easily. It is a fun and easy game to pick up and if you don't have much time you can pick it up and attempt a level they usually are not too long, but sometimes it can be easy to fail.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198262550567', 'num_games_owned': 3257, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2973, 'last_played': 1483806526}
review:
[h1]这是一款非常棒的策略游戏[/h1]
       很容易上瘾！
       游戏中你需要铺设铁轨连接各个站点，同时还要控制协调好每个岔道，调度各列火车让其安全准确地通过岔道，分别到达各个目标站点。玩Train Valley「火车山谷」考验的是你的大局观和反应能力。后期的关卡难度较高，稍有不慎就会手忙脚乱全线崩溃。进错站，列车相撞，简直家常便饭，每时每刻都会让你感到智商受到碾压。为了拿到满分，有的关卡甚至需要重复几十遍。不过，每当通过一关后看到又有一张邮票盖满三个邮戳时，那种成就感真是超级赞！
       游戏自带简中，人翻的，非机翻，好评赞一个。游戏中每个历史时期的BGM非常契合时代特色，听起来很有代入感。总之，这是一款非常棒的策略游戏，值得推荐。喜欢策略经营模拟游戏的朋友可以入手试一试。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009901736', 'num_games_owned': 1578, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1540833099}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960270054', 'num_games_owned': 2270, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1479955642}
review:
Train Valley nails the simple game mechanics + good execution = fun gameplay formula. There isn't much to Train Valley, you can build tracks, start or stop trains, and toggle switches between tracks. The real fun in the game lies in trying to reach the level goals and achievements. Complete the level without ever stopping a train or maximize your efficiency to make as much money as possible. It has a lot of parallels with tower defense games. You want to build you train tracks in an efficient layout, connecting all your stations in all directions, but using the minimum amonut of space. You only want to spend money on new track when you have to, using surplus cash to send extra trains for even more money.

Overall a solid recommendation. Especially if you enjoy the mazing and profit min/maxing parts of tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968095997', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 245, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1478721751}
review:
Sranda odreagovačka. Princíp hru je jednoduchý. Existujú a pribúdajú stanice, z ktorých vyrazí vláčik a ten je nutný dostať čo najrýchlejšie do príslušnej stanice. To sa deje stavaním koľají a smerovaním výhybok, tak aby sa mašinky nezrazili. V postupe hrou sa zvyšuje počet staníc, počet mašiniek a zmenšuje sa miesto na stavanie trate.

Nič svetoborného, ale náš malý miluje mašinky a pri tomto mi sedel na klíne a pozoroval a komentaval všetko, čo sa dialo.
Škoda toho plateného DLC, ktoré pridá iba nejakú tú jednu kapitolu z Nemecka. 

Celkom pálka za repetitíny kus, ktorý človek odohrá predým v základe. Pre hardcore hráčov asi nepatričné, ale pre oddych, malé deti, alebo manželky ideálne.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972254465', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1656, 'last_played': 1479550681}

author: {'steamid': '76561198155096907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1555769758}
review: 作为一个轨道交通工作者莫名的玩着这款游戏有种使命感QAQ上帝视角规划线路安排车次，是一款真正的策略游戏（注意年税别破产！别撞车！），画面一般不粗糙，音乐虽然就那一首但是玩个把小时也听不腻。第一章欧洲比较简单，后面的慢慢就得让人全神贯注的去经营了，会有点累，建议不要纠结3个章，下次玩的时候完成没过的那个任务最后就能3章通关了累加的。游戏很好玩我给86/100的分数

author: {'steamid': '76561198002401740', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1612243913}
review:
Wow. It's a lot of puzzle, planning out routes, getting timings down, and thinking that your routes look pretty nice when - oh god, these 2 stations don't connect to each other, quickly let's fix it before - curses, I forgot to move the switch and now this other train is moving in the wrong direction.

Overall, it's a pretty good game. I just played 4 levels and already I can feel the difficulty rising, but not so much that I want to throw out this game. And when you've had enough of the train madness, you can do sandbox mode, where you go to that map you love and hate so much and build tracks everywhere, then relax as you can literally send trains anywhere.

The main attraction/gameplay of this is building tracks at the right places, sending out trains at the right time, and flipping switches accordingly, all while making sure you don't go bankrupt. If you get this game expecting anything else you will be disappointed, but otherwise as a puzzle junkie this is great stuff for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024611733', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1480857637}
review: Train Valley je ideální lehká strategie pro casual hraní, tedy pokud máte rádi vláčky a železnici a baví vás přehazovat výhybky a stavět koleje. O tom přesně takhle hra je, spojovat různá nádraží, starat se, aby vlaky dospěly do cíle a abyste pokud možno vydělali nějaké peníze. Jeden level vám zabere tak 15-30 minut a autoři jich do zásoby připravili dostatek. Vyhrát level s jeho podmínkami není úplnou samozřejmostí. Snad jediný zápor v tého hře za sympatickou cenu je možnost prohrát úroveň kvůli bankrotu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254486135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1599417463}
review:
After watching a YouTube review by TotalBiscuit of this game, I purchased it as he said without the expectation of the realism set down by other games such as Rail Tycoon, etc.  but rather for the "frustrating enjoyment" of playing this style of game.  As a model railroader, I do not hold this game on par but I have so far thoroughly enjoyed it after already putting a number of hours into play.  Parts of the interaction are predictable in many respects, such as the not-so-much random scheduling of trains, that only makes the challenge much more enjoyable to overcome.  I have already completed my levels but I find myself going back to replay in attempts to unlock additional achievements.

I'm new to Steam, and a more mature person in age than probably most here so I have to struggle to keep up with the "younger generation" but I still recommend this game.  I need to learn how to find out about any add-ons or expansion packs for Train Valley so I can keep on playing!

My many thanks and appreciation to the the developers for their hard work and for taking an active part in the player forums!!  I look forward to continuing to be a part of the Train Valley community!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036064023', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1476051823}
review:
So i do not like the game, but the game itself is great, let me explain

if you like Micromanaging and multitasking you might like this little puzzle game, but if you like macromanaging this game i would absolutely not recommend, the only macro aspect in this game is to be able to choose how you want to connect the different stations, that's it, after that its only micro micro and more micro, to quote Direwolf20 "i like my games to play themselves", so definitely good if you like this kind of stressing game with constant pressure, but if you want some train macromanagement, you should play the great OpenTTD wich is free.

also the trailer does not reveal what kind of game really this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268158407', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1477917413}
review:
首先这不是一款休闲游戏，这是一款标标准准的策略类游戏
它是具有一定难度的（尤其第四章日本和DLC的第五章德国，后期几个关卡相当有难度）
玩这个游戏，需要耐心，需要一遍一遍的尝试，寻求最优解决方案
游戏的可玩性很高，许多关卡都是值得反复玩的

推荐人群：
+有足够耐心的玩家
+策略类、模拟建设类游戏爱好者
+强迫症患者

不推荐人群：
-喜欢爽快刺激、快节奏的玩家
-如果你受不了一遍又一遍的反复玩一张地图，别买
-不喜欢解谜、益智等类型游戏的玩家
-手残党慎入

author: {'steamid': '76561198261056397', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1517974769}
review: 列车play（手动滑稽）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198021572445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1487102943}
review:
Love the idea, hate the execution.

It has a really weird loose condition: you can't have negative balance, like in all other economy based games, resulting in regular and spontaneous "You are bankrupt" pop ups, while you have 4 really expensive trains on there way to the stations. Usually it happens because you had to expand new rail tracks really long to a new trains station and spend all the money. And than after a minute the tax comes and makes you a bankrupt. So you have to always keep an amount of money on your bank account to not let it happen, though the amount is always growing during the level, so you have to guess or loose.
Can't imagine play testers did not mention it while on development. 

It also has a typical Unity bug: it works really terrible on a dual monitor PC. So you are most likely have to change windows registry to be able to play the game. Also, the devs were not of a particular help here.

The UI even on a regular 1920p monitor is tiny and unintuitive. I have a 27' monitor and it's hard to spot most essential gameplay information when you need to. The tools icons are like 20 pixels at the top of the screen and the new train icon on the station (most essential gameplay ui element in the game) is like 5.

Track building tools are rather unresponsive, far from polished.

The lack of a proper tutorial is a pain also.

It's sad, that developers didn't put enough effort here. The game plays rather nice even with all these problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326099065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1480051829}

review: Gra niemalże doskonała. Jednocześnie prosta i będąca dużym wyzwaniem. Mimo wysiłku, jaki trzeba włożyć, by ukończyć misję z wykonanym każdym wyzwaniem, chce się do niej tyle razy podchodzić, by w końcu się to udało.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102791015', 'num_games_owned': 3732, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1477394266}
review:
仔细想想，其实是很简单重复性也很高的游戏，但就是很有魔性玩得停不下来。
每关三个额外要求可以分开达成，但一般一次达成也不算太难，只要不浪，多用暂停，保持1倍速就行了。
强迫症看着整齐的铁路和井井有条行驶的列车就是有莫名的快感。
但后期很多车站离得太近，铁路得撘的七拐八扭的非常不爽。
想要全成就得补dlc。进包后8块也能收到本体吧，然而dlc史低就要8块.....暂时还是放弃了

author: {'steamid': '76561198291876920', 'num_games_owned': 8250, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1499900553}
review:
这是一款会中毒的游戏。
为了每个关卡拿满分，你会重复个几百遍。
感觉智商已经被碾压。。
铁轨虽然能拆 ，但总得来说是没法倒退的。每做一步都得认真想好，考验大局观 。
这不是火车模拟，是一款策略经营模拟游戏。很不错 ，值得推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198012833532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 756, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1605631358}
review: Not a building strategy as it might seem on a first glance, but logic puzzle directing trains to right stations, switching track, building them so more trains can pass without coliding... it is a simple concept but very catchy, I am surprised noone thought of this before. For a few bucks, it is a great game to play for a few minutes every day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1476996917}
review:
Eigentlich müsste Train Valley genau mein Spiel sein. Leider ist das Spiel nicht einmal ansatzweise zu Ende gedacht. 

Im Prinzip baut man seine Routen auf denen die Züge fahren sollen und bestimmt wann die Züge losfahren sollen. Ich hätte jetzt ein schönes Puzzlespiel erwartet welches idealerweise nett anzuschauen ist (ähnlich zu Flight Control).

Leider konnte ich auch nach vier Stunden Spielzeit keinen Indikator für die Zuglänge entdecken. Manche Züge sind kurz und manche länger. Da es auf den kleinen Karten schnell eng wird kam es bei mir deshalb ständig zu Unfällen. Unfälle führten dann eigentlich immer dazu, dass ich einige Ziele nicht erreichen konnte. → Neustart 

Wenn ich es nicht besser wüsste, fahren manche Züge auch schneller als andere. Hier muss man dann wieder Glück haben. → Neustart

Ich wage es auch zu behaupten, dass manche Züge langsamer oder sogar später losfahren als andere. Wie man das erkennt konnte ich nicht erkennen. → Neustart

Noch mehr Glück braucht man, wenn man Schienen baut. Nicht nur dass sich der Bau irgendwie merkwürdig steuert, fallen auch immer mal wieder Steuern an. Da man nicht sehen kann wie hoch diese sind, war ich des öfteren Pleite. → Neustart

Das Train Valley ein Glücksspiel ist, hätte ich ausgehend der Produktbeschreibung nicht gedacht.

2/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197975944450', 'num_games_owned': 2199, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1601736323}
review:
Ce "petit jeu" de gestion est bien sympathique!
Il s'agit "seulement" de construire les voies et de gérer le trafic et les aiguillages mais on se laisse vite prendre au jeu justement (en tous cas ça a marché sur moi) ! Les gares sont placées aléatoirement par l'ordinateur et de nouvelles sont posées pendant la partie, à vous de faire le nécessaire pour que les trains arrivent à bon port.
Ce n'est certes pas le jeu du siècle mais il permet de s'amuser quelques heures...

author: {'steamid': '76561198172315534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1476836822}
review: A simple, relaxing, casual game. The goal is to build a train track that will transport trains to their designated station colors before you run out of money. More stations pop up over the course of a level, so you must modify your track to adjust while keeping the trains moving and making you money. Not very difficult, enough to be engaging without being frustrating. There is no plot here, just navigating waves of trains until the level is complete. Got this in a humble bundle, and I have to say, it's nice to play a carefree game like this on occasion.

review:
なにもない場所に勝手に駅が生えてきて勝手にどこそこ行きと
行き先の決まった列車が充填され勝手に発車しようとするので
押っ取り刀で用地買収から線路の敷設までこなしてポイントの
切り替えで列車を目的地まで誘導する面クリア型パズルゲー

駅に線路を繋がないまま放置しててもそこで生まれた列車が
「もう我慢出来ない！」って勝手に見切り発車しちゃって
当然駅を出た瞬間に線路が途切れて大事故起こすんだけど
堪え性がないにもほどがあるだろう一体なにを考えてるんだ

中学生男子の性欲の暗喩かなにかか

author: {'steamid': '76561197976784888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1476289464}
review:
WARNING! PUZZLE GAME!

(Received with the humble monthly bundle)

The train part only consists of closed scripted maps per level and the sandbox mode only shows the same closed level maps... I don't know if you can rotate the map as the trailer shows.

You have to manage yourself the train crossing and beware of trains going out of stations on their own, or else  your tracks will explode everywhere, Michael Bay style.

As other said, il you like fast speed strategy games, this one will be hard enough for you. Take a first look at some let's play before buying it...

Bonus point for colorblind mode!

Oh, and the tutorial is very light : you can pause the game to better think of your strategy!

review: I expected to enjoy this, as I usually enjoy management games, but it just didn't seem to grab me. The UI was a bit clunky and I only got through a level or two before getting bored. Crashed trains a lot, which was fairly entertaining to a certain extent, but overall not hugely impressed. Maybe I could've given it more of a chance, but I don't think this one's for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067040348', 'num_games_owned': 1198, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1522121702}
review:
Train Valley was one of the best surprises I've gotten from Humble Monthly so far, I have no idea why I love it as much as I do but I suspect it's a combination of the music and the torturous simple difficulty of the whole affair. You get 3 goals per map, and you can progress to the next one without completing all of them, or at least I suspect you can. Personally, if i fail to complete one of the objectives, or if I cause a collision or go bankrupt, I usually descend into a gibbering cursing madness for a few seconds with cries of "FUCK THIS GAME" or something similar, but then I'm right back at it.

Summarized in Haiku:

Train tracks by a stream
Yellow train collides with red
Fuck you Train Valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1476561116}
review:
No, I don't personally like nor recommend [i]Train Valley[/i] but oh boy does my wife play the crap out of it. [b]Moral of the story: this game definately appeals to some folks in a serious way.[/b]

[i]Essentially, this title is a pure puzzle game - the train part is just a skin.[/i] If you are here because you like trains, do yourself a favor and see yourself out now. If you like puzzles in the same vein as [i]Mini Metro[/i], keep reading. You build tracks, and tell trains when to stop and start all while helping them get to their destination. As you play a level (which can be completely seen on one screen), a few new hubs pop up as time goes on. There are three goals per level, which each earn you a stamp in your train book. You manage money, to a certain extent. [b]This game is difficult, so beware.[/b]

[i]Why don't I like it?[/i] Well I find it incredibly tedious to juggle everything in my head, and often, one mistake makes you totally want to start over. Whether it was because you missed out on a stamp/goal, or because it ruined the flow of your play. I also think the track laying mechanic/controls could be substantially better. Yeah, you get used to it after a couple of hours, but c'mon this isn't rocket science.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Although it can be quite difficult, this feels and plays like a zen puzzler; definately charming
+Music is great - BUT man they need to put some dead air in there sometimes - it's on a constant loop and you will start to go nuts after an hour or so
+Easy to learn, very difficult to master

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Out of all the puzzle games I've played, I don't really find this all that addicting, personally
-Music is great - BUT man they need to put some dead air in there sometimes - it's on a constant loop and you will start to go nuts after an hour or so
-No controller support

[b]It's certainly a niche game. If you find yourself intrigued still, I'd go for it.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970880630', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1490036379}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040842672', 'num_games_owned': 3000, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1476027075}
review:
Train Valley is a fun casual puzzle game. The screenshots and Steam tags may give you the impression that it's a management sim/tycoon game, but this is not really the case.

The core gameplay is fun enough. You build tracks to connect the various stations and then try to get each train to the right destination by manipulating the railroad switches. During each level new stations will keep popping up, forcing you to expand your rail network.

Your main goal in each level is simply to avoid going bankrupt (this is pretty easy for the most part). Additionally, each level has three bonus objectives that provide extra challenges. Some levels also have special trains arriving from outside the map. All in all there's enough variety to keep things interesting for a single playthrough.

My main issue with the game is the fairly high level of randomness. For the most part this is not really a problem as the game is pretty easy anyway, but in the later levels bad luck can really mess you up. This is not really something I enjoy in a puzzle game.

Overall I found Train Valley a pretty enjoyable experience. I'd recommend it to anyone who likes light puzzle games.

The good:
- Fun puzzle gameplay
- Rather relaxing experience

The bad:
- Too many random elements
- Building tracks is somewhat imprecise
- Some of the later levels get rather micromanagement heavy

author: {'steamid': '76561198006261345', 'num_games_owned': 1089, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1476462153}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036130561', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1478653016}
review:
嗯，這是一個接鐵軌讓火車跑來跑去然後撞在一起的益智遊戲
關卡制，每關有三個目標，不過不達成然後不要破產到過關也可以，非常輕鬆的遊戲

接鐵軌有分進入的方向，不過最多就兩個，後期可能有紅綠燈很方便..但是火車的長度 噁 煩躁
本來期待是transport tycoon那種等級，差很多...頂多是對撞一樣的舒爽

不太確定這遊戲到底要幹嘛，不是真的經營，蓋鐵軌又要錢還要繳稅，真的要認真開鐵軌各火車又不怎麼想聽你的指令
想放鬆的玩，會被三個目標壓迫心神，開了沙盒模式連賺錢的意義都沒了

題外話 TT的設計是排好之後讓火車自己走 這個是發車順序不固定外加必須靠人力調控啟動與否...應該是MINIMETRO風但是很傷神

author: {'steamid': '76561198058754123', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1481050602}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067937537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1475765335}
review:
While it might not look like it but Train Valley is one of the best puzzle games that I have played in quite a while.

What makes Train Valley stand out is that while it is pretty simplistic it is still challenging. All you do in the game is build tracks and guide the trains towards their destination. The fun comes from creating the routes and juggling multiple trains at the same time while trying to keep them from crashing into one another and running out of money. Train Valley does a great job of being a relaxing game that still challenges you.

I would classify Train Valley as an easy to play but hard to master game. It is not that hard to beat the levels in Train Valley but it becomes quite hard to 100% some of the later levels so there is quite a bit of challenge if you want it. Length wise the game includes 24 levels and should take at least six to eight hours to complete. I found Train Valley enjoyable enought though that I actually wanted to try and complete as many of the additional objectives as I could which can add quite a bit of time to the game. 

If you are looking for a train simulation game or don't really like puzzle games, Train Valley is not going to be for you. If the game's premise sounds interesting though I think you will really enjoy Train Valley. 

If you would like to read my full review check out [url=http://www.geekyhobbies.com/train-valley-indie-game-review/] Geeky Hobbies [/url] .

review: Juste énorme, si vous aimez Mini Metro, alors ce jeu est fait pour vous, il est tout simplement bien meilleur, pourtant j'adore mini metro, mais quand on a fait deux ou trois parties on a plus envie de jouer alors qu'avec train valley on a pas envie de s'arrêter !

author: {'steamid': '76561198013405601', 'num_games_owned': 981, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1481936645}
review:
Full Review at http://www.blotgaming.com/game-reviews/train-valley-review/

At first glance and after playing tycoon games with vast maps it’s easy to think this game is for the young.  We were challenged within the third level, losing trains and going bankrupt.

The logistical nightmare is just so much fun and you’ll find the stress of managing so much lingering in your chest. 

Train Valley is only $9.99 USD ($13 AUD) this game is easily worth $20 USD in our books.  It’s a bargain price and you’ll re-visit this over and over.  Amazing effort from the 3 man team.

9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023315190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1557961297}
review:
I haven't played this in over probably 6 months, (except for a quick demo to a friend). I really enjoyed the puzzles the game presents, the music, the art too. Once I've built the system I hope will work for the scenario I enjoy pushing out twice the amount of trains the rails can handle and franticly direct them to their destinations. After a while I notice my stiff back, check the clock, and panic after 3 hours have flown by. Great puzzle game with all the excitement I could want! Or even not want; It has a sandbox mode. 

There also have been numerous updates and more levels added since I purchased.

I highly suggest trying the demo if you aren't sure. It will hook you too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098628362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1502304006}
review:
Je suis très en retard mais je m'en fou, je vais donner mon avis quand même. Je vais le résumer et après le détailler.

JEU DE MERDE

J'ai l'intention de demander un remboursement. Si vous pensez achetez ce jeu, donnez vous 4 ou 5 bon coup poings dans la tête et repensez y. Car il ne faut pas que vous achetiez ce jeu. Il ne faut pas envoyer le message au développeurs que ceci est un bon jeu car non, il ne l'est pas et si on leur envoi le message que c'est bien, ils vont continuer à en faire et il ne faut absolument pas que ça arrive. Jetez plutôt votre argent par la fenêtre, ça vaut mieux.

Je suis désoler pour tous ceux qui ont fait une bonne critique de ce jeu, pour les joueurs qui y ont jouer et apprécier mais vous avez des problèmes mentaux et vous devez aller consulter.

Pour les  développeurs, reconsidérez votre carrière. Parce que le développement de jeux vidéos, c'est pas fait pour vous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154628252', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1473934974}
review:
Train Valley is a great little game that's easy to pick up and tricky to get right. Developed by Alexey Davydov, Sergey Dvoynikov, and Timofey Shargorodskiy. Some of you might know Davydov from another great game called Scrap Garden. The early levels of Train Valley are extremely simple, the difficulty ramps up quickly and you'll soon find yourself struggling to complete all the objectives. The game is balanced out perfectly, everything fits together very well, and the sound adds a certain ambiance that really makes it shine.

Pros
+ Fun game for when you don't have enough time
+ Easy to understand controls
+ Pretty graphics and scenery
+ Good sound effects

Cons
- It gets hard pretty fast

Read the rest of my review here: http://www.keengamer.com/article/14181_train-valley-review#rating

author: {'steamid': '76561197992229015', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1474550029}
review:
Train Valley is a surprisingly good title for not a whole lot of money. You just need to have the right expectations.

This is no ecosim, it's a light puzzler with trains. Your goal is to connect the different train yards, of which more will pop up during any given scenario (always in the same place, but at possibly different times each time you retry the level, i.e. upper right instead of lower left and vice versa). Your only tool are tracks and demolition. This is complicated by the terrain and already present tiles with buildings, etc. on them, which makes construction a lot more expensive if you want/need to go through instead of around. After that it's "simply" a matter of sending out trains to the correct stations by manipulation of the railroad switches and avoiding crashes. Easier said than done sometimes.

Trains will "spawn" after a set amount of time (indicated in the bottom right) and automatically leave the station if all stations have spawned trains already (i.e. you were either sleeping or you spawned extra trains and couldn't get them out in time). This can have dire consequences. The longer a train waits and travels the more of its monetary value it will lose. Since the game deducts a yearly fee (and the year goes by very quickly) you can end up bankrupt thus forfeiting the level completely, which means restarting from the very beginning, since there are no check points nor is manual saving a thing.

Add to that 3 different bonus goals (fixed) for each level (spawn x additional trains, earn x amount of money, don't let a train go to the wrong station, don't press pause, etc.) and the game can become quite hectic, despite the availability of a pause feature. It is still easy to misjudge a train's speed though and send out the next too early, so they crash. The switches get out of hand in later levels, so mistakes are easily made, especially since any train going over a switch that does not have to be changed automatically aligns it as well, which can spell trouble for the following train if you're not on your guard.

Crashes are pretty bad most of the time since they not only mean the train and money is lost forever, but you also have to rebuild the tracks, meaning even more money is lost. You could easily go bankrupt until the next train reaches its destination. However, you can stop a train and even turn it around at almost any given time, but of course this has other negative effects like loss of money and time.

If you like a challenge or want to speed things up, you can do so by up to 4 times the regular speed (2x and 4x speed). Do not press the pause button and see if you can survive ;)

The DLC "Germany" adds a new chapter to Europe, America, Russia and Japan, complete with new trains, new hazards and new music. Every region in the game features its own soundtrack and some levels have interesting hazards to play around with, for example unstoppable speed trains, or even bombing runs. Well worth it in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1468487175}
review:
[h1]Train Valley - Êtes-vous un bon chef de gare ?[/h1]

A vrai dire, vous êtes plus qu’un chef de gare, vous êtes le coordinateur des chemins de fer d’une région. 

C’est vous qui construisez les lignes, c’est vous qui décidez du trajet des trains (histoire d’éviter les collisions), vous gérez aussi les départs et vous veillez à ce qu’ils partent à temps.

Au début, c’est simple avec 2 ou 3 gares à gérer mais quand vous avez le double plus des obstacles naturels, plus des trains et encore des trains, un moment, il vaut mieux mettre le jeu en pause et réfléchir aux priorités.

J’adore ce jeu, il est tout simplement très addictif avec une réalisation soignée aux petits oignons. Bref, c’est du travail de qualité... et le tout avec un prix très attractif.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=736704065

[url=www.graal.fr/2016/07/15/test-train-valley-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur Train Valley.[/url]

This is a great little game that's easy to pick up and tricky to get right. While the early levels are extremely simple, the difficulty ramps up quickly and you'll soon find yourself struggling to complete all the objectives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132708477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1679305483}
review:
Fun, challenging and amazing little game. If your like me and want to get the best score in each level it can get a bit harder and sometimes just really make you almost wanna rage quit :P. But yeah im really enjoying the game love trains and this is a fun game with trains in it :D! Really worth buying, levels are challenging and fun to play, scenery of the levels is beautiful too look at, train designs are pretty cool too, its also cool that they have multiple train designs. The game also has a sandbox mode haven't used it myself but there are probably some people who might find that fun too :)! Im just going to stick to the campaign mode :)!

9/10 Worth buying if u like trains :)!


Edit: Forgot to mention that this game also has different centuries. So for example the first few levels are from the 1800s and the more you progress the further you get with the time. Also the game has different environments so your not sticking to one place for the whole game. They actually take you through alot of continents, for example the first few levels are based in countries in Europe after you complete those levels the next continent will be America and so on, it doesn't STICK with one level design throughout the whole game it actually CHANGES from designs, trains, continents and even countries which makes this a fun little game :)! WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS GAME!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042029841', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1471763585}
review:
[h1]Nota: 8/10[/h1]

Eu queria muito dar nota 10 para esse jogo, mas eu vou explicar o porquê da nota ao longo da análise.

[b]O jogo é demais![/b] Eu confesso que fiquei com um pouco de medo de comprar. Mesmo sendo amante de jogos puzzle, pois existem muuuuitos puzzles ruins, ou clichês por aí na internet... Vide Bejeweled, por exemplo, que é copiado diariamente.

Pois bem, [b]o jogo é basicamente conseguir conectar as estações das cidades e fazer com que os trens cheguem em segurança em cada uma dessas estações[/b]. Parece fácil, mas fazer com que os trens não batam não é tão simples como parece! Se o trem demorar muito para chegar na estação designada, o valor que você ganha da entrega vai diminuindo até chegar a $0, o que pode te levar a falência e, consecutivamente, a perder a fase.

Com o passar do tempo as telas vão te dando inúmeros desafios! Número cada vez maior de estações, obstáculos naturais [i](como lagos, rios, etc)[/i]. Além desse objetivo principal de levar os trens com segurança, [b]cada tela tem objetivos bônus[/b]. Esses sim são difíceis de se conseguir e variam de tela para tela.

Chega uma hora que você fica tão compenetrado no jogo que você esquece do mundo! [b]É o tipo de jogo perigoso, que te prende na frente do PC[/b], HAHAHA. Cheguei a ficar até pensando em estratégias mesmo depois de fechar o jogo, para ver tamanho vício que o jogo me proporcionou. xD

A única coisa que, infelizmente me fez baixar a nota do jogo é que [b]ele é MUITO pequeno![/b] Eu até espantei quando comecei a jogar e vi a quantidade de telas que ele tinha. Cheguei a pensar [i]"ah, eu preciso desbloquear algo para jogar telas novas”[/i], mas não! Ele é pequeno mesmo. [i](in)[/i]Felizmente a empresa já lançou uma DLC que adiciona novas telas! Estou aguardando um pouco para comprar, mas com certeza irei.

Além da falta de telas, achei o incentivo dos objetivos extras muito pequeno. Não que não seja legal tentar faze-los, só que após isso, [b]o jogo não te oferece mais nada![/b] Tem um modo endless, mas não é tão gostoso, porque chega uma hora que você consegue [i]"chegar a perfeição"[/i] dos seus trilhos e caminhos, fazendo que o jogo passe a ser repetitivo...

Há também um modo chamado [i]"livre"[/i] que [b]é totalmente sem graça[/b], é meio que um [i]sandbox[/i], serve apenas para você testar caminhos e estratégias. Não vale nada, não tem desafio algum, os trens podem colidir à vontade, atrasar à vontade...

[b]Eu não tenho do que reclamar do jogo em si[/b], mas acho que por ser um puzzle, deveria ter uma gama maior de telas e modos de jogo para que não se transforme naqueles jogos que você acaba ficando triste por finaliza-lo por saber que não haverá mais nada para ser feito. Ao menos temos a(s) DLC(s).

author: {'steamid': '76561198007799385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1468407516}
review:
10/10: Unglaublich fesselnde Spielmechanik!

Super Zugsimulation bzw. Puzzlespiel, dann das ist die eigentliche Spielmechanik und diese ist echt der Gewinner in diesem Spiel. 
Der Einstiegt und die Spielregeln sind superschnell verstanden und erzeugen dabei in den späteren Leveln durch hervorragendes Gamedesign eine unglaubliche Komplexität und Tiefe. Diese Sorgt mit den zusätzlichen Zielbedingungen sowie den Steam Errungenschaften einen echten wiederspielwert der Levels gibt (habe im durchschnitte mindestens alle Levels zweimal gespielt).
Hier kommt auch das einzige Problem welches ich mit dem Spiel habe: ICH WILL MEHR! :D
Damit meine ich aber nicht den Preis, im Verhältnis zum Inhalt: Für 10 Euro (Plus 2,50 Euro für den sich echt lohnenden „Deutschland“-DLC) finde ich einige Stunden wirklich hervorragenden spielspaß absolut Preisgerecht. Wenn das Spiel dann auch noch Steam im Angebot ist, kann eigentlich jeder der mal auf ein klasse Spiel zwischen seinen AAA-Spielen oder seinem MOBA Lust hat bedenkenlos zuschlagen.
Somit eine Verdiente 10/10! 

PS: Ist ein guter Kandidat für ein „Perfektes Spiel“ (brauchte für alle Errungenschaften etwas über 20 Stunden)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027292225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1470069366}
review:
English than Portuguese

From someone if 27.6 hours played and who finished the game with all the " Stamps" and completed as All the Achievements (with exception of those in dlc )

English:
I believe it is important to tell those interested in buying this game that, although it is a very good game, is not exactly a train simulator.
If you exchange the stations for water records, the tracks for pipes and the trains for water, the game operation would remain exactly the same (!), so, it´s a puzzle that uses the "skin" of trains . In the end, you don´t do nothing but have to come up with a way to take the trains (replaceable by any other object) from point "A" to "B" point.
The criticism is because I bought the game having in mind something like the old Railroad Tycoon II, and there is absolutely nothing of his features here.
There is no management of the trains. You indicates your ways and just take care of the break.
The connection of the tracks is simple, limiting creativity in creating lines (intersections) more complex.
There is no freedom to choose which trains to use, which loads carry loads, which station is more important to get that load, and so on .... it is a puzzle where you connect points. A very good and even challenging at times, but a puzzle. Not a simulator.
Likes puzzles, go ahead.
Expect something more than a puzzle ... better pass or run the risk in a very good sale.

Português:

Para indicar minha experiência com o jogo, tenho 27.6hr. de jogadas e terminei todas as fases, cumprindo com todos os desafios (são três por fase). Tenho todas as conquistas existentes com exceção daquelas constantes na dlc

Acredito que seja importante avisar àqueles interessados na compra deste jogo que, apesar de se tratar de um game muito bom, não é exatamente um simulador de trens.
Se você trocar as estações por registros de água, os trilhos por canos e e os trens por água, o funcionamento do jogo continuaria sendo exatamente o mesmo (!), ou seja, trata-se de um puzzle que utiliza a "skin" de trens. No final das contas, vc. não faz nada além de ter de bolar uma maneira de levar os trens (substituíveis por qualquer outro objeto) do ponto "A" ao ponto "B".
A crítica fica pq. comprei o jogo tendo em mente algo como o antigo Railroad Tycoon II, e não existe absolutamente nenhuma característica deste.
Não há administração dos trens. Você dita seus caminhos e no máximo os pausa. 
A conexão dos trilhos é bem simples o que limita a criatividade na criação de linhas mais complexas (cruzamentos mais complexos).
Não há liberdade para escolher que trens usar, os evoluir/melhorar, que cargas levar, para onde levar, a importância da carga para aquele local e assim por diante.... se trata de um puzzle de conectar pontos. Um muito bom e até desafiador às vezes, porém, um puzzle. Não um simulador.
Curte Puzzles, vá em frente.
Espera algo mais do que um quebra-cabeça... melhor deixar passar ou correr o risco em uma sale muito boa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010320233', 'num_games_owned': 2700, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1469406888}

I'm writing this review after finishing 100%.

Overall the game is a solid puzzle game with two main components: management of time and management of space. I would recommend this for anyone enjoying puzzle games.

- achievements are sensible and are actually a good challenge

Main negatives:

author: {'steamid': '76561198059221546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1469323949}
review:
「RailroadTycoon」や「A列車で行こう」みたいな、駅を建設し線路を敷設、列車を購入して走らせ収入を得る。
といった経営ゲームかと思い購入。

ところがこのゲーム、
マップごとに決められた位置に駅が建設されて、そこを線路で繋ぐ。
橋やトンネルも決められた場所に出現する。
列車が駅に出現して、指定された駅に到着させる。
ストーリーモードのクリア条件に「列車事故を防ぐ」「間違った駅に到着させない」。
などといったものがあり、経営要素は多少あるものの、経営ゲームというよりパズルゲームに近い感じ。

１シナリオあたりに費やす時間は１０分～１時間程度（完璧を目指すならそれ以上かかるけど）で、暇つぶし感覚で遊べる。
思っていたのと大分違っていたけれど、これはこれで大はまりしてしまいました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198083437938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1573506391}
review:
This is a great puzzle game.  It starts easy, but gets difficult as you progress through the levels.  To meet all three objectives for the levels, I replayed some of the maps 5, 10, and even 15 times.  If one track strategy doesn't work, try putting tracks in a different location.

Anyway, an awesome game that I highly recommend if you like puzzle-solving type games.  And it runs great on Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059861876', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1622392994}
review:
Un bon petit jeu de patience et de réflexe.... éh oui faut faire en sorte que les trains ne se percuttent pas...
Rapide et fluide, n'oubliez pas de faire vos raccourcis claviers du genre : w, x, c, espace pour la contruction,... mode pause...

Les pays et les locomotives sont variés et en difficultés croissantes.

Le mode bac à sable peut se jouer en famille, avec les enfants ! ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054636242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1522483481}
review:
看介绍说什么管理火车，我还以为是模拟经营，结果是个策略游戏（怪自己不看标签）。最近完全静不下心来学习策略游戏的我居然还觉得超好玩。

这游戏让我有种难以形容的快感。要说类似的感觉，会想到 mini metro 和 anomaly，可能共同点是都需要大量暂停然后微操？还有看着单位经过轨道的样子？当然这听着并不是有说服力的好玩的理由= = 但相信喜欢这两个游戏的人一定也会喜欢 train valley！

平时不玩的时候都会脑子在想着轨道排布的样子，中毒很深。希望出移动版，感觉在平板上玩的话会很棒！中毒也会更深！

一部分成就又变态又有趣。刷成就的时候才发现原来这游戏有 dlc，然而特惠已经结束了，想哭……

author: {'steamid': '76561198271451378', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1526165222}
review:
A complex and fun game that is a great way to pass the time and get your mind off the real world for a little while. 
The enjoyment I expierenced through my frustration only made me want to play the game more as I thought initially that I would end up refunding it because it just seemed odd... however this is a well put together game. 
Everyone who says it's addicting is 100% correct and I highly reccomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185081122', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1531552144}
review:
6/10.

fun for 6 or 7 hours, repetitive after . 

 Not to be compared with Train Fever or the likes, this is NOT a train simulation. It is not a deep game, you understand the rules in 30s. 

This game has more its place on IPAD or IPHONE even , than on a PC. this is really well done, but it misses some elements of Fun. Price for a game like this should be around 1$.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982210220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1468687496}
review:
Train Valley is a very good puzzle game about optimizing train routes, finding a balance in shared resources, and nail-biting micromanagement.

The levels play quickly, and the art (but not the gameplay) is a pleasant throwback to Railroad Tycoon 2. 

There is a whiff of "sameness" to the gameplay on each level, despite some randomization of station locations. This makes me think that Train Valley might do better in the mobile market. Regardless, it's inexpensive, and has a Demo available on Steam. If you enjoy puzzle games, give this one a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984880111', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1468694696}
review:
Примитивнейшая игра. Вам дается крошечный кусочек карты (вся умещается на 1-м экране), на которой постепенно открываются разноцветные станции. На станциях появляются разноцветные поезда. Надо гонять поезда в совпадающие по цвету станции. Перегонишь все (это занимает минут 10) - выйграл. Всё. ВСЁ.

Карт очень мало. Игра проходится за вечер. Реиграбельность - ок, но, пройдя игру, челленджа при повторном прохождении уже как бы и нет - примитивная игровая механика слишком быстро "раскусывается", и ты щелкаешь уровни как орешки.

Подошла бы для планшета, коротать время в туалете. Красная цена - 100 руб.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028655071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1452925707}
review: Short entertaining family game. Simple enough for kids, with difficulty that scales up to be challenging and fun for adults. The only cons are it is relatively short (like most family games) and in gameplay there is a reliance on frequently pausing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004202366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1618946401}
review: I absolutely love this game.  I bought it on a whim during a steam sale and I'm thrilled that I gave this game a chance and discovered this little gem.  You would think it would be super easy building a train track and getting the trains to the correct stations by switching the direction of the junctions, but it's more complicated then it seems.  I have been replaying all of the levels trying to get perfect scores on each so the game has tons of replayablity and I have no intention of putting the game away for a long time to come.   Buy this game as quickly as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993772546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1610202012}
review:
When i bought the game i thought that it is a game to play in a casual way, without paying much attention. It isn´t. It is a fucking time stealing machine. The gameplay is addictive, just one more level, just trying to get all stamps in the level... poof... 2h later. It looks simple, but in some levels you need to try over and over again until you find the best layout for the tracks and don´t make a failure when managing the trains.

You will hate it or love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985824936', 'num_games_owned': 1586, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1467843797}
review:
Attention : jeu hautement addictif !

Des niveaux variés avec différentes difficultés à surmonter jalonnent ce petit jeu très addictif.

Les graphismes sont très plaisants et illustrent plutôt bien chaque pays traversé et permettent donc de découvrir de nouveaux univers à chaque pays.

Côté bande-son, celle-ci est très bien adaptée au jeu, mais peut peut-être se révéler agaçante sur certains niveaux pour certaines personnes, bien que ça n'ait pas été mon cas.

Gros bémol : le tutoriel explique très mal les outils et les enjeux. Les 5 premières minutes sont donc les plus difficiles, car on ne se bat non pas contre le jeu, mais contre l'interface. Le jeu en vaut la chandelle.

J'ai terminé le jeu en 9h00 pour ma part (avec le DLC) : c'est trop court, on en veut encore !

author: {'steamid': '76561198087738131', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1955, 'last_played': 1467993826}
review:
Excellent game. It's very much about paying attention to details and good timing. 

I found that most of the levels were quite doable, but if you try to complete all three bonus objectives in a level some of them are quite challenging and took me more than a few attempts to win.

I would recommend that you watch Total Biscuit's WTF is video to get an idea of what the game is like.

The two things that would make this game better would be if there were even more of it, and if there was a level that had a crazy number of stations, say 12, on a fairly large map, with a really long time limit, so that you could get a more extreme experience of frenzied train management.

The German DLC is worthwhile I think, but it did not present as much of an increased challenge as I was hoping for, and there is a frustrating level where planes bomb your trains which feels more like luck than skill (but that's only one level in the DLC).

I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone that loved building a road and rail system in Sim City 2000, and who also likes time management games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124139802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1468020032}
review: I had originally thought this was a simulation game, but (so far) it feels a bit more like a puzzle game. That said, I am really enjoying it and finding the levels challenging and a bit addictive. Worth having in your library for some casual, but tricky fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999498546', 'num_games_owned': 8364, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 3244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3003, 'last_played': 1468150415}
review:
Train Valley has a simple premise. Bring Trains from one Station to another. But what the game makes out of this relatively simple premise is astonish. 
Why? Let me explain!

[h1][u]Gameplay[/u][/h1]
It all starts slow. Two Stations. One Train. The Interface is very intuitive and you will understand every function in absolutely no time. Of course the first mission is also a tutorial, so you will have no problem to get into the game mechanics. 

The game offers four chapters with six missions each. Also every mission has 3 “Expert goals” you can try to fulfill. These will change the way you play the mission, what is a motivation to play it again and reach them. But the final goal in every mission is the same. Get every Train that will spawn to their desired station without going bankrupt.
Bankrupt? Yes! Every train as a certain value assigned. As longer as the train needs to reach its destination it loses value over time till it is at $0. 

After the first two missions the difficult raises pretty quickly, but the Missions are never getting unfair. You will have the motivation to try it again and never have the feeling that you lost because the mission design was unfair. 

[h1][u]Programming[/u][/h1]
I had no crash in my whole play time or any stutters. The game ran smooth at any given moment. 


[b]Pros[/b]
-Motivating Gameplay
-Good tutorials
-It’s very easy to get into the game
-Motivating extra goals in each mission
-Two game modes. Classic and Freeplay

[b]Cons[/b]
-Difficult raises pretty fast
-The final mission goal is always the same


[h1][u]Final thoughts[/u][/h1]
I found this game only because Steam suggested it to me, and I am really glad about it. Train Valley really took me by surprise. At any time I was motivated to beat the actuall mission and reach as many bonus goals as I could. And when I failed I could see why I did. The price it okay for what you get. Even if you just play through it without playing for the Expert Goals you will need some hours till you beat the final mission. 
Even if you never played such a game, like I did, I can still recommend this to you if the screenshots and the trailer appeal to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009399567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1582438520}

review: 游戏很赞，在夏季打折入得，突然发现了一款放松的游戏而且还自带简体中文。休闲的时候玩玩很惬意，但是玩到后面却有一个致命的弱点！当你每次玩的势如破竹时 2倍加速，so easy。。。GG！四倍加速，我很稳。。。GG！心情很糟糕有木有！我特么玩的是休闲类游戏啊！为什么玩的像再遭罪 一样！总之这款游戏还是不能急于求成要不紧不慢的放下心来慢慢玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198088077354', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1592917816}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991111777', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1662837935}
review:
Un peu déçu car je m'attendais à un jeu de gestion, une sorte de remake HD de Railroad Tycoon... En fait pas du tout !

Dans son principe, ce jeu me rappelle beaucoup Mini Metro : les gares apparaissent spontanemment et aléatoirement. Le joueur doit les relier entre elles et contrôler le trafic ferrovière (envoyer les bons trains dans les bonnes gares tout en évitant les collisions). Bien sûr, il y a de plus en plus de gares, d'aiguillages et de trains à gérer, ce qui rend les niveaux de plus en plus rythmés et difficiles.

Pour conclure, même si ce n'est pas le style de jeu auquel je m'attendais, il reste amusant et m'occupera certainement 3 ou 4 soirées... pas non plus de quoi me rendre accro. Mais bon pour 10€, c'est correct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169083424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1477050207}
review:
Placing a piece of track is a pain in the arse, thus making the higher speeds near impossible to play on. However, if you can get past the finicky track placement then you're in for something real, darn good.

Train Valley is essentially a management simulator. You're placing tracks, trying to get "blue train" from point "A" to point "B"; all while trying to complete other, level specific objectives (which are OPTIONAL). If you do manage to complete the level specific objectives, then you'll gain 3 stars. Yes, it's one of those games... This is actually one of the games' biggest advantages though, at least it is for me. I like trying to get all the OPTIONAL stars. I like trying to perfect each level to the best of my ability. So all in all, I think this is a great management sim. It's also very accesible/casual, so that's nice to people who are new to this type of game (like me).

So yeah, if any of that sounds interesting to you then you'll most likely enjoy this game. Just be warned that the track placement is not good, but it's not enough to break the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043978586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1467275515}
review:
They tagged it as relaxing. No way in hell.

It looks and feels really good but it's much too stressful for me and I LOVE these kinds of games.

The mechanics are simple and smooth but there are no options (yet) to automate anything. You have to micromanage every single path each train takes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995283923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1468100283}
review:
Good idea, and it's fun when it works. But the game has a few major flaws that makes it incredibly frustrating. There is a timer that appears only when there are 5 seconds left before the next train. If you have anything in that range, there's very little you can do especially when the levels are complex. I've also had tracks explode after a train runs into a mountain, even though the track is green when I place it. Further, I've had objects destroy tracks when they sprout from the ground.

I was enjoying the game for a while, but the glitches and train management is just far too frustrating for complex levels. I can't recommend the game until the developer fixes these issues, and revamps some of the track management.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062956563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1482364124}
review:
Addictive little game.  Imagine taking your train set out of the box from the attic, have your friends start showing up at random times, and trying to keep all your stuff from running into each other!  It's a fun puzzle game that requires some significant multi-tasking to beat the levels for all medals.  

10/10, will oroboros my train into itself again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063327951', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1467204829}
review:
Keep in mind that this is a game about micromanaging trains, not a strategy/"tycoon" game. This game is quite fun, but quite short of you don't like completing all the challenges in the game.

I picked this game up during a Steam sale for €7.00 including DLC. I would say that it was worth that money, but I am not sure if I would recommend it at full price (€12.50).

Pros:
- The core mechanics, laying rails and directing trains, are easy to understand and work reasonably well
- The theming is great
- The levels are designed well, making it a challenge to find the optimal layout of tracks to complete all challenges
- The game is not incredibly difficult. The 6 levels added by the DLC are somewhat harder than the 24 in the base game. The ability to pause the game makes it a lot less stressful too.

Cons:
- The music is repetitive, and while soothing it just annoyed me after a while.
- Rail junctions work... weird. Rail junctions are blocked when a train is on top of them. However, the game also blocks rail junctions on adjecent rails, or even crossing rails.
- The challenges get stale after a bit. The challenges for Germany have some more fun ones in them, such as blowing up 5 trains.
- The sandbox mode is completely broken, with train stations not showing up at all. Besides that, it's not all that fun without a clear goal or even money to worry about.
- Even after completing every challenge, and completing every other achievement, I only built about 9000 train tracks towards the "build 10.000 train tracks" achievement. Luckily the game counts train tracks built just before restarting a level, so building a lot of useless tracks on a level with high starting money solves that problem, but "grinding building train tracks" is not fun nor won't it give me a sense of achieving something on reaching it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066022068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1467598732}
review:
This is a good game, but dont let the 90%+ recommended fool you, this is not a great game.

Its short, simple and at times rather frustrating. This is not a tycoon game in any way, this is just a puzzle game. Sound effects are repetitive, music is uninspired. 

That all said it is charming and a bit addicting. The puzzles are fun and keeping track of all the crossovers on a built up map can be challenging. Graphics are cute and give decent atmosphere to each level.

Not the Train tycoon game I was looking for, but a pleasant way to have some fun for a few dollars. Just dont go in with high expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043401618', 'num_games_owned': 1802, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 3249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3161, 'last_played': 1472937749}
review:
A perfect crossover between Pipe Dream and Flight Control HD.

You layout rails to bring a constant flow of trains to their designated stations. Very easy concept but gets hectic as more stations spawn around the map and the train numbers increase.

Each train you deliver will increase your money to build more tracks, and pay the taxes each year (which is very short in game time!). Trains lose worth fast, so don't deliver them fast and you risk going bankrupt.

You can also launch extra trains at a random location for a fee. Gamble on this option to increase your cash, but abuse it and you'll end up overloading your network which is certain to lead to disaster, or to fun!

Once you have multiple trains running between stations you'll need to micromanage switches and stop your trains if necessary (losing precious money) to avoid accidents which will always make your trains blow up violently; I think it must be explosives that you are delivering.

You can play the levels in a variety of styles. Spend loads of cash to build a huge rail network which can support loads of trains running at the same time. Or play it stingy and try to see how many trains you manage to circulate back and forth on a single narrow piece of track. Both methods have their risks and rewards.

Some of the later maps have special features, such as high speed trains that you cant control or stop, adding to the excitement.

The campaign is not extremely long, but you have sandbox levels at the end of each stage, and stamp challenges on each level also increase replayability. This can make some easy levels very challenging, for example play the level without using pause, without stopping any train, and launch 10 additional trains.

The game runs smooth and seamlesly performance wise, and hardly has any bugs. There are 4 (5 with DLC) countries which all have a pleasant and unique visual style, and the trains have some nice variety from around the world. You can see that the devs like their trains, even though this is a puzzle game, not a tycoon one.

Also the game still receives attention from the devs, patches, and DLC. At the really honest price tag this is sold I can not do anything but recommend Train Valley to everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021823947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1494624656}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065680736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1644054780}
review:
Io ho sempre amato i treni, sin da quando ero bambino (non dimenticherò mai il "Casimiro" del Film Dumbo!), e ho sempre sognato di possedere un diorama ferroviario tutto mio. A livello di videogiochi, tuttavia, vuoto: a parte SteamLand (che spero un giorno sarà disponibile su Steam) ho sempre trovato molto piatto questo genere. Soltanto Train Valley ha avuto quella scintilla che mi ha fatto pensare "Wow, non so niente di questo gioco, ma lo voglio!"

Graficamente non c'è male: lo stile è minimale e geometrizzato come va ormai di moda da qualche anno, ma non avrete molto tempo per ammirare la grafica.

Per vincere i vari stage, bisogna condurre i convogli verso precise stazioni, e sei incoraggiato a farlo bene da due fattori: la possibilità di guadagnare più denaro portando i treni a destinazione il prima possibile, e la presenza di tre obiettivi per scenario. All'inizio sembra facile, quasi rilassante, ma già dagli ultimi stage del primo capitolo impazzirete per far andare tutto per il verso giusto, tanto più se volete raggiungere i sudetti obiettivi. Inoltre, è molto più semplice perdere per bancarotta di quanto non voglia farti credere il gioco (Di per se le tasse annue sono piccole, ma i binari e le demolizioni hanno un costo -pesante, aggiungerei-, ed un incidente tra treni spesso si traduce in una sconfitta immediata).

Da comprare

author: {'steamid': '76561198041714386', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1574559279}
review:
Once I realized that this was primarily a puzzle game with Trains and not really a railroad simulation, I changed my expectations and enjoyed this game.  It is a fairly quick game, and it can be a challenge to track (pun intended) which switches are needed in what order for each train.  

The only thing I have trouble with are pop-up buildings that made it nearly impossible to see which way the switch was aligned.  Other than that, it works as advertised.

I enjoyed this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035374577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1466870641}
review:
Train Valley ist ein nettes Gelegenheitsspiel für zwischendurch.
Es geht darum ein Streckennetz aufzubauen und Züge zu ihrem Zielbahnhof zu schicken. Dabei sollen mehrere Ziele und Aufgaben gelöst werden.

Das Spiel bietet insgesamt 4 Kampagnen mit jeweils 5 Missionen. Man kann sich auch eine weitere Kampagne als günstiges DLC dazukaufen. 
Die Aufgaben sind anfangs recht leicht, aber sie werden in den späteren Missionen recht knifflig. Dabei sollen möglichst keine Unfälle gebaut werden und keine Züge zum falschen Bahnhof geschickt werden. Man muss ebenso ständig das Budget im Auge behalten, damit man nicht bankrott geht. Oft ist es schwer den Überblick über alle Züge zu behalten, wenn viele gleichzeitig fahren und man ein komplexes Streckennetz hat.
Aber das ist genau der Reiz um das Spiel komplett durchzuspielen und alle Missionen vollständig zu erfüllen. Ebenso um alle Steamerrungenschaften freizuschalten.
Durch die Aufgaben gewinnt das Spiel etwas an Abwechslung, aber es ist nach einer Zeit doch recht eintönig. Trotzdem ist es ein recht kniffliges und nettes Spiel, das Spaß macht.

Positives und Negatives

+Nette Grafik
+Passende Soundtracks
+Viele Karten und Aufgaben
+Unterschiedliche Züge und Orte
+Keine Bugs oder Abstürze
+Leichte Steamerrungenschaften

-Wenig Abwechslung

Wertung
80/100 Punkten
Ich gebe eine klare Kaufempfelung, vorallem wenn es im Angebot ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993180934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1651734164}
review:
Train Valley ist ein lustiges und kniffliges Gelegenheitsspiel, in dem ihr, Züge möglichst schnell in den nächsten Bahnhof schicken müsst. Was einfach klingt, gerne aber Tücken hat.

Wie der Name schon sagt, geht es in Train Valley um Züge. 
In verschieden Missionen müsst ihr unterschiedliche Anforderungen erfüllen, wie Gewinnsummen erreichen oder unfallfrei handeln. Darin liegt die Abwechslung aber auch gleichzeitig die Einseitigkeit. Das Spiel sieht sehr schön aus und ist sehr atmosphärisch und stimmig. 
Ich empfinde es als eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

+Pro

+Sehr schöne und stimmige Grafik
+netter Sound
+jede Menge Karten
+sehr stabil
+vollkommen Gewaltfrei

-Contra

-Wenig Abwechslung

author: {'steamid': '76561198024942939', 'num_games_owned': 1557, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1629822943}
review:
In a way, this is a sort of real-time puzzle game, not unlike Tetris. You lay a finite amount of track, attempt to make the best use of the limited space to deliver the most trains in the shortest time, and revise your track configuration as necessary.

The satisfaction of finding the right configuration is hard to describe. Let me put it this way: If you're the type of person who likes optimizing processes, such that an unexpectedly high workload can still be managed with nothing going wrong, you will find much to like in this game.

It is a heuristics development and revision game where learning the optimal layout for each situation is half the fun, and the other half is guiding trains through that layout with nothing exploding.

Though it usually has little bearing on gameplay, I should also say that this game uses locations and times from history rarely seen in videogames, especially the DLC.
