author: {'steamid': '76561198013097520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1659698157}
review:
I don't play tower defence games anymore, because I have this game instead. If you don't see the appeal to tower defence at all, this game is not for you. If you've got the tower defence itch, this game will scratch it until it bleeds.

This game doesn't have an undo button, so push your luck too far and it's game over. I know why that would put some people off, but it works for this game.

Why is this better than tower defence? In any good tower defence game, getting good at it means learning how the towers work and how each enemy type works. Once you've figured that out, there's not much left to learn or do.

With this game, the trains behave the same way (at different speeds) and the track laying rules are intuitive. Will you overpopulate your grid with trains to build up money, or will you play it safer with collissions, but risk facing bankruptcy? Can you time them perfectly so they almost hit but don't? What is the best configuration for the tracks? Is it worth paying extra to demolish your way through a shortcut? These dilemmas you get to face from game 1, without having to remember what does what.

There is only one change I would make to this game if I were the developer, and that is this: When the game is paused, I want to still be able to see which trains are going full speed and which trains have only started moving. As a father, I love a game that I can pause and come back to after a nappy change, but I often forget which trains are going full speed and which are not by the time I return.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262672627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1517579853}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006652851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1464902178}
review:
I've been looking for something to scratch the Transport / Railroad Tycoon itch for a while now, and although there are some potentially promising games on the horizon, it seemed like there were no good examples in the genre at the moment.

And then I stumbled upon Train Valley, which, within a few minutes of playing confirms that the above is true - this isn't a tycoon game.  What it is, is a puzzle game - and once you get a few levels in, it's fiendish.  It conjurs up the correct mix of raising a smile when things go to plan, and swearing at your screen when you get overwhelmed and the inevitable happens - and trains crash.

The premise is simple; you are given a grid and two coloured stations on each map, and you drag lines from one to the other, avoiding or bulldozing (at a cost) your way through buildings and trees, some of which are randomly placed whilst some are always in the same place.  Trains will spawn in the stations with a colour indicating that they want you to direct them to the other station, you click to launch the train and it makes its way down the track and you get paid when it arrives - each train has a value which ticks down from the moment it spawns to the moment it arrives at the destination.  The complexity comes in as the map progresses.  New stations will spawn on the map - in predetermined positions but in a random order, and begin to spawn trains all eager to go somewhere else.  You will lay more tracks, launch trains, and use the track switches to try and avoid a catastrophe.  Fortunately you can stop and reverse trains, but this doesn't always help if you're not keeping a good watch out - only one train can occupy a station, so it will launch itself if a second one is about to spawn.

The difficultly ramps up; early maps serve to teach you the basics and later ones cram stations in awkward places with choke points to force trains onto the same pieces of track.  When things go well, it's great - but sometimes, you just can't avoid an explosion.

Back to my search for a tycoon game - even though this clearly isn't one, the art style and simple way of laying track would lend itself very well to a more in depth strategy game which, if I were the developer, I'd seriously consider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231721660', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1522440452}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024461472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1463957100}
review:
Divertente, peccato che dopo alcuni livelli di fatto diventi quasi impossibile.
La gestione del livello di difficoltà si concentra troppo sulla velocità di partenza dei treni piuttosto che sulla quantità e complessità dei binari.
Ad un certo punto manca il tempo materiale per gestire troppi treni contemporaneamente.
Buon passatempo comunque.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140710588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1637144422}
review:
Pour commencer, Train Valley n’est pas à proprement parler un simulateur de train, il s’agit plutôt d’un jeu de type puzzle avec des trains. 
Les graphismes sont à la fois simples, beaux et très clairs, ce n’est pas du tout difficile à déchiffrer comme dans certains simulateurs. 
Le gameplay est idéal, on apprend à jouer très rapidement sans passer par un tutoriel laborieux. Je regrette cependant qu'il n'y ai pas un compteur dès le début sur les trains au départ, on se fait parfois avoir car ça ne s'affiche que sur les dernières secondes. 
Vous apprendrez vite les combinaisons les plus efficaces mais le jeu a de nombreux défis pour corser les choses, et le mode bac à sable permet de s'amuser avec son imagination sans contraintes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175063718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1462147138}
review: varey fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197977720437', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1594310884}
review:
Ideale Hochleistungs-Trainingssimulation, um die wichtigsten Aspekte des Jobs zu trainieren. Sicherheit, Pünktlichkeit und Wirtschaftlichkeit werden nach und nach auf Perfektion getrimmt. Probleme diesbezüglich gehören nach erfolgreicher Beendigung der Einzelspieler-Kampagne der Vergangenheit an. Absolute Höchstleistungen werden zwar erwartet, nach erreichen aller Steam-Erfolge jedoch auch in vollem Umfang im­ma­te­ri­ell vergütet. 

+ Unfälle sind nicht ganz so schlimm wie in der Realität.
+ Macht Spass, auch wenn man von der Materie überhaupt keine Ahnung hat.
+ Situation "Personen im Gleis" praktisch ausgeschlossen.
+ Gleissperrungen (auch bei Gleisbauarbeiten oder Oberbaumängeln) nicht erforderlich.

- Triebfahrzeugführer noch ungeduldiger als im realen Leben
- Bahnhöfe entsprechen nicht der Realität.
- Befehle wie "Fahren auf Sicht" oder "Rangieren über Ra10" werden komplett ignoriert.
- Betriebsrat verhält sich äußerst passiv.
- Kein Oberleitungsnetz. Dieselbetriebene Züge an der Tagesordnung. Schlecht für die Umwelt. Pöse!

Im Großen und Ganzen 10 von 10 Autoreisezüge!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983757376', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2079, 'last_played': 1698002268}

author: {'steamid': '76561198219038683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1462717637}
review:
I like this game although after you complete all of the levels there is not much left to do. 
Controls are easy and the game is easy to follow the tricky part of the game is having to focus your attention in multiple spots at once. You have to mannage all the trains and build tracks to where they are going. Luckily, you can stop trains and turn them around, though some levels require that you do not.  Overall, this game is fun and even a little challenging. 
The music for this game is also really nice and calming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153895874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1472992667}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025344376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2334, 'last_played': 1524786610}
review:
This game is frustratingly addicting, and not until I had all the achievements could I put it away.  As other reviewers have said, it's not really a sim, but a puzzle game.  Figure out where to put your tracks, when to send your trains and pray they don't crash into each other, end up in the wrong station, or heaven forbid, get hit by a passing high speed train.

The gameplay is smooth, and all levels and achievements are obtainable with a little patience.  All in all a highly recommended romp!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048939725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1558747178}
review:
まず私は、A列車とかSimcityなどの好きな人間という前提です。

このゲームは、ストレテジーでもシミュレーションでもなくパズルです。
パズルの中でも全体を把握しながら素早く動作を行う動的なパズルです。

町の発展などの要素はわずかながらありますが、それはプレイヤーの任意では不可で、プレイヤーが行えるのは列車の発車、停止とレールの切り替えです。

ランダムに出発駅を決められ、到着地点もランダムに決められ、それをレールの切り替えを以下に早くするかという部分が遊ぶポイントでした。

時刻を決め、運行を綺麗に整えるといったような事はできませんでした。箱庭ゲーと思って買わないでください。


ただ、パズルゲームそのものをやりたいという方には、中々面白くお勧めではあります。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030851518', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1463502704}
review:
Деревья? Выкорчевать! Жилые дома? Под снос!
Правительственные объекты? И их под снос!
Всё под снос. Даже ваши собственные железные дороги под снос - и такое бывает.

Train Valley - это интересные уровни с рэндомно создаваемыми помехи и случайным порядком возникнования станций, что добавляет реиграбельности миссиям.
Это либо неторопливая, рассудительная игра на обычной скорости, либо это риски ускоренной игры - шанс не переключить стрелку, не достроить дорогу, ошибиться в станции возрастает с каждой минутой.
Это три задания на каждую миссию, которые влияют на геймплей, например:
выйти на определённый уровень дохода,
отправить N дополнительных поездов,
не взорвать ни один поезд,
- эти и другие задания повторяются в миссиях, но поскольку в каждой миссии свой набор заданий и свой уникальный ландшафт, то скучно не будет.
Сложность уровней постепенно возрастает по мере прохождения игры.

Прекрасно идёт как на PC, так и на макбуке (базовый macbook pro 2015 нормально тянет на минималках, графику повыше тянет, но начинает сильно греться, имейте в виду - впрочем, это тот случай, когда минимальная графика не мешает геймплею).

В общем, Train Valley - это тот случай, когда у инди-разработчиков руки растут из нужного места, и к игре хочется возвращаться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295598484', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1462763506}
review: This is a great game! Gets more challenging as you progress but you also get better at it. I also like the design of the whole game from the menu to the actual game. I recommend getting it ad also getting the DLC. Enjoy!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026405126', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1461149672}
review:
建造轨道，链接各个站点，引导列车安全抵达指定目的地。
由于所有铁轨都是双向共用的，必须随时控制各岔路口的方向，引导列车避免相撞。
除了合理规划道路以外，还需要随改变路口导向，引导列车，玩到后期就开始各种手忙脚乱……
规则单一，后期除了站点更多，列车更多外，没有其他新的内容，时间长就开始感觉单调了。
游戏画面一般，原本以外是建设类游戏才买的，结果是考验决策和资源分配的游戏，没有想象中的建设美景。
一般吧，推荐喜欢造轨道的朋友试试。中规中矩的解谜小游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042661590', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1449195629}
review:
La combinación perfecta entre un buen juego de Puzzles y el mítico RailRoad Tycoon. El objetivo es simple, llevar a cada tren a su destino, pero la misión complicada, porque tendremos hasta 5 o más trenes a la vez circulando por limitadas vías, cada escenario comienza de forma simple con solo dos estaciones, pero al final pueden haber 6 o más, debemos estar atentos de cada tren, tener en cuenta los tiempos para no chocarlos, frenar si es necesario, realizar los cambios de agujas en el momento oportuno y ser ágil con las salidas de trenes sino queremos que los trenes salgan sin aviso.

Si completar cada nivel no es suficiente para nosotros, tenemos retos adicionales que nos propone el propio juego en cada nivel, desde cosas sencillas como evitar choques o destrucción de vías, hasta sacar varios trenes anticipadamente o evitar gastar más de cierta cantidad de dinero, tendremos que estar atentos a todo, construir muy bien nuestras vías y planear nuestra estrategia si queremos conseguir todos los retos.

Aunque no lo parezca es muy adictivo, entretenido y desafiante, más de una vez reiniciarás la partida para replantear tu estrategia, su mayor fallo puede ser la falta de variedad de situaciones, si bien es cierto que en ocasiones habrán obstáculos que tendremos que sortear con puentes y túneles predefinidos o incluso vías de acceso por las que llegarán trenes sin aviso, la variedad de situaciones comienza a estancarse con el paso de los niveles.

Los gráficos cumplen aunque no destacan, la jugabilidad es fluida, dando la posibilidad de pausar la partida para pensar bien nuestros movimientos, el sonido es adecuado con melodías que relajan bastante y sonidos de los trenes apropiados.

[b]Lo mejor:[/b]

- Niveles bastante desafiantes.
- Jugabilidad sencilla y bien implementada.
- Gráficos y sonido suficientes.

[b]Lo peor:[/b]

- Puede hacerse un poco corto.
- La relación costo/beneficio puede no ser la mejor.
- La variedad de situaciones es limitada.

[b]Calificación:[/b]

- [b]Gráficos: 7
- [b]Sonido: 8
- [b]Jugabilidad: 8

[b]Nota final[/b]: 7.5

Recomendado para aquellos que disfruten de los juegos de puzzles y de juegos de trenes que suelen ser bastante escasos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299403175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1464730334}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116490436', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1462391641}
review:
[b] Ich habe einen kostenlosen Key für Reviewzwecke bekommen, allerdings beeinflusst dies meine Wertung in keinster Weise. [/b]

[b] KURZREVIEW  [/b]

Train Valley ist ein spaßiges, aber schweres Gelegenheitsspiel, in dem es darum geht, Züge möglichst schnell (und ohne Unfälle) in die nächste Stadt zu schicken. Klingt simpel - ist es allerdings nicht.

[h1] ZÜGE! [/h1]

Wie der Name schon sagt, geht es in Train Valley um Züge. Es gibt viele Missionen, die verschiedene Anforderungen stellen, beispielsweise muss man 100.000 $ Gewinn machen oder möglichst viele zusätzliche Züge verwenden. Dadurch bekommt das Spiel etwas Abwechslung. Leider ist Train Valley nicht sehr abwechslungsreich, es gibt unterschiedliche Missionen und es wird schwerer. Das Spiel sieht sehr schön aus und der Soundtrack bzw. die Sounds sind auch sehr gelungen. Es ist sehr atmosphärisch und stimmig. Bugs hatte ich nie. Leider nervt oft der Gleisbau. Der ist zwar gut umgesetzt, allerdings baut man manchmal eine Schiene falsch. Oft muss man mehrere Schienen zerstören und nicht die einzelne. Das verbraucht unnötig Geld, Zeit und Nerven, worauf es im Spiel ankommt. 

[h1] [u] Pro & Contra[/u] [/h1]

+Sehr schöne und stimmige Grafik
+Passende Sounds und Soundtrack
+Viele Maps
+Keine Bugs oder Abstürze

-Wenig Abwechslung
-Manchmal ist der Gleisbau umständlich

[h1] [u] Wertung [/u] [/h1]

[u] Spielspaß: 35/50: [/u]

*Es macht viel Spaß, wird allerdings auf Dauer etwas eintönig.

[u] Grafik & Design: 15/20 [/u]

*Sieht sehr schön aus. 

[u] Sound & Musik: 7/10 [/u]

*Sounds und Musik passen gut zum Spiel.

[u] Technik: 5/5 [/u]

*Keine Bugs und Abstürze. Hatte dauerhaft 60FPS.

[u] Preis/Leistung: 4/5 [/u]

*Für 10€ ein tolles Game, leider wenig Abwechslung.

[u] Support: 5/5: [/u]

*Kostenlose Updates und ein günstiges DLC. Die Entwickler antworten oft im Forum.

[u] Spieleinstieg: 4/5: [/u]

*Das meiste ist selbsterklärend

[h1] 75/100 [/h1]

Dir hat diese Review gefallen? Vielleicht gefallen dir auch meine anderen Reviews! Einfach  [b] [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/schossle/recommended/] hier [/url] [/b] klicken! 

[i] Folge doch dem Kuratorprogramm der [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-#curation] German_Gamer_Community [/url] für mehr Reviews! [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198072044773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1779, 'last_played': 1460767496}
review:
Análisis del Juego Base y la Expansión Germany

Lee el análisis completo en Areajugones: http://areajugones.es/train-valley/analisis-germany/

Train Valley es un curioso y adictivo título de gestión ferroviaria que lleva en Steam desde el pasado mes de octubre de 2015, con unas notables ventas. Fue desarrollado por solo tres programadores rusos adictos a los trenes (Alexey Davydov, Sergey Dvoynikov y Timofey Shargorodskiy, nombrados a si mismos como Oroboro Games) y editado por el estudio Flazm. Nos plantea una jugabilidad bien sencilla: construir vías, calcular las rutas entre las diferentes estaciones e intentar no accidentar muchos trenes mientras superamos una serie de objetivos.

Sobre el papel parece sencillo pero la propia gran variedad de sus mapas, unido a su creciente dificultad, sencillo manejo y diferentes épocas que podemos jugar lo han hecho uno de los juegos de gestión de ferrocarriles más llamativos de los últimos meses. Hoy, con el lanzamiento de su primera expansión, ambientada en las frías tierras de Alemania, lo disgregamos y vemos sus principales novedades más importantes. ¡Pasajeros al tren!

Manejando el difícil mundo de la locomoción

Como hemos comentado, Train Valley es un título que mezcla la simulación, la gestión y los puzles con un notable resultado. Tenemos una serie de mapas que se van desbloqueando a medida que superamos los anteriores y cada uno es bastante más difícil que el anterior, siendo los primeros simples tutoriales. Solo contamos con cuatro herramientas: la de cambiar la dirección del tren en una bifurcación, la de crear nuevas vías, destruirlas o destruir algunas partes del escenario (como árboles o casas) y solicitar una nueva locomotora, lo que cuesta dinero de nuestras arcas pero normalmente otorga bastante recompensa. Además, muchos objetivos se centran en esta última opción. También podemos aumentar la velocidad del juego, aunque igualmente al final de cada año en el juego se nos cobran una serie de impuestos, y pausar la partida. Todo muy sencillo e intuitivo.

Ahora bien, crear las diferentes vías de tren entre las estaciones no es tan sencillo como pareciera ya que aparte de los propios obstáculos (algunos irrompibles) hay una serie de accidentes geográficos como lagos, ríos, montañas, etcétera, que hay que bordear, teniendo por ejemplo que pasar por los ríos por los puentes que se van creando. Esto unido a la propia gestión de los trenes para impedir que choquen o se equivoquen de estación (perdiendo dinero paulatinamente), así como su velocidad, que varía según su carga, hace que algunos escenarios sean bastante complicados, y requieran numerosos intentos para conseguir todos sus objetivos y, de paso, los numerosos logros que tiene el juego, a cada cual más complicado que el anterior.

A medida que vamos superando las fases se van desbloqueando nuevos mundos, ambientados en diferentes épocas y lugares, cada uno con sus propias locomotoras y accidentes geográficos característicos Así, por ejemplo, está Europa desde 1830 a 1980, América desde 1840 a 1960, la USSR desde 1880 a 1980, Japón desde 1990 a 2020 y, la nueva incorporación del presente DLC: Alemania, que en sus seis nuevos niveles podemos ver importantes eventos de dicho país, como la Primera Guerra Mundial, la caída del Muro de Berlín o un escenario muy moderno ambientado en el nuevo aeropuerto de Frankfurt. Además incorpora muchas novedades jugables ya que en un nivel caen bombas del cielo y el de Berlín es un autentico reto solo apto para los más valientes.

Lee el análisis completo en Areajugones: http://areajugones.es/train-valley/analisis-germany/

author: {'steamid': '76561198167868036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1460194102}
review: Just no.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987934492', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1812, 'last_played': 1672813101}
review:
Ok, let's get over the misconception first: No matter what the dumb user defined tags say, this is not a sim. This is an active puzzle game, that just happens to involve trains. 

That having been said, it does combine two of my favorite things, trains games and puzzle games. I never thought that I'd somehow have 30 hours in the game, it's something that I just kept on coming back to, having this need to finish all three stamps on all maps, including the DLC.

Personally I love the fact that there's a speed function that lets me play fast and just pause when I need to, it makes for a super great challenge (until they put in no pausing as a stamp requirement in the new DLC that made me sad).

I personally experienced no crashes of any sort, only in the DLC did I have a bit of a bug where the main menu wouldn't pop up if I hit escape, which was basically just a trifling annoyance. 

To sum it up: I love finding little unknown games like this which I end up enjoying way more than I ever thought I would, and I'm highly looking forward to future DLC!

author: {'steamid': '76561198297739789', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1463324504}
review:
Train Valley is a great game if you get really into it. It can be stressing but most of the time it's quite relaxing and if you love management and have some overview skills it's great for you! And one of the best things is that you actually learn managing and keeping your head cool in panicky moments. 

Pro's;
*Challenging
*Not boring at all
*Keeps you playing
*Very fun

Cons;
*Graphics are not optimized (But this can be a good thing if you don't have one of the best computers in the world)
*You're going to lose a lot of time ;)

But I warn you! Once you start the game with the thought "I'm going to play a little bit" it's not a little bit, but like a few hours. Great game! 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014712262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1487454181}
review: This is super fun. A kind of sequencing/timing puzzle game that can get very challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966792440', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1484266673}
review: Easy to learn, but very addicting. It's super satisfying to come up with a great track layout for a level and be able to handle as many trains as the game will throw at you. You feel like some kind of train wizard. Icing on top is that this the only game in my library my girlfriend likes. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260087087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1634222893}
review:
喜欢这种铺铁路的游戏，让我想起了小时候玩的火车玩具。
看着各种型号的小火车拉着各种车厢跑来跑去也是挺惬意的。
还有看那一座座建筑拔地而起，令人不禁感慨铁路给人们的生活带来了多大的变化啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198081407912', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1731, 'last_played': 1515178677}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029303897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1460458019}
review: Ich wollte es nur kurz anspielen und "Ruck-Zuck" waren die ersten 1 1/2 Stunden vorbei. Die Motivation, alle vorgebenen Ziele der aktuellen Aufgabe zu erfüllen, ist ziemlich hoch. Die nette Grafik erhöht den Spaß zusätzlich. Ich fasse mich kurz, empfehle das Spiel hiermit ausdrücklich und mache mich jetzt fix wieder an die nächsten Strecken. Eine geht noch ... ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198230045372', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1464417218}
review: 这是我玩过的一个铁路调度游戏，它不仅是铁路调度，它还有建设，策略等元素在里面。画面也很好，可爱的高楼和火车在电脑里面展示了一个迷你的世界，让人一看就觉得很温馨。希望制作组可以用这个游戏的引擎再做一个模拟运输的游戏出来。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041810920', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 37, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1712421993}
review:
This game have everything to be great:

- Trains!! (For the child within me)
- Relaxing and addictive gameplay
- Linux support
- Linux demo (that is a rare thing)
- Trains!!!
- Easy to learn and not very hard to master
- Have I mentioned trains?

author: {'steamid': '76561198047047619', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1643953464}
review: 好难玩的策略游戏，不是模拟经营，是策略游戏，设计好轨道很重要，火车行进时的操作也很重要，对我来说有点难，只爱经营类就别考虑了，对操作还是有一定要求的，总的来说很好玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992135430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1588166441}
review:
Same as train valley one this is a excellent train management-come-puzzle game.  It's a game that has been developed with loving care, bugs ironed out and balance made near perfect.
The devs is always on the job and listens to constructive feedback, more than that the dev's will act on player feedback.

The game is fun, very much so.  It's polished and is worth a lot more than the asking price.  They are not greedy and could easily ask twice the price for this game and get it.  Dev's like this deserve your support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107768152', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1522747962}
review:
说实话，这个游戏让我体验非常不爽。
原本我以为这个游戏就是，呜呜呜，然后money就哗哗哗。。。
结果TM根本不是！
火车各种duangduangduang......
你以为那是列车前进的音效？
too  simple!
火车各种撞起来简直不要太爽，简直突出一个excited！
这个游戏让我想起了那曾经在火车上延迟的那些个时光....
车厢内抠脚大汉的脚臭，泡面的芬芳了，熊孩子哭声,以及那焦急的面庞。
在这里，我要向所有在心里问候过的铁路从事人员的亲属表示歉意。
对不起！(鞠躬)
超时不是你们的错（[spoiler] TM是谁的错？ [/spoiler]）
[spoiler] 能不能用点心啊？！！！！	[/spoiler]
另外，作为一个老司机，我也要向所有在游戏里面的乘客道歉，
对不起！（鞠躬）
下次我会好好开车！
[spoiler] magnet:?xt=urn:btih:47125FFB406CD6DB738866305773E805A2A35CE5	[/spoiler]
再次道歉！
再见；
再见。

author: {'steamid': '76561197960283476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1458508335}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037741876', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1585121676}
review:
I got this game thinking it would be like Roller Coaster Tycoon, but found something slightly different. Yes it does require micromanagement, but did not need me to micromange a bunch of things. It need a little more thought in how and where I built tracks and use of my money. It is a nice game to just relax with and if you like to have a podcast or something else going on the side, at least for myself anyway.
      The graphics, while I don't speak for everyone, are nice. They make me feel like a kid playing with a model train set. It almost makes me want to go out and buy a model train set, but this was alot cheeper and had less of the mess. The graphics are not overly intensive but then again there really is no reason they need to be, but that is just my opinion. So I would would be willing to say that a good amount of computers could run this game no problems.
      While I have not completly finished this game I would still say I am willing to recommend this game to a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021622691', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1469903145}
review: Greatly enjoyed playing and completing Train Valley, the simple game concept flows really well and the increasing demands imposed by the levels work effectively to teach new concepts and challenge players. Plus, of course, the art in the game is just beautiful. The only downside are the limited number of levels and the artifical difficulty caused by some design choices, but I hope the developers will keep working to fix these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030884303', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1471434897}
review:
Уникальная вещь!  Редчайшая на моей памяти игра, где не надо никого убивать, строить козни, спасать один мир, покоряя другой или копаться в головах всяких психов. Нужно просто проектировать пути и внимательно переводить стрелки.  Но до чего же это может оказаться увлекательным!  Можно спонтанно играть в железную дорогу, любуясь как  паравозики пыхтят мимо милейших пейзажей, в стереотипах которых легко узнается страна и эпоха.  А можно ради совершенства результата напрячь комплексное стратегическое мышление, чтоб сделать перевозки максимально эффективными и автоматизированными.  
Геймплей выше всяких похвал, при том что я не особо жалую ни пазлы,  ни ртс - здешний коктейль пришелся очень даже по вкусу.  Вот с интерфейсом дела похуже, особенно по первому взгляду - все мелкое, не сразу понятное, нужно привыкнуть,  Ну и совсем схалтурили с сюжетом. Он как бы есть, но его совсем нет.  Думается немного пафосной лирики о значении труда железнодорожника в истории этого места на старте миссии были бы весьма кстати.  Но главный козырь тут в играбельности - уровней довольно много, стартовые вокзалы и элементы местности гернерируются случайно. Идеальный формат чтоб можно было играть понемногу, но очень долго.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141777568', 'num_games_owned': 5248, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1458227120}
review:
[h1]Review powered by [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/mamilosclub]Mamilos Club Group.[/url][/h1]

A primeira impressão que esse jogo transmite é: LEGO para crianças...Mas Train Valley não é LEGO muito menos para criancinhas

Ele é um jogo de estratégia e simulação ferroviária, que tem o objetivo de conectar Estações/Cidades, e garantir que os trens cheguem ao destino correto sem imprevistos pelo caminho.

O Train Valley possui 20 níveis e pode ser jogado no modo clássico, onde você é desafiado cumprir um conjunto de metas antes do tempo ou o dinheiro acabar, cumprindo isso, vocês irá alcançar as conquistas, cada nível desbloqueado libera uma nova fase. O outro modo de jogo é do tipo livre, que, pelo próprio nome, não necessita de descrição.

O que torna esse jogo divertido, viciante e difícil é a estratégia que deve ser utilizada na movimentação dos trens, pois caso você mude a rota, ou esqueça de manobrá-lo, você sofrerá uma colisão, e lá vão embora seus lucros.

O jogo possui gráficos excelentes, trilha sonora agradável e relaxante.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197963596414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1461492945}
review:
This is not another Railroad Tycoon type of game.  The main aim for Train Valley is to link a bunch of stations in close proximity and get the trains to the other stations as quickly as possible without them crashing into one another or going to the wrong station (colour coded).  Some also have objectives relating to the number of trains you must run before the time runs out or how much you need to earn (get them to stations quicker and/or run more trains).

This is pretty simply to play, but it requires constant attention  You are constantly fipping track switches to make the trains follow the correct route.  Highly recommended, particularly for casual gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023920509', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1457197861}
review:
Tl:DR =  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r1vx0FrwFWE&feature=youtu.be&ab_channel=LORDTRANCER

So i got this game from the the developers to test and make a review. Ill be honest its to much like a facebook game! Its too casual and i enjoy casual games. For this game it should be alot cheaper, i do think there are ways to improve the game. You can listen to my thoughts on this on the video above, but over all i beleive it is to expensive for what it is, its to casual and its not engaging, biggest improvement that could be made is making the stations to be able to be deployed where every you like instead of static locations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257053544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1595206648}
review:
Train Valley is a great game to play if you're looking for a casual train simulation/railroad builder. My only complaint is that there are fewer levels then I expected, but since the game is constantly getting updated, there should be more levels soon.

The game has 2 modes: Regular & Sandbox. In Regular Mode you have to watch your money and make sure to dispatch all the trains as quick as you can. In Sandbox Mode there are no limits. You can do whatever you want.

My rating: 8.7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063132955', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1523315455}
review: Really fun game to play. Easy at first, but then it gets more challenging. It's a little short, but there is a sandbox mode, which actually just an "endless" mode, where you can play any level, without any objectives, so you just play an play nad play... I just wish there were more levels (more worlds to play).

author: {'steamid': '76561198084488796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1528012865}
review:
I do really like this game, I like the challenge. However, there can be times where it's very frustrating because you may need to do some levels over and over again to get past them. Train Valley is about bulding train tracks from one station to another, and getting trains into the correct station.
Having a quick look in the settings, there is also a color blind mode in there, so if you need that option, they've added it for you!

SIMULAR GAMES: If you like a game on Steam called Mini Metro, you'll most likely like Train Valley. And for the people that remember the 1998 Loco Lego, and you liked the trains there, you MAY also like this game.

RATING: 7/10 - Good game, get it if you like puzzles, making train tracks, organisation and some added frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985941381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1468069614}
review:
This is a fun little train game.  It's economics are exceedingly simple as is the user interface.  

The basic game play is simple.  Lay track, control swiches, send trains to the right stations, don't run trains into each other or off the track.

The challenges, however, can be very difficult.  You may be required to earn a specific minimum amount of money while getting all your dispatches perfect, and doing so will require you to schedule extra trains that you can only just barely get enough routed, while trying to make sure you're switches are all lined up so the trains don't run into each other and end up on the right track.

Some reviewers have said the game is short.  This is true- there are only 24 scenarios and no scenario takes more than an hour.  However, the harder scenarios have great replay value and frankly will take many attempts to master anyway.

For enthusiasts of games like Railroad Tycoon (and I am a HUGE fan myself), this takes train management down several notches to the level of operating your own home layout - which quite frankly is something I've no doubt many people have been longing for because for all the wonderfullness of Railroad Tycoon, what it is NOT is a train dispatcher simulation.  Train Valley is.

Pros:
- Simple interface, simple economics
- You run trains, not companies
- Scenario complexity is just the right level of hard
- Feels like a home train layout vs. a national railroad model

Cons:
- UI needs refinement
- A little cutesy looking
- Feels like a home train layout vs. a national railroad model (yes this could be a pro OR con)

Overall?  4 stars with potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016636223', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1455361963}
review:
간단히 즐길 수 있는 게임. 전문적인 건설&경영 시뮬레이션 게임이라기보다는 퍼즐 게임에 가깝다.

맵에 지정되어 있는 역 사이를 선로로 이은 뒤, 역에 열차가 준비되면 목적지까지 운행시키면 되는데, 의외로 쉽지 않다. 
선로전환기(switch)를 직접 조작해서 열차 방향을 조작해야 하는데 클릭 한번만 잘못하면 열차가 딴 방향으로 간다. 
거기다가 맵에 따라 선로 놓는 공간이 제한되는 경우도 많아서 생각 많이 안하고 무작정 선로를 깔면 게임 진행이 심히 곤란해진다.

가격도 그리 비싸지 않고, 생각하면서 퍼즐을 푸는 느낌으로 진행할 수 있는 게임이다.


p.s OpenTTD 같은 거 생각하지 말 것. 그것보다는 휠씬 캐주얼하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041396332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1455196854}
review:
С грязной руганью, проклятиями в адрес разработчиков и прочими прелестями едва прошел первую кампанию (прохождением считается получение всех 3х медалек в каждой миссии). После 1ой миссии второй кампании снес от греха подальше сие творение.
Любопытно, разрабы сами пробовали получить все 3 медальки в некоторых миссиях? 
Кто ждет от игры расслабления и хорошего времяпрепровождения - идите мимо. Кто желает в поте лица переигрывать долбанные миссии по 15-20 раз подряд или просто доказать игре, что он - гуру стратегий с паровозиками - милости прошу.
P.S. В виду коментариев разработчиков (то бишь их мнгновенного отклика и пояснения) выдам игре "плюс". Просто, возможно, она для любителей хардора, а не бля простых стратегогонятелей, как я.

review:
Este jogo é de arrancar os cabelos. Muito bom, mas tem que haver persistência. Algumas partes se tornam até fáceis; mas caso seja derrotado, iniciasse da etapa que parou. Mas há umas que por um triz, muitas vezes tem que se repetir para se concluir a faze.

Animação boa; efeitos idem; som atrativo; manuseio simples de mais, e te prende no desespero quando tudo vai pros ares com um tremendo BOOMM!!!, faltando um tiquinho só para concluir a faze. Show, nota 10.

Vale apenas cada centavo porque quando se vê às horas, voaram longe, rsrsrs.
Abraço aos colegas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024119782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 5374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1454547316}
review: Great game and a nice 'puzzle' concept, especially for the price. You can while away many hours with this fun game. The only annoying aspect is, after a very short countdown, one or more trains may leave a station without any control by the player. This wouldn't be so bad if the train could be immediately stopped by the player but the icon does become ready often until it's too late. Of course, that could just be a limitation of my gaming skill but it appears other players have said the same thing. That aside, it's still a lot of fun for $10.00.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092348237', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1454177997}

author: {'steamid': '76561198161616672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1454296294}
review:
This is a really fun micro-managing game. You build tracks and guide trains to their respective stations, tryingto hurry them as fast as you can while also avoiding mistakes such as crashing trains together or delivering them to the wrong station. The goals are fun, and the later levels are actually a lot more challenging than I expected. I think it will still take me a few hours to beat all the levels and collect all of the task badges. 

However, I expected a lot more worldbuilding to be involved. When choosing "Sandbox" mode, you get to chose out of all the levels to center your trains, but you have unlimited money, no tasks, and a very tiny, prebuilt playing field. I honestly bought this game looknig for the worldbuidling aspect, but was pleasently surprised with a different kind of experience. Still, I -really- wish I could build cities, make my own stations, and actually run a rail in a huge environment. Maybe the later levels will resolve this. Still having a lot of fun with it though!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136295424', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1453666662}
review:
[h1] Notice: This game was sent to me to review by my YouTube network. However, my opinion is not biased and is honest to how I feel ab out the game. [/h1]

Train Valley has been sitting in my Steam Library since October, and I only downloaded it today when I was bored. To my surprise, it's a lot of fun. For the (almost) hour I've played, I have enjoyed every minute. 

[list]
[*]Firstly, Train Valley has an outstanding almost cartoonish art style.

[*]Secondly, The game has a lot of content. With over 24 levels, each lasting about 15 minutes(or longer), there's a lot to get through. Not to mention the Sandbox mode, which allows you play all the aforementioned with unlimited money and other game changing bonuses. 

[*]Thirdly, I enjoyed the sound track. Great ambient music.

[*]Last but not least, Train Valley is extremely well optimised. On the highest settings, I was easily generating way over 60fps. Allowing for an enjoyable, good looking experience.
[/list]

Overall, the game is great. But it's not very original. I've seen these game idea countless times online, usually free too. However, the quality and quantity of content in Train Valley cannot be beaten.

I highly recommend this game and I would of definitely paid the £6.99/$9.99 price premium had I not been offered it for free.

[h1] Correction: [/h1] I discovered this game is capped at 60fps, which I was easily maxing out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040147515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3461, 'last_played': 1520392182}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122916952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1542, 'last_played': 1476295857}
review:
This is a much more refined and polished version of the flash game, Railway Valley. http://railwayvalley.com/
The puzzles are the same, but much more though out. The interface is similar, but much easier to use. If you enjoy Railway Valley, then Train Valley does everything a reboot/sequel should do, it takes what worked and makes it better. 

Highly addictive, and sometimes so frustrating, but that's what makes it fun. It's never so hard you are unsure how it can be done. You can see victory, it's just a rail away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093181272', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1523997446}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114805885', 'num_games_owned': 5329, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1453127241}
review:
[quote=][b]Train Valley[/b] - стратегия-симулятор железной дороги с режимом песочницы, в котором предстоит создать свою собственную железнодорожную империю, умело руководить трафиком поездов и просто выполнять предложенные миссии.[/quote]

В Train Valley есть несколько режимов игры, наверно самым интересным станет режим истории, в которую вошли: золотая лихорадка, морская железная дорога Флориды, Вторая Мировая война, холодная война и запуск первого человека в космос. Еще вас ждет четыре сезона игры: Европа (1830 – 1980), Америка (1840 – 1960), Россия (1880 – 1980), Япония (1900 – 2020). Помимо этого, еще есть режим песочницы, в котором нет ограничений, и вы просто развиваете свою железную дорогу.

[u]✔ ПОНРАВИЛОСЬ:[/u]
[list]
[*]Красивый интерфейс .
[*]Увлекательный игровой процесс.
[*]История.
[*]Приятные звуковые эффекты.
[*]Коллекционные карточки.
[*]Достижения Steam.[/list]

[h1] Моя Оценка 8/10 ... [/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=603444662

author: {'steamid': '76561197998659977', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1452559884}
review: Train Valley ist ein charmanter und kurzweiliger Puzzler, der sich durch die Möglichkeit zu pausieren und die dadurch entstehende Ruhe von den gängigen Zug-Puzzle-Spielen abhebt. Freunde entsprechender Spiele werden damit 5-10 Stunden gut unterhalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035523550', 'num_games_owned': 2213, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1680329706}
review:
Train Valley is a casual real-time puzzle game, with trains as theme.

It's casual as it's 24 levels only takes 10 minutes each to finish, excluding pausing and retries on the harder levels :).
It's a micromanagement game, with your objective to route trains to the correct destination without making them crash or end up at the wrong station.
The puzzle element comes from the challenge of building an optimum track layout that allows many trains to run at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995998723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1451684560}
review: Fun game for a while, and it actually gets quite difficult. In the higher levels you are pressured by both time (you need to deploy extra trains) and by the fact that the trains autostart when you keep them waiting for too long. Haha, I hated this! But it gets boring after a while, the levels look very similar to each other even though they have different names/countries in the menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171259739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3411, 'last_played': 1534176358}
review: Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002251148', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2585, 'last_played': 1544647462}
review:
The very first thing you should know about this game is that it is [b]not[/b] a business simulation! This is no Railroad Tycoon or Industry Giant. It is more of a micro management focused virtual model railway. If that sounds strange and unconventional to you you might want to check out the free demo first.

The gameplay consists only marginally of financial management and largely of creating track layouts and manual train guidance. The challenge comes from creating connections between set stations and handling an ever growing amount of railway traffic that will put your planning skills to the test. With the help of 3 different game speeds and a pause button at your disposal you can decide yourself how reflex heavy each level will be.

This game is best played in short bursts since each level can be finished within minutes. Yet it maintains a decently high level of replayability, especially for players that like to maximize their efficiency and want to perfect track layouts for optimal capacity.

The level design is appealing and varied with an almost toy-like aesthetic. And the music is appropriately soothing and up-beat. Though it might get repetetive if you decide to 'binge' the game and finish it in one sitting.
Depending on your personal aim in terms of perfection and Highscores that may take you between 5 and 20 hours.

Overall you can expect a very pleasent experience for a rather low price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101178038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1527497957}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002302830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1498844206}
review:
Not sure if you've ever played "Sid Meier's Railroads" but it's a much more simplified version of that (and that game was fairly simple to begin with!). Someone also compared it to "Lionel's(?) Train Town" which is also a fair comparison to make!

To start with, it's not a tycoon game so don't be fooled by the images if they look like a Railroad Tycoon. The game is more focused on being a puzzle game based around trains. I'm sure if you've played Railroad Tycoon or the like you've had to overcome complicated junctions or network improvements the puzzles tend to focus on that skill - placing stations in awkward places. 

Every so often the game will general a train which will be at one of the stations (there's a gauge timer thing at the bottom right of the screen so you can see when the next train will generate) - you can also call on addional trains to create additional revenue. The train will be assigned a colour and you have to create a route via the switches/junctions you've made in your solution to get the train to it's destination. Laying track and destroying objects costs money and, along with a tax you have to pay, your balance can deplete quickly - going below 0 results in bankrupcy and you lose the game.

There are four different regions progressing in difficulty. Difficulty in this game is present through awkwardly placed stations, objects to either neogotiate around or destroy and build over at an addition cost (depends on what you destroy for cost) and the challenges present in each level (spend x money, don't let trains go to the wrong stations, etc) create some replayability.

This is a fun puzzler and the trains were just a bonus (well, at least for me anyway).

author: {'steamid': '76561197984909498', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1368, 'last_played': 1541410121}
review:
Ett trevligt spel som håller dig underhållen. Om du gillar att koordinera transporter och se till att transporterna löper på effektivt och smidigt, så är detta spelet för dig. Lagom klurigt och varierade banor. 
Jag hade önskat en längre kampanj - kanske kommer fler?

author: {'steamid': '76561198025143383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1647889307}
review:
Like others have said it isn't a train management game, it's a puzzle game, but it's a really good one. The graphics are great and not too taxing on a system, which means I can start it up and have a quick play in seconds. Dipping in and out is no problem and replaying some of the easier levels takes on a zen-like quality. 

The game is charming, with good music and sound effects and a really great design, essentially like looking at a really good train set!

I was playing on level 9 or so and made a really elegant rail system, so when I didn't notice I had two trains on the same path until too late I literally cried out! All I'm saying is that any game that can get that sort of reaction is a good game. 

My one critisism is that the first time I played my progress was lost because I wasn't syncing to the cloud. But thats a small complaint because it was easy t o fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057741176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1453855294}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052533235', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1450207025}
review:
Pro's
+ easy gameplay of starting/stopping/reversing trains, setting switches and building new railways
+ the feeling of those near-miss moments, well planned two way railways and "roundabouts"
+ the rocket launch (I didn't even notice it until after it happened)
+ levels change on a restart of the same level

Mixed
- not a lot of different trains; I would've liked more real trains and some sort of collectors book-ish element
- the graphics of the levels; often you're just to busy managing your routes to notice it though

Con's
- the UI; would've been visually easier to have all the elements in the top center
- the menu's look really bad to me, I like the concept of the history book and stamps though
- some special trains are sometimes pushing waiting trains out of the station without notice or countdown timer; happens only on a few levels

Recommended
+ pausing the game while building tracks ;)
+ classical music (for stress relief) playlist via Youtube
+ spending the money you earn on improving your railways (layout)

Still unsure? There's a demo that represents the game well (played that about 3 hours before purchase as well)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012415113', 'num_games_owned': 1129, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1546971819}
review: Need a little game to calm your nerves? [b]That's not Train Valley.[/b] It may look like casual fun, but it gets pretty hectic, pretty soon. Don't get me wrong, i really like it.  It's enjoyable logic/micro-management game. Building tracks, sending trains to right stations, trying not to crush them to each other, trying not to bankrupt... Sounds easy, but when the level becomes filled with trains and you must constantly juggle them ... It can ruin your nerves :) Active pause function helps a bit, but very often one mistake, one delay and you're royally **cked.   Overall, [b]very cool game[/b], but remember - it's not a cakewalk.  Far from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971589448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1514395530}
review:
I've been enjoying this puzzle/strategy/simulation game even though it's become taxing as I've got later into the game.

Don't expect A-Train, Transport Tycoon, Railroad tycoon etc as it's not a business simulator in that sense.

The concept is simple, match the trains to their destinations and try to use the shortest routes possible to make sure you get the most money when they arrive, you have to do all this while not bankrupting yourself from building track.

It can get extremely fast paced and you have to keep an eye on how your track switches are orientated as when a train passes it switches them to align with it's path, so it can mess up other trains paths.  Switches can also sometimes be obscured by buildings, so they require careful placement.

Is it worth the price I paid for it? 
Well If you rent a dvd for £3.50 it can enterain you for approximately 2 hours, this games priced currently at £6.99 and you might notice I've spent a few more hours than that playing, so I've got my moneys worth out of it.  

If I could go back in time and advise myself as to whether I should buy it, I would recommend it to myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999151078', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1557528637}
review:
Despite what you may think looking at the store page, this is less of a management sim and more of a straight-up puzzle game, although it does a decent job of simulating a rail network. It's quite a good game too: fun, challenging and pretty to boot. The only train-related complaint I have is that the steam locomotives are often depicted without tenders, but as you'll usually be playing from a birds-eye view, it's not a huge issue.


However, I have to say that Train Valley reminds me of an older train puzzle game, one near and dear to my heart: [url=http://www.xtcabandonware.com/game/2496/3-d-ultra-lionel-train-town-deluxe]3D Ultra Lionel TrainTown[/url], developed in 2000 by Dynamix. That game focused on completing missions and solving puzzles, while in Train Valley your main goal is to simply survive until the end of a level without going bankrupt, although completing side goals earns you stamps of recognition. 

Train Valley has players reenact a more realistic depiction of railroading history - although it's mainly in the background - all the while attempting to stay afloat and expand to meet the needs of industry. Players take the role of trainmaster and planner, building tracks and then routing trains to their intended destination.

TrainTown has you manually hauling freight such as ore to smelters, hamburgers to grills, or numbers to multiplication equations. It plays its Lionel model train aesthetic to the hilt and is definitely "wackier", if you're into that sort of thing. Controlling multiple locomotives at the same time is only something you might need to do in the later levels; although it's possible in every level, you don't really need to in the early game.

In TrainTown, [i]one[/i] crash fails a level, and some of those levels were as complex as any you may find in Train Valley. I mean, if the first set of levels was intended for elementary school kids, the last set was probably meant for those with associates degrees. I feel comfortable in saying TrainTown is harder, but satisfying to play as well.

(Incidentally, Train Valley's gameplay is also reminiscent of levels in Railroad Tycoon 2 & 3 where you simply had to route trains across a rail network, as opposed to building a profitable railroad company.)


I know this is a recommendation for Train Valley, which I absolutely recommend for puzzle and train fans, but if you like it I'd say you should give TrainTown a shot too. It's more or less abandonware at this point anyway, no harm in trying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073094447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1553538685}
review:
I love this game. When I say I love I mean: I'm at my office, trying to work and this game is whispering me nice words. 3 minutes later I'm at my desk creating the best train system in the whole fucking valley. I am kind of obsessed with it.
It's relaxing and yet infuriating at the same time. It makes you love trains and hate trains.
It gives you confidence with velocity, but it's exhausting how your confidence is your worst enemy.
Not enough levels. It has plenty of levels but I want more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031200400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1447748525}
review:
Price point score $2.50 Potential $60
First it looks nice and the building works well.
There is nothing really to this game. If you have streached it out to two hours you will see everything it has to offer. The sand box is made for the 4 yr old cousin that bugs you to play. it's so tiny so no pleasure for the building a beutiful thing crowd. the campain is throwing trains at you like there is no such thing as a shedual ever invented. The trains just apear and go after a short time. No time to organize build or repair mistakes. Just throw trains at you till you're broke or broken. This is not a building game nor a train shedual organization sim. So who is this game built for? 4yr ld is not going to like the campain but theres not enough to keep anyone older occupied for more than 20min. So who is this game built for? Why does it get so many unearned recomendations? Is it not finished? Do not try an run this on Windows 10 it is very unstable and a big fight to get it to run.
the potential idea is here for a good game they just haven't put the effort in.

Price point score $2.50 
Potential $60

I now rank my games for it's price point and potential price point. the point at which a game is worth taking the risk on, as in condition. What the game is worth to me to buy. Also the potential price.  The price it would be worth when the game is fully realized and functioning. What the game would be worth to me if what potential i see in it gets completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969116507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1583107725}
review: Très bon petit jeu de puzzle, assez addictif pour ma part. Mais j'ai fini le mode histoire j'espère de nouveaux niveaux dans les prochaines mise-à-jour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030777612', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1448082989}
review:
ステージクリア型の鉄道路線マネージメントゲーム。どちらかというとパズルゲームに近く、箱庭ゲーム、シミュレーションゲームのたぐいでは決してないので注意。
駅と駅を繋ぐ線路を敷き、汽車を目的の駅までうまく導いてゆくゲーム。ミニチュアっぽさが良い味を出している。
気軽に遊べるパズルゲーム、ミニチュア的なゲームをお求めの方に特におすすめ。

ルールは非常にシンプル。駅と駅を繋ぐ線路を敷き汽車を目的の駅まで導いて資金を得ながら、時間切れまでにステージ毎に課せられた様々なノルマを満たす。資金が尽きた時点でゲームオーバー。
プレイヤーが行うことは、レールを敷き、汽車を走らせ、ポイントを切り替えるだけ。
汽車は一定時間毎に駅に配備され、同時にどの駅へ向かうか示される。汽車達を目的の駅に到着できるようポイントを切り替えたり、他の汽車とぶつからないよう停止させたりといった作業をこなしていく。

シンプルなルールだがステージの構成がとてもよく練られているため、効率的に汽車を動かすための線路配置や、汽車を動かす順番を吟味するのがとても楽しい。
うっかりポイントの切り替えを忘れて汽車と汽車がぶつかり爆発四散したり、線路配置を失敗してうまいこと汽車を運行できなかったり・・・。そんな失敗をしても、よっしゃもう一回挑戦だ！となるリプレイ性の高さも高評価。
よくまとまった良作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090259142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1458519900}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168987818', 'num_games_owned': 964, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1505670848}
review:
Train Valley - представляет собой красочную и сложную инди-стратегию в который вам предстоит управлять целой сетью железнодорожных путей, а также соблюдать выделенный бюджет и выполнять трудные миссии. 

Весь смысл игры построен на том, чтобы отправлять поезда с промышленными изделиями или вовсе пассажирские вагоны из одной точки в другую для получения прибыли. На дворе 1830 год и вы начинаете своё путешествие из стран Европы, а именно из Нидерландов. Следующая глава будет посвящена 1850 годам и вы отправитесь в одну из великих держав, а именно в Соединённые Штаты Америки. Следующая нация, в которую вы отправитесь это Союз Советских Социалистических Республик здесь вам придётся управлять своей железнодорожной сетью во время Второй мировой, Холодной войны, а также пройти события запуска ракеты. Последняя она же современная глава истории будет происходить на территории Японии страны новейших технологий и лучших поездов во всём мире. 

Игровой процесс может показаться на первый взгляд очень простым и лёгким. Сложность игры будет повышаться с каждым новым уровнем. Акцент в Train Valley заложен исключительно на стратегические действия, а именно нужно правильно и точно строить железнодорожные пути, которые приведут поезд быстро и эффективно в пункт назначения. В игре есть функция в виде паузы в которой можно все обдумать без спешки и осуществить свой план строительства и вновь продолжить. Можно строить дороги без особого планирования, но тогда в большинстве случаев составы будут сталкиваться между собой или вовсе уходить с рельсов. Каждый состав нужно выпускать в определённый промежуток времени, чтобы беспрепятственно доехал до места назначения. Вам также придётся целесообразно распределять свой бюджет который выдаётся в начале миссии. Если же не будете следить за своими денежными средствами, то провалите задания. 

В игре будут доступны различные игровые режимы. Увлекательная игра в истории, интересный режим в случайной генерации, а также всеми любимая песочница в которой можно делать все без каких-либо ограничений по времени и деньгам. 

Вас ждёт большое количество разнообразных видов поездов. Вы сможете наблюдать во время процесса игры как менялась индустрия локомотивов начиная от самых первых до современных. Помимо самих локомотивов присутствуют и различные виды вагонов начиная от пассажирских заканчивая различными цистернами. 

Красивый и уникальный интерфейс в виде альбома с марками под которыми скрываются миссии. Очень простенькие достижения которые можно выполнить в течение 7-10 часов. 

Конечно, в игре есть и недостатки, например, бросаться в глаза отсутствие Steam Workshop в котором можно было бы сделать свою карту для игры в песочнице. Слабо насыщенные карты, которые не передают атмосферу города. Визуально игра выглядит не лучшим образом. 

В итоге, можно сказать, что Train Valley качественная стратегия, которая заставит вас каждый раз обдумывать как правильнее построить путь. Также радует, что в игре отсутствуют различные микротранзакции. 

Плюсы: 
Увлекательный игровой процесс 
Большое количество стран 
Стратегическая составляющая 
Три игровых режима 
Достижения Steam 
Красивый интерфейс 
Большое количество поездов и вагонов 
Приятные звуковые эффекты 

Минусы: 
Отсутствует Steam Workshop 
Низкий уровень графики 
Маленькие карты 
Отсутствие атмосферы городов 

7/10

*Для ознакомления с игрой, ключ предоставил разработчик. Этот факт никак не влияет на моё личное мнение об игре, мне за это не платят. 

Вы можете прочитать наши мнения о других играх в группе: 
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/SpecialGamesClub#curation

author: {'steamid': '76561198006807283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1498840842}
review:
Микроменеджмент поездов в простой, понятной форме.
У вас есть бюджет, есть заказы по перевозу грузов/пассажиров с одной станции в другую. С течением времени станций и заказов становиться больше. Вам нужно не допускать столкновений поездов и при этом не стать банкротом.
Игроку нужно постоянно следить за вышедшими поездами, параллельно составляя список последующих «рейсов». Бороться с собственным чувством перфекционизма при построении и эксплуатации дорог. Переигрывая, карта строится по другому, запрещая строить одинаковые пути.
От режима «песочница» я ожидал случайно генерируемых карт или редактора. Но это неспешная тренировка построения идеальной дороги. UI хотелось бы крупнее и удобнее.
Главное - ты играешь отдыхая. Сделав ошибку – понимаешь, что это только твоя вина, а не багов, большой сложности или недоработки разработчиков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017706666', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1469758898}
review:
[h1]A Paladin’s Review: Train Valley. Cursing at Train Switches from 1830 to 2020.[/h1]
[list]
[*]Genre: Indie Micromanagement Puzzle Game. 
[*]Developed and Published by: Oroboro Games & Flazm.
[*]Platform: Windows, MacOSX and Linux.
[*]Business Model: Base Game + Upcoming DLC
[*][i]Copy Purchased by Myself[/i] 
[/list]
[i][url=http://kingisaaclinksr.com/2015/11/07/a-paladins-review-train-valley-cursing-at-train-switches-from-the-1830s-to-the-2020s/]Read the full & unabridged review on A Paladin Without A Crusade[/url][/i]

[b]Overall Gameplay Thoughts[/b]
Train Valley, a quirky little title that got a surprising amount of press attention considering this is the publisher’s first game. Are we really that starved for train management styled games that anything that resembles one needs to be checked out? The answer is probably yes. The genre has been forever dominated by Open Train Tycoon, Train Tycoon Deluxe and the like for the past 20 years. Entries into the genre are far and few between, often lacking in quality. Here’s the thing, Train Valley isn’t a management game in the traditional sense. Not by a long shot. This is more of a puzzle game where the single objective is to figure out how to solve the level without running out of cash and subsequently going bankrupt. Everything else is a secondary concern.

On the surface, it looks like a simple micromanagement game and it is but there’s some mechanics woven in to make the experience more interesting. All you’ll be doing is deploying trains, building track and managing switches. During the level, trains need to be deployed and delivered to their destination station as soon as possible for a couple of reasons: each train has a money value, that’s rewarded to the player upon completion, which slowly deteriorates over time. Additionally, trains will launch automatically from the station after a certain amount of time. The only warning you’ll get is a five second notification before they launch. So, you need to make sure that stations are regularly deploying trains to prevent any accidents from occurring. This is made more complicated by the levels themselves which will spawn additional stations which need to be connected to the rest of the line and increasingly faster trains. Furthermore, there’s an in-game annual tax that you have to make sure to have money for. So, avoid being greedy or risk losing the level. Finally, as time passes, buildings will crop up over time that you may need to maneuver around or destroy (costing a lot of money).

[b]Content Thoughts[/b]
There are four chapters in total that are centered around a particular nation (or group of nations) that create the overall theme for each level and the trains you’ll see. This includes Europe, the United States, Russia and Japan. Over the course of each chapter, the levels will transition from the early 1830s to the modern age of 2020 while featuring a certain time era for that nation in the level. This changes what the trains look like as well. In terms of how it affects mechanics, the changing of time will increase the length of the trains and make them faster. For each chapter, there’s five challenge levels and one score attack level. Each challenge level also comes with the option to continue the level forever once you’ve finished it. For each level, there’s three optional goals you can try to shoot for and you don’t have to get all of them in one go. These goals can range from never wrecking a train, to gaining a certain amount of money to not allowing a train arrive at the wrong destination. They can be challenging to acquire, especially the gaining X amount of money, and may require several redos. I recommend trying to finish one of them during a level because they’ll add challenge to the levels and give them their own personality. It would have been nice if the achievements you had already completed were marked as such but it’s not a big deal. The score attack level is the culmination of the entire chapter. It plays the entire time period for the nation in one go from 1800s to 2000s while also doubling the in-game speed. This can be very tricky to deal with as it means taxes come twice as fast even though your trains stay at the same speed. Good luck on the Japan level, it’s brutally difficult.

[b]PC Settings[/b]
Settings for Train Valley are decent, if limited. Video settings only include two sliders for resolutions and quality. You’ll probably run the quality at “fantastic” unless you’re trying to run this off a toaster. Resolution choices seem pretty good and it maxes out at the monitor’s resolution. The game has a cheap 3D look to it so it’s not like there’s any options missing. Fullscreen on/off and colorblind mode are included as well. There’s only two sound slider options for effects and music. You’ll probably end up turning music off quickly because it is quite awful. That definitely could have used some more work. Rebindable keys with secondary buttons are here for every control as well. The game also supports multiple languages.

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
I’ve been looking for a lighter train management experience like Train Valley for some time and their timing was lucky. The game looks cheap both mechanically and visually but it’s got a surprising amount of depth to keep the player engaged throughout the four chapters. Their asking price is right on the money in my opinion. Biggest issues I have with Train Valley are the music and sandbox mode. The music is awful, repetitive and not fun to listen to. The sandbox mode basically gives you unlimited resources to do whatever you want but there’s not a lot of flexibility to do anything crazy, so I don’t think you’ll use it much. For a bit of micromanagement fun to play every now and again, Train Valley works and plays well. The four chapters are challenging enough that you won’t blitz right through them and playing for the achievements will give you even more playtime. An enjoyable, if light, indie game.

[h1][url=http://wp.me/p4fZDz-2tn]Read this review and more on A Paladin Without A Crusade[/url][/h1]
