author: {'steamid': '76561198006894374', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1475003514}
review:
Before I get into the review here's the basics of how the review will work. There are normally 10 categories
that I use when reviewing a game. Those ten categories are Fun, Creativity, Challenge, Graphics, Music, Cinematics, 
Story, Content, Controls, Gameplay. Each Category will be rated 1 through 10 with a maximum score out of 100.

So let's get started on the review.

Train Valley is an Indie, Simulation, Strategy game published by Flazm and developed by  Alexey Davydov, Sergey Dvoynikov, and Timofey Shargorodskiy, and was released on September 16th of 2015. 

Category 1: FUN (10 out of 10).

After playing about 40 minutes of the game I have found that the game is actually quite entertaining to me. While I'm not normally a puzzle gamer this game did catch my eye as I do have quite an interest in trains in general.

Category 2: Creativity (10 out of 10).

In this Category my perspective is that mostly for train based games, I've normally found simulation or strategy types without a puzzle element. Now while I'm sure that there are other puzzle genre train games out there, this is the only one that I have come across in these early days of my gaming channel. I'm sure that I'll be finding more out there.

Category 3: Challenge (10 out of 10).

In the beginning of the game, as to be expected, there was no challenge at all. At first I thought the challenge aspect wasn't going to really build up but by the fourth level, I found that I was just lying to myself. Things got quite interesting in fact. Now, I only made it the first 5 levels before I started becoming flustered and gave up.

Category 4: Graphics (10 out of 10).

The Graphics in this game seem to me to be a bit child-like cartoonish, but in all honesty I also feel that being a family friendly game, it was meant to be done in this fashion. My framerates while both generally playing and recording this video stayed steady between 29 and 30 frames per second for me while utilizing an MSI R7 250 2gb pci-e video card with the resolution set at 1920 by 1080, with the fullscreen option ticked and quality settings put at recommended (which I believe were at the highest quality settings.) It was easy enough to see everything with my vision problems and the textures were quite decent for the style given.

Category 5: Audio (06 out of 10).

There's really not much to be said about the music in the game other than it seems to be one looped track throughout what I've played. If the music changes in the game, I've not been made aware of it as of yet. That being said, the music seems to be slightly upbeat and wasn't overtaxing on my ears; however, I do tire of the same thing on a constant basis when it comes to instrumental music. I'd prefer variety and would have liked to seen more tracks during my gameplay. The sounds effects however were lovely and I was able to distinguish what I was listening to based on the effects of the actions taken. The sound effects is basically what is saved this category.

Category 6: Cinematics (05 out of 10).

The only cinematics that I've experienced is at the beginning of the game and between the levels where the portfolio book opens and the levels get stamped. Now, while a lot of others would not call it cinematics but more along the lines of animations which would end up in graphics, I felt as if putting it here would be the best choice. That being said, I felt as if they could've used a bit of work by actually making the animations into a more lively cinematic by adding an arm coming from the screen and a hand actually opening the portfolio. I would have also like to have seen some sort of cutscenes either animted or filmed to help fit the story line.
	
Category 7: Story (08 out of 10).

While there is a Story Mode to the game I've not really witnessed the story, but based on several reviews I've read including those from Steam Users and well known reviewers the Story is pretty good. I didn't have the time to fully delve into the Story itself, I've rated this Category based on many many reviews both positve and negative.
	
Category 8: Content (08 out of 10).

With 15 different trains and 18 different cars I was quite happy in the beginning with what was available. While I didn't get to witness all of the trains or cars personally during my short playtime, I was quite happy with the levels 'release' of train types based on level and time and am quite positive that as the Story unfolds any player will love experiencing each type. I would also love to see future releases of content with more cars and engines and maybe even some sort of expansion pack or update that allows more freedom. I would even like to see turntables and signals added into the game to give a bit more realism in stopping or turning the train around. Maybe even an option to also choose an engine type when selecting an early train. But all in all, I'm satisfied with what is available now.
	
Category 9: Controls (10 out of 10).

First let me just say that I love the controls in this game; and one of the things I like most is that you can map the controls to your liking. Control mappings are Switch mode, Build mode, Demolish mode, Scheduling additional trains, Pausing, Speed settings and even the Menu. You also have the capability of inverting the zoom functionality as well as adjusting the scroll speeds to your liking. The mouse movements were very fluid and I was able to hit switches with ease as well as getting the trains to stop and reverse with great ease. With all the games I've played, I never could stand having to put the mouse in a very small precise locations in order to toggle something and that includes train as well as aviation simulators. I was quite pleased with how well the controls were made.
	
Category 10: Gameplay (10 out of 10).

The gameplay itself was quite easy to understand from the beginning and the small video tutorials that popped up were a huge help. For being some one who's easily distracted, I was able to keep focues while playing lest I wreck everything and destroy the world. I also loved the fact that if you didn't acknowledge a train within a certain timeframe that they would depart anyhow, and if you aren't paying a lick of attention, there's no telling where that train could end up. As the cities grew I was fascinated by each building popping up as trains arrived, as if the city was growing. As the game continues and I progressed the levels I became more and more interested in the game.

Overall Rating: So when all is said and done, I'm giving Train Valley an overall rating of 87 out of 100. I was quite pleased with everything and looking forward to playing this game a lot in the future as a wonderful way to either pass time or test my logic when I'm feeling quite... illogical. 

Thanks for reading my review and I hope it helped in your decision regarding the purchase of this game. Remember, there is a Demo if you'd like to try before you buy and experience it for yourself.

For the review video I've done, see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZAERWWmmZLo

author: {'steamid': '76561198020669067', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2586, 'last_played': 1555605312}
review:
A great time killer and quite addictive. Train Valley will keep you entertained and frustrate you at the same time then keep you coming back for a little bit more.

You start out with a couple of train stations popping up with a train or two, they're waiting for you to lay down some tracks so they can be on their way, safe and sound, for now, to their final destination.
As you progress more train stations will pop up here or there and that's when it starts to get interesting, trains are flying this way and that, tracks need to be layed then switched at the right junctions so you're heading to the correct station, meanwhile another train is coming at it head on. soon you'll have up to 10 trains running at the same time and you'll be looking at your elegant and efficient track layout with a smile just as a train you forgot about explodes after another head on.

With a spare half hr or so to kill i'll happily have a go of each level again, it can also be hard to drag yourself away once started.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198088953897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1448031347}
review:
これは本当にいいゲームです
ひさびさに良ゲーと呼べるパズルゲームに出会えた感じはします
少し前にiPhoneのアプリでたしか「江ノ電」というプラレールを髣髴させるような
ゲームがあったのですが、それに少し似ています

それと違うのは１つの電車が目標地点にたどり着けるような線路を設計するのではなく
この作品は列車ごとに重さの違う貨物を引くことで違うスピードで走る列車たちを
２つ同時に、いや場合によっては４つ同時にマップ上を正しく誘導しなくてはいけません

一旦忙しい瞬間をやりすごすために、列車を一度止めたりしてもクリアは可能なのですが
自分への挑戦！といった具合にあえて無理そうでも止めずに走らせるのも楽しいです

すごく難しく感じることもありますが、ノーミスでクリアした際は最高の気分です！

author: {'steamid': '76561198028202662', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1445090868}
review:
[table]
[tr]
[th]Disclaimer: the key was provided to me for reviewing[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

Train Valley is a real time puzzle-strategy game based on trains and railroads. The player connects train stations and makes sure trains reach their correct destination by changing switches on the railroad he/she build himself/herself.

The game has a nice simplistic menu that is shaped as a stockbook (book that is used by stamp collectors). Every Postage stamp in it is a level of the game. There are 20 levels total. The game has two game modes. One of them is classic mode which consist of levels that has a time and money limit, and also have optional objectives. The other mode is sandbox. As the name suggests, there are no restrictions and limits. Also in this mode, the player decides stations’ spawn time and when a train is scheduled from a station. At the beginning, all levels except the first one is locked. New levels are opened by beating the previous level. To play sandbox version of a level, the player needs to beat the same level in classic mode.

First level is a tutorial level that shows basics of the game. Although it shows the most important parts of the game with nice message boxes, other parts are only mentioned in small bubbles that can be easily missed. Luckily, game is very simple and can be learned in a few games. That said, it would be nice to have a better tutorial.

A level starts with two stations. Player is given some money to build railroads. After that trains start to be scheduled. When such train is scheduled, an icon appears on the station it is in. Then player starts the train by simply clicking it. That said, it is not possible to make a train wait forever. After an unknown time, it starts to count down from 5 and moves when the countdown reaches zero. As time passes, more stations are spawned making the game and railroad network more complicated. That said, it will never be too complicated as a tycoon but has its challenges of its own.

Origin and destination of a train is handled very nicely in the game. It is color coded. Every train and station has a color on it. And the purpose is to make a train reach the station with the same color. When the train reaches its destination, the player gets the money. Amount of money is determined at the time of the spawn of a train. After that it will start decreasing even if the train is still in the starting station. 

This game is not a detailed tycoon game. It is designed as a puzzle-strategy game. The main purpose of the game in a level is not to bankrupt, but in this game, “bankrupt” means “negative money”. There are no loans, no maintenance cost, no economy. The player earns money by making a train reach its correct destination. After that he/she uses the money to build railroads to connect newly spawned stations. Every game year, a constant tax is debited from the money. There are only two ways the player’s money goes below zero; tax and train crash. As soon as the player’s money is negative, he/she loses. This mechanic is the games strategy part.

The puzzle part is more interesting. Because the actual puzzle is built by the player without him/her realizing. After connecting a few stations with railroads, railroads become a (simple) maze with switches left and right. More stations mean more railroads with more switches. It is never possible to create a network without switches because of either landscape or money constraints. Towards the end of a level, the player keeps clicking switches to send the trains to correct road and prevent crashes. This is the most fun part of the game.

Sounds in the game is nice and relaxing but it would be better to have a few different sound tracks.

Total game length is a bit short. There are 20 levels but if the player doesn’t care about optional objectives, then they will end quickly.

[h1][b]Pros:[/b][/h1]
[b]+ Simplistic:[/b] All menus and tabs are cleverly put together in a clear and simple manner.

[b]+ Relaxing:[/b] Because it is simple and lacks ambition, it is fit to be played just to relax.

[h1][b]Cons:[/b][/h1]
[b]- Short:[/b] Don’t have many levels.

[h1][b]Verdict:[/b][/h1]
Train valley is a nice and relaxing game. It gives the feeling of playing actual toy trains and if you like trains, you probably will like this game. That said, because it is short, I recommend it to be best considered as a side game when you got bored of other stuff.

[i][b]P.S: As a rule, I won't comment on price tag. Everyone has a different opinion on whether it is worth the price tag or not. So it is up to you to decide.[/b][/i]

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

[i]Edit: Fixed some typos and formatting[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047314661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1515587484}
review:
A simple but surprisingly addictive little game about model trains and railways.

There are two main components to this game: Setting up an efficient railway between given stations on the map, and directing as many trains to their destinations as possible. 

Each train is worth a set amount of money that decreases with time, so the quicker you get it to its destination, the more money you get. As the game goes on, you'll have to juggle more and more trains with different lengths and speeds.

Beyond earning money, each level has specific objectives which will require different approaches to beat. (like don't stop any trains, don't destroy tracks or buildings, launch a number of extra trains and so on)

The demo version covers most of what the game has to offer, so I recommend you start with that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026042052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1534739191}
review:
Every so often I'll watch with confidence as my trains all fall into place,  heading to their destinations...but I missed ONE switch and 2 trains collide which totally catches me offguard and my confidence is shattered. 


I found Train Valley to be a very fun and addicting micromanagment puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007330945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1460212124}
review: A extremely fun yet challenging casual train game that doesn't take hours to play each new map.  You have a map where you lay track to get your trains from station to station with a budget, timeframe and objectives.  Simple and entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990494580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1567575491}
review:
Perfect little game worth the money. One of the few games I can see trying to do all the achievements . If my time log is right, I 'beat' this in 18 hours, but I can see the challenge of getting most of the remaining achievements worth another 10 or 20 hours alone. I wish it would have overlaid another level of challenge on each level with some kind of star ranking based on money earned or some other metric. Instead, it general gives you three objectives, so 'beating' a level 'completely' is meeting the three objectives, which is often very challenging. But it would add even more replayability if it set an income level for a bronze, silver, and gold medal, or a three-star rating, for example. 

The game feels like someone boiled down a Railroad Tycoon game until the concentrated essense that was left fit on one screen and took maybe 20 or 30 minutes at the very most to complete. Most of the good stuff is present, but it's compressed and highly concentrated into a challenging packet of fun, minus any of the tedious or slow-moving aspects.

It's worth the money at $10 USD.  If it's on sale, grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036607055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1580073968}
review: Muy buen juego, adictivo y simple, aunque despues implica que pongas mucha atencion, porque cualquier descuido y tus trenes terminan chocando o llegando a la ciudad incorrecta. Es simple destreza, ademas de ser graficamente atractivo. Se sacaron un 10 con este juego!. Completamente familiar, y muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036013398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1654812046}
review:
Très bon petit jeu, addictif, simple à comprendre. La difficulté est progressive mais l'excitation grimpe vite quand la carte se remplit progressivement!

Chose à noter : quant on ne remplit pas ses objectifs, on ne perd pas. C'est un avantage car on est pas obligé de tout réussir pour passer au niveau suivant, mais c'est aussi un inconvénient car cela enlève un peu de challenge, et on a même parfois un peu honte de gagner un niveau alors qu'on a vraiment fait n'importe quoi!

Par contre il faut avoir de bons yeux,car c'est vraiment écrit tout petit au coeur des maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984580172', 'num_games_owned': 1028, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1558734399}
review: I like it. It's simple, but gets surprisingly tricky later on without giving the impression it deliberately tries to [EXPLETIVE DELETED] the player over. Ninety-nine times out of a hundred the failure will be entirely on the player - bad rail placement, bad timing, inefficient routes or forgetting to set a turnout or simply running out of money for being too slow - giving the player incentive to do better, where a game that has the Random Number Generator From Hell would merely incur a rage quit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008438440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1665055501}
review:
In Train Valley muss man schnell so viele Züge wie möglich zu ihrem Ziel befördern um nicht Pleite zu gehen. Man kann verschiedenen Streckenführungen ausprobieren um möglichst mehrere Züge gleichzeitig fahren lassen zu können. Sobald man die Züge losschickt steht man vor der Herausforderung die Weichen zu schalten. Man versucht die Züge zum richtigen Ziel zu leiten und Zusammenstöße zu vermeiden. Das ergibt insgesamt ein sehr spaßiges Puzzelspiel.

Die Bahnhöfe eines Levels sind immer an den gleichen Orten, aber die Reihenfolge in denen sie auf dem Spielfeld erscheinen ist in gewisser Weise zufällig. Dadurch spielen sich die Level bei erneuten Versuchen leicht unterschiedlich. Das erfüllen von Bonusziele sorgt für einen höheren Schwierigkeitsgrad. Speziell die Vorgabe, Züge auf der Strecke nicht anhalten zu lassen, hat es in sich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007107085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1443664786}
review:
I actually do enjoy Train Valley but it will not save your progress if you do not use the steam cloud apparently. So if you are like me and have steam cloud disabled then probably avoid this unless you are willing to enable it.

Otherwise I found it to be a very addictive micromanagement game.



*EDIT 01/23/16*

Yay no more steam cloud! I'm happy the developer added in a work around for those of us that experience issues when using the steam cloud. Now I can see more than the first 3 levels!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004626382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1553134710}
review:
Completely fun, compelling, and encouraging compulsive play.  I have been playing it every night.  I do not regret purchasing it.  It is a fun experience of train traffic management.  

   Rough around the edges though.  The missions are absolutely homogenous.  Any difference between the 'Japan' and 'wherever else' missions was lost on me.  Considering how interchangeable and unmemorable the missions are, I am a little surprised there were not twice as many.  The experience is compelling, so I want more.  And some tiered achievements would encourage level replay -- the levels are easy to triple-crown the first time through.  So what am I going to replay them for?  I would like to replay them so that I can get Super Platinum Ultra but there is no such possibility.  

    It could use a bit more polish.  The trains enter buildings, and you can see them pop-out.  This hurts my eyes.  Please do not do this.   Pop them out once they are completely hidden from the player.  

   And you're allowed to build train tracks where future train stations will appear, spontaneously, without warning.  Why would this be allowed?  It is completely disruptive to train traffic when a train station suddenly blocks the way.   This is completely opaque and unpredictable for the player.  It is the 'blue shell' of Train Valley.

   So, the game is broken in a few ways, but I still couldn't stop playing it.  Your mileage may vary.

review: Purchased it to play with my train-crazy five-year-old. Ended up staying up late to play through the whole campaign myself. What a delightfuly well-done puzzle/management game. No grand trainscapes here, just keeping everything tidy and run on the single screen. Good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001241298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1444716994}
review:
You think you have all the track switches set up correctly, and you lean back, marvelling over your immaculate creation with pride, when suddenly one of your trains goes the wrong way, and then everything goes go to sheet. This game will drive you insane in a fun way.

I will have nightmares tonight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001333789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1443289435}
review:
Train Valley is a nice game if you like trains and micro managing switches.
Because this is 100% what this game is about.

Also it has a demo, which is rare enough.

The tutorial and the demo (which include the tuto + 2 levels) already shows you 100% of the gameplay.
Bear in mind that all other levels are just "more of the same".

So you goal is to build a railway (with switches all over the place) so that trains of a given color (there is a proper color-blind mode but all trains and stations have symbols, in addition to the color) reaches the stations of the matching color as fast as possible without bumping in other trains and without runing out of money.
The longer it take a train to reach a station, the fewer money it earns you.

Laying tracks cost money, with a penalty when you destroy something that already exist (house/tree).
Each year passing by also cost you a maintenance fee.

Each levels have three optionnal objectives, the real one is just no to run out of money.
Completing the objectives by the end of the level (which have a predetermined duration) will earn you stamps.

Even if it is easy not to run out of money, earning all the stamps is quite challenging. and will require you to restart some missions multiple times.

The game has 24 missions, divided in 4 seasons which only slighly change the looks of the levels (they are themed Europe, USA, Russia and Japon).
All levels are of the same size : super tiny, which is challenging and frustrating at the same time...
I wish there were bigger levels.

So feel free to test the demo, if you are not like "I want more of this" by the end of it, the game is not for you.
Otherwise, it will occupy about 10+ hours of your time.

If you are interested in some gameplay, I have a lest's play (in french) :
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLqtlWN_S1WDR-GXPgZvwNlmL71H-rinkD

author: {'steamid': '76561198112954914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1445880868}
review: Very good game. Micro-management and space-oriented puzzles, mixed in with unique challenges on certain maps makes for a rather fun, and oft-times frustrating puzzle-micro-manager. Excellent game for its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045943462', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1476828820}
review: This is a Perfect game. It has everything I could ask for. Pause, speed settings, send more trains for more money.. The list is endless and it speaks for itself. I supported the game by buying a copy for me and my bestie and I will tell all gamers about it. It is so fun :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198009504997', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 5487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1580049204}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979935488', 'num_games_owned': 1015, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1468551177}
review:
This game is not a Transport Simulation Strategy game like OpenTTD, it is also not a Train Simulator game like Train Simulator.
It is a simple, but very good Puzzle Game, where the goal is to create the tracks beetween each station and managing the trains by switching the intersetion in the right direction. Which sounds simple, but gets harder as new train stations are build over time. 

Currently there are 24 Missions (six for each Theme: Europe, America, Russia, Japan) and Sandbox Mode. 
There is no Map Editior and no Steam Workshop Support yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990794902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1444200092}
review: Great game. I love train games, but there hasn't been a good one out in a while.  Ironically, one of the first train games I ever played was Shortline Railroad in the early 90's, which is very similar to this game.  The first few levels were really easy, and I was worried at first that the game might not provide enough of a challenge, but the difficulty picks up pretty quickly after that.  I've only played through 2 of the areas so far, but it's a fun game and I imagine I'll play through the entire game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977399627', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1443299308}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007151896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1445878210}
review:
Its exactly what you'd expect.

Basically a puzzle game in the form of managing train routes, as someone that enjoys strategy games I'm loving this so far.

Its just difficult enough to demand you try, but not enough that you can't experiment or make small mistakes. Great game, well worth the $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040952205', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1443553501}
review:
First thing I want to say - this is very good game. It is build with simple mechanics that turns into gameplay with pretty high difficulty at the last levels. Be prepared to restart a lot at the second half of the game. It's hard to compare with any game that I've played, but there is one, which is basically the same - old DOS game called Short Lines from 1992. I have spent a lot of time playing ShortLine and I really wanted something more modern - Train Valley is exactly that.

Of course It has a few thing, that I'd like to be improved - bigger maps; better UX (sometimes it hard to click on train to launch it or on switch etc.); music, better turn it off once you get to the settings;  more variety. I will hope on Train Valley 2, but, unfortunatly, it looks like we will not get it soon :(

Thanks guys for the grate game, I will recommended to my frieds ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978772671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1463001038}
review: The game seems nice and easy and then, as long as you go for all the objectives, last two levels MURDER YOUR SOUL. Especially the last one. Whoever designed it, there's a nice warm place in hell for that person.

review: This game look like it is not so much in it, but it is freaking mindbending when dealing with multiple tracks and trains...just like Mini Metro but with more fatal consequences...if you like it beeing a bit stressed and like mind puzzling planning and management give it a go...its a decent little puzzle and management game....

author: {'steamid': '76561198039736512', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1442950931}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f7HkQlRL7KY
"Train Valley est un jeu de micro-gestion sympathique avec des mécaniques tout à fait polies. Idéal pour se faire une petite partie de temps en temps ou pour s’occuper ou tuer le temps, il devrait en tous les cas plaire aux amateurs de chemins de fer. Je n’ai pas grand-chose à lui reprocher si ce n’est peut-être, d’une part son prix qui sera peut-être plus intéressant aux prochains soldes, et d’autre part le fait que c’est un type de jeu qui aurait peut-être plus à sa place sur tablette que sur PC. Mais c’est une question de goût personnel et il reste agréable à jouer sur PC. Je peux donc tout de même le conseiller sans autres à quiconque aime les petits jeux de gestion dans ce genre ou pour ceux qui aiment les trains. Ce qu’il faut juste garder à l’esprit, c’est le type de jeu auquel on a affaire ; si vous vous attendez à un jeu de type Tycoon où vous êtes à la tête d’une entreprise de transport vous risquez d’être déçus, mais pour un petit jeu de micro-management, il sait ce qu’il fait et le fait bien."

author: {'steamid': '76561198091596169', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1442698471}
review: Train Valley is a small, but challenging game. It's not about hard management or city building. It's about railroads and trains at all. Very simple to start playing, but hard to win.

review: This is a lovely little game. Not especially challenging in the sense that it's hard to win, but you'll feel yourself going for more perfectly efficient layout and those level achievments. The perfect unwinding-after-a-long-day game. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031334245', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1618878666}
review:
A seaming simple yet very addictive little puzzle game, I'd already sunk 10 over hours into this before it left early access.
Some of the levels and layouts can be surprisingly challenging, especially if you are trying to complete all the objectives. Fortunately if needed you can play each level as many times as you like completeing 1 objective each time to earn your stamps! 
The devs seemed to have solved most of the problems with layout, UI, bugs etc before it left early access, so all in all it's a good buy if you're looking for a simple puzzle game to kill an hour or so at a time.
Just understand, this is NOT an in depth train simulator, it's a puzzle game with a train theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074983196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1469205900}
review:
Здравствуйте.
Игры в данном жанре (назову его "диспетчерской головоломкой", т.к. не знаю точного названия) весьма немногочисленны. Лично мне известно менее пяти. И Train Valley - лучшая из них. Как по концепции, так и по реализации. Есть некоторые косяки с моделями локомотивов, но они малозаметны и не портят общей картины.
Благодарю авторов за проделанную работу и жду дальнейшего развития игры.
Оценка: 10 тепловозов из 10, безоговорочно. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069412942', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1554356208}
review:
Мне понравилось. Единственный минус - нельзя сохранять прогресс миссий. Если я выйду во время выполнения задания, то потом придется начинать заново. 
А так игра получилась интересной.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030755232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1558174561}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092202227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1442525581}
review:
That's REALLY addicting game!

It seemed easy at first, but after the 3rd level (maybe even after the 2nd?) it became quite challenging! You should build the optimal track to connect stations, choose which train to dispatch earlier to earn more (each train has different length and speed), avoiding train crashes or arrival to the wrong destination and other stuff which makes this management strategy so cool! Each level is well designed. Some obstacles on the way makes building the track more challenging, but not too hardcore at the same time. Main menu is a separate cute thing. It looks like an album with different postage stamps on the wooden table, which bring warm and cozy atmosphere.

Lovely game, totally recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998084785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 9072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2875, 'last_played': 1516539605}
review:
[h1]What is it?[/h1]
Train Valley is a casual game where you must lay tracks to connect multiple stations to each other, and route trains without crashes or delays with the goal of sending trains to the correct station marked by a coloured flag.  It's not a tycoon or serious transport management sim and there is no cargo or passenger quota to manage.  It's more a strategy/puzzle type of game that challenges you to meet a set of goals before time or money run out.

[h1]What's to like about it?[/h1]
It's silly in a fun way as the difficulty ramps up and you find yourself frantically clicking switches in the hope of avoiding crashes or wrongly-routed trains.  Some trains are faster and longer than others and it soon becomes manic.  Don't even think of trying a delaying tactic!  Keep a train waiting long enough and it will release itself whether you're ready or not!  The tutorial is somewhat scant but the game is intuitive to play with a simple interface.  You are not automatically thrown out of the game if you suffer a collision (luckily) though your profits take a hit and you'll probably need to do some track repairs.  You are given a set of objectives to meet for each location - of increasing difficulty with a greater number of stations to be served.

[h1]What's not to like?[/h1]
Quite honestly, not much.  At first, it feels a bit TOO casual (ie Facebook style) but as the difficulty and number of stations ramp up, the game becomes a real challenge of strategy and timing.  The graphics are somewhat muddy and aliased (no in-game options to correct this).   Station colours can be a bit obscured by train flags at times when there are a lot of things going on, and a couple of colours are a little too similar which adds unnecessarily to the level of difficulty (for example: the orange and yellow station colours look very similar).  These are all minor gripes however, and don't detract from the fun of the game.

[h1]In summary...[/h1]
Train Valley is no 'Sid Meier' or other type of management or tycoon sim, but it's a fun and addictive little game easily worth its low price.  Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961352342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1442523400}
review:
This is a puzzle game that takes cues from strategy/management games rather than a management game in itself, and that's important to remember. Having accepted this simple and reasonable premise, you must understand how absolutely excellent and fun this game is.

It tasks you to complete a seemingly simple building and scheduling puzzle, which can be, if you take your time and use everything at your disposal relatively straightforward. Then it throws in a few limitations and challenges which cause you to break into a worried sweat, madly clicking on everything in a precise order and quite forgetting to pause the game sometimes. Remembe to pause!

Oh, also - charmingly lovely art style to boot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970719391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1500233929}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067019938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1460297813}
review:
Bought it, played five hours in one session right away. So I guess that's good.

It is not a classic "Tycoon" game, as you might have figured out from the screenshot, more like a halfway point of that and a puzzle game like, say, Air Control. Which is good! The levels really change up the core gameplay of "somehow get a bunch of trains from A to B without them all crashing into each other" in some interesting ways, and some of the Russian and Japanese levels require LOTS of concentration.

I would say I had more fun with this than with many of the "real" railway management sims. Two things, though:

* I'd like to have more content. There's enough right now to justify the price point, but after going through most of the levels, I'd still like to go on. So give me some DLC and I'll buy that stuff.
* There are still some glitches, which also occasionally forced me to restart levels. It is annoying as hell, but because I like the core gameplay so much, I can still recommend it. I hope there will be improvements, though. (EDIT: Yay, there have been indeed.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991075484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1712332149}
review:
Another little gem I picked up when browsing games on Steam.

You have to build track between each station and deliver the trains to their intended destination, whilst avoiding crashes, sending to the wrong place and running out of money.  Each scenario has three different objectives.

All in all, a neat and ingenious design that is a lot of fun for only £6.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006641321', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1728, 'last_played': 1462803299}
review:
Train Valley è un piccolo capolavoro, non vi aspettate una simulazione o un manageriale in stile Sid Maier's, Train Valley è più un puzzle game che altro, difficile ma mai frustrante, bisogna costruire in uno spazio ristretto i binari tra due o più stazioni e gestire gli scambi affinchè i vari treni arrivino alla loro destinazione senza scontrarsi, nei vari scenari che sono generati casualmente ogni volta, (o meglio cambiano la posizione degli ostacoli e le stazioni di partenza dei treni) avete tre obittivi che si ripetono ogni volta, tipo non far arrivare un treno nella stazione sbagliata, guadagna tot soldi, fai partire dei treni aggiuntivi, senza mai andare in banca rotta, qui nessuno vi salva nessuna banca vi da soldi, detto così sembra facile ma vi ritroverete a ripetere lo scenario più di una volta per ottimizzare al meglio le linee, e vi aiuterà moltissimo il tasto pausa! altrimenti quando si hanno 3/4 treni contemporaneamente a schermo gestire tutti gli scambi sarebbe davvero ostico, adesso hanno già promesso altri scenari manca il Giappone, perchè attualmente il suo punto più debole è la scarsa longevità dato che una volta completata la campagna, rimane la possibilità di giocare sandbox ma non si può salvare la partita, spero che continuino a supportarlo con scenari e magari aggiungono anche la classifiche online sarebbe perfetto.
La grafica è pulita e piacevole anche se avrei voluto qualche effetto in più
Il sonoro e piacevole e mai stancante ma lo giocato poche ore
il prezzo contenuto ed il divertimento dato lo fanno diventare una piacevole scoperta! complimenti Flazm

author: {'steamid': '76561198013021650', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 2655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1448316195}

Como o jogo ainda está sendo desenvolvido pode ser que coloquem algum modo com uma mecânica diferente de jogo(espero) pois ficar ''apenas'' ligando estações é broxante.* _____Não sei ainda se recomendo(SIM) ou NÃO (coloquei SIM pois a Steam obriga a escolher)._____*

author: {'steamid': '76561198154414099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1583238986}
review:
A great choice for railfans and strategy gamers alike. The gameplay is pretty fun and addictive; although it might be easy enough at times, at other times it can actually be pleasantly challenging. When you fail a task, you may feel more persistence and resilience than frustration.
The music is rather good; quite soothing, making for a relaxing atmosphere. The graphics are okay, and present no performance issues when at the highest possible settings.

Run a railway of really useful engines, or cause confusion and delay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974002194', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1452775327}
review:
[table][tr][th][h1][b]FR[/b][/h1][/th][th][h1][u]Premières impressions[/u] : [/h1][/th][th]v. 0 -[/th][/tr][/table]Train Valley c'est un Mini Metro dédié aux locomotives. Comprenez par là que le jeux n'est pas orienté gestion au sens où nous l'entendons d'ordinaire, il n'y a pas de « Tycoon ».  Votre rôle se borne (ce n'est pas réducteur) à administrer les allées et venues des trains et construire les voies.
Tout comme Mini M., nous sommes loin d'un jeu au rabais, c'est un challenge de haute volée, technique et relevé. 

Des gares naissent ça et là, votre but est de les connecter et ensuite d'agir sur les trains qui en sortent régulièrement pour qu'il ne se percutent pas, atteignent la bonne gare (il n'y a pas de voie double bande), ne demandent pas simultanément un même aiguillage. Ces derniers ont des longueurs et des vitesses variables. Ca n'a l'air de rien mais il faut avoir du répondant a mesure que la pente de la courbe d'apprentissage s'accroît. 

En plus de la gérance des trains, d'autres données entre en lignes de comptes, votre budget où votre faculté à épargner le terrain (détruire des batiments). Des taxes sont ponctionnées à intervalles régulier et chaque trains rapporte un peu d'argent. Mais plus le train tarde à arriver à destination moins il rapporte (c'est vous qui contrôlez son départ de la gare, au bout d'un certain délai son délai est forcé et fonce sur les rails avec où sans votre consentement). Chaque mission comporte trois objectifs variables : aucun accident, ne pas démolire la réserve indienne ou d'autres éléments précieux du décors, des objectifs en terme de finances ou de train additionnel ajouté par vous sur les rails. Mais quoiqu'il arrive si votre budget touche le 0, c'est fini. 

Ces missions se succèdent au rythme de 5 par chapitres (un thème et une difficulté), un mode bac-à-sable est également disponible. Graphiquement il n'y a rien à redire, cartoonesque, coloré, un effet d'échelle façon Civilization avec proportion très variables. Vous pouvez zoomer mais en général la caméra en retrait maximal est nécéssaire pour convenablement maitriser les opérations. Notez que la taille de la carte est un élément de diffculté, vous devrez poser les lignes et surtout leur jonction dans des mouchoirs de poches. 

Je dois bien avouer que je n'ai pas ressenti beaucoup de manque quant à son aspect Early Access en travaux, son gameplay restreint mais totalement complet et cohérent, je n'ai pas non plus subit de bogues ou autres. 
Train Valley offre un challenge limité niveau variété mais sa difficulté est bien dosée et vous pousse à donner plus. Visuellement propret, il fait honeur au $10€ qu'il demande. [quote][h1]N'hésitez pas à réagir, que ce soit pour une question ou pour signaler une erreur[/h1][/quote] [table][tr][th]- -[/th][th][url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/smithfield]Smithfield[/url][/th][th][url=http://steamcommunity.com/discussions/forum/12/617328967244490669/][h1]Ajoutez-moi, si…![/h1][/url][/th][th][url=http://steamcommunity.com/discussions/forum/12/617329150699182932/][h1]Critiques:Les règles[/h1][/url][/th][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198158601203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1464569918}
review:
I find this to be a very entertaining game, although frustrating at times.  I have now spent several hours playing and would recommend this game to others.  That said, there are a few things which I would like to see added to the game.

First, although the monetary value of each train tends to tell you something about the length of the train, I would like to be able to see a profile for each train before I release it from its station.  If I were to design the profile I would provide information regarding the total length of the train in number of cars.  Further, I would like to know the top speed of the locomotive so as to compare the top speeds of every locomotive currently waiting to be released from a station.  Added to that, it appears that most of the trains have the same top speed, despite the number of cars being pulled by the locomotive.  I know that there are a couple of different locomotives, but I do not know when a different locomotive is hitched to a load.  If the locomotive is random, I would like the profile to list its top speed under different loads.

Second, it appears that trains are ready to leave random stations at random times.  If this is indeed random, I would like a queue added which tells me in which order the waiting trains were introduced so as to help me decide which trains should be released in which order.  Further, trains do not stack in their railyards, so two trains cannot be waiting to be released at one time.  Instead, if another train is about to be added to a station, you receive a sudden five second warning and the first train is automatically relased.  If trains can only sit waiting to be released for a designated period of time, I would like to see a timer added into the queue so I know how much time is left before a train automatically disembarks.

If, however, trains are not random and a schedule truly does exist, I would like to have access to this schedule so I know when a train will be ready to leave a station, and where it needs to go.  It could even be the case that a single train could be required to visit multiple stations as opposed to a single station.

I believe that these additions could both simplify and introduce difficulty as more planning is possible and required.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041716504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1573989224}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003831199', 'num_games_owned': 1016, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1555631393}
review:
Довольно приятная стратегия про управление поездами, чем-то напомнило Sid Meier's Railroads. Ниже кто-то сравнивает её с Transport Tycoon, но здесь все в разы проще. Суть игры в том, чтобы оптимально соединить дорогами точки, которые постепенно и полуслучайно появляются на карте, а затем грамотно управлять поездами, избегая аварий. Беспокоиться о типе грузов и о том, что и куда везти, а также о покупке паровозов и вагонов, как в упомянутых в начале играх, не приходится, игра сама случайным образом подкидывает маршруты, а игроку остается только запускать поезда в правильном порядке и вовремя переключать стрелки на развилках.

Звучит все довольно просто и на освоение игры уходит не более 15 минут, но при этом выполнить все задания на карте не так-то легко. Зачастую нужно не просто не обанкротиться и пройти миссию без аварий, а еще и заработать определенную сумму денег, поэтому приходится наперед продумывать, какие поезда в каком порядке отправлять. Некоторые карты приходится переигрывать по несколько раз, а последняя, с ракетой, мне далась только на третий вечер упорных попыток. 

И как раз на примере этой карты хорошо видны некоторые огрехи. Во-первых, игра не позволяет делать сложные развязки, пути в одной клетке могут вести в двух направлениях, из-за чего создавать некоторые перекрестки не так-то просто. Во-вторых, карты здесь довольно крошечные, особо не разгуляешься, а мосты и тоннели строятся без твоего участия в определенных местах. Понятно, что карты сделаны небольшими намеренно, чтобы не затягивать игровую сессию, но, мне кажется, необязательно было делать её уж настолько короткой. Так вот, на последней карты прямо у границы карты намеренно поставлены два города вплотную, чтобы их было невозможно соединить коротким маршрутом, приходится делать огромное кольцо. Но, допустим, это намеренная левел-дизайнерская уловка, окей. Что реально начинало подбешивать, так это поезда, которые самовольно начинали выезжать из депо. То есть, если долго не выпускать поезд из точки, он, в конце концов, выедет оттуда сам, предупредив об этом ровно за 5 секунд. И, конечно, ровно за секунду до его выезда, как правило, в эту точку приезжал другой мой поезд, который уже было поздно куда-то разворачивать или останавливать (а на последней карте один из челленджей как раз не делать этого). В результате, конечно же, авария и рестарт карты.

Каждый сезон в игре разворачивается в какой-то уникальной эпохе и в описании игры упомянуто, например, о золотой лихорадке и запуске ракеты в космос. Действительно, внешне локации выглядят соответствующе, но не хватает каких-то дополнительных элементов. Небольшого сюжета или какого-то вступительного брифинга перед картой. Поезда вроде бы тоже постепенно эволюционируют и начинают ехать быстрее, но на этом никак внимание не акцентируется. Из-за этого несколько раз более быстрый поезд у меня догонял своего медленного предка и, разумеется, врезался в него.

Но, в целом, игра оставила все же приятные впечатления. Отмечу милую и приятную графику, сделанные с фантазией достижения, ну и затягивающий несмотря ни на что игровой процесс. Все-таки со времен Sid Meier's Railroads соскучился по подобным играм, так что прошел Train Valley с удовольствием. Буду ждать, когда добавят четвертый сезон, и пройду его обязательно.

До этого ничего не покупал в Early Access, и после прохождения даже осталось недоумение, почему эта игра здесь. С технической стороны все отлично, ни единой проблемы за все время у меня не было. Контента тоже уже, в принципе, достаточно, игра уже выглядит как самостоятельный и законченный продукт. Так что, если вдруг это кого-то смущает, не смущайтесь — покупайте.

Да, и отдельной строкой отмечу приятное, что игра от русских разработчиков и весьма удачная. Собственно, изначально покупал просто с целью поддержать и взглянуть (увидел в твиттере Климова, скажите ему спасибо), что же получилось, а в результате прошел до конца и ни капли не жалею.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027023975', 'num_games_owned': 1106, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1437412226}
review:
Initial impressions (3 hours in) are very good.  A very simple game to grasp that will also provide you a challenge to keep track of and control all the stations and trains as you progress.

It plays well, and have yet to see any game breaking bugs.  Devs respond to users on the forum and they have a demo available for you to try it out.

Well worth the £6.99 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029752352', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1505737698}
review: Awesome game with "train atmosphere". Absolutely love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029942124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1436460300}
review: Отличная игра. Заставляет немного напрягать мозги а не долбить в кнопку мыши. Можно хорошо отвлечься после рабочего дня. Спасибо!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012304328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1614047225}
review: I started playing Train Valley and I could not stop! Once you get up to eight plus stations its a real challenge to anyone, if you turn up the time to X2 your a genius, if your turn the time to x4 your on some kind of stimulants , playing at that speed will fry your brain. This sim is simple but elegent . It will take you from simple to strategic and on to madness. You will want more to test the plan you dreamed about last night it will keep you entertained and thinking for a long long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025008206', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1554379391}
review: Quite possibly the perfect distilation of the train management genre into a light modern style. Simplified but complex enough to be very challenging, all while still giving the player a lot of freedom. That's a hard balance to get right, but these guys have done it. There are still a few minor bugs, but it's surprisingly polished for an Early Access game, and already an absolute joy to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997821081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1508818163}
review: This is a great game!  The developer is doing, in my mind, early access correctly.  Releasing a functional and stable game that has a good set of content.  It also looks like they have a way to get information about crashes so that they can continue to make the game better befor release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996734475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1559037267}
review: A very addicting rail-building game. It took quite a bit of puzzling together to get all stamps on all tracks, but I am already looking forward to the next chapter. Bring it on! I need more! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004495034', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1486289463}
review: Il s'agit d'une petit jeu indé, un puzzle game de gestion de voies ferrées et de trains. En gros, on relie des gares sur de petites cartes, et on gère les aiguillages pour que les trains de couleur arrivent à la gare de destination, de la même couleur. Ca rappelle le vieux Locomotion. On a aussi une gestion simple du budget, et des défis à remplir si on le souhaite. Ce n'est pas un jeu de gestion, attention, c'est un puzzle game de style casual. Je suggère d'attendre les premiers tests ou de suivre un let's play pour voir si le jeu tient ses promesses sur la longueur. Perso, j'ai déjà échoué à la 3ème map, donc je pense qu'il y a du challenge, à voir si la diversité permettra de ne pas se lasser trop vite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033169079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1685731974}
review: Довольно интересная игра с понятным интерфейсом, нетребовательной и приятной графикой и затягивающим, простым и одновременно бросающим игроку определённый вызов игровым процессом. Технически никаких замечаний, контента уже достаточно для того, чтобы назвать игру полноценной. Ожидается лишь одна серия уровней. Какой-нить ЕА давно бы выпустил игру, а новые уровни продал бы в качестве ДЛС. Рекомендую. Купил в рамках импортозамещения))

author: {'steamid': '76561198030930856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1443124872}
review: Sencillo, divertido y adictivo

author: {'steamid': '76561198026464792', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1503634827}
review:
Un piccolo puzzle game impegnativo ma mai frustrante. Grafica accettabile, belle musiche e ottima atmosfera che ci immerge nel mondo dei trenini elettrici della nostra infanzia.
Attenzione: il gioco consiste nel piazzare i binari, gestire gli scambi e il traffico ferroviario. Se cercate un manageriale con mappe vaste e gestione economico/industriale, prendete Railroad Tycoon 2 o Sid Meier's Railroads.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047217382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1433346338}
review: Nem por um segundo te deixes enganar pela aparência de [b]Train Valley[/b]. À primeira vista pode parecer um jogo elementar. Mas é uma mera ilusão que [b]Train Valley[/b] desfaz logo nos primeiros níveis. Cada patamar do jogo tem uma dose saudável de dificuldade inultrapassável sem um mínimo de estratégia. Por outro lado, há momentos em que apetece pausar o jogo para apreciar cada detalhe dos mapas, pois se nos distrairmos com eles enquanto jogamos os acidentes ferroviários disparam imediatamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970928351', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1657322859}
review:
I bought this game because I enjoy building train layouts, liked the original Railroad Tycoon way back in the early 90s, and like optimization puzzles.  That's good, because this game hits all those likes of mine to some degree, and I love it for that.

What you do:  you build tracks between stations, and dispatch trains that the game randomly builds (or, you can summon your own in addition to the random ones).  Each scenario is a bit different--goals for specific scenarios don't vary within the scenario, but placement of stations and obstacles do to a degree.  In general, goals are of the variety:  don't crash trains, build X amount of track, make X amount of money, manually summon X amount of trains.  These sound simple, but the land area of each scenario is small and you need to make efficient rail networks in that small space without going bankrupt. 

Additional stations appear as the game progresses, so you have to modify your rail network on the fly.  This isn't a surprise after your first scenario, but they are also placed somewhat randomly in a random order, meaning you have to think on the fly.  Thankfully, the game does include a pause button and you should make use of it often.  You direct the trains as you go, throwing switches to put trains on specific paths.  Screw up switching even once, and you may be restarting the scenario if it's a bad enough miss.  :)

Good:  engaging play, certainly not a piece of cake, but not impossible either.  Graphics are clean and perfect for this kind of game.  Music and sounds work well and fit the game.  Bugs are pretty much non-existent.  

Meh:  keyboard shortcuts appear to be unlabeled nor identified, and not changeable.  Some of them can wreak havoc with your game.  No ability to save in mid level, and scenarios aren't super quick.

Bad:  Scenarios often have razor thing win margins.  This is not unusual for optimization puzzle games, but can be frustrating if you've never played one before.  So, perhaps this isn't a "bad" thing, as I'd sure not want this changed.  Still, it comes as a warning--not so much to stay away from the game, but don't give up on it too quickly.

Overall:  Highly recommended for those who like optimizing things for fun, designing rail networks in confined spaces, and choo choo trains.  Easily frustrated by puzzles?  Probably not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034045757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1432802220}
review: В дождливую погоду и сонное настроение эта игра пришлась как раз кстати.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971025896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1584659318}
review:
Very enjoyable railroad building game, with attentive developers willing to listen to the players on possible improvements.

The latest update helped to alleviate the bankruptcy issue, leaving the challenges of actually running the trains and building the tracks the focal point.  Beware! Some trains schedule themselves for departure, and you have to be ready to  handle them, or suffer the consequences.

The overarching victory condition on all levels is to survive. The bullets shown on the right of the screen are optional, and none of them need to be achieved in order to advance to the next level. Those optional bullets are very challenging, and add replayability to the game.

The actual laying of the tracks and placing of the switches is very easy. Faster trains become available as you progress through the level you are playing, but watch out for older, slower trains as they are NOT retired, but continue to function, adding additional challenge to the level.

The graphics are nice and functional. Same for the trains.

This is one of those games where you'll want to play until you beat the current level, and can't wait to conquer the next.

Definitely worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029024078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1461269952}
review: Головоломка в реальном времени (хотя есть пауза) по управлению трафиком поездов между разноцветными городами - каждый состав в свой город. Приятная графика, некоторая случайность в генерации уровней, возрастаяющая по мере прохождения сложность - всё это делает игру достаточно привлекательной. Отличный выбор, если хочется расслабиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082552419', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1481674684}
review:
Fun little train game. If you're fine paying 10 Euro for 4 hours of rather simple train entertainment - because it's very short.

The track laying system is pretty good, interface is very intuitive. The mission objectives seem forced, and the game is rather easy. Still, the basic idea is solid, and it's decent for early access (compared to buggy shit like prison architect or pixel piracy). 

If you like trains get it on a sale, because 10 euro is too much IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026195360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1527306121}
review:
The cute looks may deceive you, but it gets very challenging very fast. I only wish it was on mobile device.
Keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977016810', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1452496712}
review:
[h1][i]A Great Train Game![/i][/h1]
This game is actually REALLY Good! I was amazed at how well it's easy to pick up and just enjoy the mechanics of it. 40 minutes in and I was hooked. If you like trains, this game with have you aboard!

Basically the game is time managing with trains, the trains can and will collide of you don't offer another line for another train or provide the time it takes to clear the line you use before its too late. Lay track strategically saving time and money or would you rather cut down trees to make it a strait shot for trains? or save money to work around them objects in your way?

The game is really well made even in the beta I haven't had any problems yet. But the devs are sure doing a good job so far. Train Valley is my kind if game, it's addicting.

[b][i]Weegee APROOVED[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002524261', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1462487517}
review:
Train Valley is a puzzle/logic game with trains as its main theme. The goal of the game is to manage trains and build tracks without running out of funds by the end of the level. There are additional objectives you can try and achieve, and each map has a different layout and enough randomness to keep things freesh.

This is NOT a simulation, tycoon or similar type of "management" game. It's a puzzle game with a charming theme and presentation. If that sounds up your alley, I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121385408', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1444673447}
review:
Прекрасно небо голубое!
Прекрасен поезд голубой!
- Какое место вам? - Любое.
Любое место, край любой.

Еще волнует все, что было.
В душе былое не прошло.
Но слишком дождь шумел уныло,
Как будто все произошло.

И без мечты, без потрясений
Среди одних и тех же стен
Я жил в предчувствии осеннем
Уже не лучших перемен.

- Прости, - сказал родному краю, -
За мой отъезд, за паровоз.
Я несерьезно. Я играю.
Поговорим еще всерьез.

Мы разлучаемся с тобою,
Чтоб снова встретиться с тобой.
Прекрасно небо голубое!
Прекрасен поезд голубой!

(С) Н.Рубцов "Прекрасно небо голубое!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198014335998', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1555658534}
review:
It might start off easy, but it's a hard game to master. 

To begin with, it's drag-able track, that automatically links up or creates crossings by itself. Then you run trains, and where you can afford or have space to, extra trains. 

However, TV is not without issues. 

1. bankruptcy is common. 3K of tax annually cripples you if you've been building a lot or had a bad year for revenue.
2. Beware the optionals - achieving them is harder than it looks. 
3. Russia is incredibly hard to conquer. Get some practice in. 

Overall, I'd rate the game at the moment a 8/10. It's good now, but a couple of nights play will get you through most of the levels, but not necessarily with the optionals. Japan is the next area; I hope they do it justice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972279378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1460374727}
review: Excellent addictive game that I cannot wait to see where the development takes it. Much better than other games with predesigned tracks and having to lead the correct colour train to the correct station. The fact you need to build the track is highly satisfying and very challenging. Buy it now :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198165469452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1497685912}
review:
Pour les amateurs de gros jeux de train, c'est une excellente récréation : les éléments du jeu sont simples, les scénarios rapides et l'optimisation du réseau est motivante.

Le logiciel est abouti (ce qui devient rare). Juste peut-être un petit bug dans le dernier scenario "russe" où des batiments nouveaux écrasent des voies et des trains.

J'attends de nouvelles cartes et scenarios avec intérêt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071928141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1647805741}
review:
One of the most infuriating games to play but very much fun! 

You will always come back to it for one more try.

Could do with some more modern units and longer game-play. 
Still in the early stages yet. Graphics are nice.

But all in all 7/10 for this!

One of the big drawbacks is that you cannot draw a full end
to end road as it cancels itself out and you have to start over!
It goes too quickly through the months!

The other STUPID thing about this game is when your balance goes down to 0
IT DOES NOT MEAN YOU ARE BANKRUPT but the game thinks so! So annoying!!!!

Just gone back to it today and my antivirus picked something up and when
I restarted the game ALL MY PROGRESS HAS GONE! Was on the last level too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138410849', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1443939422}
review: Three or four tiers might not seem long, but puzzles are already challenging on tier 2, which means about 2/3 of the time you would probably only want to play 1 level per day.  Enjoy, and I hope the developers could release some DLCs once a while!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016718914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1431273057}
review: I played trains since childhood. For a long period of time TTDeluxe was one of my favourite games. And when I saw this new train-game - it was awsome!!! First i tried to make a 4-train crash at one time. It happened. And it was good. Game is rather relaxing, needs a glass of beer to play, nothing annoys you, except may be the lamp sound from the start of the game (i first thought that smth happened with my speakers)...

author: {'steamid': '76561198009603502', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1450898869}
review:
Иногда бывают моменты, когда, приходя с работы, ты хочешь расслабиться и поиграть во что-нибудь простое с симпатичной графикой и казуальным геймплеем. Если первый пункт и подходит под это требование, то вот относительно второго возникает понимание, что не всё так просто, как может показаться на первый взгляд. 

В первом уровне есть два города, их необходимо соединить путями и пустить паровоз — [i] ничего сложного.[/i] Но дальше городов становиться больше, рельеф усложняется, а бюджет ограничивается довольно скромной суммой. Кстати, для каждого уровня выдвигаются свои требования, такие как потратить определенную сумму денег, построить какое-то количество дорог или запустить N паровозов. Достичь всего этого можно разными способами, вам лишь остаётся выбрать оптимальный по-вашему мнению и реализовать его. Именно это и заставляет повторять попытки пройти уровень после очередного фэйла.  

[b]Плюсы:[/b]
[list]
[*]Геймплэй
[*]Графика
[*]Реиграбельность
[*]Цена
[/list]

[b]Минусы: [/b]Поскольку игрушка находится в раннем доступе, могут быть обнаружены различные мелкие недочеты, но если
вы поддержите проект денежкой, думаю, в будущем разрабы добавят новые уровни и дополнительные возможности.

Вывод: Покупайте, оно того стоит. 

З.Ы. Всем добра

author: {'steamid': '76561198052403199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1431358517}
review:
Просматривал недавно новинки каталога Steam и наткнулся на эту игрушку, судя по скриншотам выглядит добротно и мне сразу напомнила старый добрый Transport Tycoon Deluxe, конечно я не смог пройти мимо и установил себе это дело.

Оказалось, игра довольно приятная, убить за ней субботний вечерок или послеобеденный перерыв в офисе можно с удовольствием. Кстати, жене игра понравилась больше чем дочке, потому что всёже нужно следить за финансами, чуточку включать мозг.

Меня лично порадовал проработанный мир, красивые фермы, коровы гуляют,  домики строятся - разработчикам респект и всяческая уважуха. Напомнило третьих сетлеров, если вы понимаете о чём я.

Чуточку не хватает зума на карте, хотелось бы увидеть паровозы поближе, тем более сделаны они мультяшно и красиво.

Говорят, в конце можно будет дойти до ракет, не знаю, пока не видел, прошёл только первую главу. Кстати, в игру хочется играть ещё, запускаю её уже который раз, пройду пару уровней и похорошело =))

Уважаемые разработчики, хочется больше фана, когда можно будет сбивать коров на переездах?

author: {'steamid': '76561198007547332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1590651761}
review: A fun, challenging game in an attractive package. Two questions: Why do you manually start some trains and at other times they release on their own? Why do some switches only change manually and other switches automatically flip? There is no tutorial as yet and everything is guesswork. But it is simple enough that the lack of a tutorial is not an obstacle. I'd recommend this game and I've only played it for 90 minutes. I hope they finish it off. It's a great start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064424630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1551430006}
review:
There is no casual train management strategy game quite like Train Valley.  Explore new worlds and learn the rail management skills to build, manage, and rule your great rail empire.  No train enthusiast on a budget can go without this game. There are a few kinks (i.e. buildings spawning on laid tracks and trains spontaeously exploding for no reason) but they are so rare or predicatable you can adapt to your situation.  I am proud to say I had the privelege to enjoy this game from early developement, and you can witness that experience for yourself in my let's play from the earliest alpha release to the most recent patch (a7.4/beta1.0 at this period) here: 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLq7fziG4I2WvsbCzGsxICVvHoK4CpOiuq

I personally want to thank Flazm.com and Oroboro Games for the fantastic experience they provided me and cannot wait for the next patch.  There is so much more to experience!

Advice for new users:

-the bell, whistle or horn sound a locomotive makes leaving a station in this patch gives you a cue of how fast it will go regardless of what it looks like (mid or late 19th century steam, 20th century steam, early diesel, modern diesel)
-the grid matrix in build mode is your friend; drag your cursor from a place that has track wherever you want, just be sure you are aware of how you drag your mouse cursor
-dirt roads on game maps give you a hint about how to configure your tracks
-compact triangular swicthing junctions are essential for saving money and space, crosing tracks are not
-plot your track configuations while the game is paused to be safe (or don't for an extra challenge) :3
-train crashes require track replacement at the point of impact (unless the impact point is in a station)
-don't leave a train sitting in a station sitting for too long; it will eventually leave 
-consider in game annual taxes paid each new year before building or adding more trains (which both cost money)
-trains going into the wrong station will go straight in and swing back out instantly, so be careful
-avoid building over existing map strutures to save more money where reasonable
-game logic prevents trains from derailling on switches regardless of which way they are oriented
-building new tracks under existin tracks with trains still running on them will cause derailments (game logic won't save you here) 
-enjoy yourself

P.S. (Please don't throw rocks at me for sounding like a brown-noser, I just like this game a lot.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039233007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1522362669}
review:
Okay, so this concept might have been done on the iPhone with Trainyard, but this is a huge step up. Less about the puzzle and more about the careful placement of track and when to actually start that train...

The style is great, animations simple and not distracting.
Not having to scroll the screen like some PC games keeps your attention. And.. this is hard. Not too hard you want to quit, but hard enough that if you want to complete with all achieves its going to take some time...and more time.
Only at level five and just burnt through a few hours without knowing about it.
Going to keep me going for a while yet.
